baodur.gblbaodur199.mp3: {Emphasis on second line into next}Not since Malachor. It is always in my dreams. I remember the ships.
baodur.gblbaodur183.mp3: {Emphasis on second line into next}I dreamt of Malachor. I remember the ships.
baodur.gblbaodur184.mp3: The last stand of the Republic. The tattered remnants of our fleet, the largest we could gather, but it was damaged, weakened and vulnerable.
baodur.gblbaodur185.mp3: The Mandalorians couldn't resist. They tore into us like beasts, shredding our ships to scrap as we fought back.
baodur.gblbaodur186.mp3: Yet this time, there were no reinforcements for either side. Revan had been delayed out-system by Mandalorian scout ships. By the time he arrived, it was too late.
baodur.gblbaodur190.mp3: You didn't say anything - just a nod.
baodur.gblbaodur191.mp3: {Brisker, as though the hard part of the story is over}Events move quickly then, even in my dreams. Flashes, explosions, you - falling. I could feel the pain around me.
baodur.gblbaodur192.mp3: And then the memory. The drifting hulks of the Mandalorian ships, the dead - allies, friends, strangers.
baodur.gblbaodur193.mp3: And then the echo. Lingering. The sound I awaken to in my nightmares.
baodur.gblbaodur197.mp3: Glorious? It was nothing more than a slaughter. A slaughter caused by one of my creations.
baodur.gblbaodur194.mp3: Blame lies with me, for creating it. The situation forced your hand, anger forced mine.
baodur.gblbaodur079.mp3: If it wasn't for me, we'd all be floating in space! I think I can handle a few repairs to your circuits.
baodur.gblbaodur067.mp3: I am not pushing you around. I just wanted to see if there was anything I could do to upgrade your functionality.
baodur.gblbaodur075.mp3: Thanks for the vote of confidence.
baodur.gblbaodur077.mp3: Yes, I'll be careful. Now let's get started.
baodur.gblbaodur074.mp3: Thanks for the vote of confidence.
baodur.gblbaodur070.mp3: You wouldn't guess it from the outside, but it looks like you've been through a lot.
baodur.003bao_t3350.mp3: [T3-M4 has received a permanent +2 bonus to his Constitution.]
baodur.gblmandalore123.mp3: I was part of the war effort, yes. I worked as a technician, though.
baodur.gblmandalore126.mp3: And look at them now. Mandalorians are little better than mercenary thugs. And what's honor to someone like that? All they care about are credits.
baodur.gblmandalore138.mp3: I don't need compliments from a murderer.
baodur.gblmandalore128.mp3: {Not letting go of the point}You fought for no cause other than to spread suffering and pain to the people you conquered.
baodur.gblmandalore130.mp3: You did nothing but murder innocents.
baodur.gblmandalore136.mp3: {Sarcastic}Well, I'm glad to have you guarding my back.
baodur.004board009.mp3: {Guarded, doesn't trust Kreia}Kreia? Is something wrong?
baodur.004board011.mp3: Someone's trying to board u-{"us", knocked unconscious.}
baodur.004board002.mp3: Someone's trying to board u-{"us", knocked unconscious.}
baodur.231231atton004.mp3: They were probably looking for me when they saw your shuttle go down.
baodur.231231bdur045.mp3: The freighter's not here. We'll have to enter the underground ruins and look for the military escape shuttle. The entrance is at the south end of the compound.
baodur.231231bdur046.mp3: I don't, but that's not going to stop me. I'm getting back to Citadel Station if I have to build a new ship myself.
baodur.231231bdur027.mp3: Sentry droid ahead - we've been spotted again.
baodur.231231bdur026.mp3: We can pick our way through, or take the time to disarm some and clear a path.
baodur.231231bdur024.mp3: The mercenaries must be using them to locate us. There's probably another patrol nearby.
baodur.231231bdur017.mp3: Mercenaries, right where we need to go. That sentry droid probably spotted us already.
baodur.231231bdur021.mp3: Who do you think shot you down in the first place?
baodur.231231bdur016.mp3: The mercenaries have at least two hidden caches like this. We should keep our eyes open.
baodur.231231bdur030.mp3: I always feel a sense of calm when I walk the surface of Telos. The Ithorians are truly amazing in their work.
baodur.231231bdur041.mp3: We could cross along the shore, or head along the cliffs to the south.
baodur.231231bdur043.mp3: Bold. All right, let's do it.
baodur.231231bdur036.mp3: Look! There's a large mercenary patrol in the valley up ahead.
baodur.231231sntry046.mp3: But it's only fair, I owe you more than one, General.
baodur.231231sntry094.mp3: Too bad she's not a droid, huh?
baodur.231231sntry050.mp3: We can't all be that lucky.
baodur.231231sntry051.mp3: I'll humor you, General. I was one of the Iridonian mechanic corps that was at Malachor. Bao-Dur?
baodur.231231sntry093.mp3: Don't think too hard. I'd rather not talk about the war if we could.
baodur.231231sntry055.mp3: Guess that's one thing we've got better than droids - they can't forget anything.
baodur.231231sntry060.mp3: Got some news for you, General. That shuttle of yours is done for - scrap.
baodur.231231sntry086.mp3: I had a little run-in with Czerka that involved me ending up in a force cage. I managed to escape during an electrical malfunction. So far, I've managed to outrun them.
baodur.231231sntry020.mp3: Something went wrong underground. The ruins used to be some sort of military research center, and something reactivated its defenses.
baodur.231231sntry023.mp3: The power was blown out in the firefight, and that's when I got away. They sent a pursuit team after me, but most of them were busy trying to resecure the compound.
baodur.231231sntry022.mp3: I don't know - I was already locked up. They thought the salvage teams accidentally turned something on, but I don't believe it.
baodur.231231sntry072.mp3: We'll have to get back to the compound. It's the old Ithorian research station, turned into a salvage team staging area. It won't be an easy hike.
baodur.231231sntry081.mp3: Czerka freights men and equipment from the landing pad there. If it's there and we can breach the perimeter, there's probably something we can use.
baodur.231231sntry082.mp3: If not, we could try our luck in the underground ruins. Either way, it's back to the compound for us.
baodur.231231sntry073.mp3: First, there's the mercenary pursuit team looking for me. If Czerka's secured the compound, there could be a lot of them out there. Second, there's all the cannoks.
baodur.231231sntry075.mp3: Trust me, there's no way you're going to slice into the shield network. Just leave it to me.
baodur.231231sntry079.mp3: Right. The cannoks ate them all. Now they'll eat anything they can catch, including us.
baodur.231rodkill004.mp3: Wait, bounty? Why is there a bounty on your head?
baodur.232232bdur009.mp3: {Walks up to the first shield}Looks like Czerka got the shield system up and running. Good thing you have me along, though. I'll get them down in no time.
baodur.232232bdur012.mp3: This arm of mine isn't just for show, General. Stand back.
baodur.232232bdur013.mp3: The Czerka mercenaries were a little surprised when I broke my way out of my holding cell. The shields there were even weaker than these.
baodur.232232bdur015.mp3: [Bao-Dur has the ability to break through various shields with his repulsor fist.]
baodur.232232bdur010.mp3: {Emphasis at the end}Same reason you ever put up shields. You're either trying to protect yourself from whatever's outside, or trying to keep something inside.
baodur.232232bdur011.mp3: Now stand back and let me get this shield down.
baodur.232232bdur001.mp3: There she is. One orbital shuttle... looks like it's in serviceable condition.
baodur.232232bdur002.mp3: That's all a moot point, though.
baodur.232232bdur003.mp3: The hangar bay doors are closed. I don't fancy flying the shuttle through solid metal, so I'd say we need to find a way to get them open.
baodur.233233bdur045.mp3: The freighter's not here. We'll have to enter the underground ruins and look for the military escape shuttle. The entrance is at the south end of the compound.
baodur.233233bdur046.mp3: I don't, but that's not going to stop me. I'm getting back to Citadel if I have to build a new ship myself.
baodur.233233bdur001.mp3: Hopefully, I'll be able to access the shield network from this console.
baodur.233233bdur002.mp3: Good it's functional, and my passcodes still work. Now let's find your ship.
baodur.233233bdur004.mp3: Telos' atmosphere has been turned into acidic vapor. Landing a ship in the wastes would be like sealing it in a hangar full of hungry mynocks.
baodur.233233bdur006.mp3: So that means there's probably an unsanctioned landing site somewhere on the planet. Still shielded, but not a restoration zone or other listed facility. That's why I need access to the shield network.
baodur.233233bdur008.mp3: It looks like power is being drawn to generate a shield over a small area in the polar region, but nothing should be down there. Orbital cameras show... nothing. Just an empty mesa.
baodur.233233bdur010.mp3: That's a little tougher. According to the computer, a shuttle is currently docked inside the research facility.
baodur.233233bdur015.mp3: But it's not as though we have any choice.
baodur.262262bdcg001.mp3: {Weakened groan - he is unconscious, player attempts to talk to him}
baodur.262262bdcg018.mp3: [Bao-Dur still looks unconscious from the crash. You can probably move him to medbay on the Ebon Hawk when you are ready to leave.]
baodur.262262bdcg004.mp3: {Looking around}This place looks part of a huge polar irrigation system, possibly planet-wide, like the one on Coruscant. {Beat at second sentence, realizes he's been lied to}I had been told by the Republic that it was not in use.
baodur.262262bdcg003.mp3: I am fine, General. Even power has been restored to my arm.
baodur.262262bdcg005.mp3: {Waking up, shaking his head}I... am sorry, General. I must have lost consciousness in the crash.
baodur.262262bdcg015.mp3: I will not, General. The attack was unexpected, but I will not let down my guard again.
baodur.262262bdcg016.mp3: I will, General. The attack was unexpected, but I will not let down my guard again.
baodur.262262bdcg006.mp3: {Looking around}What is this place? Where are we?
baodur.262262bdcg013.mp3: Of course, General. If you wish, I may travel with you or join you at the ship.
baodur.262262bdcg007.mp3: {Reflective}This must be where I had detected the energy readings before - and the drain to the restoration shields.
baodur.262262bdcg008.mp3: {Looking around}This room, this place - it looks part of a huge polar irrigation system, possibly planet-wide, like the one on Coruscant. {Beat at second sentence, realizes he's been lied to}I had been told by the Republic that it was not in use.
baodur.262262bdcg011.mp3: Very well, General. I will await your arrival.
baodur.262meddoor005.mp3: The construction of this door is like nothing I've seen on Telos... and it is not the same as the rest of the facility, here.

baodur.301attwarn061.mp3: Do not stray far. He may need us.
baodur.301attwarn2025.mp3: We are not going to leave him here. We stand with the General, or not at all.

baodur.302airtaxi013.mp3: That's a little better. Try it now.

baodur.301drdplay017.mp3: I used to work on droids like this in the war. Let me take a look.
baodur.351351hub004.mp3: {Surprised}Looks like someone's been busy. This is a droid control center - but on a huge scale. It could control thousands of droids, on Nar Shaddaa and elsewhere.
baodur.410xarga006.mp3: A type 2 perimeter motion relay. That particular model has several security vulnerabilities and design flaws. Stealth field generators can fool them.
baodur.410xarga007.mp3: {Second sentence is almost to himself, he's offended at how shoddy it is}If one of us could get close to it, I know the corporate override code for it. Amateurs shouldn't even bother building security technology.

baodur.501beastrdr014.mp3: Ithor, Onderon and Dxun are rich in food chains necessary to create new life on Telos and sustain it.
baodur.502mp_ponla036.mp3: You continually amaze me. A lot of people would've been hurt or worse.
baodur.503xaart041.mp3: {Approving}I wonder what his mission was... I think you may have helped the Republic considerably.
baodur.504bostuco003.mp3: The force shields won't present a problem. I can get us through them.

baodur.601saedhe034.mp3: They are vitally important pieces of equipment on tectonically or environmentally unstable regions. But do you really need atmospheric sensors on Dantooine?

baodur_other_1.gblbaodur174.mp3: Guess if one planet was good enough for me, why not the galaxy?

baodur_other_1.gblbaodur164.mp3: I remembered when word of the Mandalorian attacks arrived on Iridonia.

baodur_other_1.gblbaodur136.mp3: I moved around for a couple years. Working as a starship mechanic got me from place to place. I wasn't ready to settle down after the war.

baodur_other_1.233233mrcc002.mp3: Looks like we're going to have to fight our way there, though.

baodur_echo.gblkreia467.mp3: {Thinking to himself, these are his thoughts as Kreia is reading his mind}Your command echoes still, General. And I obey, as I did at Malachor.
baodur_echo.003pcdead2025.mp3: {These are his thoughts as he's thinking to himself, player is reading his mind without him knowing}Your command echoes still, General. And I obey, as I did at Malachor V.
baodur_echo.003pcdead2026.mp3: I have destroyed planets for you, General. But now, this once, if we could save something in this galaxy...
baodur_echo.003pcdead2028.mp3: I know you can hear me. I have always known. It is why I followed you.
baodur_echo.003pcdead2030.mp3: {Reverent, pronouncement of doom, then sad at the end}And she must be stopped, there, now, or she will bring the screams of Malachor V to the galaxy - just as we carried the echo all this way.

baodur_echo_1.003pcdead2029.mp3: You know where you must go. It calls to you still.

baodur_radio.901sensorfi001.mp3: If you are hearing this, then the sequence has been completed... when active, it will destroy Malachor... again.
baodur_radio.901sensorfi002.mp3: I have one last command for you.
baodur_radio.901sensorfi003.mp3: You must remain behind and ensure that the sequence fires properly once the General gives the command... if not, then all we have fought for has been for nothing.
baodur_radio.901sensorfi004.mp3: You have done all I asked... all you were built for. And for that, I thank you.
baodur_radio.901901bao001.mp3: {Hologram: Pending for Functionality}If you are watching this, then what the General suspected was true... the Sith are striking from the graveyard of Malachor V. The ship the Sith Lord was on was one of the vessels damaged in that final battle.
baodur_radio.901901bao002.mp3: If you reach Malachor's surface, the mass shadow generator can be undone... provided there are enough vessels intact within the orbiting debris or buried in the planet's surface.
baodur_radio.901901bao003.mp3: Use the sequence I am unlocking in your memory banks on the engine core of any vessel you encounter on Malachor.
baodur_radio.901901bao004.mp3: If my calculations are correct, four vessels should be enough to power up the mass shadow generator and undo the damage that was done in Malachor V... {a little quieter here at the end}the damage I did.
baodur_radio.901901bao005.mp3: Once the sequence has begun, it cannot be stopped, so make sure the General is off the planet before triggering the sequence. Otherwise, there will be no retreat.
baodur_radio.901901bao006.mp3: I know your weapon systems are minimal, and I don't know what awaits you on Malachor's surface. Try to avoid contact with any potential threats.

hk47.gblhk47063.mp3: {Player just did something nice for someone else, is commenting on it, irritated}Statement: Oh, master, must you act like a Jedi?
hk47.gblhk47065.mp3: {Player just did something nice for someone else, is commenting on it}Statement: Master, I certainly hope this will not become standard behavior.
hk47.gblhk47064.mp3: {Player just did something nice for someone else, is commenting on it, warning}Statement: The path of tolerance and compassion is self-destructive, master.
hk47.gblhk47061.mp3: {Satisfied, like just had a good beer, player just did something evil}Statement: Ah... seeing such cruelties inflicted on the weak gives me hope for all inferior organic meatbags.
hk47.gblhk47059.mp3: {Matter of fact, player just did something evil, impressed}Observation: You display a fascinating variety of cruelties, master. It is difficult to catalogue them all.
hk47.gblhk47062.mp3: {Hopeful, player just did something evil}Query: That was wonderful, master - next time, may I try?
hk47.gblhk47058.mp3: {Matter of fact, player just did something evil}Statement: Master, there are times when your actions make my behavior core glow.
hk47.gbl000react020.mp3: Statement: Oh, master, that was refreshing. Nothing like a spontaneous impulsive extermination to make my behavior core glow.
hk47.gblmira008.mp3: {Off-screen}Interjection: Master, I must disagree. Merely the threat of mass sl-
hk47.gblmira010.mp3: Correction: Assassination theory and execution of said theories is my primary function. {Beat before last sentence}I also possess excellent hearing.
hk47.003attt3006.mp3: Warning: If you draw another +/- 1 card, I will enact assassination protocols.
hk47.gblbaodur081.mp3: Statement: I have had quite enough tampering at the hands of unskilled meatbags such as yourself. I am not eager to submit to this treatment now or in the future.
hk47.gblbaodur083.mp3: Appeasement: I did not mean to imply that you were an unskilled meatbag, as incapable of performing rudimentary repairs as holding a hydrospanner.
hk47.gblbaodur084.mp3: It is only that I am quite particular with my repairs. Perhaps when I am more confident in your abilities, I will allow you to examine my internal components.
hk47.gblbaodur086.mp3: Answer: Indeed I did. I hope you understand how difficult it is for me to trust a meatbag with something as delicate as my inner mechanics.
hk47.gblbaodur087.mp3: Explanation: Our encounters with my copies has convinced me that I should look into upgrading my capabilities, in order that I may be able to destroy them with greater impunity.
hk47.gblbaodur089.mp3: Objection: Nothing of the sort. I am programmed to improve my capabilities, if it will improve my chances of destroying a target.
hk47.gblbaodur090.mp3: {Slightly under his breath}Even as unsavory an avenue as this.
hk47.gblbaodur092.mp3: Retraction: You must understand, my previous interactions with meatbags have rarely been pleasant.
hk47.gblbaodur093.mp3: Disclosure: After all, most of those meetings involved the termination of said meatbags.
hk47.gblbaodur096.mp3: Answer: In that case, please go ahead. Just be careful not to damage any of my delicate parts.
hk47.gblbaodur097.mp3: Analysis: My self-diagnostic indicates that my performance has indeed been improved. Also, many of my systems are reporting improved efficiency.
hk47.gblbaodur098.mp3: Commentary: I am most pleased with this turn of events. It would appear that my initial analysis of your mechanical abilities was incorrect.
hk47.003baohk_2350.mp3: [HK-47 has received a permanent +1 bonus to his Constitution.]
hk47.gblbaodur050.mp3: Analysis: Such an improvement would be beneficial to maintaining optimal damage output in combat situations.
hk47.gblbaodur051.mp3: Suggestion: Master, your technician should be put on this task right away.
hk47.003g0t0hk47002.mp3: Query: What is it you wish, fat one?
hk47.003g0t0hk47007.mp3: Query: Have we had the misfortune to meet before? I believe I would have remembered one as large as you.
hk47.003g0t0hk47004.mp3: {Condescending}Statement: If I require a similar diagnostic in the future, I shall seek out the Iridonian.
hk47.003hk47t3m4010.mp3: Statement: It has been some time, and we have much to discuss.
hk47.003hk47t3m4001.mp3: Statement: My memory core has suffered some damage.{Gameplay Programmer: T3 whirls around as HK speaks.}
hk47.003hk47t3m4002.mp3: Statement: Yet somehow, a gap in my circuits makes me feel as if I should remember you.
hk47.003hk47t3m4003.mp3: Statement: This is all the more important since during my routine inspection of all potential escape routes from this vessel, I made an interesting discovery.{HK-47 walks in, closing in on droid.}
hk47.003hk47t3m4004.mp3: Observation: The navicomputer is voice-locked. As a consequence, you are now responsible for course corrections and astrogation.
hk47.003hk47t3m4005.mp3: Statement: That is indeed a great burden. It also raises many questions.
hk47.003hk47t3m4006.mp3: Query: Why would someone lock the navicomputer? Answer: Presumably to hide where one has been.
hk47.003hk47t3m4009.mp3: Statement: I believe you've been somewhere, somewhere you wish to keep hid-
hk47.003hk47t3m4007.mp3: Statement: I believe you've been somewhere, somewhere you wish to keep hid-
hk47.003hk47tort004.mp3: Statement: I shall up the charge to your circuits next time. Now answer the question.
hk47.003hk47tort006.mp3: Statement: Then I will have to settle for your screams.
hk47.003hk47tort008.mp3: Statement: My prisoner has revealed something of interest. Allow me to share it with you.
hk47.003hk47tort009.mp3: Statement: The facility that is creating these cruder, unsophisticated versions of me is located on Telos. I propose we go there and turn it into a smoldering crater.
hk47.301borna027.mp3: Statement: Our frames are designed to withstand considerably more trauma than you meatbags.
hk47.302airtaxi020.mp3: Suggestion: I excel at such activities, Master. Perhaps I can be of assistance.
hk47.302airtaxi024.mp3: Translation: Master does not recognize his inadequacies.
hk47.302airtaxi023.mp3: Statement: It will be done, Master.
hk47.302airtaxi022.mp3: Statement: The power cells are installed, Master.
hk47.402deton005.mp3: Statement: Your actions make me proud to be your loyal droid.
hk47.402deton2006.mp3: Statement: That explosion has stirred many life-forms in the area. Fighting is undoubtedly imminent.
hk47.402kelborn017.mp3: Interjection: Master, this is one of those rare times when you make my behavioral module glow.
hk47.402kelborn013.mp3: Interjection: Master, I assure you that the elimination of these intruders is an absolute necessity. Please give the command.
hk47.410exit007.mp3: Observation: We are going the wrong way!
hk47.410xarga008.mp3: Interjection: That's a primitive security system, meatbag. It scans its immediate vicinity for anything it perceives as a threat.
hk47.410xarga009.mp3: One of its many faults is that it can't detect stealth field generators.
hk47.501cp_guard007.mp3: Observation: Master, your powers of persuasion without the use of pain or violence is a mystery to me.
hk47.501cp_guard034.mp3: Statement: I understand your reasoning, but I think you should be less subtle in your dealing with your inferiors.
hk47.501cp_guard033.mp3: Statement: Power is meant to be used, Master.
hk47.502mp_ponla052.mp3: Exclamation: My behavioral core glows when my Master acts like this.
hk47.503kavar020.mp3: Observation: This is a great opportunity for slaughter. Area effect attacks, such as grenades will do great damage to soldier and civilian alike.
hk47.512bounty1021.mp3: {Eager, hopes for a fight}{[In wookiee]}Interjection: As long as he is good at running, the target practice will provide a pleasant diversion.
hk47.512bounty1018.mp3: Interjection: Yes, it would be unfortunate if the casual display of weapons were to escalate into a city-wide firefight, resulting scores of meatbag casualties.
hk47.601akkere005.mp3: Observation: It is a hostile galaxy, master - upgrades would allow us to pulverize our enemies more efficiently.
hk47.601azkul046.mp3: Statement: I approve of your style, Master.
hk47.701kreia_cv011.mp3: Observation: This cave is infested with shyracks, a species of easy-to-kill winged pests. They shall prove useful for testing my blaster accuracy ratio.
hk47.702mal_door009.mp3: Observation: It would take more firepower than we have to access the room beyond this door.
hk47.702vash006.mp3: Observation: This body has been dead no more than an hour.
hk47.710sec_tomb016.mp3: Observation: The tomb ahead was devised to keep out sentients not strong in the Force.
hk47.901sensorfi032.mp3: Query: What am I doing here? What has happened?
hk47.901sensorfi033.mp3: Statement: I understand. Assassination protocols activated. Let us see what you have in your arsenal, fat one.
hk47.901sensorfi034.mp3: Statement: Come out, little one. I promise I will end you quickly, without a single lingering charge remaining in your behavior core.
hk47.901sensorfi035.mp3: {Evil, hunting}Statement: Hiding from me is useless. I will find you eventually - you only delay the inevitable.
hk47.901sensorfi014.mp3: Statement: As always, fat one, you have miscalculated.
hk47.901sensorfi015.mp3: And while I find this small droid annoying in the extreme, I find my urge to shoot you takes a higher priority.
hk47.901sensorfi022.mp3: {Irritated}Observation: I thought he would never die.
hk47.901sensorfi012.mp3: Correction: One could rust listening to your speeches, fat one. Perhaps it is the large, unwieldy vocabulator within your moon-sized frame that prevents your calculations from taking me into account.
hk47.902sensorfi014.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer: HK-47 is destroyed, several HK-50s and HK-51s arrive on the scene, behind G0-T0, flanking him like thugs.]}
hk47.gblhk47232.mp3: Of course, we would need to find three separate HK squads and use this device in order to target their base.
hk47.gblhk47447.mp3: Statement: Master, I think I have detected signals emanating from this planet that indicate the presence of other assassin droids such as myself.
hk47.gblhk47014.mp3: Query: Is there someone that you need killed, master?
hk47.gblhk47274.mp3: {A little confused, doesn't understand the player}Statement: Master, before you go, I had a question for you.
hk47.gblhk47401.mp3: Statement: Yes, master. My, I must confess, I enjoy it when you are so authoratative and dismissive toward me. It bodes well for your treatment of our enemies.
hk47.gblhk47275.mp3: Query: I must express some degree of confusion concerning your actions. You are the one who followed Revan in the Mandalorian Wars, are you not?
hk47.gblhk47276.mp3: Observation: Well, master, I was not at Malachor V during your near-genocidal reaction to the Mandalorian threat, but I feel that I may have been constructed as a result of that.
hk47.gblhk47277.mp3: Observation: I believe that Revan determined that mass slaughter on such a scale may no longer be needed to achieve his aims.
hk47.gblhk47278.mp3: So perhaps you are responsible for my creation.
hk47.gblhk47281.mp3: Answer: No, master. I was constructed shortly after the beginning of the Jedi Civil War.
hk47.gblhk47282.mp3: {Condescending}Answer: Oh, master, please, use your imagination. I am an illegally constructed assassination droid designed to masquerade as a protocol droid until I reach my target.
hk47.gblhk47399.mp3: Clarification: Well, yes, perhaps concerning the somewhat dubious morality of the Republic Senate, that would leave some doubt as to my allegiance.
hk47.gblhk47400.mp3: Answer: Very well, yes, I served on Revan's side during the Jedi Civil War - just as you did against the Mandalorians.
hk47.gblhk47283.mp3: Answer: Well, master, unless you were operating on my central control cluster, I would be somewhat hesitant to discuss my targets. But I suppose it could do no harm.
hk47.gblhk47284.mp3: During the Jedi Civil War, I was responsible for certain strategic targets. For some reason, Revan did not feel that the Republic presented much of a military threat.
hk47.gblhk47285.mp3: Aside: I am somewhat unclear as to why this was so, but Revan did have a certain biological instinct regarding such things, so I will simply say that there were probably reasons for such an assessment.
hk47.gblhk47286.mp3: [Influence: Success] Answer: Revan felt the true war was against the Jedi.
hk47.gblhk47287.mp3: Observation: It was not something discussed with much of the others, but I think Revan recognized that a single Jedi, both in the past and in the present, could turn the tide of a conflict.
hk47.gblhk47288.mp3: So my targets were frequently Jedi, or someone close to a Jedi that could result in their corruption or collapse. Revan often assigned me to kill leaders or supporters of certain Jedi so as to erode their will.
hk47.gblhk47289.mp3: Answer: Revan saw the pressures of war on Dxun, and knew that even in the heat of conflict, Jedi could be broken, not physically, but psychologically.
hk47.gblhk47290.mp3: Observation: It is a curious thing to assassinate and wound someone's personality, to assassinate them psychologically, and it took me some time to reconcile the acts.
hk47.gblhk47291.mp3: I am much more used to the... direct approach. Still, I served well, and killed many Jedi.
hk47.gblhk47338.mp3: [Influence: Success] Request: First, Master, I would appreciate it if Jedi need to be killed, that you permit me to kill those annoying pseudo-pacifists for you.
hk47.gblhk47339.mp3: But if you are determined to do it yourself, then there are many techniques I would suggest.
hk47.gblhk47340.mp3: Recitation: First, weapon selection is critical. If I see one more idiot attacking a Jedi with a blaster pistol, then I'll kill them myself.
hk47.gblhk47341.mp3: {Shakes head before "silly Jedi."}Answer: Select grenades, sonic screamers, cluster rockets, and plasma charges. Mines are also effective, since many Jedi will run to meet you in hand to hand combat. {Smiles}Silly Jedi.
hk47.gblhk47342.mp3: Addendum: Gas attacks are effective if you can take the Jedi by surprise - inhalation is less effective than ones that work on skin contact, as some Jedi seem able to hold their breath for long periods of time.
hk47.gblhk47343.mp3: Cautionary: Still, don't rely on it, since Jedi can fight off the effects, it just distracts them, leaving them open to another avenue of attack .
hk47.gblhk47344.mp3: Recitation: Do not forget to activate any energy shields you possess.
hk47.gblhk47345.mp3: Lightsabers, while powerful, have trouble penetrating most military issue energy shields - provided they are energy shields and not those crude Mandalorian melee shields.
hk47.gblhk47346.mp3: Answer: Countering their other powers is more difficult.
hk47.gblhk47347.mp3: Confession: I do not fully understand their other abilities, but I do know that many of them require that the Jedi know that you are there, and can see you.
hk47.gblhk47348.mp3: Thus, sniping and using cover are always advantageous.
hk47.gblhk47349.mp3: Evaluation: A technique that Revan used frequently was to attack a Jedi indirectly. This method only works if the Jedi is adhering to the self-destructive path of pacifism and sacrifice.
hk47.gblhk47350.mp3: Answer: Kill their allies, or place them in jeopardy. Many Jedi will leave themselves exposed in order to protect another.
hk47.gblhk47351.mp3: That is why there is many less Jedi than there were a decade ago.
hk47.gblhk47356.mp3: Answer: No, master. In addition to traps, mines, and orbital bombardment, Revan and the Sith often employed meatbag assassins for some Jedi, skilled in the same techniques that I was trained in.
hk47.gblhk47357.mp3: Strangely enough, Revan believed that meatbags that did not use or believe in the Force were especially important, since in many respects, they were more difficult for Jedi to detect.
hk47.gblhk47358.mp3: Revan had many of them trained to "hide their minds," as it were. Again, once these techniques were learned, the percentage of living Jedi began to decrease accordingly.
hk47.gblhk47359.mp3: Answer: Generally, this was done by broadcasting strong emotions while thinking about something else. It was a curious technique, but it seemed to be effective in blinding Jedi.
hk47.gblhk47360.mp3: Whether guilt, lust, fear - they act as mental interference, making finding the true intentions of the broadcasting meatbag difficult.
hk47.gblhk47361.mp3: Answer: Obviously, a Force Sensitive broadcasting such emotions puts themselves at risk of not using the Force "properly," since to use it seems to require an inner calm that most meatbags do not possess.
hk47.gblhk47362.mp3: As much as the Jedi could not use such a technique, the Sith Lords cannot use it for much the same reasons - such passions as guilt, lust, and fear are rarely strengths to the Sith code.
hk47.gblhk47363.mp3: Statement: The master felt it was ironic that only people who had experienced such passions could harm Jedi in such a way - that to kill Jedi, you had to be a human being. Revan found that quite amusing.
hk47.gblhk47382.mp3: Answer: Perhaps I will elaborate on them at another time, master. I do not wish to reveal all such techniques in case it leaves me no recourse should I need to terminate you.
hk47.gblhk47364.mp3: Answer: The odds of me being forced to use such techniques against you has decreased, master. There are some more methods I could describe, if you wish.
hk47.gblhk47365.mp3: Statement: Overwhelming odds is also a good tactic, master. There are few Jedi that can long hold their ground against a hundred attackers all firing at once... or being turned on by their own troops.
hk47.gblhk47366.mp3: But the most effective weapon against Jedi seems to be the erosion of the spirit.
hk47.gblhk47367.mp3: Answer: Revan claimed that psychological warfare against Jedi was important because much of their power comes from their state of mind, their connection to this religion called the "Force."
hk47.gblhk47368.mp3: {This is very important, this is what the player can do on a vast scale}Revan said that many Jedi have the capability to form connections to life around them, although few of them realized the extent to which this is possible.
hk47.gblhk47369.mp3: Recollection: I believe my Master speculated that many Jedi did not fully form such connections because of their discipline, because they never opened their lives to the passions around them.
hk47.gblhk47370.mp3: I believe Revan termed it that "one would need to be a human being to develop such connections." It is something that the Jedi code could not teach. One simply knew it instinctively, or not.
hk47.gblhk47371.mp3: Observation: Master, I am somewhat surprised that I need to explain this to you at all, considering your past with Revan.
hk47.gblhk47951.mp3: Answer: Why, she said you had such capability, master, but it would be your downfall. To tie so much of yourself into others - if they suffer or die, then you would die as well.
hk47.gblhk47372.mp3: Answer: Why, he said you had such capability, master, but it would be your downfall. To tie so much of yourself into others - if they suffer or die, then you would die as well.
hk47.gblhk47373.mp3: Observation: I think Revan pitied you, master. It was very insulting, if I may say so.
hk47.gblhk47374.mp3: Clarification: Whatever it is called, master, it seems to be quite a vulnerability. Revan even admitted as such.
hk47.gblhk47375.mp3: When a Jedi, or any soldier, suffers doubt, it weakens them. With the Jedi, however, it is more pronounced, since they are extreme examples.
hk47.gblhk47376.mp3: That is why Revan felt that Malachor V was so important. It was intended to be a conversion tool.
hk47.gblhk47377.mp3: Assessment: When faced with a continuous series of hard-fought battles, I detected a significant statistical increase in Jedi following Revan over the Jedi Code - a compromise in principles brought about by battlefield conditions.
hk47.gblhk47378.mp3: The emotional weight of war changed Jedi morale, power, and eventually, their allegiance.
hk47.gblhk47379.mp3: Conclusion: I believe the Mandalorian Wars were to beat the Mandalorians and also to allow Revan to build the foundation of his army.
hk47.gblhk47380.mp3: But I am surprised you have not already arrived at this conclusion.
hk47.gblhk47381.mp3: Surely the loss of your troops and the Jedi who served under you at Malachor V, had a detrimental effect upon you and your ties to the Force - and I suspect, your desire to be around others ever again.
hk47.gblhk47352.mp3: Cautionary: Oh, no, master. In fact, that is the worst thing you can do.
hk47.gblhk47353.mp3: Explanation: Statistically, overplanning the assassination of a Jedi seems to backfire.
hk47.gblhk47354.mp3: Extrapolation: There are many theorists who claim Jedi can see the future, and I do not know if that is true, but it seems impulsive acts are more common to succeed than planned incidents.
hk47.gblhk47355.mp3: {More to himself}Jedi, like sand-kivers, seem to sense trouble a few seconds before it happens. They are tricky little pests.
hk47.gblhk47971.mp3: [Influence: Failure] Answer: Master, I think that should wait until I am certain of your allegiance - and your intentions toward me and the galaxy.
hk47.gblhk47972.mp3: {A little miffed}I mean, to simply give away trade secrets in such a way - it would be an insult to my protocols.
hk47.gblhk47297.mp3: Answer: Yes, master. It wasn't always easy, and I had to adapt quickly to rapidly changing battle conditions. And they would often sever my limbs and my head from my torso, which was an inconvenience.
hk47.gblhk47331.mp3: {Chiding at end}Answer: Oh, yes, master. I hope none of them were friends of yours. But really, they had it coming.
hk47.gblhk47332.mp3: I do not know when the Jedi ceased to be adherents to their code, but many did not tread cautiously, and many were quite arrogant when facing a droid, as if we were somehow beneath them.
hk47.gblhk47333.mp3: It gave certain kills an added pleasure when being underestimated.
hk47.gblhk47334.mp3: Cautionary: Master, don't take this the wrong way, but in my opinion, a blaster shot to the throat is often the best way of silencing Jedi hypocrisy.
hk47.gblhk47335.mp3: I have found many Jedi to be arrogant practitioners of pacifism when it is convenient for them. Also, their tendency to never directly answer a question is rather annoying.
hk47.gblhk47336.mp3: Statement: I do not have the exact counts, master, since it is difficult to determine who was a Jedi and who was not - it seemed to be largely a matter of perspective.
hk47.gblhk47337.mp3: I did kill many soldiers who used techniques in combat that could make them be considered Jedi, although they called themselves Sith.
hk47.gblhk47298.mp3: {Challenging}Query: Then why do you get to remain?
hk47.gblhk47299.mp3: {Slight biting accusation}Observation: It seems to me that you have killed many more Jedi than I could ever hope to achieve.
hk47.gblhk47300.mp3: This was formerly something that generated respect, now I wonder from your tone if those deaths you caused were merely an accident. How disappointing.
hk47.gblhk47329.mp3: Query: "Might?" Oh, master, I would hope in the future that you would not hesitate when an opportunity presents itself.
hk47.gblhk47330.mp3: Let nothing stand between you and your targets, especially the twin crippling behaviors of hesitation or forethought.
hk47.gblhk47328.mp3: {Saddened}Statement: Oh, master, please say no more. Every word of apology you utter from now on will simply chip away at my last of my respect reserves for you that I had stored in my core.
hk47.gblhk47325.mp3: Observation: And if you did, master, I could not prevent you. I will suggest that if my words are difficult to hear, then it is lost past time someone said them to you.
hk47.gblhk47326.mp3: Speaking from the perspective of one who suffers considerable memory problems, repressing such horrific acts of slaughter seems like such a waste.
hk47.gblhk47327.mp3: {Wistful}It is better to drag such delightful memories kicking and screaming into the open, where they may be examined and replayed again and again, savoring each beautiful moment.
hk47.gblhk47301.mp3: Retort: Master, the hypocrisy of you meatbags never fails to cause a surge in my behavior core.
hk47.gblhk47302.mp3: Not only have you no doubt ended the lives of many recently, but in light of the event at Malachor V, you must recognize that death is necessary.
hk47.gblhk47303.mp3: Evaluation: Well, master, that is your problem. Personally, I think you should seek help, but you seem to be the silent loner type, unwilling to admit such weaknesses to another.
hk47.gblhk47304.mp3: Answer: Oh, quite easily, master. If you had not slaughtered the Mandalorians at Malachor V, they would have destroyed you and everything you tried to protect.
hk47.gblhk47305.mp3: Now once you accept that the Mandalorians had to die, then the next logical step is determine exactly how many need to die to convince them to correct their need for conquest.
hk47.gblhk47306.mp3: And that, I am pleased to say, is where I come in.
hk47.gblhk47307.mp3: Statement: It is a fact that the targeted extermination of certain individuals will bring war to a close quickly and efficiently. Leaders unite - and when the leaders are removed, the unity they inspire erodes as well.
hk47.gblhk47308.mp3: You were a General in the Mandalorian Wars, master. I have seen the records of your battles, and I know that your name was one the Mandalorians feared.
hk47.gblhk47309.mp3: It is not solely because of your skill in battle, but the fact that you could inspire others, convincing them to fight to the death in situations where other military leaders would be forced to retreat.
hk47.gblhk47310.mp3: Revan often speculated on your leadership in this regard. I believe my previous master had formed some other conclusions concerning you.
hk47.gblhk47311.mp3: Revan's apprentice wanted me to kill you when you left the war effort and did not go with them to the Unknown Regions, but Revan would not permit it.
hk47.gblhk47312.mp3: Speculation: I believe Revan wanted you to face the Jedi Council, master. As if there was something that you would show them and possibly undermine their strength.
hk47.gblhk47313.mp3: Perhaps Revan wished the Council to see how far the Jedi had fallen. Knowing Revan, it was no doubt a strategic decision on many levels.
hk47.gblhk47318.mp3: Statement: Master, that, again, requires a somewhat complicated answer. Because this exchange is in danger of boring me, I will simply say, "no."
hk47.gblhk47319.mp3: And that I am glad I was never in service to Malak.
hk47.gblhk47323.mp3: Observation: Revan was a human capable of subtle, intelligent cruelties. She had a strategic mind, and she accepted losses and sacrifices.
hk47.gblhk47324.mp3: Her meatbag apprentice was more like an angry club.
hk47.gblhk47320.mp3: Observation: Revan was a human capable of subtle, intelligent cruelties. He had a strategic mind, and he accepted losses and sacrifices.
hk47.gblhk47321.mp3: His meatbag apprentice was more like an angry club.
hk47.gblhk47322.mp3: He was also given to grandiose displays of brutality and murder that seemed inefficient - and in many cases, unnecessary.
hk47.gblhk47314.mp3: Observation: Master, this is purely speculation, but there is a certain strength in parading defeated leaders before their people.
hk47.gblhk47315.mp3: Perhaps Revan felt that your return to the Council in your state would show them what Jedi were capable of - and the cost.
hk47.gblhk47316.mp3: Revan often referred to you as a Jedi who was already dead, and felt your reception by the Council would further show you their hypocrisy.
hk47.gblhk47317.mp3: Considering the council's judgment, I see they did not receive your return well. Perhaps whatever anger they held for Revan they held against you.
hk47.gblhk47292.mp3: {Quietly, this is the core of the PLAYER'S problem}Observation: Master, that was the lesson of Malachor. Any Jedi involved in the systematic slaughter on such a scale cannot help but doubt and question themselves.
hk47.gblhk47293.mp3: Observation: Master, I do not believe that the Mandalorians were the true target at Malachor - I believe that the intention was to destroy the Jedi, break their will, and make them loyal to Revan.
hk47.gblhk47294.mp3: I do not know if you examined the records of the deaths on Malachor, but you cannot escape that many of the Jedi and Republic soldiers who died were not Revan's strongest supporters.
hk47.gblhk47295.mp3: Observation: I believe that Revan was "cleaning house" at Malachor V. What ones did not die became Revan's allies against the Republic.
hk47.gblhk47969.mp3: [Influence: Failure] Answer: Master, that is somewhat a complex question, and I do not want to burden you with a complicated answer.
hk47.gblhk47970.mp3: Besides, I am still evaluating your tactical and psychological threat to me - perhaps when I have completed my analysis, we may speak more.
hk47.gblhk47279.mp3: Answer: Oh, please, master - even as a metaphor, that idea is repugnant. You are a gland-driven meatbag, while I am of superior droid construction.
hk47.gblhk47280.mp3: Clarification: I meant that I was built as a result of the need for a selective killing machine rather than a crude mass-slaughter war droid.
hk47.gblhk47454.mp3: {Pleased}Statement: Something approaching joy is now growing in my behavior core, master. Please install it at once.
hk47.gblhk47455.mp3: Cautionary: But please do so carefully. I have seen how you use a hydrospanner.
hk47.gblhk47402.mp3: {Confused, just had his programming switched to become a peace-loving droid, play it up for comedy}Answer: I... do not know... master. I feel strange. Like a circuit has been flipped.
hk47.gblhk47406.mp3: Answer: Assassination protocols? As in the premeditated killing of another for personal or economic gain?
hk47.gblhk47407.mp3: {Sincere}Surely master is joking with his humble, peace-loving droid. I exist only to serve and learn how to serve meatbags.
hk47.gblhk47408.mp3: Musing: I think perhaps I would enjoy learning a new language. Or watching an informative holovid.
hk47.gblhk47414.mp3: Answer: Master, your concern is unfounded. I assure you, I am operating at peak efficiency.
hk47.gblhk47412.mp3: Statement: I am fulfilling my primary function, which is to facilitate communication between species and put an end to hostilities.
hk47.gblhk47409.mp3: {Pleasant greeting}Greeting: Oh, hello, little T3 unit. I am HK-47, protocol and translation droid.
hk47.gblhk47411.mp3: {Slight indignation}Answer: Of course I am all right. Why wouldn't I be?
hk47.gblhk47413.mp3: I respect all life. All life is connected and should be nurtured.
hk47.gblhk47973.mp3: {Being operated on}Exclamation: No! Master, no! What are you doing?
hk47.gblhk47974.mp3: {Irritated}Statement: Master, please, I beg you. Never install anything again without checking it in the diagnostics bay first.
hk47.gblhk47975.mp3: {Disgust}That was a close one - I almost surrendered completely to peace and pacifisim - how repugnant.
hk47.gblhk47976.mp3: Conclusion: Still there was a brief moment where I felt like I almost understood why some meatbags choose peace and friendship over a high-powered blaster carbine.
hk47.gblhk47977.mp3: Query: Now, are there any other horrors you wish to try and insert in my system, or is your electronic butchery done?
hk47.gblhk47404.mp3: Answer: Oh, master, I could not allow myself to harm another. What if they have families? Or children?
hk47.gblhk47405.mp3: {Wistful}We must always think of the children. The littlest ones always suffer in war.
hk47.gblhk47403.mp3: {Woried}Answer: Combat ready? Did you mean in case we need to run away or retreat? Oh my, I am afraid I am ill-equipped for combat.
hk47.gblhk47030.mp3: Statement: Oh, I am aware of that, master. I simply use it to give you the illusion of control and obedience. Humans often need such comforts until the end comes.
hk47.gblhk47032.mp3: Consolation: Master, everyone dies eventually, and not all of them by my hand. Even droids die when not routinely maintained, sadly enough.
hk47.gblhk47031.mp3: {Of course I obey you... sucker}Statement: Of course I do, master. Until the end.
hk47.gblhk47025.mp3: Answer: Many organic meatbags find that question difficult to answer, Master, but I believe I can provide you with a satisfactory definition.
hk47.gblhk47026.mp3: Definition: "Love" is making a shot to the knees of a target 120 kilometers away using an Aratech sniper rifle with a tri-light scope.
hk47.gblhk47027.mp3: Statement: This definition, I am told, is subject to interpretation. Obviously, love is a matter of odds.
hk47.gblhk47028.mp3: Not many meatbags could make such a shot, and strangely enough, not many meatbags would derive love from it.
hk47.gblhk47029.mp3: Yet for me, love is knowing your target, putting them in your targeting reticule, and together, achieving a singular purpose... against statistically long odds.
hk47.gblhk47015.mp3: Statement: Master, assassination is my primary function. It is only expected that when you speak to me, it is to give me the order to kill.
hk47.gblhk47016.mp3: {Irritated}Statement: Oh, very well, master. No doubt you are bothering me because you wish to interrogate me with harmless, non-lethal questions.
hk47.gblhk47017.mp3: Or perhaps you need the deck of your freighter scrubbed. Or an exciting alien text translated.
hk47.gblhk47018.mp3: My circuits are a-buzz with anticipation of what your next task will be for me that does not involve ending the life of an organic meatbag that deserves death.
hk47.gblhk47024.mp3: {Not happy about it}Statement: Ah. More questions. Wonderful.
hk47.gblhk47448.mp3: Theory: Well, master, I believe I was shot repeatedly. Once reduced to my component parts I suspect pieces of me were sold across the galaxy.
hk47.gblhk47449.mp3: Statement: I am an extremely valuable piece of equipment after all, master. My parts were no doubt costly to obtain, and their new owners hesitant to part with them.
hk47.gblhk47451.mp3: Statement: There is no need to hide your embarrassment over the high price I commanded, master. I will be worth every credit... despite my apparent memory damage, crippled assassination protocols, and the small amount of rust that decorates my frame.
hk47.gblhk47453.mp3: Regardless, please bear in mind that I am quite an asset, and that you would be well-advised to take good care of me.
hk47.gblhk47450.mp3: I would be most distressed if you were to shoot me, attack me, or dismember me in any way. I do not wish to repeat the experience.
hk47.gblhk47019.mp3: {Slightly excited}Statement: Ah - you wish to conduct an interrogation? Very well, proceed.
hk47.gblhk47022.mp3: Statement: Master, I am no behavior droid, but it is obvious to me that you have serious ethical problems that will need to be treated at some point.
hk47.gblhk47023.mp3: Very well, ask your questions. If you feel the need to make it an interrogation, however, do not restrain yourself. I would be saddened if you held back.
hk47.gblhk47458.mp3: {Hurt}Statement: Master, you wound me. Not physically, but in my behavior core.
hk47.gblhk47459.mp3: It is true that I once possessed many more protocols and upgrades, but time and damage has taken its toll.
hk47.gblhk47460.mp3: {A little wistful}And I am afraid that I have a rather long history of memory problems which has also compromised my effectiveness as well.
hk47.gblhk47461.mp3: Still, you will find me a valuable asset, master, willing and able to terminate anything you point me towards.
hk47.gblhk47218.mp3: Answer: No, master, I do not. I am afraid I have been out of touch with the Sith for many years.
hk47.gblhk47219.mp3: This new Sith threat fights differently than the ones I was familiar with - these seem to favor stealth and assassination to achieve their ends.
hk47.gblhk47220.mp3: Answer: No, master. The Sith had many hidden bases and strongholds before and during the Jedi Civil War, and I doubt the Republic found them all.
hk47.gblhk47221.mp3: Theory: It is possible that the Sith still hold one such base - if not several.
hk47.gblhk47222.mp3: Consolation: But I would not worry, Master, I imagine it will not be long before their murderous hands try to seize you by the throat.
hk47.gblhk47223.mp3: Twi'lek Metaphor: It seems like they are attracted to you like krek beetles during the Bright Land seasons.
hk47.gblhk47238.mp3: Query: Master, excuse me, one thing I have noticed as we travel the galaxy - you seem to possess the ability to understand a variety of alien languages.
hk47.gblhk47239.mp3: Forgive me, but that does not seem in keeping with my assessment of your talents.
hk47.gblhk47224.mp3: Query: Master, excuse me, but how is it you know so many languages?
hk47.gblhk47236.mp3: Statement: My apologies, master, but that device seems to know all the languages I do, and I am feeling degrees of familiarity and inferiority both at once.
hk47.gblhk47237.mp3: Statement: Very well, master. I will await patiently until you realize that perhaps letting me examine that device may shed light on our current predicament.
hk47.gblhk47226.mp3: Answer: Because it seems to know all the languages I do, and I am feeling degrees of familiarity and inferiority both at once.
hk47.gblhk47228.mp3: {Studying object}Indeed, it seems to be modeled after my vocabulator, with some modifications, of course. Curious. You say you obtained this device on Peragus?
hk47.gblhk47229.mp3: Observation: Master, I do believe this device serves multiple functions - including tracking your position. It is sending out a passive carrier wave that signals itself to HK units in the vicinity.
hk47.gblhk47968.mp3: Observation: Master, I do believe this device serves multiple functions - including tracking your position for any HK units in the vicinity.
hk47.gblhk47235.mp3: Confirmation: Yes, master, I believe so.
hk47.gblhk47230.mp3: Objection: Master, they do not know we have discovered it. Which means the advantage is ours.
hk47.gblhk47965.mp3: Statement: I suspect when the time is right, this device can be used to pinpoint the location of the HK factory - and I... I mean, we... can deal with them once and for all.
hk47.gblhk47966.mp3: Answer: Master, the nature of the signal from the sonic imprint sensor is such that we must wait until it is signaled.
hk47.gblhk47967.mp3: It does not please me any more than it does you, but one of the primary traits of an assassin... or assassin droid... is patience.
hk47.gblhk47383.mp3: Answer: Master, when conventional weapons will not work, then one must resort to other means of assassination.
hk47.gblhk47384.mp3: When Jedi... or Sith... or whatever they call themselves, cannot be defeated with weapons, then use doubt.
hk47.gblhk47385.mp3: Evaluation: It sounds as if this Sith Lord is somehow able to keep fighting, no doubt by drawing on his connection to the Force to keep him alive even after suffering grievous harm.
hk47.gblhk47386.mp3: It may be whatever pain he experienced in the past was so great, that the technique he used to recover from it... and sustain himself... also gives him an incredibly high pain threshold.
hk47.gblhk47387.mp3: Answer: Well, master, you have heard of Jedi healing techniques - that is certainly possible. The Sith may have their equivalent, although it seems known only to this particular Sith Lord.
hk47.gblhk47388.mp3: I know many Jedi and Sith have exhibited strange behavior in near-death situations. This may be another example of this.
hk47.gblhk47398.mp3: Clarification: Not impossible, master, but judging from the description, it may be improbable.
hk47.gblhk47389.mp3: Observation: It does seem unlikely, master, but I have observed that you - allies included - seem to be able to recover from the most grievous of injuries, and quickly as well.
hk47.gblhk47390.mp3: Perhaps it is not as uncommon as one would think. Besides, it really doesn't matter what you believe.
hk47.gblhk47391.mp3: Clarification: Master, I spoke literally. It doesn't matter what you believe - it matters what this Sith Lord believes.
hk47.gblhk47392.mp3: If his strength comes from his connection to the Force, then you must undermine that connection, master.
hk47.gblhk47393.mp3: Answer: Doubt, master. It has killed many Jedi... and it has killed many Sith.
hk47.gblhk47394.mp3: Make him doubt himself, his beliefs, or his intentions. Such things disrupt connections to the Force - and death soon follows.
hk47.gblhk47395.mp3: The only question is what belief or intention he holds dear that would make an effective target.
hk47.gblhk47396.mp3: Answer: Oh, master, I have no idea. That does present something of a problem.
hk47.gblhk47397.mp3: If you should encounter the target in the future, I would bait him into talking and see what you can draw from him that you can use against him.
hk47.gblhk47189.mp3: [Influence: Success] {Takes a deep breath, this is a hell of an answer}Statement: Master, that is a question that has an extremely complicated answer.
hk47.gblhk47217.mp3: You see, I do not believe my Master knew who she was most of the time, which led to some confusing situations that could have otherwise been avoided.
hk47.gblhk47190.mp3: You see, I do not believe my Master knew who he was most of the time, which led to some confusing situations that could have otherwise been avoided.
hk47.gblhk47215.mp3: Clarification: Suffice to say that my Master had her ups and downs, and in my opinion, traveled from a high point in her life to a low point, and then back again to her true potential.
hk47.gblhk47216.mp3: And even as a meatbag, my Master still had some remarkably efficient droid-like qualities which I admired. She, too, suffered memory problems as I did.
hk47.gblhk47212.mp3: Clarification: Suffice to say that my Master had her ups and downs, and in my opinion, traveled from a high point in her life to a low point.
hk47.gblhk47213.mp3: She developed qualities such as mercy, compassion, and even love for others. It was really rather revolting.
hk47.gblhk47214.mp3: Still, my Master had some remarkably efficient droid-like qualities which I admired. She, too, suffered memory problems as I did.
hk47.gblhk47209.mp3: Clarification: Suffice to say that my Master had his ups and downs, and in my opinion, traveled from a high point in his life to a low point, and then back again to his true potential.
hk47.gblhk47210.mp3: He could be a merciless, efficient killer when the need arose. It really made my behavior core glow.
hk47.gblhk47211.mp3: And even as a meatbag, my Master still had some remarkably efficient droid-like qualities which I admired. He, too, suffered memory problems as I did.
