carth.221carthend024.mp3: She said that she believed something had been behind the Mandalorian Wars. That it hadn't been the Mandalorians choice to attack the Republic.
carth.221carthend025.mp3: Whatever it was, I think she went off to find it... to fight it.
carth.221carthend026.mp3: It was near the end of the Jedi Civil War, when it seemed like we were going to lose everything.
carth.221carthend027.mp3: {Beginning story, will fade to black}We met on a Republic warship, called the Endar Spire. It was being attacked over Taris, and the Sith had stormed the ship...
carth.221carthend047.mp3: We saved the Republic. But it was like the war didn't end for him. He would keep remembering things that he'd done, and it kept driving him.
carth.221carthend048.mp3: And I think he finally remembered something terrible that he'd done during the Mandalorian Wars. And he went to put an end to it.
carth.221carthend049.mp3: {Talking about Bastilla}He left a lot of people who cared about him behind. But I think he did it because he thought it was the right thing to do.
carth.221carthend050.mp3: But whatever he set out to do, I...I don't think he succeeded.
carth.221carthend051.mp3: And here you return, with his ship, without him.
carth.221carthend028.mp3: We saved the Republic. But it was like the war didn't end for her. She would keep remembering things that she had done, and it kept driving her. And she kept using it as a wall between us.
carth.221carthend046.mp3: I think she finally remembered something, some threat to the Republic that she had created during the Mandalorian Wars. And she went to put an end to it.
carth.221carthend029.mp3: And I think she finally remembered something terrible she had done during the Mandalorian Wars. And she went to put an end to it.
carth.221carthend030.mp3: She left without warning. She didn't say where, only that it was to a place where she could not take anyone she loved.
carth.221carthend031.mp3: And here you return, with her ship, without her.
carth.221carthend045.mp3: Yes, wherever he went, your ship's been there.
carth.221carthend032.mp3: Yes, wherever she went, your ship's been there.
carth.221carthend033.mp3: If... if you return to that place, if you find some trace of Revan...
carth.221carthend044.mp3: Simply tell him that Admiral Onasi is following his orders.
carth.221carthend035.mp3: Simply tell her that Carth Onassi is waiting for her.
carth.221carthend036.mp3: {Quietly, after the door closes.}Safe journey, exile.
carth.221carthend040.mp3: He asked us to stay, to keep the Republic safe. It was important to him.
carth.221carthend041.mp3: And after meeting the exile, I'm convinced that there are worse things to lose in the galaxy.{Fade out}
carth.221carthend010.mp3: {A little tired, sad, honored Revan, staring off in the distance}I served with him, like you did. And we had to part ways, like you did.
carth.221carthend011.mp3: {Staring off into distance}He said that there were places where he had to walk where I could not go - places where having allies, or anyone he cared about, would only place them in danger.
carth.221carthend012.mp3: It's been four years, and I still don't know what happened to him.
carth.221carthend018.mp3: She told me to stay here, to try to keep the Republic strong, and that she would return. It was the hardest request I ever had to follow.
carth.221carthend013.mp3: {Male}I don't believe that. I've lost friends before - and until I see them dead, I don't believe it.
carth.221carthend014.mp3: He told me to stay here, to try to keep the Republic strong, and that he would return. It was the hardest request I ever had to follow.
carth.221carthend015.mp3: I don't know. But it was important to him.
carth.221carthend016.mp3: He said that he believed something had been behind the Mandalorian Wars. That it hadn't been the Mandalorians choice to attack the Republic.
carth.221carthend017.mp3: Whatever it was, I think he went off to find it... to fight it.
carth.221carthend054.mp3: Very well. I have taken enough of your time, then. For what it's worth, I thank you.
carth.222carth003.mp3: Let's close the trap. Concentrate all fire on the warship and deploy red and blue wings to engage enemy fighters.
carth.222carth006.mp3: We can't hope to match its firepower - but we need to draw it away from Telos.
carth.222carth008.mp3: {Urgent, punching controls}I am aware of the situation, lieutenant. I do not intend to lose Telos twice.
carth.222carth009.mp3: And I know that ship. It was at Malachor V.
carth.222carth001.mp3: {GAMEPLAY PROGRAMMER: If it is possible to call animations, have Carth look "worried". Cut to another camera to the side of Carth that shows both the navigator of the ship and Carth. The navigator is hitting controls on the console.}

carth_radio.151repcapt016.mp3: "You have permission to divert course, captain. If there is a Sith presence in the region, I want you to investigate."
carth_radio.151repcapt017.mp3: {Probing, the ID signature of the vessel is very important, but he doesn't want to tip his hand}"The ID signature on the freighter... did you get confirmation on it?"
carth_radio.151repcapt019.mp3: 'There was, captain. If you find any trace of that vessel - even wreckage, I want it.'
carth_radio.151repcapt032.mp3: "After you have investigated the sector, resume course to Telos with the passenger. It is of the highest importance that he reach Telos."
carth_radio.151repcapt021.mp3: "After you have investigated the sector, resume course to Telos with the passenger. It is of the highest importance that she reach Telos."

carth_radio_1.201201shu003.mp3: Citadel Station, this is Admiral Carth Onasi of the Republic Cruiser Sojourn.
carth_radio_1.201201shu005.mp3: Grenn! It's nice to know the TSF hasn't gone to shambles in my absence.
carth_radio_1.201201shu008.mp3: Well, it can't be that bad, Grenn, I think Telos has already been through the worst.
carth_radio_1.201201shu011.mp3: Well, that's unfortunate, but luckily it still fits our plans.
carth_radio_1.201201shu013.mp3: I'll tell you more when I arrive, but the Republic has decided not to detain the exile, and adopt a wait-and-see approach.
carth_radio_1.201201shu015.mp3: Like I said, we'll talk more when I arrive.

bastila.gblhk47208.mp3: {This is a line that HK-50 is playing back in Bastilla's voice, mocking his lines from the first game - do it breathlessly}"Oh, master, I love you but I hate all you stand for, but I think we should go press our slimy, mucus-covered lips together in the cargo hold!"
bastila.gblt3m4105.mp3: T3, I have one last order for you. Our master does not know about this, and I order you to keep it a secret.
bastila.gblt3m4106.mp3: {Evil Bastilla}Every day as we build upon Korriban, more of his memories return - and the bond he and I share cannot hide it from me.
bastila.gblt3m4107.mp3: {Evil Bastilla, Hesitant at the end, does not like to admit that she is afraid}He believes a threat lurks on the edge of the galaxy. Something that could threaten his power. I... fear he will go there... and I fear he will not return.
bastila.gblt3m4108.mp3: {Evil Bastilla, Rueful at end, wants to go with Revan, but knows why she can't}If he leaves, he will take you with him - but not I. He knows the bond we share may prove a weakness... but he will take you.
bastila.gblt3m4109.mp3: {Evil Bastilla}If something happens, T3, then I need you to return to the Republic and find me. And if you cannot, then I need you to seek whatever help you can elsewhere, whether Jedi or the Sith... or someone in-between.
bastila.gblt3m4110.mp3: {Evil Bastilla}This is my last order to you, T3. Obey it - and do not let me lose my Master... {beat}even if he believes he is protecting me.
bastila.gblt3m4098.mp3: {Soft, quiet, good Bastilla}T3, you have been with us since Taris. Without you, we would never have escaped that place... and for that, I thank you.
bastila.gblt3m4099.mp3: I'm leaving this message inside you because I have seen glimpses of the future... and the bond that he and I share does not allow him to hide everything from me.
bastila.gblt3m4100.mp3: More of his memories have returned - and they trouble him. He has remembered something, something on the edge of the galaxy, and he believes that he must go there to end it.
bastila.gblt3m4101.mp3: But I'm afraid for him... afraid that he may not return.
bastila.gblt3m4102.mp3: I need you to be the beacon, T3. If he is lost out there, on the edge of the galaxy, if he finds whatever terrible thing he has seen, then he may not survive.
bastila.gblt3m4103.mp3: If he doesn't make it back, then I need you to return to the Republic, find help. If you cannot find me, then seek out other Jedi, the Republic...
bastila.gblt3m4104.mp3: I can't lose him, even if he believes he is protecting me.
bastila.221carthend039.mp3: {Sighs}There are times I fear we shall never know why he left, Carth. {Beat}And I cannot live not knowing the answer, why he sought to protect us.
bastila.702bastila100.mp3: [This holocron was very recently broken, a result of the Thorium charges used to blast open the door to this room. Whatever message this holocron contained is now lost.]
bastila.702bastila001.mp3: It has been months since Revan's full memories returned, and unrest grows amongst the Sith.
bastila.702bastila002.mp3: They're convinced Revan will not return, so they fight amongst themselves. The betrayals mount. And no matter who wins, the Sith will lose.
bastila.702bastila003.mp3: There is no one left with the power to control the Forge, though many have tried.
bastila.702bastila004.mp3: I have watched them be devoured, their life drained from them as they attempt to tap into its power.
bastila.702bastila005.mp3: Knowing what we do of the Builders and their fate, I am convinced that Revan did not intend us to keep the Star Forge.
bastila.702bastila006.mp3: To use it would mean the end of the Sith... and the end of the Force.
bastila.702bastila013.mp3: {Revan was Female}I have done as Revan asked and remained here, but she has been gone for too long. I will wait no longer.
bastila.702bastila014.mp3: {Shakes head}Whoever survives this Sith Civil War shall not be one I wish to follow. There is only Revan. Only she can shape this galaxy as it is meant to be shaped.
bastila.702bastila015.mp3: She lives still, this I know. If she will not return, then I shall find her and discover why. I cannot remain here, not knowing.
bastila.702bastila016.mp3: I've become certain there is something she remembered in the Unknown Regions.
bastila.702bastila017.mp3: It is a technique she learned fighting the Mandalorians, that allowed her to convert the last of the Jedi who fought beside her - and murder those who would not.
bastila.702bastila018.mp3: And she fears it is still out there... and silent for far too long.
bastila.702bastila007.mp3: {Revan was Male}I have done as Revan asked and remained here, but he has been gone for too long. I will wait no longer.
bastila.702bastila008.mp3: {Shakes head}Whoever survives this Sith Civil War shall not be one I wish to follow. There is only Revan. Only he can shape this galaxy as it is meant to be shaped.
bastila.702bastila009.mp3: He lives still, this I know. If he will not return, then I shall find him and discover why. I cannot remain here, not knowing.
bastila.702bastila010.mp3: I've become certain there is something he remembered in the Unknown Regions.
bastila.702bastila011.mp3: It is a technique he learned fighting the Mandalorians, that allowed him to convert the last of the Jedi who fought beside him - and murder those who would not.
bastila.702bastila012.mp3: And he fears it is still out there... and silent for far too long.

zezkaiel.gbllrn_form021.mp3: Unh. If you think to learn anything from my death... mm...then you are wrong.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form022.mp3: {Still confronting player, sweat dripping down forehead}If battle is the only thing you yet learn from me, then that is the only victory this day. What are you waiting for?
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form024.mp3: {Firm}Come, that form is still new to you. Let us see if you have the years to back it up.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form063.mp3: {Zez-Kai Ell teaches the player a form}{almost grudging}But we have spoken enough, I think. And words I think dull us both. Let us speak through the Force - through sparring.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form079.mp3: {Player demonstrates the form he just learned, beside Zez-Kai Ell}{pleased}Perhaps exile has been good to you indeed - it has certainly not dulled your instincts, nor the speed at which you learn.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form076.mp3: {Zez-Kai Ell meditates, glow surrounds him, if possible, or some other effect}This form heightens your affinity to the Force, allowing you to gather your strength faster, even in the midst of combat.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form073.mp3: { (12) Force Potency}It has been some time since you have used the Force, it is true. But there are techniques to enhance one's tie to the Force, to make your influence through the Force more potent.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form074.mp3: {Zez-Kai Ell casts Force, turns the door to the room glowing}Yet even as such techniques can enhance the Force, they should be used cautiously - they can drain you quickly, leaving you at the mercy of your opponents.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form071.mp3: { (7) Juyo form - Zez-Kai Ell draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}You are at home in places of war and battle - this form may already be known to you. It is Juyo, a ferocious form of lightsaber offense.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form072.mp3: Against an armed enemy, it is powerful indeed - but against an enemy armed with the Force, you will find them a difficult foe, indeed.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form069.mp3: { (6) Niman form - Zez-Kai Ell draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}Sometimes sparring with another can achieve a form of meditation - the Niman form is one of the best such techniques.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form070.mp3: There is no great strengths, no edge in such a form, but yet, its achieves worth in not leaving you as exposed as some of the more aggressive forms. Its strength is its balance.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form067.mp3: { (5) Shien form - Zez-Kai Ell draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}This Shien form should prove appropriate - its best use is when you are outnumbered, which I fear suits your... our predicament perfectly.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form068.mp3: You will find it easier to deflect blaster fire with this form - and it shall also guard you against critical strikes by your opponents.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form064.mp3: { (4) Ataru form - Zez-Kai Ell draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}This form you may have already seen much of during the Mandalorian Wars - but it is fitting to speak using elements of the past, I think.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form065.mp3: Ataru is the name given to the movements of this form - though it is aggressive, it is focused, and its best use is in combat against a single opponent.
zezkaiel.gbllrn_form066.mp3: This form is somewhat less useful in deflecting blaster shots - use it when dealing with opponents in close combat, not against a battalion firing heavy blasters at you.
zezkaiel.301zezkaiel001.mp3: Finally, you awaken... I did not doubt you would, only when.
zezkaiel.301zezkaiel002.mp3: One of the ones you seek - has time been so unkind to me that your eyes do not believe it?
zezkaiel.301zezkaiel004.mp3: You were nearly killed in the explosion that claimed the Jekk'Jekk Tarr... I was able to retrieve your body.
zezkaiel.301zezkaiel005.mp3: You instinctively entered your Jedi meditation trance shortly after the explosion... it probably saved your life.
zezkaiel.301zezkaiel006.mp3: So the question becomes... now that you are here, what do we do?
zezkaiel.301zezkaiel003.mp3: I? Lost? Perhaps you are referring to yourself.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel018.mp3: {A little world-weary, matter-of-fact}Still, you were always a difficult one to read - both when you were tied to the Force, and even more when it was lost to you.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel107.mp3: What I can tell you, I will.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel022.mp3: {Nods, keep weary}No doubt. I think the answers will provide us both with some measure of peace - I have kept secrets for far too long.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel096.mp3: Yes... such bonds are a connection that can be formed at moments of crisis - or in the slow understanding that grows between master and apprentice.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel097.mp3: It is most common between two beings who are sensitive to the Force. It allows the transmission of feelings, of influence.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel098.mp3: {Musing}It was something you were gifted with, as I recall, before your fall. You formed such attachments easier than most - even to those who could feel the Force only faintly.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel099.mp3: {Rueful}Even Vrook could not ignore it, which is saying something.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel101.mp3: There were a few within the Order who knew more than I did of such bonds - but their students were few, lost in the Mandalorian Wars.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel106.mp3: It was rumored that Revan studied such bonding deeply, both through the Jedi histories and with certain teachers, before he left the Order and went to war.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel102.mp3: It was rumored that Revan studied such bonding deeply, both through the Jedi histories and with certain teachers, before he left the Order and went to war.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel103.mp3: I do not know - a bond between two living beings is not something easily broken. It not a choice... it is like breaking a feeling. Like turning away from the Force.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel104.mp3: To break a bond, your feelings would have to change, or one of you would have to die - but even then, the bond wouldn't go away, it would simply... it would simply be empty, a wound.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel093.mp3: Ah, so the records of your trial were found. Good... sometimes I think this galaxy would be a better place if there were less Jedi secrets.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel094.mp3: But I have no answer for you, as much as I would like to give one. We vowed never to speak of it - and although I would not keep promises to Jedi, I keep promises I make to others.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel095.mp3: And Kavar was a friend. If we were gathered as one, then the promise might be revoked. Until then, I can say nothing.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel088.mp3: {A little surprised}Is that what you think? We did no such thing, but it is a technique that has been used as punishment in the past, yes.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel089.mp3: {Quietly referring to an event in Star Wars history}It is a rare sentence, and to my knowledge, it has only be done once, at a moment where a Jedi discipline has failed.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel090.mp3: What caused your loss I fear, was different. I am not certain I understand it - we did not understand it fully, then, and only recently do I feel we may have become enlightened.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel091.mp3: The other masters may have more knowledge of this, but I do not - and I do not know if they even live.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel092.mp3: Does it matter? It seems your power has returned. Perhaps the loss was not a loss at all.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel072.mp3: The bounties on Jedi and their disappearance - I did not believe the two were connected, but there was a chance.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel073.mp3: And the strong currents of life here on Nar Shaddaa make perceiving a Force user difficult. I could use it to cloak my movements and watch without being discovered.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel075.mp3: {Quietly}It is difficult to detect a Force user on Nar Shaddaa, and I knew it.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel076.mp3: {Frightened}This threat we face... it leaves wounds in the Force when it strikes. It leaves nothing.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel077.mp3: To live life without the Force, to vanish and die and leave only an echo - it was terrifying. To be connected to all life around you, then to have it stripped...
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel078.mp3: ...I can only imagine what it must have been like for you. But even that imagining cannot compare with the truth.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel079.mp3: But there is more than that. On Nar Shaddaa... one cannot escape what was left from the Jedi Civil War.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel080.mp3: {Reflective, this is the question that haunts him}From the failure of the Masters, from our failure to properly train Jedi, came disaster. And I wondered, if perhaps, the teachings of the Jedi had been our failing all along.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel081.mp3: There have been so many failures, by teachers who believed in the Code with all their being - Master Arca failed Ulic, as Master Baas failed Exar Kun, as Kae and Zhar and the others of the Council failed Revan... and Malak.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel082.mp3: For all the acts we do to preserve the galaxy, from such an arrogance that all we do is right and just, I wonder if there is a counter-effect that is created, that strikes back at us.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel085.mp3: And I think that maybe, perhaps, to forsake the Force as you did, to cut loose our bonds, may not be the wrong thing to do.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel086.mp3: You taught me something important in the Council Chamber long ago, exile, and it has stayed with me all these years.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel087.mp3: You were right to do what you did. Everything you did.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel067.mp3: We told you it was because you followed Revan to war. But you ask because you are not certain of that answer.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel069.mp3: The day we cast you out, that is the moment I decided to leave the Order. Because I do not believe we truly faced the reasons you were exiled, and if we do not examine such truths, then we are already lost.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel070.mp3: I think it was because we were afraid. It is a difficult thing to live one's life with the Force - to see a vision of what it would be like to be severed from it. It is more frightening than you know.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel055.mp3: {Reciting tale, firm}Only a handful of us remained after the Jedi Civil War, barely a hundred in number. Then even that hundred began to vanish, in places where the Force seemed blind.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel056.mp3: The only pattern we determined that when Jedi gathered, they were seen no more.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel058.mp3: It was only then that we realized we were facing something far more powerful than we knew how to fight.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel059.mp3: We could not allow the fact when we gathered, we placed everything around us at risk... a Jedi's life is sacrifice, but we cannot allow our presence or actions to endanger others.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel061.mp3: And we could not fight an enemy that would not reveal itself. But any Jedi, anyone who was strong in the Force, who attempted to track down such a threat... vanished, without a trace.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel066.mp3: I know little about it. I know more of the absence it leaves behind than its face.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel062.mp3: It does, but you must step back to see it.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel063.mp3: Whatever this threat was, it was targeting us and everything around us. Yet it was somehow weak enough that it was afraid to confront us openly.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel064.mp3: If it believed us defeated, then perhaps it would finally show itself. It was a faint hope, but it was the best we had.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel065.mp3: It was Kavar's plan - he was always the greatest tactician among us. And had seen war more than the rest of us.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel023.mp3: They have scattered, but there is a purpose in their movements. It is to both to hunt - and draw out our enemies.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel024.mp3: {Has to remind himself he is a Jedi}Somehow, they... we... are being targeted through the Force - and when Jedi gather, we are vulnerable.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel025.mp3: So we have chosen places where it is difficult to sense others through the Force... whether on planets dense with life, or touched by war.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel026.mp3: In such places, we may conceal ourselves, gather information - without presenting ourselves as targets. It was part of Kavar's plan.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel037.mp3: Now... now I must take up the role I was ready to cast aside. This threat has finally revealed itself, and we Jedi will need to stand together.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel038.mp3: I did not speak fully of what I have felt. Staying on Nar Shaddaa - it is an exile of sorts. One that I have chosen.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel039.mp3: I, too, lost a Padawan on Malachor. Not to the battle, but to the alternative - to the teachings that Revan brought from the Unknown Regions.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel041.mp3: No, no - they were not to blame, but many of the Order did so - it was a difficult time, a time of strong emotion.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel042.mp3: Perhaps the Council, perhaps the Order itself had grown arrogant in their teachings.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel043.mp3: It is easy to cast blame, but it is perhaps time the Order accepted responsibility for their teachings, and their arrogance, and come to recognize that perhaps we are flawed.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel044.mp3: Not once did I hear one of the Council claim responsibility for Revan, for Exar Kun, for Ulic, for Malak... or for you.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel045.mp3: Yet... you were the only one who came back from the wars to face our judgment. And rather than attempting to understand why you did what you did, we punished you instead.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel046.mp3: {Frustrated}Our one chance to see where we had gone wrong, and we cast it aside. And now, that decision has come back to us, and may carry with it, our destruction.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel047.mp3: Perhaps there is something wrong in us, in our teachings. And though I tried, I could not cause that thought to leave me - so I left the Council.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel048.mp3: And I was not the only one. That is why many scattered... and why many in the Republic do not trust us. And why we do not trust ourselves.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel049.mp3: Make no mistake - I am no Jedi. This is the end you see. After this, there will be nothing.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel052.mp3: It provides no comfort at all, for reasons on which I still must keep secret.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel053.mp3: Suffice to say redemption was not Revan's choice, and I have never believed those of the Council who attempt to console themselves otherwise for the crime they committed.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel027.mp3: Yes - he felt if our enemy cannot detect us, then perhaps they would believe themselves victorious and show themselves.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel036.mp3: So if you hoped to pry their whereabouts from me, you will be wasting your time. Even if I knew how to find them, I would not tell you.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel032.mp3: {A little surprised}Atris? But I had thought she had gone to Katarr, with the others.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel033.mp3: Yes, she holds the last of the Jedi teachings... it is good she survived.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel035.mp3: As I told you... I did not feel myself a Jedi any longer. But I did not realize what would happen at Katarr. If I had known, I do not know what I would have done.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel034.mp3: {A little evasive}I had not finished my investigations here, and I did not wish to reveal myself. There was nothing I could do.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel031.mp3: {A little sad}Yes, I know. I think perhaps I knew he was already dead.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel030.mp3: {A little surprised}Vrook still lives? I had not felt his presence for some time.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel019.mp3: {A little defeatist at the end}I do not know. It was a sense he had, and he had served in war, as you had. Perhaps he thought he understood you, or maybe he simply hoped he did.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel020.mp3: He felt you were the key to understanding the threat we face - the others were not so certain. But so many of them are gone now, as you no doubt know.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel021.mp3: He sensed some connection between you and many of the worlds touched by war. He thought by traveling to such places, he could achieve understanding.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel109.mp3: {Resigned, like meeting with a murderer who is stronger than he is}So you have returned from exile, though I do not know why. You were always difficult to read, when you were tied to the Force, and even more when it was lost to you.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel111.mp3: But I will answer your questions, if only for some measure of peace. In exchange, I wish only the answer to one.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel112.mp3: Why have you done this to the Jedi? Was it just revenge - or something more?
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel122.mp3: Whatever this threat is, it leaves echoes in the Force, wounds that do not heal.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel113.mp3: But you are. Whatever this threat is, it leaves echoes in the Force, wounds that do not heal.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel114.mp3: {Ashamed at the end}It is something that we had never felt before - until you stood before us in judgment. And we exiled you.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel121.mp3: You are more involved than you know. Whatever is striking at us, it is something tied to you, something you had experienced - and survived.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel120.mp3: Not directly perhaps. But it is something tied to you, something you had experienced - and had survived.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel119.mp3: No. But it was something tied to you, something that you had experienced that we had not - and that you had survived.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel115.mp3: Yes. Whatever was killing the Jedi, it was something tied to you, something you had experienced - and had survived.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel116.mp3: Some of us sought to understand you, to find you. It seems we succeeded, even though we thought you were lost to us.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel117.mp3: Now as we hoped, you have returned, and you know nothing that could help us. Such irony.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel003.mp3: When I first heard you were on Nar Shaddaa, I didn't quite believe it. I didn't think anyone could track me here, but I see I underestimated you.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel016.mp3: She was supposed to protect you, but I should have watched her more carefully.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel013.mp3: I have been trying to discover your purpose in coming here, but it eludes me - some of your actions have aided the Exchange, others have thwarted them.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel015.mp3: I do not know what game you are playing here, but you have succeeded in drawing me out.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel014.mp3: I did not know your intentions when you stood before us at your trial, so long ago, and I do not know them now. But whatever they are, you have succeeded in drawing me out.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel008.mp3: I have watched you as you have traveled the Refugee Sector. I've seen what you have done... what I refused to do.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel009.mp3: {Tired}Even exiled, you are more a Jedi than I. If anything, know that your actions have convinced me I can stand by and watch no longer while the Exchange closes its grip on this sector.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel012.mp3: A friend of mine, the young woman, went to meet with Visquis in your place. If you ever want to see me again, you'll rescue her - it's my fault she came after you.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel010.mp3: I know a young woman went to meet with Visquis in your place. He will not negotiate with her - he will kill her.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel011.mp3: I intend to rescue her. I will return shortly... or not at all.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel004.mp3: {Stern}I've been watching you travel this moon, and I've seen the damage you've caused. I may no longer be a Jedi, but I will see you answer for your crimes, I promise you.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel005.mp3: If anything, you should know that your actions have convinced me I can stand by and watch no longer. Whatever harm the Exchange harbors against Jedi, I would not let another suffer for it.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel006.mp3: {Resigned}A friend has gone to meet Visquis in your stead, and I intend to rescue her. I will return shortly... or not at all.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel007.mp3: If you have come to this moon for answers - or for revenge, then you will follow me. For if I fail, then you will be denied both.
zezkaiel.303zezkaiel124.mp3: I shall go to Dantooine, to the ruins of the Enclave. If you gather the others, I will meet you there.
zezkaiel.gblt3m4201.mp3: Master Zez-Kai Ell: Nar Shaddaa: Deceased.
zezkaiel.262holorec010.mp3: Why did you defy us? The Jedi are guardians of the peace and have been for centuries. This call to war undermines all that we have worked for.
zezkaiel.262holorec069.mp3: You were correct, Kavar. When he was here I felt it. It was as if he was not there, more like an echo.
zezkaiel.262holorec017.mp3: You were correct, Kavar. When she was here, I felt it. It was as if she was not there, more like an echo.
zezkaiel.262holorec022.mp3: I fear it is our teachings that may have led Revan to choose the path he did.
zezkaiel.262holorec062.mp3: What would you have be done with him, Atris? Be mindful of your feelings. This is not Revan who stood before you. This one walks a different path.
zezkaiel.262holorec066.mp3: No, not death. Many battles remain for that one, if what we have seen is true. But the future is a shifting thing, and he cuts like a blade through it.
zezkaiel.262holorec029.mp3: What would you have be done with her, Atris? Be mindful of your feelings! This is not Revan who stood before you. This one walks a different path.
zezkaiel.262holorec033.mp3: No, not death. Many battles remain for that one, if what we have seen is true. But the future is a shifting thing, and she cuts like a blade through it.
zezkaiel.650650jedi004.mp3: This moment has taken some time to reach us, and I imagine you have many questions.
zezkaiel.650650jedi181.mp3: {Consoling}Don't do this. You're making a mistake.
zezkaiel.650650jedi064.mp3: {Slight hesitation at second sentence}You draw them to you... and your actions affect them, strongly.
zezkaiel.650650jedi067.mp3: And when that life dies, then you suffer. Their screams become your screams.
zezkaiel.650650jedi069.mp3: {Shakes head}For one such as you who feels life so strongly, who makes such connections so easily...
zezkaiel.650650jedi070.mp3: {Slightly judgmental}The silence you heard within yourself after Malachor was not silence. It is death, so loud as to deafen you... you carry all those lives with you still.
zezkaiel.650650jedi025.mp3: Your actions affect others more than you know. You draw others to you, especially those strong in the Force.
zezkaiel.650650jedi062.mp3: {Quietly}And that is why Malachor echoes within you still.
zezkaiel.650650jedi028.mp3: {Quietly}And that is why the Mandalorian Wars echo within you still.
zezkaiel.650650jedi030.mp3: The screams of countless thousands, Jedi and Mandalorians, crushed by the planet's gravity, annihilated.
zezkaiel.650650jedi051.mp3: He's right. It's... all the death you've caused to get here. You feed on it, and you grow stronger. You're like Malachor... it's in you, it's what you are now.
zezkaiel.650650jedi052.mp3: You must have noticed as you've fought across all these planets, killing hundreds - only to become more and more powerful. Why do you think that was?
zezkaiel.650650jedi177.mp3: You have almost completely restored your connection to the Force... but there are cracks, dark places within you that echo still.
zezkaiel.650650jedi175.mp3: For you, the Mandalorian Wars was that crucible.
zezkaiel.650650jedi056.mp3: For you, Malachor was that crucible.
zezkaiel.650650jedi144.mp3: We sought to lure the Sith out... and now they have come to us.
zezkaiel.650650jedi106.mp3: But our presence must not endanger others. And as long as we were visible targets, we were a threat to everything around us.
zezkaiel.650650jedi118.mp3: This echo travels in the places where death has walked, where planets have died. Massacres fuel its power, the death of life fuels it.
zezkaiel.650650jedi119.mp3: No, we do not believe so... but it is tied to you somehow.
zezkaiel.650650jedi122.mp3: It echoed in the ruins on Korriban.
zezkaiel.650650jedi108.mp3: It is like a scream in the Force, and finding its source is difficult. It has cast many echoes.
zezkaiel.650650jedi094.mp3: The echo we have felt on the worlds we have walked - we have encountered it only once before, when you stood before us at your trial.
zezkaiel.650650jedi083.mp3: So... you have finally come. We were wondering if you would come to finish us.

zezkaiel_other_1.gbllrn_form023.mp3: {Resigned}So it as Kavar feared... you have taken what you have learned of the Jedi, and used that knowledge against us.
zezkaiel_other_1.gbllrn_form077.mp3: { (14) Force Mastery}This is among one of the greatest techniques of the Jedi Master - yet when one has seen all that you have, it is such a simple thing, you may wonder why you did not notice it before.
zezkaiel_other_1.gbllrn_form078.mp3: {Glow surrounds Zez-Kai Ell, then the player, like stasis}Do you feel it gathering within you - now, slowly, let it out... slowly - this technique allows you to maintain your Force Powers for longer than normal, though the energy and discipline required is great.
zezkaiel_other_1.gbllrn_form075.mp3: { (13) Force Affinity}This is a long war, I fear, with many battles left to fight - you will need to conserve your strength when using the Force if you hope to make it through the long road ahead.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel017.mp3: {A little weary, like meeting with a son who is in prison}So you have returned from exile. Kavar thought you might, if only to wander your old battlegrounds. But I did not think you would come to Nar Shaddaa.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel100.mp3: {Frowns}That is most unusual - and unnatural. I have never heard of a bond of such strength.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel105.mp3: {Becomes quieter at the end}One of you would have to die, but even then, the bond wouldn't go away, it would simply... it would simply be empty, a wound.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel071.mp3: {Slightly ashamed, actually secretly came here to hide}I had thought perhaps that here upon the smuggler's moon, I might find some evidence of the threat we faced.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel074.mp3: {Ashamed, secret revealed}No, you are right - that is not the whole truth.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel083.mp3: Exar Kun, Ulic Qel-Droma, Malak, Revan, you... all Jedi. There is something wrong in the Force, a wound, a sound that is growing, like a scream.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel084.mp3: {Quietly}You can hear it echo on Nar Shaddaa, sometimes when the moon is on orbit. It is a frightening thing to feel, that perhaps being connected to all life is not enlightenment at all, but simply another doom.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel054.mp3: It is a long story, but there is no harm in you knowing. And someone should know.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel057.mp3: {Sad, thinking about the massacre of millions}At the last Jedi conclave on the Miraluka world of Katarr, the entire planet was wiped out. An entire race, destroyed... because the Jedi chose to gather there.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel040.mp3: {Quiet}And I was not the only Jedi Master to watch a student turn on them.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel050.mp3: {Quietly}And I think it will be for the best.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel051.mp3: Do you wish to do battle now? I have nothing more to say.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel028.mp3: {Quiet, thinking about the slaughter of the Jedi}And we knew that the war would be lost if we continued to act as we had.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel029.mp3: {Good}I do not know where they wander now. There are few of us, though, too few... and I have not heard from them in some time.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel123.mp3: {Quiet}But I can see the mark of the dark side upon your features - I know how this will end.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel110.mp3: {Quiet}But I can sense the death of others upon your hands - I know how this will end.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel118.mp3: Now as we hoped, you have returned, but only to speed our destruction. Such irony.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel002.mp3: I know you can hear me... the numbness you feel should be wearing off soon, but not before we've spoken.
zezkaiel_other_1.303zezkaiel125.mp3: And... thank you, exile. Your returning... it is good that you are back among us.
zezkaiel_other_1.262holorec071.mp3: You refuse to hear us. You have shut us out, and so have shut yourself to the galaxy.
zezkaiel_other_1.262holorec070.mp3: Know that there is no turning back from this judgment.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi002.mp3: {Quietly}But perhaps that is for the best.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi007.mp3: {Slight push, cajoling, a little frustrated}The answer's already been shown to you - look at who you travel with.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi008.mp3: {Sighs}Have you noticed that when you act, others follow?
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi018.mp3: ...they follow you, without question. Without hesitation.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi044.mp3: {Quietly, like a pronouncement of doom}In you, we saw the end of the Force.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi127.mp3: {Quietly}You will lead the Sith here. And that we cannot allow.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi145.mp3: {Quietly, like trying to see someone who is cloaked in shadow}She is difficult to see... she's like a shadow of the exile.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi102.mp3: {Quietly}But not just Jedi... all things touched by the Force.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi111.mp3: {Quietly, guilty}And some of us just left.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi097.mp3: No, there was another... you had become different somehow, changed. The war had changed you.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi100.mp3: {Quietly, ashamed.}And if you had stayed, you would have changed us. And that we could not allow.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi082.mp3: {Resigned, final}We know what you have done to Vrook. And we know you have come for us.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi078.mp3: It has been some time since I walked on Dantooine... and I can still hear the dead.
zezkaiel_other_1.650650jedi079.mp3: I hear them - just as I know you have slain Vrook, and Kavar. And I know you have left me for last.

vrook.gbllrn_form018.mp3: {Challenging}Are you arrogant enough to think you can divide your attention while fighting me?
vrook.gbllrn_form047.mp3: {Vrook teaches the player a form}{almost grudging}I suppose there is something I should show you. It will keep you alive long enough to prove useful.
vrook.gbllrn_form062.mp3: {Player demonstrates the form he just learned, beside Vrook}{grudging respect}Hmmm... I don't know how you learned that so quickly. Still, your form is sloppy. Keep practicing to tighten it up, and you'll be fine.
vrook.gbllrn_form060.mp3: You may lack the discipline for this, but I will attempt to teach you anyway. This form is considered the pinnacle of Force Mastery. Now watch carefully.
vrook.gbllrn_form061.mp3: {Vrook demonstrates using Force Stasis, or some other force power with a sustained duration}This subtle technique enhances the duration of many Force powers at your disposal. However, the focus required for this form, can drain your energy quickly and leave you vulnerable to Force attack.
vrook.gbllrn_form058.mp3: { (13) Force Affinity}When you are facing a long campaign, you need to be more conservative with how you use your Force energy.
vrook.gbllrn_form059.mp3: {Vrook levitates multiple objects with the Force}This form gives you increased Force affinity. In simple terms, it helps you to quickly regenerate Force energy in the middle of a fight.
vrook.gbllrn_form056.mp3: { (12) Force Potency}Using the Force as a weapon is a sticky issue. Many Jedi feel it leads to the dark side. My experience has taught me that it's {he's trying to imply that the player is reckless} lack of discipline that leads a Jedi astray.
vrook.gbllrn_form057.mp3: {Vrook uses Force Push against an inanimate object, and it goes flying and breaks against a wall}Use this form with proper restraint and it will enhance the potency of your Force attacks. However, if you are reckless with this form, you will quickly drain your Force energy.
vrook.gbllrn_form054.mp3: { (7) Juyo form - Vrook draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}I hesitate to teach this to you, because of your demonstrated recklessness... This is Juyo, a very ferocious form of lightsaber offense.
vrook.gbllrn_form055.mp3: It goes without saying to exercise proper control and restraint when using this technique. It may allow you to eviscerate a lone enemy, but it will leave you open to attack by force powers.
vrook.gbllrn_form052.mp3: { (6) Niman form - Vrook draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}I'm not sure if this lesson will be to your liking. This is Niman, a lightsaber form of balance, which contradicts the recklessness that you have so often exhibited.
vrook.gbllrn_form053.mp3: Using this technique provides no particular strengths, but also lacks the weaknesses of some of the more aggressive forms.
vrook.gbllrn_form050.mp3: { (5) Shien form - Vrook draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}I'm only going to demonstrate this once.  This is the Shien form, a defensive stance that's good when you're outnumbered - which is most of the time.
vrook.gbllrn_form051.mp3: This form will increase your ability to deflect blaster fire and it increases the odds of dealing critical strikes against your attackers.
vrook.gbllrn_form048.mp3: { (4) Ataru form - Vrook draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}Now watch and learn. This form is Ataru. Because it is such an aggressive fighting style, you should only use it against single opponents.
vrook.gbllrn_form049.mp3: And don't try using this form amidst heavy fire. Nothing is more embarrassing for a Jedi than to be cut down by a stray blaster shot.
vrook.601zherron050.mp3: Since you are here to bolster Khoonda's defense, I will hurry to the mercenary camp and delay their assault however I can.
vrook.602azkul028.mp3: {ALTERNATE VO, may be cut---Player has defeated Vrook, but he still lives}Ah! Curse you, dark Jedi!
vrook.602azkul041.mp3: {Vrook arrives, running in to stand beside the player}{gruff}Sorry I was held up. But it looks like I've arrived in time to pull you out of your predicament.
vrook.262holorec015.mp3: There is one last thing. Your lightsaber. Surrender it to us.
vrook.262holorec035.mp3: No good would have come from it, even if what you believed was true. There is still the matter of Revan, and such truths could leave us vulnerable on two fronts.
vrook.262holorec038.mp3: Then that is the future we must accept.
vrook.602vrook010.mp3: {more of a statement than a question}You have more questions for me?
vrook.602vrook007.mp3: {If the player is attacking Khoonda, Vrook faces him at the end}I should have stopped you long ago. Your machinations end here, outcast!
vrook.602vrook009.mp3: Did you think a handful of mercenaries could hold a Jedi Master?
vrook.602vrook008.mp3: No more words. Defend yourself or perish!
vrook.602vrook001.mp3: You heard what the Administrator said, each of us has to do what they can to aid in the defense of Khoonda. See where you can lend a hand.
vrook.602vrook002.mp3: We'll have time to talk more when this is all over.
vrook.602vrook080.mp3: {If the player defended Khoonda, but chooses to let Azkul kill Terena}There was little could be done about the Administrator's death. Jedi can turn the tide of a battle, but we were never meant to fight a war by ourselves.
vrook.602vrook005.mp3: The Dantooine settlers will have to find new strength amongst them, otherwise... {He sounds grim}Otherwise who knows how long they'll last.
vrook.602vrook003.mp3: Khoonda{COON-da} is safe in no small part due to you. I feel certain that the Administrator wouldn't have made it without your assistance. {He doesn't sound entirely convinced he hasn't}I may have misjudged you.
vrook.602vrook004.mp3: {Things are complete - now he talks about things the PC cares about}In any case, I am free to talk about whatever you wish.
vrook.602vrook070.mp3: {Challenging}Have they? I have seen no evidence of them upon Dantooine - only murderers and raiders.
vrook.602vrook071.mp3: {Suspicious}Why would they attack you? You are no Jedi - you cannot feel the Force.
vrook.602vrook076.mp3: {Frowns}Perhaps it is Dantooine, but I do not feel such from you - I feel nothing but what I felt in the Council judgment chamber on Coruscant, so long ago.
vrook.602vrook077.mp3: Still, you and your... connections were often a subject of debate in the Council.
vrook.602vrook078.mp3: It is possible that returning to known space, journeying with others, has caused the Force to stir within you again. Though it seems unlikely the Sith would bother with you.
vrook.602vrook072.mp3: {Thinking}For some reason, I believe you. Still - I am curious as to how they would know to find you. Your trial was not public knowledge.
vrook.602vrook073.mp3: Regardless, these Sith have struck, and you survived - this is more knowledge than I had before. And that means the Jedi may gather.
vrook.602vrook074.mp3: If you can find others - or find some trace of this Sith threat, then we shall gather here on Dantooine.
vrook.602vrook075.mp3: And from there, we may decide what can be done.
vrook.602vrook065.mp3: Force Bonds? Yes... it is the bond that grows between Master and student. Are you saying you have bonded with another?
vrook.602vrook066.mp3: Such bonds normally grant strength to both - but not to such a degree. Are you certain? Perhaps it is merely what you believe.
vrook.602vrook067.mp3: {Thinking}Still... your ability to form such connections, to influence others, was always a subject of discussion, even when you were a student here.
vrook.602vrook068.mp3: Perhaps it is a punishment of a sort. But a bond that ties two lives together... such bonds do not seem natural to me.
vrook.602vrook069.mp3: And with your loss of connection to the Force, it seems such a connection would be impossible.
vrook.602vrook059.mp3: {Disapproving}You have seen the end of your trial? Perhaps you would like to explain how you came to this knowledge.
vrook.602vrook060.mp3: That was intended only for the Jedi Council. If what remains of the Council chooses to tell you, then I will abide by their decision... and its consequences.
vrook.602vrook064.mp3: [Failure] {condescending}Are you listening? I can't tell you more. The knowledge would not help you anyway.
vrook.602vrook061.mp3: [Success] {A little tired, giving in}There is little I can tell you. Master Kavar felt something had happened to you in the war, but all he had were suspicions, not truths.
vrook.602vrook062.mp3: {Slightly dismissive and disapproving - Kavar liked the player, saw potential in him}And Kavar was too close to you in any event - he, too, felt the call of war and took to battle more than a Jedi should. His speculations would not help you now.
vrook.602vrook063.mp3: {Final}But enough of this - it is knowledge for the Council alone until they choose to reveal it.
vrook.602vrook052.mp3: {Irritated, being blamed for something he didn't do}We did nothing to you. Accuse us if you will, but it will not change the truth.
vrook.602vrook053.mp3: Cutting one off from the Force - such punishments are reserved for only a few. Although it was within our power, we did not inflict such a loss upon you.
vrook.602vrook054.mp3: Your loss was a casualty of war, no more.
vrook.602vrook056.mp3: {Frowns}Perhaps it is Dantooine, but I do not feel such from you - I feel nothing but what I felt in the Council judgment chamber on Coruscant, so long ago.
vrook.602vrook057.mp3: Still, you and your... connections were often a subject of debate in the Council.
vrook.602vrook058.mp3: It is possible that returning to known space, journeying with others, has caused the Force to stir within you again.
vrook.602vrook055.mp3: Perhaps that is a question you should ask yourself. It is not something I could help you with, even if I wanted to.
vrook.602vrook048.mp3: {Firm, challenging}Because you defied the Council and followed Revan to war. And from that war, came another.
vrook.602vrook049.mp3: Do you know how many worlds were destroyed in those wars - Dantooine? Telos? {SAIR-A-CO}Serroco? Do you see now why we counseled caution, instead of action?
vrook.602vrook050.mp3: {Runs out of steam, quiet}You were the only one to come back and face judgment. But that was because you had lost your connection to the Force - another casualty of war.
vrook.602vrook051.mp3: No doubt you still blame us for your exile - I had hoped your isolation would give you time to reflect on what had happened, what you had done. But I see it has not.
vrook.602vrook034.mp3: We were not in hiding, despite what you believe.
vrook.602vrook035.mp3: This threat is striking through the Force. There is a reason that we cannot detect it - it is somehow masking its presence from us.
vrook.602vrook038.mp3: Jedi sanctuaries, places of learning, conclaves - many of them secret, have been attacked.
vrook.602vrook039.mp3: That requires that our enemy knew of our whereabouts - or had access to records and holocrons from the Enclave here on Dantooine.
vrook.602vrook040.mp3: There was much Jedi teaching buried here before the planet was attacked.
vrook.602vrook041.mp3: In the hands of our enemies, such knowledge could be used to track and kill Jedi, find other Enclaves, gathering places.
vrook.602vrook042.mp3: {Tired, worn out}And so much has been plundered from here, that now many secrets of the Jedi have been spread throughout the galaxy.
vrook.602vrook043.mp3: So I did what I could, attempting to let myself be captured. I hoped that it would lead me to the Sith, and the stolen artifacts.
vrook.602vrook044.mp3: The Sith attacked this place once, and only they would seek the death of the Jedi with such obsession - and be able to be as successful as they have.
vrook.602vrook045.mp3: {Sighs}But the destruction of Dantooine - it is difficult to sense the presence of any Force users here. If any Sith are here, I cannot detect them.
vrook.602vrook046.mp3: {Quieter, Vrook is showing his human side - the school where he taught has been torched}Yes... perhaps I wished to see this place one more time - it has changed much, as I knew it had.
vrook.602vrook047.mp3: {Firm}But I had to see it for myself.
vrook.602vrook036.mp3: I do not know. There are techniques in the Force that hide one's presence and thoughts from other Force users.
vrook.602vrook037.mp3: But I do not believe that such techniques alone would be capable of hiding the enemies we face - it does not seem possible.
vrook.602vrook021.mp3: {Grim}We are at war, but it is unlike any war we have fought before - we have yet to even meet our attackers in battle.
vrook.602vrook022.mp3: {Frustrated}Somehow, our enemy is targeting us through the Force, striking, then retreating to the shadows.
vrook.602vrook023.mp3: The gathering of any Jedi seems to attract them like a beacon. So it was necessary to divide our forces and conceal ourselves for a time until we could learn more of this threat.
vrook.602vrook029.mp3: How did you know of Katarr? Few knew it was one of the gathering worlds for the Jedi.
vrook.602vrook030.mp3: {Quiet, reverent, lost friends there}But yes, Katarr was one such place.
vrook.602vrook031.mp3: Now the planet is no more. Master Zhar... Master Dorak... and many more perished there, and we do not know why or how. But all life on the planet ceased to exist.
vrook.602vrook032.mp3: I was not on Katarr when it was destroyed. But now that it is dead, it has left its echo, like Dantooine.
vrook.602vrook033.mp3: It was after Katarr that the few of us left realized that wherever we gathered, we were placing others in danger - not just Jedi.
vrook.602vrook028.mp3: {Quiet, reverent, lost friends there}Yes... the Miraluka world of Katarr taught us that. Many Jedi gathered there, in an attempt to use the Force to find the location of the enemy.
vrook.602vrook024.mp3: {Tired}Great tragedies, old battlegrounds... places of suffering, all leave wounds on the galaxy and in the Force.
vrook.602vrook025.mp3: {Quiet}In such places, the deaths of so many echo, so much so that it is difficult to center oneself.
vrook.602vrook026.mp3: By coming here, those echoes served to mask my presence, allowing me to investigate the ruins and try to find some clues as to who our attackers are.
vrook.602vrook027.mp3: {Quiet, reverent, lost friends there}The Miraluka world of Katarr taught us a terrible lesson. Many Jedi gathered there, in an attempt to use the Force to find the location of the enemy.
vrook.602vrook011.mp3: {Weary}There are a few of us left. But I do not even know if the others still live... we may be the last.
vrook.602vrook012.mp3: We have been forced to divide our forces and retreat to places which will be difficult for our enemies to detect - and attack.
vrook.602vrook013.mp3: We have chosen to hide our presences from each other, so that the discovery of one will not endanger the others.
vrook.602vrook019.mp3: {Confused}Nar Shaddaa? Why would he go there?
vrook.602vrook020.mp3: It is good that you bring word of him - but you must not speak of it to others. It will only put him and any other Jedi who remain in danger.
vrook.602vrook014.mp3: We cannot. And we have resolved not to until we have found where the Sith are striking from.
vrook.602vrook015.mp3: {A little quieter, worried}But even as our numbers thin, there is still no trace of them.
vrook.602vrook016.mp3: We had hoped to outmaneuver them. By letting them believe themselves victorious, we thought they would become bold and step from the shadows.
vrook.602vrook017.mp3: Then, all of us who remained vowed to meet here on Dantooine. From here, we can plan a course of action and carry the battle to them.
vrook.602vrook018.mp3: But so far, they remain in hiding. And Jedi continue to vanish - and die.
vrook.604vrook005.mp3: Khoonda is in danger, and you've ruined the best chance of averting a full scale conflict
vrook.604vrook010.mp3: {Not recorded}Things are rarely what they seem. And even if your actions were well-meant, they've destroyed the best chance we have to avoid a needless conflict.
vrook.604vrook023.mp3: {Not recorded}{He's pretty harsh here - the PC hasn't proved he isn't a traitor to him yet}We don't have the time for that discussion. You need to control your emotions if you have any hope of avoiding the dark side.
vrook.604vrook024.mp3: {Not recorded}If we deal with the situation here, we can talk about it. But right now there are more pressing concerns.
vrook.604vrook018.mp3: {Not recorded}{A lot of disdain for the PC and their poor attitude}If our enemies were as reckless as you are, we'd be perfectly safe. Unfortunately our enemies are careful and deliberate, as well. I don't have time for this.
vrook.604vrook015.mp3: {Not recorded}I may have a use for you...
vrook.604vrook013.mp3: {Not recorded}If you have anything else you need to do, do it quickly. The settlers are going to need all the help they can get. I'll see you at the Administrator's office.
vrook.604vrook016.mp3: Every action has consequences, no matter how small or insignificant they seem - and even the smallest choice has the potential for harm.
vrook.604vrook017.mp3: The Mandalorian Wars was proof of this. Intentions mean nothing if a greater tragedy is caused.
vrook.604vrook019.mp3: Did you think rushing into battle against the Mandalorians did anything but bring more harm to the galaxy? It only served to bring about a second war, more dangerous than the first.
vrook.604vrook064.mp3: Countless Jedi died in both conflicts, and everyone who followed Revan and Malak died or were turned to the dark side. Except conveniently you.
vrook.604vrook022.mp3: You were always difficult to read, as a Padawan and again at your trial - and perhaps more so now that we are here on Dantooine.
vrook.604vrook066.mp3: If you wish to prove yourself, then do so - Khoonda is in danger, and they need our help.
vrook.604vrook021.mp3: Revan acted. You acted. There is no way of knowing what would have happened had you trusted in the Council - much like what you have done today.
vrook.604vrook020.mp3: Disobeying the Jedi Council brought about more destruction than the Mandalorian Wars ever could - countless Jedi lost, the Republic broken, the...
vrook.604vrook065.mp3: Enough of this. This is not the time for such arguments.
vrook.604vrook014.mp3: I need to get to Khoonda and warn them. They could be attacked at any moment.
vrook.604vrook011.mp3: The mercenaries have allied themselves with the Exchange and are planning to attack Khoonda. They've been holding off for the right moment.
vrook.604vrook012.mp3: And now since they lost their captive Jedi, they'll attack immediately. I'm going to try to reach Administrator Adare. Time is of the essence.
vrook.604vrook008.mp3: When an opponent believes that you are defeated, they no longer consider you a threat - and they relax their guard, become bold.
vrook.604vrook063.mp3: After I was captured, they talked freely of their plans, enough for me to learn their intentions.
vrook.604vrook007.mp3: Do you honestly believe six mercenaries could keep a Jedi master hostage? You still have no faith in the Jedi Council.
vrook.604vrook006.mp3: Right now Dantooine is at a critical moment. If Khoonda falls, then the Republic may lose control of this system.
vrook.604vrook062.mp3: Still, I'm surprised you were able to get this far. Although you do have your Jedi training to fall back on.
vrook.604vrook025.mp3: Khoonda is in danger, and you've ruined the best chance of averting a full scale conflict. Though perhaps that was your intent.
vrook.604vrook026.mp3: Don't think that I can't sense the taint of the dark side in you. It is difficult to perceive with the Force here on Dantooine, but it does not conceal your nature completely.
vrook.604vrook027.mp3: Perhaps you are not beyond redemption. But trying is not enough.
vrook.604vrook002.mp3: {A tone of righteous vindication}You've just confirmed everything I thought about you. You were a stain to the reputation of the Jedi Order.
vrook.604vrook003.mp3: I may have been caged, but I was never helpless. Guard yourself, exile.
vrook.604vrook057.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}Force Bonds? Yes... it is the bond that grows between Master and student. Are you saying you have bonded with another?
vrook.604vrook058.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}Such bonds normally grant strength to both - but not to such a degree. You are deluded to think it would be lethal.
vrook.604vrook059.mp3: {Thinking, though still hostile}Still... your ability to form such connections, to influence others, was always a subject of discussion, even when you were a student here.
vrook.604vrook060.mp3: {righteous satisfaction}Perhaps it is a punishment of a sort. {Beat, suspicious}But a bond that ties two lives together... such bonds do not seem natural to me.
vrook.604vrook061.mp3: And with your loss of connection to the Force, it seems such a bond would be impossible.
vrook.604vrook051.mp3: {Hostile, Disapproving}You have seen the end of your trial? Perhaps you would like to explain how you came to this knowledge.
vrook.604vrook052.mp3: {Hostile}That was intended only for the Jedi Council. If what remains of the Council chooses to tell you, then I will abide by their decision... and its consequences.
vrook.604vrook053.mp3: [Success] {Annoyed}Fine! There is little I can tell you. Master Kavar felt something had happened to you in the war, but all he had were suspicions, not truths.
vrook.604vrook054.mp3: {Very dismissive and disapproving - Kavar liked the player, saw potential in him}And Kavar was too close to you in any event - he, too, felt the call of war and took to battle more than a Jedi should. His speculations would not help you now.
vrook.604vrook044.mp3: {hostile, irritated, being blamed for something he didn't do}We did nothing to you. Accuse us if you will, but it will not change the truth.
vrook.604vrook045.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}Cutting one off from the Force - such punishments are reserved for only a few. Although it was within our power, we did not inflict such a loss upon you.
vrook.604vrook046.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}Your loss was a casualty of war, no more.
vrook.604vrook048.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}{Frowns}Perhaps it is Dantooine, but I do not feel any power in you - I feel nothing but what I felt in the Council judgment chamber on Coruscant, so long ago.
vrook.604vrook049.mp3: Still, you and your... connections were often a subject of debate in the Council.
vrook.604vrook050.mp3: It is possible that returning to known space, journeying with others, has caused the Force to stir within you again.
vrook.604vrook047.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}Perhaps that is a question you should ask yourself. It is not something I can help you with, even if I wanted to.
vrook.604vrook040.mp3: {Firm, accusing}Because you defied the Council and followed Revan to war. And from that war, came another.
vrook.604vrook041.mp3: {accusing, angry}Do you know how many worlds were destroyed in those wars - Dantooine? Telos? {SAIR-AH-CO}Serroco? Do you see now why we counseled caution, instead of action?
vrook.604vrook042.mp3: {Runs out of steam, quiet, but still hostile}You were the only one to come back and face judgment. But that was because you had lost your connection to the Force - another casualty of war.
vrook.604vrook043.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}No doubt you still blame us for your exile - I had hoped your isolation would give you time to reflect on what had happened, what you had done, but I see it has not.
vrook.604vrook032.mp3: {accusatory}The Sith strike at us from the shadows, never facing us in open combat. They seek the extermination of the Jedi Order.
vrook.604vrook033.mp3: {Accusatory, frustrated}Somehow, they are targeting us through the Force, and where we gather, they can sense it.
vrook.604vrook034.mp3: {Belligerent}But now, by dividing our forces, we have made you come to us so we can deal with you.
vrook.604vrook035.mp3: {hostile}I had suspected a Sith presence on Dantooine, but the destruction the Sith caused here made detecting Force users difficult - as you know.
vrook.604vrook036.mp3: {upset}The deaths of so many echo, so much so that it is difficult to center oneself... {strong}but it also served to mask my presence, to prevent me from being an easy target.
vrook.604vrook037.mp3: {challenging}And forcing the Sith - forcing you - to come to me.
vrook.604vrook029.mp3: {Scoffs}Do you think I would tell you if I knew?
vrook.604vrook030.mp3: {Challenging}There are enough of us left to stop you. And now that you have finally chosen to reveal yourself, you shall answer for what you have done.
vrook.604vrook001.mp3: You've become strong again... but I know not how. This isn't over, exile.
vrook.650650jedi001.mp3: {Gazing at the recently rebuilt Academy, appraising it}It is not as it was...
vrook.650650jedi005.mp3: Or perhaps you have come for revenge.
vrook.650650jedi179.mp3: {Superior, disgusted at second sentence}Killing... your answer to everything. You defeated the Mandalorians during the war, only to become one of them.
vrook.650650jedi182.mp3: {Resigned}No, we expected this. And perhaps our judgment only delayed what needed to be done.
vrook.650650jedi183.mp3: {Draws himself up}But no matter how far you have fallen, we will not kill you.
vrook.650650jedi073.mp3: {Slight reprimand}She still does not know. She has traveled all this time, and never reached her destination.
vrook.650650jedi006.mp3: {Slight reprimand}He still does not know. He has traveled all this time, and never reached his destination.
vrook.650650jedi019.mp3: {Disapproving}Against their instincts, and sometimes against their sense.
vrook.650650jedi071.mp3: Perhaps not. But it is not that to which I am referring. Surely you are familiar with Force bonds.
vrook.650650jedi021.mp3: It is not an easy thing to explain... surely you are familiar with Force bonds.
vrook.650650jedi022.mp3: It is the bond that develops between apprentice and Master, when one truly understands another. It is developed over time, through understanding of each other.
vrook.650650jedi023.mp3: {Frowns, suspicious}Yet you do it so easily, and we do not know why.
vrook.650650jedi029.mp3: We did not cut you off from the Force. You were merely deafened to it, because of that last battle of the Mandalorian Wars.
vrook.650650jedi042.mp3: When you returned to us, we saw what had happened. You carry all those deaths at Malachor within you, and it has left a hole, a hunger that cannot be filled.
vrook.650650jedi045.mp3: Yes... you can feel the Force, but you cannot feel yourself.
vrook.650650jedi046.mp3: You are a cipher, forming bonds, leeching the life of others, siphoning their will and dominating them.
vrook.650650jedi047.mp3: It is the teaching of these new Sith, to feed on others, on other Force Sensitives. They are symptomatic of the wound in the Force.
vrook.650650jedi048.mp3: You are a breach that must be closed. You transmit your pain, your suffering through the Force.
vrook.650650jedi049.mp3: Within you, we see something worse than merely the teachings of the Sith. What you carry may mean the death of the Force... and the death of the Jedi.
vrook.650650jedi050.mp3: {Scoffs}So you think. It is not the strength of a Jedi you feel.
vrook.650650jedi054.mp3: And that is why you are a threat to us all.
vrook.650650jedi055.mp3: What if other Jedi went to war as you did, suffered the same events, and emerged as you did. What if there was a crucible that trained such Jedi to consume and kill?
vrook.650650jedi059.mp3: {Accusing}Somehow, they have learned their hunger from you. And so you have brought about the end of the Jedi, and perhaps all the knowledge of the Force.
vrook.650650jedi125.mp3: But it is of no consequence. Your ability to make such connections, such bonds, so easily are why you cannot remain.
vrook.650650jedi126.mp3: You are a threat to living creatures, and all who feel the Force.
vrook.650650jedi128.mp3: Our judgment before remains, exile. You must leave... and you must leave without your tie to the Force.
vrook.650650jedi129.mp3: It is a punishment reserved for only a few - and only when necessary, but we have the power to cut you off from the Force, and it must be done.
vrook.650650jedi174.mp3: {Commanding, passing sentence}This must be done. As long as you feel the Force, you are a danger to those around you.
vrook.650650jedi132.mp3: Do not be afraid - you shall feel no pain, but this must be done. As long as you feel the Force, you are a danger to those around you.
vrook.650650jedi170.mp3: Is this your new Master, exile? If so, then you follow Revan's path. Her teachings will cause you to fall as surely as she did.
vrook.650650jedi143.mp3: Is this your new Master, exile? If so, then you follow Revan's path. Her teachings will cause you to fall as surely as he did.
vrook.650650jedi072.mp3: You already know the answer - you've noticed it in those who travel with you.
vrook.650650jedi101.mp3: I see you have failed to grasp the nature of the enemy we face. Where Jedi gather, Jedi die.
vrook.650650jedi114.mp3: There was a gathering of Jedi on the planet - when we realized that something was attacking us, we resolved to meet secretly to attempt to find this threat.
vrook.650650jedi121.mp3: And it was in the ground at Dantooine.
vrook.650650jedi107.mp3: We have been trying... for years, without success. Whatever disturbance in the Force that would cause death on such a scale also clouds it from our sight.
vrook.650650jedi109.mp3: So we sought out places touched by the Force, by such events.
vrook.650650jedi112.mp3: We thought the enemy might show themselves. They were Sith, that much was certain.
vrook.650650jedi113.mp3: But where they were striking from, we did not know.
vrook.650650jedi096.mp3: We cast you out of the Order because you followed Revan to war. There was no other reason.
vrook.650650jedi095.mp3: We believe that somehow, you are creating this - or that the Sith have learned this technique from you.
vrook.650650jedi084.mp3: No. We will do as we have done - we will wait. There is nothing else we can do.
vrook.650650jedi085.mp3: No, the true threat has yet to show itself. It is waiting for something - us, perhaps, to enter the war.
vrook.650650jedi086.mp3: We have seen their soldiers, the remnants of their fleet, but those are symptoms of a disease. It is more bait to attempt to draw us out.
vrook.650650jedi090.mp3: If Jedi gather, if we wage war against these... shadows now, then Jedi will die, and we will die for nothing.
vrook.650650jedi091.mp3: Whatever this thing is, it must be fought by those strong in the Force - it cannot be fought in any other way. It knows this, and that is why it is killing us.
vrook.650650jedi092.mp3: If we die, then it will win, no matter what fleet or weapons are brought against it.
vrook.650650jedi081.mp3: We know what you have done to the others. The fault is mine - I knew you for what you were when we met on Dantooine, and I should have stopped you then.
vrook.650650jedi076.mp3: Even here on Dantooine, I can still hear you faintly in the Force... now that I know what to listen for.
vrook.650650jedi077.mp3: I know what you have done to the others. It is my fault - I knew you for what you were when we met on Dantooine, and I should have stopped you then.

vrook_other_1.gbllrn_form019.mp3: {condescending}You think you can learn my technique just by watching me? It takes a Jedi Master years to perfect it.
vrook_other_1.262holorec008.mp3: Do you know why we have called you here?
vrook_other_1.604vrook004.mp3: Always the rushing into action without thinking of the consequences. What? You were expecting thanks?
vrook_other_1.604vrook009.mp3: Is this a joke to you? People's lives are at stake.
vrook_other_1.604vrook028.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}I don't know why you think I'd tell you anything.
vrook_other_1.604vrook056.mp3: [Failure] {Hostile}I said I will not tell you.
vrook_other_1.604vrook055.mp3: {Final, hostile}But enough of this - it is knowledge for the Council alone until they choose to reveal it.
vrook_other_1.604vrook038.mp3: {Belligerent, condescending}We were not in hiding, despite what you believe.
vrook_other_1.604vrook039.mp3: {Belligerent}It is you, and all those allied with you, that hide and must be found.
vrook_other_1.604vrook031.mp3: {Hostile}You are wasting your time. Anything I tell you will die with you.

kavar.gbllrn_form015.mp3: {somewhat taxed, but determined}Your... power... is undeniable. But it won't be enough.
kavar.gbllrn_form017.mp3: Damn you. You must die. I will not have you teach the others the secrets of the Jedi.
kavar.gbllrn_form031.mp3: {Kavar teaches the player a form.}There is something I would like to teach you. It is a technique which, I believe, will aid you in the trials ahead.
kavar.gbllrn_form046.mp3: {Player demonstrates the form he just learned, beside Kavar}{Impressed}Excellent! I am impressed with how quickly you've mastered this form. I always knew you were gifted.
kavar.gbllrn_form044.mp3: { (14) Force Mastery}The philosophy of Force Mastery states that a Jedi's powers are best used without the direct intent to harm another. Here is a form that will aid in that philosophy.
kavar.gbllrn_form045.mp3: Through careful concentration, the duration of many of your Force powers will be enhanced. But be cautious when you face dark Jedi. This form drains energy quickly, and decreases resistance to force powers.
kavar.gbllrn_form042.mp3: { (13) Force Affinity}As demonstrated here on Onderon, great conflict is often resolved slowly through a drawn out war of attrition. To persevere through long battles, a Jedi must reserve his Force energy.
kavar.gbllrn_form043.mp3: {Kavar levitates multiple objects with the Force}This form offers greater affinity to the Force, increasing the rate at which you regenerate your Force energy during combat.
kavar.gbllrn_form040.mp3: { (12) Force Potency}The Jedi Order generally scorns the unnecessary use of the Force as a weapon. However, sometimes it is necessary to deal with certain powerful threats with a potent Force attack.
kavar.gbllrn_form041.mp3: {Kavar uses Force Push against an inanimate object, and it goes flying and breaks against a wall}This form is used for such dire situations. {warning}Be warned though. Using your powers in this manner will quickly deplete your Force energy.
kavar.gbllrn_form038.mp3: { (7) Juyo form - Kavar draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}There are times when you want to overwhelm a particular opponent quickly. For these situations, use the Juyo form.
kavar.gbllrn_form039.mp3: {warning}Do not get carried away using this form, particularly against dark Jedi. The ferocity required to use this form leaves one vulnerable to enemy force powers.
kavar.gbllrn_form036.mp3: Many of the lightsaber forms you've already learned will bolster your abilities in one area, while leaving you vulnerable in others. For superior balance, use the Niman form.
kavar.gbllrn_form037.mp3: This form has no specific strengths, but no weaknesses either. It will provide a decent defense versus enemy force powers and blaster fire.
kavar.gbllrn_form034.mp3: { (5) Shien form - Kavar draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}Never before have the Jedi been so greatly outnumbered. You will doubtless encounter many situations with multiple assailants.
kavar.gbllrn_form035.mp3: To better protect yourself from blaster fire without compromising your offensive capabilities, use the Shien form.
kavar.gbllrn_form032.mp3: { (4) Ataru form - Kavar draws his lightsaber and fences with the player, demonstrating the form}This is Ataru, an aggressive lightsaber form which is best used against a single opponent.
kavar.gbllrn_form033.mp3: Take care when you face multiple adversaries, and be sure to close the distance between ranged attackers quickly, as your ability to deflect blaster fire will be diminished.
kavar.501cs_tal_1002.mp3: Unfortunately, lie or not, it's a madness people will believe.
kavar.501cs_tal_1004.mp3: Curiously, only Tobin's men were involved in that battle.
kavar.501cs_tal_1006.mp3: Strong words, your majesty. But there is no good time for news like this. I recommend we continue with our plan.
kavar.501cs_tal_1008.mp3: For a time, perhaps, but we both know he's not the true threat. It's his unseen support from the shadows that we must drag out into the light.
kavar.501cs_tal_1009.mp3: Then, and only then, can we strike.
kavar.503kavar014.mp3: I must return to the Palace. I'll get word to you when I'm able. Run!
kavar.503tobin004.mp3: I must return to the Palace. I'll get word to you when I'm able. Run!
kavar.506kavar037.mp3: Then I have to leave. My job is done here.
kavar.506kavar040.mp3: {Kavar is at half health, the player learns a technique from him}Your... power... is undeniable. But it won't be enough.
kavar.506kavar042.mp3: Damn you. You must die. I will not have you teach others the secrets of the Jedi.
kavar.506kavar038.mp3: I'm going to Dantooine. The Jedi Council vowed to assemble again when the Sith revealed themselves. Now that they have attacked Onderon, we can act.
kavar.506kavar039.mp3: Our paths will cross again. May the Force be with you.
kavar.506kavar044.mp3: We spent all this time looking for you, and you came to us. I thought you might return to Onderon. Looks like just in time.
kavar.506kavar011.mp3: The difficulties you surmounted to get here. You must have many questions. You deserve answers.
