kavar.506kavar035.mp3: You always did form connections to others, strong ones, even when you were a student. But what you are describing is beyond me.
kavar.506kavar036.mp3: I'm sure others in the Jedi Council would be able to assist you. If you could find them.

kavar.506kavar029.mp3: You must understand . This is hard for me, especially after all you've done. But it is necessary.

kavar.506kavar010.mp3: When I first sparred with you during your training as a Padawan, I could tell that you were different. And it wasn't just your strong connection to the Force.
kavar.506kavar084.mp3: {perplexed}Cut you off from the Force?  Why do you think the Council was responsible for that?
kavar.506kavar085.mp3: No, I'm afraid the cause of your condition was as great a mystery to the Council as it is to you.
kavar.506kavar078.mp3: There was nothing else we could do. You defied the Council. You followed Revan to war. I know why you did it, but in so doing, much more harm was done.
kavar.506kavar079.mp3: {Quiet}But you must understand - the exile was never the punishment you thought it to be.
kavar.506kavar080.mp3: {Sighs}We could not have made you do such a thing, in any event. I think you knew, inside, what you needed to do in order to heal.
kavar.506kavar081.mp3: All those lives during the Mandalorian Wars - and all those you served beside. Too much death leaves echoes in the Force; it is the price for having such connections.
kavar.506kavar082.mp3: I suspect that is why you chose to accept the Council's judgment, to wander beyond the Rim. And why you traveled with no one, and did not stay in any place too long.
kavar.506kavar083.mp3: {Looking off in the distance, reflective}I have thought of you since your trial, and there are times when I wonder if being connected to the Force is always the gift it is believed to be.
kavar.506kavar060.mp3: Scattered, searching for you. Going to places where they thought they might cross your path.
kavar.506kavar077.mp3: I think we all know that Vrook isn't easily swayed from his convictions, and his views on anyone who went to the Mandalorian Wars are low.
kavar.506kavar062.mp3: Yes, at least, that's what I asked them to do. I believed you are the key to this whole war.
kavar.506kavar063.mp3: When you stood before us in the Council chamber on Coruscant, we felt something from you, we'd never felt before - it was as if the Force had died within you, leaving you hollow.
kavar.506kavar064.mp3: We had suspicions as to why this was, but nothing definite. But rather than try to understand, we sent you away. I think because at some level, there was fear.
kavar.506kavar065.mp3: We live our whole lives in touch with the Force, in touch with life all around us, and you had a gift in that regard. You formed bonds so easily, and they flowed deep between you and others.
kavar.506kavar066.mp3: To see such emptiness in the Force standing before you... it is not an easy thing to face.
kavar.506kavar067.mp3: Whatever is attacking us, it is leaving something in its wake, something we haven't felt since you stood before us in judgment.
kavar.506kavar068.mp3: The deaths of the Jedi, the destruction of Katarr, all of these things are leaving behind echoes - like the one we felt from you in the council chamber.
kavar.506kavar069.mp3: It was clear to us - to me, that we had to find you. But we couldn't call you back from exile, because we didn't know where you'd gone.
kavar.506kavar070.mp3: Plus, there was a chance we might put you in danger, and that we couldn't allow. If you couldn't feel the Force, then it would just make you a target.
kavar.506kavar071.mp3: I don't know how you got back, but I'm glad you're here.
kavar.506kavar072.mp3: The thing is, in traveling to these places... these places where war was fought, we felt the same thing, echoes.
kavar.506kavar073.mp3: Something happened in all these places, but it's hard to figure out what. It's hard to sense things through the Force in such places. Too much pain occurred here.
kavar.506kavar074.mp3: It makes listening to the Force difficult.
kavar.506kavar075.mp3: We resolved to meet again on Dantooine, but only when the threat revealed itself - unfortunately, I happened to be here when it struck.
kavar.506kavar076.mp3: Now that we've stabilized Onderon, I can join the others on Dantooine.
kavar.506kavar056.mp3: It's a long story - but there's a reason the Jedi have scattered across the galaxy - we've come to worlds such as this one.
kavar.506kavar057.mp3: Worlds touched by war, or great tragedies, can be felt within the Force... strongly.
kavar.506kavar058.mp3: We thought by traveling to such worlds, it would help conceal us from the eyes of the enemy.
kavar.506kavar059.mp3: And they were places we thought we might find you.
kavar.506kavar012.mp3: I know that all too well. I came here to find them, to trace them to their source. The war on Dxun and Onderon - I had thought that perhaps the tragedies that occurred here were concealing them.
kavar.506kavar022.mp3: They wanted to aid General Vaklu in breaking away from the Republic. If Onderon became independent, this place would be an excellent staging ground for them.
kavar.506kavar023.mp3: But I fear it was more than that, that the consequences of Onderon's fall would have greater implications for the galaxy.
kavar.506kavar020.mp3: You've had more success than I. General Vaklu's men and their allies effectively kept me pinned inside the Palace.
kavar.506kavar021.mp3: I felt all along that Vaklu had contacted the Sith. But the identity and purpose of the Sith, I can't say.
kavar.506kavar013.mp3: The Jedi Order has been fighting the dark side since the beginning. Our rules and the Jedi Code provide protection from what's inside each of us.
kavar.506kavar014.mp3: The dark side is always there, and it is something that can never truly be defeated. I feel our current troubles, though, are beyond what we faced before.
kavar.506kavar055.mp3: This threat that is targeting us, drawing us out... it's not a battle we are used to. And it has ended many of us.
kavar.506kavar019.mp3: Whatever I can tell you, I will.
kavar.506kavar015.mp3: Not enough. I feel it is something that was born from the wars that have struck the Republic. The threat is Sith, but the manner and timing of their attacks is difficult to defend against.
kavar.506kavar016.mp3: We don't know all that the Sith planned during the Jedi Civil War, what secret training grounds may still remain, what worlds he discovered. We just don't know.
kavar.506kavar018.mp3: Even after we deal with this current threat, I fear we may be dealing with the legacy of the Jedi Civil War for years to come.
kavar.506kavar045.mp3: I told the other Masters that our only chance to figure out what was happening to us was to find you - and try to understand what happened to you.
kavar.506kavar046.mp3: I don't know how much you know, but this threat that's striking at the Jedi... it's attacking us through the Force.
kavar.506kavar047.mp3: Vrook didn't believe me. But he was willing to travel to Dantooine, if only to help the settlers there... and perhaps protect what was left of the Jedi Enclave.
kavar.506kavar048.mp3: Whatever, the reason, having us all drop out of sight I thought might make the enemy more bold - but then you happened.
kavar.506kavar049.mp3: You came back, and you became a new target for whoever was attacking us.
kavar.506kavar050.mp3: They were places touched by war. And we thought there was a chance you would return to these worlds, if only to try and make peace with what happened there during the war.
kavar.506kavar051.mp3: But now the Sith have revealed themselves, that means the remaining Jedi will gather on Dantooine. From there, we can counterattack.
kavar.506kavar052.mp3: Telos? But Telos was destroyed during the Jedi Civil War. I heard they're trying to rebuild.
kavar.506kavar053.mp3: {Slight confusion, thinking at the end}Atris? I had thought Atris had gone to Katarr.
kavar.506kavar054.mp3: Too many Jedi have scattered - the council needs to gather, we cannot remain concealed any longer.
kavar.506kavar024.mp3: We knew that someone was preying on us, hunting us. Finally the Jedi decided to take action, and called a secret conclave on Katarr to decide what must be done.
kavar.506kavar025.mp3: Before the meeting could even begin, all the Jedi on the planet were killed, along with the Miralukas and all other life on the planet. Their deaths could be felt throughout the galaxy.
kavar.506kavar026.mp3: So the Council decided that we must not present ourselves as a target again. The consequences to others was just too great, that we should use our resources to find who was responsible and deal with them.
kavar.506kavar027.mp3: I think you're the only one who's made progress.
kavar.506kavar001b.mp3: The defense of Iziz requires my full attention. Later...
kavar.506kavar002.mp3: I don't know how you made it, but well done. Come in, quickly, before more Sith or Vaklu troops arrive.
kavar.506kavar003.mp3: We got split off from Talia's troops by the currents of this war. We really need to talk, but Kadron and I are coordinating the defense of the war.

kavar.506kavar008.mp3: {Some irritation - which is quickly mastered to Jedi serenity}I'm not her bodyguard. We were fighting at the palace gates. There were too many of them...
kavar.506kavar009.mp3: We'll talk when all of this is over. Until then, may the Force be with you.

kavar.506kavar005.mp3: Even if there wasn't a civil war going on, I can only say so much. We'll talk later. Now, every moment counts.
kavar.506kavar086.mp3: {Wary}So you've come to us. I had thought coming to Dxun might cause our paths to intersect, and I see that I am right.
kavar.506kavar087.mp3: But it turns out you were the enemy all along. The connection between these places and you was stronger than I knew.

kavar.506kavar089.mp3: {angry}What a fool I was.  And now you are no doubt seeking to destroy the Jedi.
kavar.506kavar090.mp3: {bold, confident}But the remaining Jedi will gather again very soon. This, at least, you cannot prevent.
kavar.506kavar091.mp3: {confused, hostile}Telos? But Telos was destroyed during the Jedi Civil War. I don't know what you mean.

kreia_voice.gbllrn_form013.mp3: { (14) Force Mastery}He may appear stronger in the Force than you, but this is merely an illusion granted by a certain mastery of the Force.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form014.mp3: The powers he uses against you will not directly harm you, but he seeks to weaken and confound you. Exploit the weakness of his form by using your own Force powers against him.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form011.mp3: { (13) Force Affinity}He is being typically cautious. He isn't sure of your strengths and weaknesses, so he is using a force form that grants him greater affinity to the Force.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form012.mp3: This allows him to more quickly regenerate his energies. Don't be drawn into a long battle. Once you understand his technique, attack him aggressively while he dawdles.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form009.mp3: { (12) Force Potency}Note the strength of his Force powers. He is desperate to finish you quickly, so he uses a potent form of the Force.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form010.mp3: Defeat him by going on the defensive and absorbing his attacks with the Force. He will quickly run out of energy and then you can finish him easily.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form007.mp3: { (7) Juyo form}Predictably, he seeks to unbalance you with his erratic attacks. His technique is called Juyo, the most chaotic of the lightsaber forms.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form008.mp3: This form sacrifices much to bolster offense, leaving one exposed to attack by the Force. He has made a grave error in assuming you lack the power to harm him with the Force.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form005.mp3: It would serve you well to assimilate the style this Jedi is demonstrating. It is called Niman, and it is a very balanced form.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form006.mp3: Niman offers none of the specific strengths of other forms, but neither does it have their weaknesses.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form003.mp3: { (5) Shien form}You have him on the defensive. He uses the Shien form. Study his movements carefully and try to emulate them.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form004.mp3: This form will be useful when you face multiple opponents or ranged attack. Shien also allows you to make more devastating critical attacks.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form001.mp3: { (4) Ataru form}He is overconfident. Observe how he handles his lightsaber. He is using Ataru, an aggressive form, best suited for single opponents.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form002.mp3: You can easily defeat him by encircling him with your companions or by using blaster fire. Be wary of his Power Attack, however, as it is further enhanced using this form.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form028.mp3: It is something the Sith, the assassins that stalk us, can do - it is of the dark side, the ability to feed on life, the Force, the closer one comes to it. It makes them stronger - for a time.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form029.mp3: {telepathically}Not all techniques in the Force are learned through practice and training - this is something instinctual, born from experience.
kreia_voice.gbllrn_form030.mp3: {Quiet}It is a way that they fill the hollow places where the Force used to be.
kreia_voice.301miratch021.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer: Need an animated camera swooping around the pit, like in the Kreiatch scene. See Avellone]}:: Feel the currents here on Nar Shaddaa, the ebb of life. A simple kindness can be given to another. ::
kreia_voice.301miratch022.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer: Need an animated camera swooping around the pit, like in the Kreiatch scene, but it comes back to Mira and Kreia. See Avellone]}:: This is the Force. And all our choices, from the greatest to the smallest, affect each other. And the echoes travel. ::
kreia_voice.301miratch037.mp3: ::Feel the currents of Nar Shaddaa, the ebb and flow of life. Where one creature feels pain, it lashes out...::
kreia_voice.304visenter001.mp3: So... it seems the exile has chosen to come after all.
kreia_voice.304visenter002.mp3: Seal the entrance to the Jekk'Jekk Tarr.
kreia_voice.304visenter003.mp3: Unlock the sequencer to the private chamber, I will meet the human there.
kreia_voice.304visenter005.mp3: You shall be compensated, Hanharr. The trap is not yet sprung - until then, I request your patience.
kreia_voice.304visenter006.mp3: Ah... finally, the genuine specimen. I had thought I might have to waste more time and resources baiting another trap.
kreia_voice.304visenter012.mp3: But the Jedi has come without an environmental suit - brave, indeed.
kreia_voice.304visenter023.mp3: We shall let the fumes of the Jekk'Jekk Tarr capture the Jedi for us.
kreia_voice.304visenter013.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer: Cut to a scene of the player choking, as the poisonous gas of the Jekk'Jekk Tarr begin to hit him.]}We shall let the fumes of the Jekk'Jekk Tarr capture the Jedi for us.
kreia_voice.304breath001.mp3: {Urgent, the player is dying}:: Listen to me - clear your thoughts. ::
kreia_voice.304breath002.mp3: {Urgent, trying to teach the player to resist poison gas}:: Still your breathing, let the trace amounts of air in your lungs hold you. ::
kreia_voice.304visenter022.mp3: :: It is an old technique, similar to the healing trance - some Jedi can hold their breath for hours, even days... ::
kreia_voice.304breath003.mp3: :: The Force can sustain you... listen to it. Let it keep you alive until you can reach safety. ::
kreia_voice.304breath004.mp3: :: It is an old technique, similar to the healing trance - some Jedi can hold their breath for hours, even days... ::
kreia_voice.304visenter019.mp3: I grow weary of these subtleties.
kreia_voice.304visenter007.mp3: Let all the clientele know the Jedi... the real Jedi... has arrived. If necessary, remind them of the price for the exile's capture.
kreia_voice.304visenter011.mp3: Hanharr, do not take me for a fool... they cannot kill the exile, only weaken her for capture.
kreia_voice.304visenter009.mp3: Hanharr, do not take me for a fool... they cannot kill the exile, only weaken him for capture.
kreia_voice.304visenter010.mp3: But be silent - and let us watch the amusements on the monitors.
kreia_voice.402beast_co012.mp3: Wait a moment... Do you see that boma over there?
kreia_voice.402beast_co013.mp3: The Force flows through even these simple creatures. If you empty your mind you may be able to feel its thoughts.
kreia_voice.402beast_co014.mp3: They aren't fully formed. Basic instincts, urges, dominated by every breath and every moment. Primal and unsophisticated.
kreia_voice.402beast_co016.mp3: Good. Beasts can be easier to affect than other sentients. But you must bridge the gap between what distinguishes us and them.
kreia_voice.402beast_co017.mp3: You feel its consciousness, yes? Like a low rumble before the storm. Use the Force to create a barrier around it. Make it with care and subtlety.
kreia_voice.402beast_co015.mp3: The point is to learn something about the Force. Even if you cannot appreciate that, you should value the power my teachings will provide you.
kreia_voice.402beast_co018.mp3: You came close, and you have potential. With practice, you can make any animal passive and pliable.
kreia_voice.402beast_co019.mp3: But the cage around their perceptions is a fragile thing. Many things can break its hold. Violence, especially.
kreia_voice.402beast_co022.mp3: The Force is subtle and more powerful than people imagine. Keep an open mind.
kreia_voice.402beast_co020.mp3: With the Force, anything is possible. But that is the end of the lesson for now.
kreia_voice.402beast_co024.mp3: [You have gained the power Beast Trick.]
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm001.mp3: {Impressed}You've succeeded in this trial. I am impressed.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm011.mp3: Search the room you are in. You should be able to unlock a passage that leads outside the tomb.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm010.mp3: {annoyed}We have been linked together in this manner for a reason. The dangers you faced here should have illuminated your need for fellowship.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm008.mp3: Sometimes, a momentary insight is worth lifetimes of experience.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm009.mp3: You may not yet understand what you learned here. That wisdom will come in the future.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm006.mp3: You overestimate the power of the tomb. Any change you feel is coming from within yourself. Instinctually, you know your true path.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm007.mp3: Trust in your feelings. They will lead you in conquering the many challenges that the future holds for you.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm002.mp3: The dangers you faced in this tomb were real, but these images of the past served to prepare you for your future.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm003.mp3: {grim}Surely you have felt what awaits... events are shaping themselves about you, seeking to draw you into their center.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm004.mp3: {warning}Take care not to give in to vanity and arrogance. This breeds complacency and stagnation, as exhibited by the Jedi Council.
kreia_voice.711kreia_tm005.mp3: Their prolonged inaction led inevitably to their downfall. The galaxy will bend itself only to those of strength and conviction.
kreia_voice.903903kreia005.mp3: :: When the exile enters the Trayus Academy, she will be faced with a choice. ::
kreia_voice.903903kreia008.mp3: :: Show her every respect when she arrives in these halls, Lord Sion. This I command you. ::
kreia_voice.903903kreia001.mp3: :: When the exile enters Trayus Academy, he will be faced with a choice. ::
kreia_voice.903903kreia004.mp3: :: Show him every respect when he arrives in these halls, Lord Sion. This I command you. ::

atris.262atris082.mp3: We shall see... for now, the perspective on your situation has changed.

atris.262atris011.mp3: {Irritated that the player has forgotten, because she never has been able to}Why? Because you turned your back on us... and the Order.

atris.262atris015.mp3: {Slight contempt}So you said, so long ago. I didn't believe it, then, and I don't believe it now.
atris.262atris016.mp3: {Disgusted, then accusing}You sought adventure, you hungered for battle. You could not wait to follow Revan to war.
atris.262atris017.mp3: {Wounded, then spiteful}The Jedi Order asked only for time to examine the Mandalorian threat. They urged caution, patience. And you defied them.

atris.262atris055.mp3: Then you misunderstand its meaning while it is in my possession - and what it now represents.
atris.262atris054.mp3: It is not yours. It is a symbol of something greater, which you no longer represent.
atris.262atris024.mp3: {Incredulous}Become a Jedi again? That is a thing far out of reach.
atris.262atris053.mp3: And you were ruled by hate and aggression! That is not the way of a Jedi!
atris.262atris028.mp3: So your choice was to meet the aggression of the Mandalorians with more aggression? That is not the Jedi way!
atris.262atris029.mp3: Every choice we make, whether we know it or not, sends echoes through the Force. It can awaken feelings, ignite passions, hate, anger, fear - where none existed before.
atris.262atris030.mp3: By meeting aggression, by serving as an opponent against which the Mandalorians could test themselves, you fed their hate, their lust for war.
atris.262atris031.mp3: And it sent a terrible echo through you. And because of it, you and those Jedi who met them on the battlefield lost their way... and you turned on us.

atris_other_1.262atrend3010.mp3: I sought to preserve the knowledge of the Jedi, and to do that, I needed to know the Sith, in order to stop them.
atris_other_1.262atrend3007.mp3: Once, I was a historian, the chronicler of the Jedi. And when both wars passed me by, I was determined that I would not forsake battle again.
atris_other_1.262atrend3008.mp3: {Quiet, to herself}In some part of me... I knew I had made choices, compromises, but always for the sake of the Republic, of the galaxy.
atris_other_1.262atrend3009.mp3: {Quiet}To do what you had done... at times, did not seem so wrong.
atris_other_1.262atrend3143.mp3: {Quieter as door closes}But please... do not leave me...
atris_other_1.262atrend3131.mp3: {Quiet, admitting guilt}You are right. The Jedi were all that seemed left to me, and yet I had become so far removed from them that I betrayed them.
atris_other_1.262atrend3050.mp3: She said you would come here, to this place. If you think you can defeat me here, you are wrong.
atris_other_1.262atrend3051.mp3: All this collected knowledge, all these teachings of combat and the Force - they are mine to command.
atris_other_1.262atrend3052.mp3: And if I must use it to end you, I will. Surrender... you need not die.
atris_other_1.262atrend3128.mp3: {Spitting, hissing mad}I fear nothing - least of all you.
atris_other_1.262atrend3053.mp3: {Reflective, as if unfamilair with the name}Atris... that is not who I am, not any longer.
atris_other_1.262atrend3054.mp3: She has not existed for some time, I think. There was always something else within me - it just took time for its voice to be heard.
atris_other_1.262atrend3071.mp3: But now they have been drawn from the shadows of the Outer Rim - and the only final matter to attend to is finishing you.
atris_other_1.262atrend3079.mp3: Then there were survivors, as I thought... as I hunted them. And they are cowards, afraid to battle the Sith.
atris_other_1.262atrend3082.mp3: {A little distant, like watching a scene far away}Yes... I sensed what would happen on Katarr. It was I who leaked knowledge of its presence in the hopes of drawing the Sith out.
atris_other_1.262atrend3116.mp3: It was their punishment for hiding from the galaxy, for hiding from me.
atris_other_1.262atrend3087.mp3: They hoped to gather, to use their combined knowledge of the Force to see, to listen to the currents of the galaxy.
atris_other_1.262atrend3089.mp3: It revolved around you, as it always has. It is you who've tried to end us.
atris_other_1.262atrend3091.mp3: So that is why I arranged for you to return to the Republic, so that I might draw the Sith out and end them.
atris_other_1.262atrend3092.mp3: Is it not obvious? You are one of the Sith, fallen at Revan's side. The path to them lies through you.
atris_other_1.262atrend3112.mp3: And behind it all, a terrible echo.
atris_other_1.262atrend3111.mp3: Whatever this threat we faced, it was from something you had done, and like all things, would return to you. All echoes do.
atris_other_1.262atrend3095.mp3: Whatever this threat we faced, it came from you - these Sith were something born of you.
atris_other_1.262atrend3110.mp3: Yes, it was one such possibility. The others were only darkness, a galaxy devoid of the Force... but always there was an echo.
atris_other_1.262atrend3108.mp3: It may have been both - the past, the future, both linked. The only aspect of the vision that was certain was you.
atris_other_1.262atrend3099.mp3: {Condescending}Of course you still do not know. The Jedi Council was not sure you would believe them if they told you - and I am not sure they fully believed it themselves.
atris_other_1.262atrend3102.mp3: It is the sound of life in agony - it is a wound in the Force that has yet to close. War... destruction... these events leave wounds in the galaxy, in all life.
atris_other_1.262atrend3062.mp3: Yes, the Sith are here at last - you have brought them to this place, as I had foreseen. It has all been part of my plans for you.
atris_other_1.262atrend3066.mp3: So I arranged for you to return to the Republic, leaked information of your past, and then waited for the Sith to come. And they did.
atris_other_1.262atrend3064.mp3: You know. You have always known. It is the place where the Sith were born, where they came again into the galaxy, through a horrible act of sacrifice.
atris_other_1.262atrend3055.mp3: The old woman you traveled with, finally made me... listen to myself, to the galaxy.
atris_other_1.262atrend3058.mp3: I do not know - yet. I suspect she went in search of you. But just as when she first came here, her path is difficult to see.
atris_other_1.262atriscs3003.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer: Atris stops, as if she has heard something, and turns around.]}{Whispers}Betrayal.
atris_other_1.262atriscs3005.mp3: {Can't believe it}She has betrayed me... the last of your sisters has betrayed me. {Beat at end, correcting herself}Betrayed us.

atris_other_2.262atrend4001.mp3: No, I could not bring myself to tell him. It would have changed nothing.
atris_other_2.262atrend4008.mp3: Because it is Malachor V. And because she was lost there, once - and I fear she will be lost again.
atris_other_2.262atrend4007.mp3: Because it is Malachor V. And because I love him.
atris_other_2.262atrend4004.mp3: You know what lies at the heart of Malachor V. I had thought it was in the past, yet it has become the future.
atris_other_2.262atrend4005.mp3: And all that has happened there will happen again. And that is why I cannot bear it.
atris_other_2.262atrissis002.mp3: She has left with the exile.
atris_other_2.262kreatris027.mp3: {Quiet, as if shellshocked, staring off into space, but not looking at Kreia}Were you here when the exile arrived?
atris_other_2.262kreatris035.mp3: I did as you asked, so long ago.
atris_other_2.262kreatris005.mp3: {Quiet, should be mad, but isn't}You are that which has attacked the Jedi... you are Sith.
atris_other_2.262kreatris018.mp3: Where is the exile? I had thought...
atris_other_2.262sisend016.mp3: We shall see what the exile has taught.
atris_other_2.262atrend3024.mp3: {Quieter, lying, been told something that she doesn't want to reveal}...but I do not know for certain.
atris_other_2.262atrend3025.mp3: [Success] She is willing to sacrifice herself at the heart of that graveyard world for you... a choice others have made in the past. {Beat, quieter at last sentence.}A choice I wished to make.
atris_other_2.262atrend3144.mp3: [Failure] I do not know for certain. If there is a reason, you must discover it for yourself.
atris_other_2.262atrend3136.mp3: Perhaps exile is what I deserve... even though it is many years too late, and you have already returned.
atris_other_2.262atrend3120.mp3: Did they? I think you are wrong.
atris_other_2.262atrend3096.mp3: No... behind it all was a terrible echo.

intro.0013cfd_end001.mp3: [3C-FD is now a member of your party. To change which party member you control, click on their portrait or press TAB (Default).  Later, when you have more companions, you can add and remove party members from the Party screen in the Game Menu.]

intro.0013cfd_int003.mp3: [Talking to other characters is much like using the computer console in the cockpit. Scroll through your response options or move the mouse cursor, and then click to select a response.]
intro.0013cfd_int001.mp3: [Talking to other characters is much like using the computer console in the cockpit. Use the D-pad to go up and down the dialogue options, then press <abutton> to choose a response.]

intro.0013cfd_int004.mp3: [Furthermore, certain skills (Repair, Computer, Persuade), powers (Affect Mind) and attributes (Intelligence or Wisdom) may modify what choices you have... or how successful you are with those choices.]
intro.001blast001.mp3: [Some doors can only be blown open with mines. To do this, select a door, place a frag mine on it, then get away. The mine should be able to blow open a door and allow you to get past it.]
intro.001combat020.mp3: [There are two weapon configurations in the Equip screen. This is useful to switch between ranged and melee weapons. To switch or unequip weapons, click the two swords icon in the lower right area of the screen, or press H (Default).]
intro.001combat019.mp3: [There are two weapon configurations in the Equip screen. This is useful to switch between ranged and melee weapons. To switch or unequip weapons, press up or down on the D-pad to select the two swords icon and press <abutton>.]
intro.001combat018.mp3: [These sensor balls don't leave behind any useful items when you kill them, but many enemies do. After combat, be sure and search your enemies' remains.]
intro.001combat017.mp3: [You found a grenade in the container. With grenades you can damage multiple enemies at once. To throw a grenade, click the grenade icon above your selected target, or press 3 (Default).]
intro.001combat016.mp3: [You found a grenade in the container. With grenades you can damage multiple enemies at once. To throw a grenade, select the grenade by pressing right or left on the D-pad. Then press <abutton>.]
intro.001combat015.mp3: [You can pause and unpause combat by clicking on the hourglass icon in the lower right area of the screen, or press Spacebar. Pausing combat will help you plan your moves strategically.]
intro.001combat014.mp3: [You can pause and unpause combat with <whbutton>. Pausing combat will help you plan your moves strategically.]
intro.001combat013.mp3: [Change your target by pressing Q or E, or left click on the object you want to target. To attack an enemy, left click on the Sword icon or press 1. To Queue up actions, left click multiple times. Clear your last combat action by clicking in the queue, or by pressing Y.]
intro.001combat011.mp3: [Change your target by using the left and right triggers. To attack an enemy select the Sword icon with the D-pad and press <abutton> or <xbutton>. To queue up multiple combat actions press <abutton>. To cancel the last combat action press <ybutton>.]
intro.001combat012.mp3: [Change your target by using the left and right triggers. To attack an enemy, select the Sword icon with the D-pad and press <abutton>. To queue up multiple combat actions, press <xbutton>. To cancel the last combat action, press <ybutton>.]
intro.001combat010.mp3: {Equip weapon}[You can equip a weapon from the Equip screen. To open the Equip screen, click on the Blaster icon in the top right area of the screen or press U (Default).]
intro.001combat009.mp3: [You can equip a weapon from the Equip screen. Press START to open the Pause Menu, and then use the left or right triggers to cycle to the Equip screen.]
intro.001combat008.mp3: [Destroy all the sensor balls to continue to the next step of combat training.]
intro.001combat007.mp3: {More sensor balls appear and start circling around}[This box seems to have an infinite supply of sensor balls.]
intro.001combat006.mp3: {More sensor balls appear and start circling around}[More sensor droids emerge from the container.]
intro.001combat005.mp3: [You have completed combat training. You may still continue to use the metal box to display the combat training messages from the beginning.]
intro.001combat004.mp3: [You destroyed another group of sensor droids. To continue combat training, open the metal box again.]
intro.001combat001.mp3: [Good work defeating the sensor droids. To continue combat training, open the metal box again and more sensor droids will appear.]
intro.001combat002.mp3: [Sensor droids emerged from this box when you opened it.]
intro.001combat003.mp3: [These droids will make for excellent target practice. Use the weapon from this container to attack the droids.]

intro.001comcon009.mp3: [The door in the corridor behind you opens, allowing you access to the rest of the ship.]
intro.001controls002.mp3: Press W, A, S, D (Default) to move T3-M4 and turn. Press Caps Lock (Default) to toggle first-person Free Look. Hold Ctrl (Default) to Look About.
intro.001controls001.mp3: Use the left thumbstick to move T3-M4. Swivel the camera with the right thumbstick. Click the right thumbstick to toggle first-person Free Look.
intro.001eng_door003.mp3: {player has found a mine}[This door is damaged and cannot be opened with your Security skill, or by bashing it. You can use a mine to open this door.]
intro.001eng_door001.mp3: [This door is damaged and cannot be opened with your Security skill, or by bashing it. You will have to find and use an explosive trap to open this door. Take the lift outside the Ebon Hawk to find one.]
intro.001eng_door002.mp3: {player has found a mine}[This door is damaged and cannot be opened with your Security skill, or by bashing it. You can use a mine to open this door. Once you plant the mine, back away from the door to avoid taking damage.]
intro.001eng_port001.mp3: [The port engine is shut down, but appears intact. Fixing the hyperdrive will allow you to restore power to the port engine and bring primary power online.]
intro.001eng_port002.mp3: [The port engine is powered up. You can now use the Galaxy Map to travel to the Peragus mining station.]
intro.001eng_star001.mp3: [The Starboard engine is badly damaged. Fixing it won't be possible until after docking with the Peragus mining station.]
intro.001exit001.mp3: [When the Ebon Hawk has landed, this is where you will go to exit the ship.]
intro.001extra024.mp3: Use the Galaxy map to travel to Peragus.
intro.001extra022.mp3: Search the Ebon Hawk, inside and out, to find enough Parts to repair the Hyperdrive.
intro.001extra021.mp3: Use the mine on the Engine Room door to access the Hyperdrive.
intro.001extra020.mp3: Don't forget to explore the other side of the Ebon Hawk.
intro.001extra019.mp3: Use the Proton Missile to receive a mine.
intro.001extra018.mp3: Take the lift outside the ship to find a Mine to use to open the Engine Room door.
intro.001extra017.mp3: Use the Communications Console to open the Main Hold door.
intro.001extra016.mp3: Open the plasteel cylinder and take the Computer Spike.
intro.001extra015.mp3: This is the Port side of the Ebon Hawk.
intro.001extra014.mp3: This is the Starboard side of the Ebon Hawk.
intro.001flameth001.mp3: [You found a droid flamethrower. This is one of the special weapons that droids can use. To equip it open the Equip screen, by clicking on the Blaster icon in the top right area of the screen or press U (Default).]
intro.001flameth002.mp3: [You found a droid flamethrower. This is one of the special weapons that droids can use. To equip it open the Equip screen, by pressing START to open the Pause Menu and then use the left or right triggers to cycle to the Equip screen.]

intro.001fl_bash002.mp3: [Your security skill is too low to open this footlocker. However, you can use your weapon to Bash it open. Press up or down on the D-pad to select Bash and then press <abutton>.]
intro.001fl_bash001.mp3: [Sometimes bashing or blowing opening a container will break some of the items in the container. But you can use even broken items. They can be turned into useful components at a workbench.]
intro.001gar_door003.mp3: [To access the area beyond this door, you will have to use Solo mode (Default: V). Click the Solo mode button at the bottom right area of the screen. While in Solo mode, move 3C-FD to the security computer to open the door for you.]
intro.001gar_door002.mp3: [To access the area beyond this door, you will have to use Solo mode. Press BACK to toggle Solo Mode. While in Solo mode, move 3C-FD to the security computer to open the door for you.]
intro.001gar_door001.mp3: [There is a hull breech in the area beyond this door. Safety protocols prevent you from opening it manually. Try using the security computer in the Main Hold.]
intro.001glxy_map001.mp3: [This is the Galaxy Map. It shows you are near Peragus, a mining colony. When the hyperdrive is fixed you can use the Galaxy Map to choose a destination planet.]
intro.001glxy_map003.mp3: [You can now plot a course to the Peragus mining station. To dock with Peragus, left click on the Peragus planet to select it and then left click on the Travel button.]
intro.001glxy_map002.mp3: [You can now plot a course to the Peragus mining station. Select Peragus by pressing left or right on the D-pad and then press <abutton> to travel to Peragus.]
intro.001got_meds001.mp3: [You have found medpacs. You can use one to stabilize the condition of the human lying on the bed.]
intro.001hk50dr001.mp3: [You can hear a banging noise coming from the other side of the door to this storage compartment, but the door is sealed shut and cannot be opened from the outside.]
intro.001hyper006.mp3: [With the hyperdrive online, you can now bring the port engine online and restore primary power.]
intro.001hyper008.mp3: [Failure] The port engine isn't responding to the hyperdrive. You'll have to take the lift outside the ship to diagnose and repair the problem.
intro.001hyper007.mp3: [Success] Primary power restored. Systems are coming back online.
intro.001hyper010.mp3: [You've already repaired the Hyperdrive. Now return to the Galaxy Map in the cockpit and Travel to Peragus.]
intro.001hyper001.mp3: [The hyperdrive is suffering badly. You won't be able to make the jump to lightspeed until it is fully repaired, and you do not have the needed equipment here on the Ebon Hawk.]
intro.001hyper003.mp3: [However, you should be able to rig the hyperdrive to restore primary power and bring the port engine online. This will allow you to dock with the Peragus mining station for full repairs.]
intro.001hyper005.mp3: [Failure] You do not have enough Parts. Search around the ship to find more Parts. If you can gain access to the Garage, you can use the Workbench there to create Parts.
intro.001hyper004.mp3: [Success] The hyperdrive is online. Primary power is restored.
intro.001hyper009.mp3: [Only one step remains. Return to the Galaxy Map in the cockpit and travel to Peragus.]
intro.001hyper002.mp3: [Primary power restored. Systems are coming back online.]
intro.001impdoor001.mp3: [This blast door is magnetically sealed and cannot be opened.]
intro.001intro020.mp3: This is the voice of the Ebon Hawk.
intro.001intro005.mp3: [Do you want to skip the Prologue?]
intro.001intro001.mp3: [T3-M4 is alone in the cockpit of the Ebon Hawk. The computers surrounding the droid emit recognizable tones and beeps, a dozen different alerts and warnings.]
intro.001intro011.mp3: [Primary power is offline, propulsion is down, multiple hull breaches, blast doors closed all over the ship, computers failing, proximity warning.]
intro.001intro010.mp3: {Fade in to Placed Camera 25}[The Ebon Hawk is adrift in space after a terrible battle. Most of its crew are dead or dying.]
intro.001intro002.mp3: [<FullName> lays in the Medical Room in critical condition. He won't survive long without medical attention.]
intro.001intro003.mp3: {Fade in to Placed Camera 23}[The hyperdrive is damaged. Main power must be restored in order to bring the engines online and dock with the nearby Peragus mining station for much needed repairs.]

intro.001outro001.mp3: {Computer beeps}[The sensors show the door to the storage compartment is being sliced. There is someone - or something - else alive on the Ebon Hawk.]
intro.001pcbody001.mp3: [This patient appears to be unconscious, but in stable condition. If you can navigate the asteroid field, the patient should recover in time.]
intro.001pilotdr001.mp3: [Beyond this door is the main hold of the Ebon Hawk. This door appears to be locked down due to a hull breach. See if there is an emergency override somewhere in the communications room behind you.]
intro.001plscylsp001.mp3: [You will come across many containers, some of which will be locked. The computer spike you just picked up can be used at computer terminals to access functions such as opening doors.]

intro.001plscylsp002.mp3: [Take the programming spike inside this container by pressing <abutton>. Use this spike to access the terminal nearby.]
intro.001rep_kit002.mp3: [You can use Repair Kits to heal droids like yourself. To use a Repair Kit, click on the Repair Kit on bottom of the screen or press 5(Default).]
intro.001rep_kit001.mp3: [You can use Repair Kits to heal droids like yourself. Select the Repair Kit by pressing Left or Right on the D-pad, and then press <abutton> to use it.]
intro.001secdoor001.mp3: [While some doors can be bashed open (or cut open with a lightsaber or cutting tool). Some doors require the use of the Security skill to open. Use your Security skill from the action bar to open this door and search the remains of the cargo hold beyond.]
intro.001secdoor2001.mp3: [While some doors can be bashed open (or cut open with a lightsaber or cutting tool), some doors require the use of the Security skill to open. Use your Security skill from the action bar to open this door.]
intro.001secspk001.mp3: [If you encounter a difficult lock on a container or door, you can use a security tunneler on it to improve your chance of opening the lock. Use the security tunneler to open the High Security Cylinder nearby.]
intro.001sectun003.mp3: [The lock on this container is too difficult to open. You'll need to use a security tunneler to help open the lock. Look in the unlocked cylinder next to this one to find security tunnelers.]
intro.001sectun002.mp3: [The lock on this metal box is too difficult to open. You can use one of the Security Tunnelers you found to crack this lock. Select the Security Tunneler by clicking on the arrows above or below the Security icon.]
intro.001sectun001.mp3: [The lock on this metal box is too difficult to open. You can use one of the Security Tunnelers you found to crack this lock. Select the Security Tunneler by pressing left or right on the D-pad and press <abutton> to use it.]
intro.001sectun004.mp3: [You must lower your difficulty setting in order to open this lock. Access the Options screen and select Gameplay. Then change the difficulty setting from Difficult to Normal.]
intro.001sens_drd001.mp3: [The sensor balls are hostile now, which will allow you to attack them.]
intro.001sens_drd003.mp3: {Equip weapon}[T3-M4 must equip a blaster before attacking the sensor droids. To open the Equip screen, click on the Blaster icon in the top right area of the screen or press U (Default).]
intro.001sens_drd002.mp3: {Equip weapon}[T3-M4 must equip a blaster before attacking the sensor droids. Press START to open the Pause Menu and then use the left or right triggers to cycle to the Equip screen.]
intro.001sparkwir014.mp3: [These sparking wires connect to the trigger mechanism for the inner and outer garage doors. You can open and close the doors from here.]
intro.001sparkwir016.mp3: [Do you want to do anything else here?]
intro.001sparkwir011.mp3: [You can't open the inner garage door without depressurizing the rest of the Ebon Hawk. First you will need to close the outer garage door.]
intro.001sparkwir015.mp3: [You can't open the outer garage door without depressurizing the rest of the Ebon Hawk. First you will need to close the inner garage door.]
intro.001stardoor001.mp3: [This door is sealed shut, but the magnetic clamps are not engaged. You may be able to override the door's locking mechanism from outside the ship.]
intro.001target002.mp3: This room contains a Plasteel Cylinder and the Communications Console. To target one of these objects, move close to it, left click on it, or press Q or E (Default) to cycle through available targets. To interact with an object, first target it and then left click on it.
intro.001target001.mp3: This room contains a Plasteel Cylinder and the Communications Console. To target one of these objects, move close to it, or use the left or right triggers to cycle through available targets. To interact with an object, first target it and then press <abutton>.
intro.001treatinj006.mp3: [<FullName> is in critical condition. She will need a medpac to be stabilized.]
intro.001treatinj005.mp3: [<FullName> is in critical condition. He will need a medpac to be stabilized.]
intro.001treatinj004.mp3: [Success] <FirstName> is stabilized. To recover fully, she will require the medical facilities at the Peragus mining station, but she is not in any danger of dying from her wounds right now.
intro.001treatinj003.mp3: [Success] <FirstName> is stabilized. To recover fully, he will require the medical facilities at the Peragus mining station, but he is not in any danger of dying from his wounds right now.
intro.001treatinj001.mp3: [<FullName> has already been stabilized with a Medpac. There is nothing more to do here. To recover fully, <FirstName> requires the medical facilities at the Peragus mining station.]
intro.001tr_lift001.mp3: [This lift will take you to the outer hull of the Ebon Hawk, where you will find many parts and mines to use for accessing and repairing the Hyperdrive. Use the lift controls to go up.]
intro.001wrkbnch001.mp3: [This is a workbench. With a workbench you can break down objects in your inventory into components. You can then use the components to create repair kits, weapons, armor and upgrades.]
intro.001wrkbnch002.mp3: [Because of the damage to the Ebon Hawk, this workbench has limited functionality. You can still use it to create a repair kit, which you can use to repair yourself.]
intro.001wrkbnch003.mp3: [Use the workbench to break down the items you've found into components. Then use the components to create a repair kit.]
intro.002cmp_fix016.mp3: [This relay to the port engine is not receiving any power. You can divert the power from the starboard engine console.]
intro.002cmp_fix001.mp3: The readings of this console indicate that the broken starboard engine is siphoning all power from the hyperdrive. This prevents the hyperdrive from powering the port engine.
intro.002cmp_fix002.mp3: [In order to do this without blowing up the ship, the port engine's power relay needs to be connected to the auxilliary starboard power at the same time power is diverted.]
intro.002cmp_fix015.mp3: [This is a job for two droids. One must be stationed near the starboard engine console and the other near the port engine relay. Use Solo Mode (Default: V) and move 3C-FD to the panel on the other side.]
intro.002cmp_fix014.mp3: [This is a job for two droids. One must be stationed near the starboard engine console and the other near the port engine relay. Press BACK to use Solo Mode and move 3C-FD to the panel on the other side.]
intro.002cmp_fix009.mp3: [This is a job for two droids. One must be stationed near the starboard engine console and the other near the port engine relay. Search the Ebon Hawk to find another droid to help you.]
intro.002cmp_fix003.mp3: [You are in a position to begin diverting power. Proceed?]
intro.002cmp_fix013.mp3: {Fade in}[The problem with the hyperdrive has been fixed. To restore primary power, return to the engine room and flip a switch on the hyperdrive.]
intro.002cmp_fix012.mp3: [This relay to the port engine is not receiving any power. You'll have to go to the engine room inside the Ebon Hawk and repair the hyperdrive.]
intro.002cmp_fix011.mp3: [This console shows that there is no power flow from the hyperdrive. You'll have to go to the engine room inside the Ebon Hawk and repair the hyperdrive.]
intro.002cmp_fix010.mp3: [You have restored power flow from the hyperdrive to the port engine. Now return to the engine room inside the Ebon Hawk to power up the port engine.]
intro.002door_ovr004.mp3: [You have already opened the door to the starboard dormitory. You can get to it through the garage inside the Ebon Hawk.]
intro.002door_ovr003.mp3: [These exposed wires control the door to the starboard dormitory. The door is currently sealed, but you can override it from here.]
intro.002door_ovr002.mp3: [Falure] You need a Part. To find Parts, search the Ebon Hawk, inside and out.
intro.002door_ovr001.mp3: [Success] The door is opened. You can now access the starboard dormitory through the garage.
intro.002engine001.mp3: [This busted engine port has some needed Parts for the Ebon Hawk's hyperdrive. Take the Parts here back down below to get main power restored.]
intro.002hatch001.mp3: [This open hatch has some Parts that will be useful for getting main power restored.]
intro.002hintdem001.mp3: [The bubbles ahead indicate mines that you've detected automatically with your Awareness skill. Some mines require higher Awareness to detect.]
intro.002hintdem002.mp3: [Approach mines carefully. They will blow up and damage you if you get too close. You can use your Demolitions skill to either Disable or Recover these mines.]
intro.002hintdem003.mp3: [Recovering mines requires a higher Demolitions skill than disabling them, but you get to keep the mine, which you can then use to set as a trap for enemies, or break down into components at a Workbench.]
intro.002missile002.mp3: [You can use the explosive device in this missile to blow open the engine room door inside the Ebon Hawk. This will give you access to the hyperdrive.]
intro.002missile001.mp3: [You can use the explosive device in this missile to blow open the engine room door inside the Ebon Hawk. This will give you access to the hyperdrive. After you plant a mine, back away quickly so that you do not take damage.]
intro.002quad001.mp3: [This is one of the Ebon Hawk's quadlaser turrets. They are damaged, but you can scavenge some Parts from it to use in repairing the Ebon Hawk.]
intro.002turret001.mp3: This is the Ebon Hawk's gun turret. Although it is against your behavioral programming to man a gun turret and shoot up enemy aircraft, there is nothing preventing you from manning the gun turret to shoot up asteroids.
intro.502turret001.mp3: [This turret is inactive at the moment.]
intro.101pervoice002.mp3: {Disembodied voice}Emergency Lockdown is in effect. Turbolifts have been sealed to contain the explosion.
intro.101pervoice001.mp3: {Disembodied computer warning voice like the "Death Star" has cleared the planet voice}WARNING: There has been a fuel detonation in the mining tunnels. Emergency Lockdown commencing. All personnel report to quarters and prepare for emergency venting countermeasures.
intro.101pervoice003.mp3: {Automatic warning message}Attention all approaching vessels. You are entering the Peragus asteroid field.
intro.101pervoice004.mp3: {Automatic warning message 2}Please shut down all engines and weapon systems and prepare your navicomputer to receive orbital drift charts.
intro.101pervoice005.mp3: Do not attempt to enter the asteroid field without the orbital drift charts or you will endanger your vessel and your crew.
intro.101pervoice006.mp3: Docking maneuvers complete. Docking umbilical extended, and docking doors unlocked.

comp_voc.001comp_voc005.mp3: {female computer voice: monotone, but pleasant. Droid and comlink post processing.}Hyperdrive online.
comp_voc.001comp_voc004.mp3: {female computer voice: monotone, but pleasant. Droid and comlink post processing.}Proximity alert.
comp_voc.001comp_voc003.mp3: {female computer voice: monotone, but pleasant. Droid and comlink post processing.}Multiple hull breaches detected.
comp_voc.001comp_voc002.mp3: {female computer voice: monotone, but pleasant. Droid and comlink post processing.}Hyperdrive offline.
comp_voc.001comp_voc001.mp3: {female computer voice: monotone, but pleasant. Droid and comlink post processing.}Primary power offline.

cp_replace.003attond007.mp3: {nerves a little shot}I can't keep us in one piece much longer. Sorry to spoil your fun, but we've got to land now. {Determined}I'm going to put us down on that jungle moon.
cp_replace.003attond001.mp3: Well, this is Onderon. It looks like there's a long line to get into the Iziz Starport.
cp_replace.003attond002.mp3: I guess this blockade is a symptom of larger problems on Onderon.
cp_replace.003attond003.mp3: Looks like we're about to find out.
cp_replace.003attond004.mp3: I'm receiving a message from some Colonel Tobin. Patching it through...
cp_replace.003attond006.mp3: {Determined}We can try to fight back, or I can outrun them and hide us on the jungle moon nearby. It's your call.
cp_replace.207czerka002.mp3: Orders? Whose orders? This is ridiculous.
cp_replace.207czerka005.mp3: You! This is all your doing, isn't it? I knew I couldn't trust you! You sold me out to Lorso.
cp_replace.502cp_replac013.mp3: The Sky Ramp is restricted to military personnel only. Um... move along.
cp_replace.502cp_replac012.mp3: There has been a serious accident here. The Sky Ramp is closed to all personnel pending an investigation. Leave now.
cp_replace.502cp_replac001.mp3: {Junior officer, who is rattled}Wh - what's happening in the west square? It sounded like battle?
cp_replace.502cp_replac002.mp3: Command's ordered comm blackout. Do you know what's going on?
cp_replace.502cp_replac009.mp3: I understand. Carry on, then. But be careful. I could've sworn I heard sword clangs in the west square.
cp_replace.502cp_replac008.mp3: {He doesn't suspect the PC of anything}I see... But I could've sworn I heard something in the west square. Uhh - oh - carry on, citizen.
cp_replace.502cp_replac003.mp3: What? Why? That makes no sense. Command hasn't issued any alerts.
cp_replace.502cp_replac004.mp3: Are you sure it wasn't some of those beast-riders slags? They've been getting bolder recently.
cp_replace.502cp_replac007.mp3: {He seems very confused}Listen, if you really were in a fight you should report it to the soldiers. The west square is a dangerous place these days.
cp_replace.502cp_replac005.mp3: You - you must be mistaken. Soldiers just don't attack civilians without orders. If it weren't for the comm blackout I'd check with command.
cp_replace.502cp_replac006.mp3: Just head to the safety of the merchant square, citizen. We'll send a patrol to investigate as soon as we can contact our HQ.
cp_replace.502term_so007.mp3: I said this terminal is restricted, civilian.
cp_replace.502term_so005.mp3: Hey! What do you think you're doing?
cp_replace.502term_so006.mp3: This terminal is restricted to military personnel only.
cp_replace.502term_so003.mp3: Your visa's been scanned. You're cleared to leave.
cp_replace.502term_so001.mp3: {[Guard is facing the computer panel and is typing] Talking with the other guards, he's perplexed}The diagnostic is doing something strange.
cp_replace.502term_so002.mp3: "Target acquired?" What the hell does that mean?
cp_replace.502term_so004.mp3: I'd leave right away. Things are going crazy in this quarter!

ratrin.004ratrin014.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer: A scene of Ratrin walking on board the ship, looking around.]}
ratrin.004ratrin007.mp3: If they think I'm going to give up this ship without a fight, well, they're wrong.
ratrin.004ratrin001.mp3: Ah, finally, my ticket off this hole. {Beat at second sentence}Looks like it's been through hell.
ratrin.004ratrin002.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer: Walks forward as he says the line, and at the end, Nikto slavers surround him.]}It's good to be back on the old girl...
ratrin.004ratrin003.mp3: {Defiant, to pirates}Hey - what are you doing on my ship?
ratrin.004ratrin005.mp3: Damn right I am! What are you...
ratrin.004ratrin015.mp3: {[The other one smashes him across the face with a rifle, knocks him unconscious.]}
ratrin.004ratrin016.mp3: {[Show a scene of Ratrin on the floor, unconscious, from a worm's eye view.]}
ratrin.004ratrin008.mp3: {A little weakly, trying to squirm out of a problem}Look... there's been a misunderstanding. The ship - it's all yours. Consider it a gift, all right?
ratrin.004ratrin009.mp3: Didn't know you were messing with Red Eclipse slavers - guess those stories about the Hawk being a cursed vessel are true.
ratrin.004ratrin013.mp3: Great... I'll, uh, just... find my way out, all right?
ratrin.004ratrin011.mp3: Hey! Wait a minute! You can't do this!
ratrin.301ratrin025.mp3: Hey, I saw that ship you flew in on. My ship.
ratrin.301ratrin001.mp3: Hey, I saw that ship you flew in on. My ship.
ratrin.301ratrin003.mp3: Was I talking to you? I tell you, that ship's mine.
ratrin.301ratrin024.mp3: {Threatening}No, I don't think so. You and me, we got some business to settle.
ratrin.301ratrin004.mp3: It's the Ebon Hawk isn't it? She was stolen from me during a routine run in the Mid-Rim, near the close of the Mandalorian Wars.
ratrin.301ratrin019.mp3: We'll see about that. Watch yourself - Nar Shaddaa can be a rough place.
ratrin.301ratrin018.mp3: So you admit it's not yours? How did you come by it, anyway? Who did you buy it from?
ratrin.301ratrin011.mp3: {Smug}Good to hear you aren't going to challenge it, that makes things a lot easier.
ratrin.301ratrin016.mp3: {Insincere}No hard feelings, I hope. Don't worry - you shouldn't have any trouble finding transport off Nar Shaddaa on your own.
ratrin.301ratrin017.mp3: I'll be going now. Get used to the solid ground beneath you. {Walks away}
ratrin.301ratrin005.mp3: The registry's 34-P7JK. It's got a temperamental hyperdrive, and the turrets can be sluggish and unresponsive against fast moving fighters.
ratrin.301ratrin006.mp3: She's also got two secret compartments - one in the cargo hold, right near the plasteel cylinders in the back, and the second beneath the bunks in the starboard cabin.
ratrin.301ratrin009.mp3: No deal. A ship's worth its weight in spice on Nar Shaddaa, and nothing's worth being trapped here another year, scrounging freight jobs.
ratrin.301ratrin008.mp3: So you gonna hand it over now, or are you going to be difficult?

admoff.101admoff015.mp3: [Static.] {Tired, "there's been..."}"...trouble between the work shifts. Word of the Jedi leaked out, and the miners aren't sure what to do with her."
admoff.101admoff010.mp3: [Static.] {Tired, "there's been..."}"...trouble between the work shifts. Word of the Jedi leaked out, and the miners aren't sure what to do with him."
admoff.101admoff011.mp3: "{COR-TAH}Coorta's mining crew wanted us to collect the creds for the bounty the Exchange has on Jedi, but I put a stop to that. We're contacting Telos to get the Republic records on the Jedi, but nobody w-"{wants} [Static.]
admoff.101admoff012.mp3: [Static.] {"Still"}"...no word from the Republic, but I've sent out a broad comm transmission for records on this 'Ebon Hawk.' One of the miners said it used to be a smuggling ves-"{"vessel"} [Static.]
admoff.101admoff013.mp3: [Static.] {the}"...accidents are making the miners restless. The droid behavior cores must be undergoing some kind of binary decay..."
admoff.101admoff014.mp3: "...two miners were drilled by a droid's mining laser, and those blasts in the ventilation tunnels nearly caused the whole facility to blow." [Holorecord ends.]
admoff.101admoff006.mp3: [Static.] "...inventoried the bodies and cargo - everything matches the protocol droid's story."
admoff.101admoff007.mp3: "The T3 droid had seized up, so we left it in storage in standby mode. Don't know what code will access it - it could be it's voice-activated for all we know."
admoff.101admoff008.mp3: "...we put the protocol droid to work in maintenance, sorting the mining droid comm routines and updating their recognition sensors... and to shut him up."
admoff.101admoff009.mp3: "When the survivor recovers, hopefully we can get them off this station before there's a ri-" {riot}[Holorecord ends in static.]
admoff.101admoff001.mp3: "...tractored the freighter in... it was lucky it wasn't destroyed when it drifted into the asteroid field."
admoff.101admoff002.mp3: "Not much on board - one damaged droid, one annoying protocol droid, and a lot of bodies."
admoff.101admoff003.mp3: "Sent the survivor to medical, and the others to the morgue. Didn't recognize the ship's ID code, so we transmitted it to the Republic for some answers..." [Static.]
admoff.101admoff004.mp3: '...questioned the protocol droid about what happened. Says his master, the survivor I guess, was on a Republic ship, the 'Harbinger,' when it suffered an engine failure.'
admoff.101admoff005.mp3: {Worried, a little incredulous}"...he says the survivor was a passenger on the vessel and a Jedi. If so, that's going to mean tr-" {trouble}[Holorecord ends in static.]
admoff.105admoff009.mp3: "We just took an inventory of our supplies. We've got enough emergency rations in the dormitories to last almost a month, but with all the problems in the facility, I don't know how long we'll last."
admoff.105admoff015.mp3: "I wish we could contact the Jedi, maybe he could... but no, he's still floating in that damn tank."
admoff.105admoff010.mp3: "I wish we could contact the Jedi, maybe she could... but no, she's still floating in that damn tank."
admoff.105admoff011.mp3: {A little quieter, angry}"Someone's played us for fools - and since Coorta and his crew aren't locked in here with us, it's pretty clear who it was. If I ever catch up with that Mandalorian-loving son of a..."
admoff.105admoff012.mp3: "At least the air scrubbers are still working, even though they're tied into the..." {Stops, starts looking around.}
admoff.105admoff013.mp3: "Hey, what's happening to the ventilation system? It's..." {Hissing of poison gas, and then there's a moment of silence, that drags on, and on.}
admoff.105admoff014.mp3: {Moment of silence, then an animated camera of all the dead bodies in the corridor, then nothing but static, then darkness.}
admoff.105admoff001.mp3: "This may be the beginning of a long record - it's about an hour after the facility suffered the explosion that triggered the emergency lockdown."
admoff.105admoff002.mp3: {Gets interrupted at end}"Just finished helping the dock officer set up the transmission relay. Not much signal strength, but it's better than nothing."
admoff.105admoff003.mp3:
TRANSMITTING SUBSPACE FLASH SEQUENCE
... [3]
-X.. [17]

admoff.105admoff005.mp3: {Shakes head}"No good - the link to the medical computer was severed from the hub, just like the administration console."
admoff.105admoff007.mp3: 'Even if the Jedi wakes up, how would we get the dormitory turbolift code to him? Without it, the turbolift to the administration level is locked down.'
admoff.105admoff006.mp3: 'Even if the Jedi wakes up, how would we get the dormitory turbolift code to her? Without it, the turbolift to the administration level is locked down.'
