203_lorso.203203lorso025.mp3: Excellent, I see my faith in your abilities was well founded.
203_lorso.203203lorso026.mp3: We'd like to get this droid into service as quickly as possible. Opo Chano?
203_lorso.203203lorso042.mp3: Just plug into the mainframe and get to work.
203_lorso.203203lorso044.mp3: You may go, Chano, I'm sure you have many repairs to see to.
203_lorso.203203lorso046.mp3: Now then, your payment. Here are the credits agreed upon.
203_lorso.203203lorso028.mp3: Well, then, you've proven helpful enough so far. Let's see what you can do.
203_lorso.203203lorso030.mp3: Your opinion was not asked for, Opo Chano.
203_lorso.203203lorso031.mp3: I'll have no further use for you today, you may go.
203_lorso.203203lorso034.mp3: Just plug into the mainframe and get to work.
203_lorso.203203lorso036.mp3: Now then, your payment. Here are the credits agreed upon.
203_lorso.203203lorso037.mp3: And a small bonus for performing the repairs, as well.
203_lorso.203203lorso096.mp3: There is another task I would like for you to perform for me.
203_lorso.203203lorso097.mp3: Do you doubt that I will uphold my part of our agreement? Don't worry, when my word is given, it will not be retracted.
203_lorso.203203lorso094.mp3: I simply do not have time for you. My hands are full with trying to manage the restoration project without the aid of a droid intelligence, which you so kindly gifted to the Ithorians.
203_lorso.203203lorso095.mp3: If there is nothing else, I would prefer it if you left our premises.
203_lorso.203203lorso134.mp3: I had my reservations about some of these mercenaries, but I had hoped that CSD would be able to keep them in line.
203_lorso.203203lorso135.mp3: It appears that I was wrong.
203_lorso.203203lorso140.mp3: Mercenaries stay here until they are transported to the surface. The restoration zones have proven to be extremely dangerous due to the deadly creatures imported by the Ithorians.
203_lorso.203203lorso141.mp3: As you might expect, it was credits they were after. Despite the fact Czerka has paid them more than adequately, they figured that Czerka could easily be coerced into increasing their 'fees.'
203_lorso.203203lorso137.mp3: Of course. I understand the importance of keeping a valuable asset like yourself happy. I believe these credits should be sufficient to repay you for your work.
203_lorso.203203lorso138.mp3: You are also welcome to anything found on the mercenaries' bodies as your own. They carried no Czerka-issue equipment, anyway.
203_lorso.203203lorso139.mp3: Now, if you will excuse me, this unfortunate turn of events has generated quite a bit more work for me, and I should be getting to it.
203_lorso.203203lorso136.mp3: Indeed - credits cannot buy loyalty, but greed can. And if there is one thing you can count on with people - mercenaries especially - it is their greed.
203_lorso.203203lorso022.mp3: More credits, you say? That's news I wouldn't mind reporting to the Sector Executive Officer.
203_lorso.203203lorso165.mp3: B-4D4! I want you to pull up the maintenance records on that T1 unit. Find out the last time it was given a memory wipe and how it could have been outfitted with illegal weaponry.
203_lorso.203merclead009.mp3: I will not be badgered by you.
203_lorso.203merclead011.mp3: {Somewhat surprised, by covering it well}Ah, there you are. I was wondering when you would arrive.
203_lorso.203rodkill001.mp3: I will arrange transport to one of the restoration zones on the planet's surface. You will be safe from the TSF there.
203_lorso.203rodkill003.mp3: For the services you have offered to Czerka, you will also be reimbursed. I trust that is an agreeable arrangement?
203_lorso.203rodkill005.mp3: Of course. I will instruct the commander to await your arrival.
203_lorso.203rodkill022.mp3: And? If memory serves me correctly, it wasn't too long ago that you were wanted by Grenn and his cronies.
203_lorso.203rodkill024.mp3: Consider the charges against them cleared, as well. They committed no crime against this station, the TSF had no reason to arrest them.
203_lorso.203rodkill023.mp3: Right, you only destroyed an entire mining facility.
203_lorso.203rodkill010.mp3: I have just finalized a working agreement with these two gentlemen, Czerka's two newest contract employees.
203_lorso.203rodkill011.mp3: Be reasonable. I have given them a contract and my word that they will be safe from TSF persecution.
203_lorso.203rodkill015.mp3: They will take the next shuttle to the restoration zones and be out of the reach of Grenn. This does not affect you.
203_lorso.203rodkill017.mp3: I think you forget that I have already agreed to smuggle you to the restoration zones to find your lost ship.
203_lorso.203rodkill018.mp3: You are wanted by the Republic. That's no small task I have agreed to.
203_lorso.203rodkill019.mp3: So you will excuse me if I suggest that you turn a blind eye to this occasion, and be grateful that I do not rescind our agreement.
203_lorso.203rodkill021.mp3: By all means, if that will make you happy. But if they get the best of you, it will be of no moment to me.
203_lorso.203rodkill020.mp3: I suggest that you do, lest I forget about our agreement. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must see to some things so that Czerka may continue to be in the good graces of the Council.
203_lorso.203rodkill016.mp3: You will not undo work the work that I have done here. I do not break my word, and will not start here.
203_lorso.503sakarie027.mp3: Are you satisfied with your payment for the visa? I can exchange it for something else if you like.
203_lorso.503sakarie033.mp3: Aren't we all? But there's nothing I can do to help with that. My backside is still scorched from the heat I've got recently. Ask around elsewhere.
203_lorso.503sakarie032.mp3: The visa wasn't for me, but for an associate of mine. There are plenty of business opportunities left in Iziz. I plan to stay here for awhile.
203_lorso.503sakarie028.mp3: You aren't? Then what would you like instead?
203_lorso.503sakarie001.mp3: There's got to be something you need. Something you want. I have connections, many connections in the city. I can provide high-quality unique weapons that you won't be able to find elsewhere.
203_lorso.503sakarie024.mp3: Because we'll trade them simultaneously. And if you aren't satisfied with your payment, I'll let you switch it for something else. I don't want to cross a Jedi.
203_lorso.503sakarie025.mp3: It's a small universe. I don't really care about the trouble that's behind you or ahead of you. We have exactly one thing we can talk about - starport visas.
203_lorso.503sakarie018.mp3: Many Jedi have fought on this world. One of them lost their lightsaber in the Beast Wars. A reliable source says it's a rare Qixoni crystal. Incredibly rare and valuable.
203_lorso.503sakarie023.mp3: I see that's grabbed your interest, eh? There's only one way you're going to get it - one open starport visa. No visa, no crystal.
203_lorso.503sakarie015.mp3: Don't worry what I'll do with the visa. Maybe I'll just take a vacation. Maybe I just want to visit my mother on Nar Shaddaa. Decent citizens like you really don't want to know what I'm going to do with it.
203_lorso.503sakarie017.mp3: I am not going to tell you what I'm using it for. Considering what I'm willing to pay or give you - no questions asked seems reasonable.
203_lorso.503sakarie016.mp3: You have an honest face... I will answer your question... I need to transport permacrete explosives for the Exchange. They're going to use it to take care of some competition and some local authorities. Permanently.
203_lorso.503sakarie006.mp3: I had faith you'd get a hold of one. I've always been good at spotting talent. I've got big plans for it.
203_lorso.503sakarie014.mp3: You won't find a better deal anywhere on Iziz for the visa. You'd be a sap to give it to anyone else.
203_lorso.503sakarie010.mp3: So what do you want for it? A weapon, money, or the lightsaber crystal. Your pick.
203_lorso.503sakarie013.mp3: Here you go. If you aren't satisfied with it, just let me know.
203_lorso.503sakarie012.mp3: Here you go. If you aren't satisfied with it, just let me know.
203_lorso.503sakarie009.mp3: Haven't we covered this yet? I'm not going to tell you. It's not legal, and you don't want to get involved. Trust me.
203_lorso.503sakarie007.mp3: So what if they do? You'll have what you want. Don't be stupid, I'll pay you more than anybody. Or if you want those items, there's no way you'd get them from anywhere else.
203_lorso.503sakarie008.mp3: To each their own. Come back if you change your mind.
203_lorso.503sakarie003.mp3: I really can't be any help with that. I might have been in the same detention cell that night that Dhagon's in now. The soldiers were asking me some entertaining questions that night. I've got no idea what was going on.
203_lorso.503sakarie005.mp3: That's all I want to talk to you about, anyway.
203_lorso.503sakarie004.mp3: Let's just say I'm one of their usual suspects. Sort of comes with the territory. That's all I'm going to say.
203_lorso.503sakarie034.mp3: Seems like you take after me. You should leave the city, Tobin's boys don't play nice.
203_lorso.602g_settlf009.mp3: Don't play pazaak with Pato{pa-TOE}. He's either lucky or cheats, or both!
203_lorso.602g_settlf008.mp3: We should try getting along with the mercenaries. If we push them, they will make our lives miserable!
203_lorso.602g_settlf006.mp3: {Very bitter}I'm sick and tired of those mercenaries. Some people say Zherron{zeh-ron} is antagonizing them too much. I think he should do more!
203_lorso.602g_settlf005.mp3: It's getting dangerous to even come to Khoonda{COON-da}. I hear the kinrath are attacking swoop bikes now.
203_lorso.602g_settlf004.mp3: Salvagers are just thieves and scavengers. I can't wait until the last of them leaves.
203_lorso.602g_settlf003.mp3: Zherron{zeh-ron} keeps goading the mercenaries. I think he should let the little things slide. He's making things worse for everyone!
203_lorso.602g_settlf002.mp3: If it weren't for the Jedi we'd be a prosperous community. They've brought us nothing but trouble.
203_lorso.602g_settlf001.mp3: The salvagers keep coming here and bothering the militia. That Gerevick{GUERRE-eh-vick} is the worst of them.
203_lorso.602g_settlf010.mp3: They say the Jedi saved us from the mercenaries. I guess we should stop blaming them for the troubles on Dantooine.

203_lorso_radio.203203lorso001.mp3: Thank you for accepting my call. As my assistant no doubt informed you, I am Jana Lorso.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso002.mp3: I understand that you were approached by an Ithorian earlier. Doubtless he tried to obtain your help, attempting to purchase it with imposed guilt and veiled threats...
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso008.mp3: I believe you're a person of influence. Someone I'd like on my side, rather than aiding the Ithorians, whose quasi-mysticism and bumbling foolishness is standing in the way of progress and profit.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso009.mp3: I'm not asking for your help, though. I'm offering you a job. Work for Czerka, and be handsomely rewarded. You'd be helping yourself.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso010.mp3: If you're interested, please visit our offices here in Residential 082. B-4D4 will know what to do when you arrive.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso017.mp3: That's too bad. Well, you know where we are if you change your mind.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso018.mp3: Citadel Station is at a crossroads right now, you know. And so are you. Don't take the wrong road.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso016.mp3: Excellent! Good luck with that messy investigation, and I hope to see you shortly.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso015.mp3: I'd rather discuss that in person. I'll be more than happy to answer any and all questions when you visit our offices.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso011.mp3: Their plans for the restoration of Telos are aimless and meandering. "Restore the sacred, natural beauty of Telos," they say.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso012.mp3: Just what does that mean? How does that apply to natural resource development and consumption? The proper planning of urban sectors? Resorts and tourism?
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso013.mp3: It doesn't. The Ithorians are spending billions of Republic credits on a plan with no defined profit.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso014.mp3: If it continues, they'll drive the Republic into irreparable debt, and have nothing to show for it but a few meadows and a weather generator the size of a small continent.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso006.mp3: Oh, and I suppose he didn't mention the Exchange? "Helping" you with any problems here? In other words, the Ithorians won't lead the Exchange to you if you work with them?
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso007.mp3: Well, no matter. My apologies - I never intended to waste your time discussing Ithorians.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso003.mp3: Yes. They play at being downtrodden innocents, having come to you because of these "Jedi" rumors that are going around the station.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso004.mp3: Oh, I'm sure you've heard. That you're a Jedi, one of the last, wanted by the Exchange and who knows how many other organizations for reasons good or ill.
203_lorso_radio.203203lorso005.mp3: But that's of no interest to me. The Jedi and your standing with them have no bearing on this discussion.

203_lorso_other_2.203203lorso159.mp3: Excellent. Let me hear what you have.
203_lorso_other_2.203203lorso128.mp3: Yes, you will be going now.
203_lorso_other_2.203203lorso067.mp3: I'm sorry to hear that. If you change your mind, I'll be here.
203_lorso_other_2.203203lorso133.mp3: I must say, you have wonderful timing.

203_lorso_other_1.203203lorso144.mp3: Corrun Falt... Ah, that one. You don't say?
203_lorso_other_1.203203lorso153.mp3: [Success] You would be putting yourself somewhat at risk, true enough. 600 credits, then.
203_lorso_other_1.203203lorso081.mp3: To put it plainly, I want you to kill Loppak Slusk.
203_lorso_other_1.203203lorso168.mp3: I don't think you appreciate the kind of people we're dealing with.
203_lorso_other_1.203203lorso169.mp3: That isn't to say I haven't tried to bargain with them. But perhaps they'd listen to you, given your background.
203_lorso_other_1.203203lorso132.mp3: Hm. That was very proactive of you. In that case, let me thank you for taking care of that unpleasantness for me. I am in your debt.
203_lorso_other_1.203203lorso068.mp3: Very well, then. I hope to see you soon.
203_lorso_other_1.503sakarie026.mp3: Do you have a visa yet? I'm still paying very well for it. Some unique items you won't get anywhere else - including a lightsaber crystal.
203_lorso_other_1.503sakarie002.mp3: I even have a rare lightsaber crystal - something you'd never find elsewhere. If you need money, I'll pay you 5000 credits. All I ask is get me one open starport visa.
203_lorso_other_1.503sakarie011.mp3: Here you go. If you aren't satisfied with it, just let me know.
203_lorso_other_1.602g_settlf007.mp3: It's not smart to speak badly of Azkul{AZ-CULL} and his mercenaries. Some of the most vocal have gone missing.

serthug.201201travm002.mp3: Most people don't stay on Telos long unless they work here. No one wants to get bogged down in the troubles.
serthug.201201travm001.mp3: I hear the refugee problem on Nar Shaddaa is getting out of hand. I met someone who managed to escape - he didn't even want to talk about it.
serthug.503panar033.mp3: You need any more work done, just come to me.
serthug.503panar040.mp3: Yeah, I am. Good money in it. Want to get enough credits to upgrade my bike. Then I'm going after M'sadaar's{mussuh-DAAR} time in the second round.
serthug.503panar041.mp3: Second round is where the money starts getting good. Your contribution earlier is going to help the cause. Heh.
serthug.503panar039.mp3: I suggest you leave the room, offworlder. I've got all the fans I need right here. So go space yourself.
serthug.503panar013.mp3: And right when I thought you were boring, you've gone and got interesting. Go on.
serthug.503panar016.mp3: {It sounds like he relishes this assignment}That I can do. All I need to know is who and whether or not you got 500 credits. With those two, we can do some business.
serthug.503panar024.mp3: [Success] All right, 400 credits. But that's as low as I'll go.
serthug.503panar023.mp3: [Success] Fine, we'll do it for 200 credits. Bakkel has been wanting to send the guard captains a message, anyway.
serthug.503panar017.mp3: Pleasure doing business with you. He's right over there, isn't he? Just wait a little while.
serthug.503panar019.mp3: We need a word with you outside. Let's take a walk. Someplace quiet.
serthug.503panar021.mp3: I hear your daughter just turned four, is it? Good age. And a pretty young wife. Don't make this hard, Gelesi. We just want to talk.
serthug.503panar014.mp3: {No compromising with this line}Sorry, not with a guard captain. That's the death mark, there.
serthug.503panar015.mp3: He owe you money? Actually, it's better if I don't know. Just give me a name and 500 credits and we got a deal. We'll pay this guard captain a visit and turn the old hydro-spanner on him a couple times.
serthug.503panar002.mp3: Heh... If you ask me, she got what she deserved. She looked down on us beast-riders. Good riddance.
serthug.503panar009.mp3: That Bith keeps buying droids. And the scavengers keep stealing them or blowing them up. Seems he's finally given up. The waitress is awful, but she's more fun than his droids ever were.
serthug.503panar010.mp3: I wouldn't tell you even if I knew. I could tell you where you could find the parts, though.
serthug.503panar011.mp3: That western square has the perfect fence for droid parts. There is a droid vendor called 1B-8D. That droid is as dumb as a Gamorrean. He'll buy anything 'cause he's too stupid to do anything else.
serthug.503panar012.mp3: 1B-8D is quite handy. Quite a few of the slum dwellers make a good living salvaging droid parts for him. You might've even bought some.
serthug.503panar007.mp3: We were only in the cantina at the beginning of the evening. We were doing the rounds afterwards. Heh. It was pretty late and I heard this loud bang.
serthug.503panar008.mp3: I was in the alley behind the doctor's office. When I came up on Sullio, she was already dead. I saw Dhagon and Nikko there, and there was also some rabble around. The noise attracted a lot of people.
serthug.503panar032.mp3: Nikko would know more, he was first on the scene.
serthug.503panar005.mp3: You're flaming right, I do. The night she made the Great Flight, she ripped Dhagon apart. Not literally, but we could hear her laying into him over here.
serthug.503panar006.mp3: We got a good laugh at it, Dhagon was so mad he was sputtering. Then he stormed off. Best entertainment we had that night. The only good thing about that Sullio is she had a good tongue on her. Heh.
serthug.503panar003.mp3: I know his face, that's about it. His office is on Bakkel's turf.
serthug.503panar004.mp3: She's a beast-rider like me, and our leader. You better never be speaking ill of her. Or else.
serthug.503panar036.mp3: You think you can come here and just beat my time and I'll take it lying down. We got a grudge match going on now.
serthug.503panar037.mp3: You going to race, or just forfeit? You should think it over real careful before trying to beat my time. Real careful.
serthug.503panar034.mp3: You're just lucky. And your bike is better outfitted than me.
serthug.503panar035.mp3: Enjoy that win while you can. When Bakkel gets here, we might throw you our own victory party. Heh.
serthug.503panar026.mp3: We don't like droids around here. Get the little one out of our room.
serthug.503panar029.mp3: [Success] {Sounds a trifle scared - more annoyed}Just keep the flaming thing quiet while it's over here, then.

czerbay.201czerbay001.mp3: About time you showed up, Samhan. Get your things loaded, I'm already behind schedule.
czerbay.201czerbay003.mp3: You don't understand how it is with Czerka. When the process stops working like clockwork, questions get asked. And we don't want questions asked, do we?
czerbay.201czerbay005.mp3: The faster we get this loaded, the faster we can get it out of here.

tsf_smuggling.201czerbay007.mp3: You are all under arrest, and those goods will be taken as evidence.
tsf_smuggling.201czerbay008.mp3: And you, we're curious about your involvement as well.
tsf_smuggling.201czerbay010.mp3: Quit your protestations, Samhan. We all know your little secret. The circumstances have changed. You will be coming with us.
tsf_smuggling.201czerbay011.mp3: So what do you have to say for yourself?
tsf_smuggling.201czerbay015.mp3: That's fine, too. But after a few days in a force cage, you might change your tune.
tsf_smuggling.201czerbay012.mp3: [Failure] Well then, after we place you under arrest, you'll have plenty of time to corroborate that story with Lieutenant Grenn.
tsf_smuggling.201czerbay013.mp3: Now, you'll be coming with us.
tsf_smuggling.201samhan025.mp3: I thought you might see it my way. All of you, come with me.
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf008.mp3: I heard the Peragus mining facility was completely destroyed. What are we going to do for fuel?
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf007.mp3: Republic dissidents blew up an armory depot in the Lower City. Vaklu should do something about it.
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf006.mp3: I think Vaklu is using Republic spies as an excuse to intimidate anybody that would oppose him.
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf005.mp3: I think Queen Talia's policy is a wise one. We need the Republic. Without them, we'd be under Mandalorian rule.
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf004.mp3: General Vaklu is royalty, too. I know a lot of people that wish he was King.
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf003.mp3: The Republic wouldn't attack our ships. That makes no sense! Someone else must have started it.
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf002.mp3: I can't believe that the Republic assaulted our space forces! Forget about secession, we should declare war!
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf001.mp3: They just barred entry to the Merchant Quarter. I wonder if there's been another bombing... ?
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf011.mp3: {PC Started Riot}You're the one that started that riot. I... uh... don't want any trouble.
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf010.mp3: {Swoop Champ}My son will never believe the Iziz Swoop Champ talked to me!
tsf_smuggling.501gen_citf009.mp3: {sky ramp explosions}Did you hear that there was some trouble over at the Sky Ramp? I hope no one was hurt.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf008.mp3: I heard the Peragus mining facility was completely destroyed. What are we going to do for fuel?
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf007.mp3: Republic dissidents blew up an armory depot in the Lower City. Vaklu should do something about it.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf006.mp3: I think Vaklu is using Republic spies as an excuse to intimidate anybody that would oppose him.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf005.mp3: I think Queen Talia's policy is a wise one. We need the Republic. Without them, we'd be under Mandalorian rule.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf004.mp3: General Vaklu is royalty, too. I know a lot of people that wish he was King.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf003.mp3: The Republic wouldn't attack our ships. That makes no sense! Someone else must have started it.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf002.mp3: I can't believe that the Republic assaulted our space forces. Forget about secession, we should declare war.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf001.mp3: What's going on? There isn't more fighting, is there?
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf016.mp3: {sky ramp explosion}I hear the Republic attacked the Sky Ramp!
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf015.mp3: {swoop champ}A real-live swoop racer. Can I have your autoprint?
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf014.mp3: {bounty hunter attack}I heard a whole bunch of bounty hunters got killed in the Western Square. Maybe the beast rider gangs finally did something useful.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf013.mp3: {missing captain}Captain Riiken isn't back from his patrol yet. I hope he's all right.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf012.mp3: I heard a lot of bodies were found over in the Western Square. The gangs must be at war now.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf011.mp3: {sky ramp explosions}Have you heard any news about the Sky Ramp? Is it true that it was another Republic attack?
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf010.mp3: We're going to have to find another source of cheap fuel now that Peragus is gone.
tsf_smuggling.502gen_citf009.mp3: {swoop champ}You're that swoop biker, right? My friend says you should go pro.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly015.mp3: Captain, you're back? Please tell me you have an open starport visa.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly002.mp3: Please, captain! Help me! My children and I are desperate to get off of Onderon. Do you have an open starport visa?
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly005.mp3: {Hesitates, holding something back}My husband... was killed by General Vaklu's troops. Our home was seized, and we were cast out.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly006.mp3: We have seen many wars on Iziz, and I know war is coming. I want to spare my children from bloodshed.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly007.mp3: I've told you our story, please, won't you help us?
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly013.mp3: The military is divided, some supporting the Queen, others supporting General Vaklu. Their arguments over seceding from the Republic become angrier and more public every day.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly014.mp3: General Vaklu has said that if the Queen doesn't rule with the consent of the people, she has no right to the throne. Things could get bloody.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly012.mp3: [Failure] Please, just help us. You're... you're right. I'm not telling you everything. But I am telling the truth about my children. I only want to get them out of the city. We have no home, and I don't think we can survive if a civil war starts.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly008.mp3: [Success] My husband... He was a part of the Iziz Council. He was a strong supporter of the Queen and the Republic. His views weren't always popular.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly009.mp3: Over time he became convinced that Vaklu was trying to kill Queen Talia. He... he tried to kill Vaklu, to protect the Queen.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly010.mp3: The conspiracy was discovered and he was shot during the arrest. What he did was wrong, and our life has been so difficult since then. I just want to get off this planet and start a new life.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly011.mp3: Please, help us. No one else will.
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly003.mp3: Thank the four moons for your kindness, off-worlder! I only wish I had some way to thank you. But my children and I will never forget your kindness!
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly004.mp3: Hurry, children, we get to go on a spaceship, thanks to the captain. We get to go into space!
tsf_smuggling.502cp_terly001.mp3: {She fears that their future will be short, trying to calm them}Be quiet children. Hush. Everything will be... all right.
tsf_smuggling.602jedi_rum002.mp3: They certainly would. You remember how they were - always so superior, so arrogant. And never lending a hand when we really needed them.
tsf_smuggling.602jedi_rum004.mp3: You should. My cousin's friend? He used to tend the gardens around the Enclave. He swears he saw a Jedi in Khoonda. Could be hiding anywhere.
tsf_smuggling.602jedi_rum006.mp3: Unless somebody beats you to it.
tsf_smuggling.602jedi_rum008.mp3: Tarn is an idiot to be sure, but he seemed genuinely frightened. Perhaps he did see something.

moza.201moza001.mp3: <FullName>! Can you hear me? This is Moza! It is terrible, this is terrible! Armed humans have burst into our home and are causing much destruction and death.
moza.201moza002.mp3: Many of my herdmates lie dead. They have threatened to kill Chodo, and I fear they will see it through. You must help us, we can turn only to the Jedi, the TSF is powerless.
moza.201moza003.mp3: They are holding Chodo in his room, and have sealed the door behind them. You will need a passkey to open it.
moza.201moza004.mp3: I will give you this passkey, but I am stuck in the plant room and I can hear the men hammering on the door. Please, you must help us!
moza.202moza001.mp3: <FullName>! Can you hear me? This is Moza! It is terrible, this is terrible! Armed humans have burst into our home and are causing much destruction and death.
moza.202moza002.mp3: Many of my heardmates lie dead. They have threatened to kill Chodo, and I fear they will see it through. You must help us, we can turn only to the Jedi, the TSF is powerless.
moza.202moza003.mp3: They are holding Chodo in his room, and have sealed the door behind them. You will need a passkey to open it.
moza.202moza004.mp3: I will give you this passkey, but I am stuck in the plant room and I can hear the men hammering on the door. Please, you must help us!
moza.221habat007.mp3: No, Chodo, you are not the only one who has suffered for this planet. We will stay.
moza.221moza001.mp3: You must help us, <FullName>. This planet has survived much in its sad history, and should not be consigned to this fate.
moza.204204moza011.mp3: Hello again, <FullName>. How may I be of service?
moza.204204moza012.mp3: I'm sorry, but I cannot help you. I have little knowledge of these things.
moza.204204moza073.mp3: It is hard for me to even think that far into the future. I believe that this will consume many of the next years of my life.
moza.204204moza074.mp3: It is our hope, however, that our restoration of the planet will convince the Republic Senate to allow other herds to see to some of the other war-torn planets of the Outer Rim.
moza.204204moza075.mp3: Perhaps I would even be placed in charge of a planet of my own. But that is getting quite far ahead of myself. For now I am occupied completely with Telos.
moza.204204moza071.mp3: I serve primarily as Chodo's assistant. My duties became even more time consuming after the loss of our original droid intelligence, but I am loathe to place more on the shoulders of Chodo.
moza.204204moza072.mp3: I am also our herd's representative when it comes to matters concerning the Telosian Council, Republic representatives, among others.
moza.204204moza069.mp3: Forgive me, Chodo, but the human - I could feel her suffering.
moza.204204moza070.mp3: I did not feel it until she stood before us, but then it filled my senses. Have you ever felt such an intensity before?
moza.204204moza004.mp3: Forgive me, Chodo, but the human - I could feel his suffering.
moza.204204moza005.mp3: I did not feel it until he stood before us, but then it filled my senses. Have you ever felt such an intensity before?
moza.204204moza066.mp3: It is a planet's worth of pain. I do not know how she endures.
moza.204204moza007.mp3: It is a planet's worth of pain. I do not know how he endures.
moza.204204moza061.mp3: Thank goodness you've come! There is no time to lose, you must go to Chodo's aid. Take this passkey, it will give you access to his room.
moza.204204moza063.mp3: We have already provided you with a shuttle to reach the Restoration Zone as well as many credits. Our herd is poor, we have little more to give.
moza.204204moza065.mp3: After all we have done to you, this is how our kindness is repaid. Go, then, and we shall die for your greed.
moza.204204moza064.mp3: If that is how it must be, though we will be beggared for it.
moza.204204moza078.mp3: Thank you, <FullName>. Again, we are indebted to you.
moza.204204moza062.mp3: Thank you, <FullName>. Again, we are indebted to you.
moza.204204moza077.mp3: Thank you, <FullName>. Again, we are indebted to you.
moza.204204moza001.mp3: <FullName>! Can you hear me? This is Moza! It is terrible, this is terrible! Armed humans have burst into our home and are causing much destruction and death.
moza.204204moza002.mp3: Many of my herdmates lie dead. They have threatened to kill Chodo, and I fear they will see it through. You must help us, we can turn only to the Jedi, the TSF is powerless.
moza.204204moza003.mp3: They are holding Chodo in his room, and have sealed the door behind them. You will need a passkey to open it.
moza.204204moza060.mp3: I will give you this passkey, but I am stuck in the plant room and I can hear the men hammering on the door. Please, you must help us!
moza.204204moza058.mp3: I do not wish to speak with you, <FullName>. By aiding Czerka, you have doomed a planet to a second, withering death.
moza.204204moza059.mp3: For that, I may never forgive you.
moza.204204moza076.mp3: We are counting on you, B-4D4.

202_tsf1.202202grenn026.mp3: Man down! Quick, call a medic!

wtress.202202grenn029.mp3: Come on, Lieutenant! They've already killed... eh...
wtress.203203atton009.mp3: It was Moza, representing the Ithorian restoration interests on Telos. I don't know what he wanted.
wtress.503wtress004.mp3: Not really. I just started here. I have to get back to work.
wtress.503wtress002.mp3: Wait your turn. I have three customers ahead of you.
wtress.503wtress001.mp3: Now what did he order? I'll just guess.

merc01_other_1.202202grenn006.mp3: So this is the "Last of the Jedi." I must admit, I'm a little disappointed.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn103.mp3: Doubtful, though at least it appears you have some spirit.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn008.mp3: The Exchange has a bounty on Jedi, you know. You're worth quite a bit of money.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn011.mp3: {Surprised, defensive}Eh? I'm more than skilled enough to work for the Exchange.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn013.mp3: {Challenging}No Mandalorian could match my skills. No Mandalorian could have been clever enough to infiltrate this station, taken the identity of one of the guards, then...
merc01_other_1.202202grenn015.mp3: {Thinking, re-evaluating, angry at last sentence}Don't think overloading your cages had not occurred to me... you're wanted alive, but I doubt anyone will care as long as I bring them your corpse.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn016.mp3: Like I said. The Exchange has put out a huge bounty on Jedi. I'm just looking forward to early retirement.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn018.mp3: {Slight mockery in first sentence}The security cameras have mysteriously shorted out. There will be no witnesses to your escape attempt, during which I'll have been forced to kill you.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn021.mp3: Come, "Jedi." It is time to die.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn023.mp3: You have goaded me once, and you shall not do so twice. But I shall dispose of all of you eventually. And an old woman, a fool, and a broken Jedi are no match for my skills.
merc01_other_1.202202grenn007.mp3: Jedi or no, you're the one I am pledged to kill - there is no mistaking that.
merc01_other_1.301refugee046.mp3: You're back. Anything to spare this time?
merc01_other_1.301refugee001.mp3: What do you want? I've got nothing to tell ya.
merc01_other_1.301refugee034.mp3: All right, then, but the offer's open if you return. Think about it.
merc01_other_1.301refugee028.mp3: If I can help you, even just by keeping an ear out, I can let you know if I hear anything.
merc01_other_1.301refugee012.mp3: But you know, I did hear something about a bounty on Jedi, though. Something the Exchange posted.
merc01_other_1.301refugee007.mp3: Refugees and war veterans both... and anyone else who was rendered homeless by the war. The Jedi destroyed planets across the galaxy, and here's where the wreckage ended up.
merc01_other_1.301refugee008.mp3: {Shrugs}That's two names for one thing. It's difficult to tell in the crossfire, and the Sith were led by Jedi. In the end, it didn't make much difference.
merc01_other_1.301refugee004.mp3: Much appreciated, friend. Life's hard in the Refugee Sector, and this should go a long way to helping.
merc01_other_1.602recept015.mp3: Welcome back to Khoonda. How can I help you?
merc01_other_1.602recept001.mp3: {Not all that thrilled to meet the player - but not impolite}Welcome to Khoonda{coon-da}. You're a salvager, right? You'll need to see Administrator Adare{uh-DAR-ey} to get access to the ruins. If you need directions to anything else, just ask.
merc01_other_1.602recept014.mp3: Certainly. What do you want to know?
merc01_other_1.602recept004.mp3: {When mercenary is mentioned his tone gets dark - when he uses the word gritty it should be clear he's not saying what he really thinks}You're not? The only heavily armed people that visit us are either salvagers or mercenaries. And you don't look quite... gritty enough to be a mercenary.
merc01_other_1.602recept002.mp3: {He seems nervous - like talking about Gerevick is dangerous (which it is)}Gerevick{GUERRE-eh-vick} is a salvager. The worst one of the lot. Try to stay clear of him. He's a dangerous one to cross.

merc01.202202grenn019.mp3: By the time the TSF realize I'm not one of them, I will be far from this place.
merc01.202sullust002.mp3: That didn't look like an accident to me or my associate here. It looked like you wanted to make a fool of him.
merc01.202sullust004.mp3: Not even an apology? That won't do at all.
merc01.202sullust005.mp3: This Sullustan here had a few things to say about us that we didn't take to so well. We're just trying to work out our differences.
merc01.202sullust019.mp3: That was the plan, chief. Now why don't you run along - this doesn't involve you.
merc01.202sullust018.mp3: The only way that he'll learn - a little physical reinforcement.
merc01.202sullust009.mp3: This doesn't have anything to do with you, stranger. Just move right along. Have a drink in the cantina.
merc01.202sullust012.mp3: Yeah, or what? You're going to teach me a lesson? Go ahead, I hate your kind anyways. Keep your nose in your own business.
merc01.202sullust015.mp3: Believe me. There's nothing to talk about.
merc01.202sullust016.mp3: You must be kidding me. 100 credits? Why don't you just run along and let us handle this.
merc01.202sullust013.mp3: Then you shouldn't have gotten involved.
merc01.202sullust011.mp3: Just my luck. Someone who wants to be a hero. Why don't you run along before you get hurt?
merc01.203mercbat008.mp3: Right on schedule, here's the Jedi with Batono.
merc01.203mercbat010.mp3: You should have stayed in hiding, Batono.
merc01.203mercbat003.mp3: Hm, what do we have here? Batono, if I'm not mistaken. You've been a hard man to track down.
merc01.203mercbat005.mp3: It doesn't matter who I am. It's you we've all been looking for. Executive Lorso sent me to take care of some unfinished business.
merc01.203mercbat001.mp3: Well, it's been a pleasure doing business with you. Executive Lorso asked me to tell you that your payment is waiting with her.
merc01.203mercbat002.mp3: I think it'd probably be a good idea for us to get out of here before the TSF starts asking questions.
merc01.301refugee002.mp3: Haven't heard anything more yet. I'll come seek you out if I do.
merc01.301refugee025.mp3: Bounty hunters? You'll trip over them if you stay on Nar Shaddaa long enough. They've been laying pretty low recently, though, haven't seen them around.
merc01.301refugee011.mp3: {Scoffs}Jedi Master? There aren't any Jedi Masters in the galaxy, let alone on Nar Shaddaa - this place is a cesspit, with the Exchange and the Hutts stabbing their claws into everything.
merc01.602recept006.mp3: The things that would most interest you are our weapon merchant and Zherron, the leader of our militia. Akkere is still around here somewhere, too. He sells droid components.
merc01.602recept013.mp3: {Seems kinda miffed but can't really refute the sentiment}We're a small group of settlers on the edge of Republic space. The building isn't large, but it's only the beginning.
merc01.602recept008.mp3: If you get into any trouble, he's the person you'd contact. Unfortunately recent problems with the salvagers and mercenaries have kept him quite busy.
merc01.602recept009.mp3: He's at the militia headquarters. Just make a right at the central corridor and the headquarters is one of the rooms furthest in the back.

merc01_other_2.203mercbat007.mp3: So you say. But I'm stubborn. So we're going to try just in case.
merc01_other_2.203mercbat006.mp3: That's fine, we weren't planning on taking him anywhere anyways.
merc01_other_2.301refugee045.mp3: All right, maybe next time, then.
merc01_other_2.301refugee005.mp3: Uh, all right... I don't know much beyond the Refugee Sector here, but I can share what I know.
merc01_other_2.301refugee030.mp3: Look, one other thing, it's obvious you're new around here; I can tell it just by looking at you.
merc01_other_2.301refugee031.mp3: Nar Shaddaa can be a rough place, and easy to get lost in. If you want, I can keep an ear out for ya, let you know if I hear anything.
merc01_other_2.301refugee033.mp3: Life's been better - and every credit can go a long way. Just think it over.
merc01_other_2.301refugee032.mp3: I'll do that, then. I'll come seek you out if I hear anything I think you might want to know.
merc01_other_2.301refugee029.mp3: Friend, you did promise some credits in exchange for information.
merc01_other_2.301refugee027.mp3: I know you probably didn't come here to save us, but... but I knew Jedi during the war, and I know that they always helped when they could.
merc01_other_2.301refugee024.mp3: {Shakes head}No, should I? He doesn't sound like a Hutt. What, is he a bounty hunter or an Exchange boss?
merc01_other_2.301refugee013.mp3: Doesn't matter, though. Aren't any more Jedi around, so no one's gonna be collecting that bounty.
merc01_other_2.301refugee020.mp3: Not much to say, except it's a high price. You'd need to find a bounty hunter to get more, and they've been pretty scarce lately.
merc01_other_2.301refugee021.mp3: You might have more luck trying to find someone connected to the Exchange - and I don't mean some spaceport muscle, I mean someone connected.
merc01_other_2.301refugee023.mp3: Well, they tend to lay low. To be honest, it's like with bounty hunters. You may need to do something to get their attention.
merc01_other_2.301refugee022.mp3: No idea. Could be one of them crossed the Exchange, and they're looking for revenge on all of them.
merc01_other_2.301refugee014.mp3: {Scoffing}You're lying... or mad. A Jedi wouldn't come to th...
merc01_other_2.301refugee017.mp3: You're serious. You're telling the truth.
merc01_other_2.301refugee018.mp3: What are you doing here? Are you trying to get us out of this place? Please, you have no idea what life is like here...
merc01_other_2.301refugee019.mp3: Of course, of course. Tell me. What else did you want to know, Jedi?
merc01_other_2.301refugee015.mp3: You are no Jedi... you're something else. I can tell it, just by looking at you.
merc01_other_2.301refugee016.mp3: I don't know why you're here, but I fear for this place... and everyone on it. I... I have to go.
merc01_other_2.301refugee006.mp3: This sector's filled with refugees from the Jedi Civil War, and even as far back as the Mandalorian Wars.
merc01_other_2.301refugee009.mp3: A lot of space lanes cross at Nar Shaddaa, and once here, it's hard to move on. Even fighter pilots from the war can't get work at the docks - the freighter crews are full up.
merc01_other_2.301refugee010.mp3: {Shakes head}There's no work here and no way out, unless you want to become hired muscle for the Exchange, or work in a Hutt slave camp.
merc01_other_2.301ref_mira009.mp3: {Shrugs, dismissive}Not much, just answers to some questions.
merc01_other_2.301ref_mira007.mp3: Just answers to some questions. {Scoffs}Asked about a Jedi Master, of all things.
merc01_other_2.301ref_mira002.mp3: {A little defensive, protecting the player}Nothing, just answers to some questions.
merc01_other_2.602recept012.mp3: We hope it will become the new center of government for the settlers. The Administrator has been trying to organize us in the wake of the Jedi Civil War.
merc01_other_2.602recept010.mp3: The mercenaries cause disruptions for some of our out-lying settlers. They are a constant source of friction for us. I hear the salvagers are having some internal problems, too.
merc01_other_2.602recept011.mp3: {Slight irritation - "it's not my job to know that" sort of attitude}No, I couldn't. If you're really interested in that just speak to Zherron{zeh-ron}.
merc01_other_2.602recept007.mp3: Just go to the central corridor and make a right. His shop is the first on the right.
merc01_other_2.602recept003.mp3: Her office is directly behind this room. You really can't miss it. She can see you now if you like.
merc01_other_2.602recept016.mp3: It's you! The hero of Khoonda!

batono.202202grenn100.mp3: {Sarcastic}You don't sound happy to see me, Grenn.
batono.202202grenn102.mp3: I don't have anything for you, but thanks for saving my life. I'll try and return the favor someday.
batono.203mercbat009.mp3: {Realization dawning that he might have been double-crossed}"Right on schedule?" I knew I shouldn't have trusted you.
batono.203mercbat013.mp3: So this is how it ends...
batono.203mercbat014.mp3: When Czerka kills this planet again, you'll remember this moment, believe me.
batono.203mercbat011.mp3: Then it's time for you to earn your keep and protect me.
batono.203batono039.mp3: You again? What do you want now?
batono.203batono018.mp3: Lead the way, I'll watch your back.
batono.203batono036.mp3: You're back. Are you ready to get going?
batono.203batono038.mp3: Every minute we wait is a minute Czerka gets closer to finding me.
batono.203batono035.mp3: That was a close one. We need to keep moving. Let's leave this mess for the TSF guards to sort out.
batono.203batono009.mp3: {Increasing disbelief}What the-? Hm, you're not CSD, what are you doing here?
batono.203batono010.mp3: What? No, you must be mistaken. You're probably looking for the previous tenant or a neighbor.
batono.203batono034.mp3: No, wait! You can't tell Czerka where I am. They'll kill me for sure.
batono.203batono011.mp3: Dol sent you? Can't say I'm surprised, he was the one who wanted me to come forward in the first place.
batono.203batono027.mp3: You'd be signing my death warrant.
batono.203batono028.mp3: Fine, then. Here's 500 credits. Take them and forget you ever met me.
batono.203batono029.mp3: {Sarcastic}And if Grenn really did send you, tell him thanks.
batono.203batono033.mp3: Don't be too surprised if I'm not here when you get back.
batono.203batono032.mp3: What good are credits, if you aren't around to spend them?
batono.203batono030.mp3: Well, I'm glad we understand each other. Now get out of here.
batono.203batono012.mp3: Easy to say that, but you're not the one Czerka will send its assassins after.
batono.203batono013.mp3: Sure, but everything takes time - testifying before the Council, the Council's deliberation... time that Czerka could use to rub me out.
batono.203batono014.mp3: You might be right. I don't think Czerka has gone so far that it's willing to openly clash with the TSF.
batono.203batono015.mp3: But Czerka has eyes everywhere. I'm not even sure I can leave this apartment safely.
batono.203batono023.mp3: What would you know? It's more attractive than the alternative.
batono.203batono024.mp3: {Resigned}You're right, of course. It's not easy to sit around in this apartment, afraid of anything and everything, jumping at shadows.
batono.203batono025.mp3: But it sure would feel good to put a little fear into Czerka. See how Lorso likes a few sleepless nights of her own.
batono.203batono026.mp3: All right. You've convinced me. Can you escort me safely to the TSF office?
batono.203batono016.mp3: You? Look, I'm sure you can handle yourself, but I think this might be a little out of your league
batono.203batono021.mp3: You obviously haven't been on Station for long if you believe that.
batono.203batono022.mp3: But I guess it's a risk we'll have to take. Lead the way and let's get this over with.
batono.203batono017.mp3: A Jedi? Jedi or no, Grenn wouldn't have sent you if he didn't think you could get the job done. All right, fine. But we need to get moving.
batono.203batono019.mp3: Good idea. I'll wait here, but hurry, I'm starting to feel very exposed here.
batono.203batono001.mp3: {Increasing disbelief}What the-? You're not CSD, what are you doing here?
batono.203batono004.mp3: Just looking around? In another man's apartment? You're either very crazy or very dumb.
batono.203batono008.mp3: Fine, just do your business and get out of here.
batono.203batono007.mp3: Take what you want and get out of here.
batono.203batono002.mp3: Czerka Security Division. They've been known to break into apartments from time to time. Think they're above the law, you know how Czerka is.
batono.203batono003.mp3: But I'm still curious why you're barging in here. Does a locked door mean nothing to you?
batono.203batono040.mp3: B-4D4! So Czerka's on to me. Look, I want you to forget you ever saw me.

203b4d4.203203b4d4001.mp3: Good day. I am B-4D4, administrative assistant for Czerka Corporation's Citadel Station Branch.
203b4d4.203203b4d4002.mp3: I am attempting to connect you with Executive Officer Jana Lorso. May I put you through?
203b4d4.203203b4d4005.mp3: I will relay such to Executive Lorso. I am sorry to have inconvenienced you. Good day.
203b4d4.203203b4d4004.mp3: I am sorry, but I do not know. I am only her administrative assistant. May I put you through?
203b4d4.203203b4d4003.mp3: Thank you. I will connect you now. Good day.

linu.203203tsf2a001.mp3: Excuse me. You have a caller - Moza, representing the Ithorian planet-restoration interests on Telos.
linu.203203tsf2a002.mp3: Lieutenant Grenn's cleared him, if you'd like to speak with him.
linu.203203tsf2a038.mp3: Very well. I'll inform Moza and send him on his way.
linu.203203tsf2a039.mp3: He says he wishes to speak with you on behalf of Chodo Habat. That's all he will say.
linu.203203tsf2a003.mp3: Very well, I'll let him in now.

202czerf.203203vula020.mp3: That door can't be opened from there. Is there something I can do for you today?
202czerf.203203vula004.mp3: I'm terribly sorry, but I don't show you as having an appointment. If you need one, they can be made through Luxa.
202czerf.203203vula005.mp3: At the cantina, most likely. Good day.
202czerf.203203vula003.mp3: Luxa? Well, let me open the door for you, then.
202czerf.203203vula008.mp3: I'm terribly sorry, but there must be some sort of mistake. I don't have a record of your appointment - are you certain it was for today?
202czerf.203203vula014.mp3: No appointment? Then how did- Why did- oh!
202czerf.203203vula015.mp3: Let me, ah, open the door for you, ah, right away...
202czerf.203203vula016.mp3: There's a package here for pickup.
202czerf.203203vula017.mp3: There you are. Have a good day!
202czerf.203203vula010.mp3: [Success] Well, if... very well. What was your name?
202czerf.203203vula011.mp3: Excuse me. Loppak Slusk's appointment has arrived. Please open the inner door.
202czerf.203203vula012.mp3: There you are. Have a good day!
202czerf.203203vula009.mp3: [Success] You know what? There must be a mistake in the system. Why don't I open that door for you. What was your name?
202czerf.203203vula007.mp3: Loppak Slusk should be waiting within. Have a good day!
202czerf.203203vula006.mp3: I'm terribly sorry, but there must be some sort of mistake. I don't have a record of your appointment - are you certain it was for today?
202czerf.203203vula001.mp3: Please don't kill me! I'm only doing my job!
202czerf.203203vula021.mp3: Our appointments calendar is completely full for the foreseeable future.

falt.203falt003.mp3: Is that a threat? I could have Czerka security here in seconds. You don't scare me.
falt.203falt015.mp3: There's no need for that, I want to help. Put your weapons away.
falt.203falt004.mp3: Heh. Let's not be hasty, huh? I just don't want to stick my neck out for nothing. Come on, we can work out a deal, one businessman to another.
falt.203falt005.mp3: Stalling? I don't know what you mean. You're the one who's stalking me!
falt.203falt006.mp3: Wait! I'll help you! Just... just don't hurt me.

falt.203falt008.mp3: If you controlled B-4D4, you could walk right in.
falt.203falt009.mp3: Nearly all the Czerka technicians are planet-side these days, working the Recovery Zones we've taken from the Ithorians.
falt.203falt010.mp3: We've contracted out the maintenance for the office's protocol and utility droids. The guy, Chano, lives in the apartments in Residential 082. Unit 2B, I think.
falt.203falt011.mp3: If you had his credentials, B-4D4 would leave with you willingly.
falt.203falt014.mp3: You won't be going anywhere, I think.
falt.203falt013.mp3: You should have taken my deal when you had the chance.
falt.207207falt049.mp3: What do you want to know?
falt.207207falt058.mp3: I am the most qualified to take over her position, should it be vacated... and yes, I would remember your help. Alright, I'll tell you my plans.
falt.207207falt056.mp3: Believe me, I'm familiar with that. Alright, I'll tell you what my plan is. What's the harm?
falt.207207falt057.mp3: I'm trying to get access to files on the Czerka mainframe. I'm sure I could find evidence of Lorso's dirty dealings.
falt.207207falt054.mp3: [Failure] I don't think so. I'm sorry, but I'm not sure if I can trust you. I don't understand why you're so interested.
falt.207207falt050.mp3: [Success] I've been trying to get access to the Czerka mainframe. If I could just look at our records, I'm sure I could find evidence of Lorso's less reputable dealings.
falt.207207falt051.mp3: Failing that, I considered speaking with Luxa about the increased profit possibilities if someone replaced Lorso as Czerka executive - someone like me, for example.
falt.207207falt052.mp3: I'll do anything to get that woman fired - bribes, forged records, anything!
falt.207207falt053.mp3: Thank you, I'd appreciate that. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'd like to not think about that woman for a while.
falt.207207falt030.mp3: I've told you everything I know. I don't think we should be seen talking to each other anymore.
falt.207207falt028.mp3: So, do you have those 1,000 credits?
falt.207207falt001.mp3: Is there something I can do for you?
falt.207207falt032.mp3: I'm Czerka employee, Citadel Station branch, number 85. Finally worked my way out of the trenches into a promotion.
falt.207207falt033.mp3: Then Czerka transferred me here to the Outer Rim to manage the military reclamation effort.
falt.207207falt034.mp3: That wasn't the worst of it, either. Now I've got Lorso as my new superior, and a career that's going nowhere.
falt.207207falt002.mp3: What's there to say? We're the only corporation with a branch on Citadel Station. Getting in early, as they say.
falt.207207falt003.mp3: If this whole Telos thing pans out, we could be in a great position. If Lorso doesn't screw it up, that is.
falt.207207falt006.mp3: Ugh, Jana Lorso. That woman's a... look, forget it. She's my superior, and that's that. She'll screw up soon enough, and then I'll move in for the kill.
falt.207207falt048.mp3: That's not the point. This has nothing to do with whether she's a man, woman, Duros or droid.
falt.207207falt046.mp3: What would you know about it, anyways? You didn't claw your way through the mass of faceless Czerka employees - to finally be rewarded with a meaningful posting, only to have it taken away by some woman who'd stoop to anything to get ahead.
falt.207207falt007.mp3: She's got her hands in too many dirty little - whoah. I think I've had a few too many drinks. I shouldn't be talking to you about this stuff. Just forget it.
falt.207207falt045.mp3: Besides the fact she's totally dirty? Czerka's not what you might call a model citizen, but Lorso has taken it to new lows, allying us with the Exchange and hiring the dregs of society as mercenaries.
falt.207207falt042.mp3: Oh, so you're the one she's got running all of her dirty little projects. I don't know how you do it, you must need her for something badly.
falt.207207falt043.mp3: I've been trying to get her removed for months now, but nothing seems to work. I might need to resort to more drastic measures.
falt.207207falt044.mp3: Aaah... yeah, I shouldn't be talking about this. Forget I said anything, you- you must have good reason if you're helping her, so just be careful. If she decides you've outlived your usefulness... Let's just say you should watch yourself.
falt.207207falt009.mp3: Wait - are you talking about accessing the mainframe? The Czerka mainframe? You're crazy! What are you, some kind of slicer?
falt.207207falt010.mp3: Well, I'm sure there are a dozen sorts of dirt on Lorso in there. But it's a closed system.
falt.207207falt011.mp3: This is a joke, right? You're CSD, aren't you? Loyalty test?
falt.207207falt015.mp3: Look, this is a risky proposition. I'd be sticking my neck out. Way out.
falt.207207falt027.mp3: 1,000 credits and I'll find you a way in. No negotiating - take it or leave it.
falt.207207falt026.mp3: What are you gonna do? Torture me in the middle of a crowded cantina? Get out of here. I don't have to take this.
falt.207207falt024.mp3: [Failure] I... well... fine. 1000 credits and I'll find you a way in. No negotiating - take it or leave it.
falt.207207falt025.mp3: [Failure] Not a chance. I said 1,000, no negotiating.
falt.207207falt016.mp3: [Success] Yeah. Yeah, you're right. 500 credits and I'll find you a way in. No negotiating: Take it or leave it.
falt.207207falt023.mp3: [Failure] Not a chance. I said 500, no negotiating.
falt.207207falt022.mp3: [Success] Didn't I say-? Oh, forget it. 300 it is.
falt.207207falt017.mp3: All right. Other than Jana Lorso, only B-4D4 has free access to the mainframe. He's a protocol droid, her administrative assistant.
falt.207207falt018.mp3: If you controlled B-4D4, you could walk right in.
falt.207207falt019.mp3: Nearly all the Czerka technicians are planet-side these days, working the Recovery Zones we've taken from the Ithorians.
falt.207207falt020.mp3: We've contracted out the maintenance for the office's protocol and utility droids. The guy, Chano, lives in the apartments in Residential 082. Unit 2B, I think.
falt.207207falt021.mp3: If you had his credentials, B-4D4 would leave with you willingly.
falt.207207falt040.mp3: Right, whatever. You could use B-4D4 to get into the mainframe.
falt.207207falt014.mp3: [Failure] ...and I want Jana Lorso looking dirty. Right, right.
falt.207207falt013.mp3: [Success] ...and I want Jana Lorso looking dirty.
falt.207207falt012.mp3: [Success] You know, this is serious. I should help you out.
falt.207207falt039.mp3: Means you can't get in remotely. You've got actually be in front of the mainframe to access it.
falt.207207falt004.mp3: Yeah. It's a long shot, considering the state of the Republic these days. Still, if it works out, the Republic may decide to start restoring other war-torn worlds. At least, that's what Czerka hopes.
falt.207207falt005.mp3: If we can integrate ourselves into the process, Czerka stands to make a tidy profit in the future.
falt.207207falt036.mp3: Quite a few ways. As part of the Republic contract rewarded for a planet like Telos, Czerka is allowed to use the planet's natural resources to help fund and support the project.
falt.207207falt037.mp3: On top of that, the Senate's easy to negotiate with. They're liberal with the amount of credits they throw around, even with the Republic being in the shape its in.
falt.207207falt038.mp3: And of course, new planets mean new markets for Czerka products. All in all, a very good arrangement for us.
falt.203203lorso161.mp3: I'll do anything to get that woman fired - bribes, forged records, anything!

falt_other_1.502bostuco031.mp3: I was a soldier when the Mandalorians took our world, and I fought in the resistance. When we drove them from Onderon, I served on the Wall for ten years after.
falt_other_1.502bostuco013.mp3: I was a soldier when the Mandalorians took our world, and I fought in the resistance. When we drove them from Onderon, I served on the Wall for ten years after.

falt_other_1.502bostuco021.mp3: {Stiffly}My personal feelings on the matter are irrelevant. I received an order, and I carried it out.

falt_other_1.502bostuco024.mp3: [Success] You're right, I have many good years of service left in me. Yet I feel like I am being set aside.

falt_other_1.502bostuco007.mp3: I suggest you move along, off-worlder... before you test my patience any further.
falt_other_1.502bostuco002.mp3: Thank you for the conversation earlier. It was good to hear an outsider's perspective. I still can't allow you to go up the Sky Ramp, though.
falt_other_1.502bostuco001.mp3: Thank you for the conversation earlier... you took a great weight off of my mind.

falt_other_2.602berun066.mp3: Hello there! You haven't had any new troubles, I hope?
falt_other_2.602berun090.mp3: I'm not the one to talk to. You should see Administrator Adare about that.
falt_other_2.602berun070.mp3: Thanks for your support. I've been waiting for some time to get my chance to lead the Militia the right way.
falt_other_2.602berun001.mp3: What brings you to Khoonda? Do you have any troubles to report? I'm here to help! I just hope you aren't here about Gerevick.
falt_other_2.602berun080.mp3: All right. Stay out of trouble now!
falt_other_2.602berun049.mp3: I'll tell you anything that's public knowledge. Most militia news passes by me and Zherron. I might be able to help.
falt_other_2.602berun065.mp3: I'm here to help. What do you need?
falt_other_2.602berun054.mp3: I've heard that rumor, too. People get really riled up about Jedi around here. Some people seem to have a selective memory.
falt_other_2.602berun055.mp3: During the war, the Jedi were a big help here. They did everything for us, from clearing out dangerous beasts to solving a murder investigation.
falt_other_2.602berun056.mp3: I try to stay out of it, though. Standing up for Jedi is one way to become unpopular around here.
falt_other_2.602berun063.mp3: Eh. I've heard all that before. I don't agree with you. But there are plenty of people who would.
falt_other_2.602berun058.mp3: Heh. Easy to say for someone that doesn't live here. I'd rather grab an unshielded power coupling than get involved in that debate. The militia is dealing with enough already.
falt_other_2.602berun053.mp3: {He's not pleased that he's not on the loop on this one}I don't know what Saedhe{SAY-d} is up to. He's working directly with Zherron on that investigation. Sorry I can't help.
falt_other_2.602berun052.mp3: If you want to know more, ask Daraala. She's the smart one in the salvager camp.
falt_other_2.602berun051.mp3: Oh, you heard about that? We have so much to look into that Suulru's concern is pretty low on our list. We asked the salvagers, but they claim that the salvager responsible is nowhere to be found.
falt_other_2.602berun050.mp3: You should see Administrator Adare about that. She'll be able to set you up. You're not a typical salvager, so I don't expect you'll have any trouble there.
falt_other_2.602berun045.mp3: {His friendliness is a little more uncertain now - he gives the PC the benefit of the doubt and assumes he's joking}I see... Well, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to go over the militia rules then. Khoonda{COON-da} and the salvager camp are under militia protection.
falt_other_2.602berun046.mp3: So a friendly scuffle is all right, but if any blasters are drawn there will be hell to pay. But if you buy some Jedi trinket and you're not satisfied, you're on your own.
falt_other_2.602berun047.mp3: {He sounds disapproving of the difficulties, but unlike most people it isn't scorn directed at them. He's upset that the militia has made matters worse}I'd stay away from the mercenary camp. We've had... difficulties with them. We don't patrol or investigate there any more. A trip there, and you're on your own.
falt_other_2.602berun048.mp3: Follow the rules and we don't have any problems. Oh - and Pato Ado{pa-TOE ah-DOE} doesn't cheat as far as we can figure. So don't complain about the Ithorian, either.
falt_other_2.602berun043.mp3: I don't even want to get into it. Ask around if you want to know the details. It'll just make my headache worse if I talk about it.
falt_other_2.602berun044.mp3: I don't know what we'd do without Administrator Adare. She managed to plow through a lot of the family bickering once the Sith left during the war. She's kept us together. Oh, and uh, Zherron, too, I suppose.
falt_other_2.602berun041.mp3: {He sounds proud of his position - but there is a hint of trouble}Well call me a defective protocol droid. Manners, right? I'm Berun Modrul, I'm Captain Zherron's{zeh-ron} right hand man. I help run the militia here.
falt_other_2.602berun042.mp3: Well, that makes it sound more important than I am. Zherron takes a hands-on role in running the militia. If you have any real trouble, you'd have to go to him anyway.
falt_other_2.602berun013.mp3: You haven't? Well, that's something. I'm the second in command over here, and we keep getting "incidents." Our staff is stretched thin. Too thin.
falt_other_2.602berun014.mp3: {His tone should change here - much more neutral, he doesn't approve of Zherron but is trying to be diplomatic about it}If you do have trouble, I'm not the one to talk to. You'd need to talk to Zherron{zeh-ron}. He takes a hands-on role as the militia captain.
falt_other_2.602berun016.mp3: {When he talks about what "people" believe, it should be clear he believes it, too}The thing is, he expects everyone to follow all the laws. That's not normally a bad thing. But the mercenaries are used to having a bit more freedom.
falt_other_2.602berun017.mp3: So it's like Zherron keeps prodding a rancor with a stun stick. To a rancor it's just a minor nuisance, but if you keep at it he's going to fight back.
falt_other_2.602berun018.mp3: The mercenaries aren't unreasonable. They're mostly just war veterans looking for work. But Zherron just keeps poking them.
falt_other_2.602berun019.mp3: So he has to get involved to make sure that the militia does what he wants. Otherwise, we'd probably give the mercenaries some room.
falt_other_2.602berun040.mp3: {He doesn't take this badly}No, it really isn't. It's one of the many Dantooine problems grown right here at home. If we could export them, we'd be rich.
falt_other_2.602berun029.mp3: {He doesn't sound convinced by this argument}Dantooine has had mercenaries on it for years. I've talked with some, and they're not unreasonable. There's got to be some sort of compromise we can both live with.
falt_other_2.602berun038.mp3: Yeah, you're probably right. There's no obvious solution to this.
falt_other_2.602berun035.mp3: There's danger everywhere. I think the direction we're headed may be even more dangerous. I can see we don't agree on this.
falt_other_2.602berun030.mp3: Heh. Using my own analogy against me? The mercenaries aren't rancors. They're people like you and me. But if you keep provoking them...
falt_other_2.602berun021.mp3: I also think he's doing more to provoke them than just investigating every complaint against them hard. He's up to something.
falt_other_2.602berun022.mp3: If someone could just ask a few questions, turn up some answers, maybe see if Zherron isn't being completely honest with the rest of us? Well, then maybe he should be replaced.
falt_other_2.602berun028.mp3: {He doesn't seem to be put out by the request for money}Definitely, the militia makes sure to reward anybody that helps out Dantooine. And if he's doing something risky...
falt_other_2.602berun026.mp3: So if you happen to find something out like that, you should see Administrator Adare. If you have to do some footwork to check into things, you'll be compensated.
falt_other_2.602berun024.mp3: Just a lot of little things don't add up. It could just be a surprise party. But I think Zherron takes this problem very personal.

luxa.207207luxa047.mp3: I should be Citadel's boss - but Goto doesn't allow breaks in the chain of command. I can't go over Loppak Slusk's head, so I've got to take care of him myself. And I want your help.
luxa.207207luxa024.mp3: You've returned. Did Chano cough up those credits?
luxa.207207luxa032.mp3: Strange. I would not expect he'd be able to escape the Station without our knowledge. I'll have to look into it to see that this does not happen again.
luxa.207207luxa114.mp3: I see. Well, at the very least, we should be able to sell his equipment and possessions and regain our losses that way.
luxa.207207luxa113.mp3: And I'm sure he learned it very well in the moments before his life ended.
luxa.207207luxa112.mp3: True. He likely had a good supply of equipment and droid parts that he was to repair or use for repairs. We could sell them off and possibly recoup more than the 2,500 credits owed to us.
luxa.207207luxa025.mp3: Already? It's a pleasant change to have someone who so diligently and successfully completes the tasks set before them. But then, I was fairly sure you were the capable sort.
luxa.207207luxa026.mp3: Before you say anything - yes, I will arrange the meeting with Slusk that you desired.
luxa.207207luxa027.mp3: But first, I was wondering if you might listen to a proposition. A business proposition, given your obvious abilities.
luxa.207207luxa107.mp3: Let me ask you an honest question - this meeting with Slusk you want, it's because Lorso's fed up with him, right?
luxa.207207luxa108.mp3: I feel the same way about Slusk, and I think it's time someone solved the problem. I think that maybe our interests lie in the same direction.
luxa.207207luxa109.mp3: Now I know you're not dull enough that you can't read through the lines. Slusk's no good for anybody's business - yours, Lorso's or mine.
luxa.207207luxa110.mp3: But there's a problem, Slusk's boss, Goto. Now this Goto... he's rigid, ruthlessly efficient - and all he sees are numbers.
luxa.207207luxa002.mp3: 'Almost.' I had enough faith in you to know that you could handle any on-the-job dangers that popped up.
luxa.207207luxa021.mp3: Unfortunate. But they paid the price for trying to take advantage of the Exchange.
luxa.207207luxa004.mp3: At least the deal is done and paid for.
luxa.207207luxa006.mp3: I've got some more work for you, if you're up for it. A matter of a rather sizeable debt owed to the Exchange.
luxa.207207luxa020.mp3: And you will. I just need you to perform this one last service for me.
luxa.207207luxa104.mp3: I trust you - why else would I request your help with Exchange business?
luxa.207207luxa007.mp3: Right to the point. I like that.
luxa.207207luxa008.mp3: Opo Chano, one of Czerka's droid technicians, owes a sizeable gambling debt from his last stay on Nar Shaddaa.
luxa.207207luxa009.mp3: We've been patient with him, but we can only let a debt go unpaid for so long.
luxa.207207luxa013.mp3: Hey, that's the business. I can't be responsible for your lack of control.
luxa.207207luxa015.mp3: You'll find Chano in Unit B2, Residential 082. Tell him his time is up, and we want those credits.
luxa.207207luxa016.mp3: Then rough him up - put some fear into him. Make sure he understands the situation.
luxa.207207luxa019.mp3: Look, if I wanted you dead, I think I'd send some armed killers.
luxa.207207luxa103.mp3: And Chano's harmless. He's just a technician. I wouldn't worry yourself.
luxa.207207luxa017.mp3: Look, I don't care how you get the credits out of him. Just take care of it.
luxa.207207luxa018.mp3: Good. I knew I could count on you.
luxa.207benok013.mp3: Oh, leave the woman alone, Benok. I bet she'd come out on top if you fought.
luxa.207benok006.mp3: Oh, leave the man alone, Benok. I bet he'd come out on top if you fought.
luxa.207benok008.mp3: It's your skin, Benok. Just warning you - Slusk could easily replace you.
luxa.203203luxa001.mp3: Well, that's all wrapped up. I've got to thank you for your help.
luxa.203203luxa004.mp3: Is that supposed to frighten me? Let me let you in on a little secret. Fried squid there isn't half the fighter I am.
luxa.203203luxa005.mp3: And if you think I'm going to let Jana Lorso push me around, you're sadly mistaken.
luxa.203203luxa012.mp3: It's a shame, but I think you've outlived your usefulness.
luxa.203203luxa014.mp3: Sorry, beautiful, but even the best relationships have to end sometime.
luxa.203203luxa013.mp3: Sorry, handsome, but even the best relationships have to end sometime.
luxa.203203luxa006.mp3: Oh, I don't know - I never did. But you won't need it where you're going.
luxa.203203luxa009.mp3: Slusk's dead, but Goto's still my boss. I'm shipping you to Nar Shaddaa, "Jedi," dead or alive.
luxa.203203luxa010.mp3: If you don't want to defend yourself, that's your choice.
luxa.203203luxa008.mp3: When you've come as far as I've come in the Exchange, it isn't by overestimating your own abilities.
luxa.203203luxa007.mp3: Slusk's dead, but Goto's still my boss. I'm shipping you to Nar Shaddaa, "Jedi".
luxa.203203luxa002.mp3: It a shame I have to turn you down after you asked so nicely. But no.
luxa.203203luxa003.mp3: I always did break a lot of hearts.
luxa.203203slusk008.mp3: I may have had a hand in this, yes.
luxa.203203slusk016.mp3: Not as soon as you might think.
luxa.203203slusk013.mp3: I guess it's just like they say. If you want something done right, do it yourself.

luxa_other_1.207207luxa068.mp3: Oh, too bad. I hope you'll come back when you change your mind. So long, beautiful.
luxa_other_1.207207luxa030.mp3: You killed him? And how do expect us to be able to collect credits from a corpse?
luxa_other_1.207207luxa091.mp3: Oh, you're back. Going to take me up on my offer, hmmn?

b4r5.207bardroid001.mp3: Welcome to the Entertainment Module 081 cantina. How can I assist you?
b4r5.207bardroid002.mp3: We feature Citadel Station's most talented all-Bith band around the clock, as well as live Twi'lek dancers, you won't find any holograms here.
b4r5.207bardroid003.mp3: Casual pazaak players should be able to find a friendly match in the game room, or if you're a bit more seasoned, we have daily tournaments with some of the best players in the Outer Rim.
b4r5.207bardroid004.mp3: Cards too slow for you? Try your hand at Citadel Station's swoop track and see if you can challenge the all-time records.
b4r5.207bardroid005.mp3: Last but not least, we feature only the finest cuisine and beverages from Ryloth to Coruscant.
b4r5.303b4r5006.mp3: I'm sorry, I'm quite busy at the moment.
b4r5.303b4r5001.mp3: Oh my! You startled me. What are you doing here?
b4r5.303b4r5002.mp3: I monitor the transponder codes of all ships leaving the docks, then transmit departure information for any of Vogga the Hutt's freighters.
b4r5.303b4r5003.mp3: The information is sent to a remote computer system.
b4r5.303b4r5004.mp3: Oh, I see. In that case, I will upload the transponder codes to you. And here is the blank transponder card you need.
b4r5.303b4r5005.mp3: You're welcome. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must go back to monitoring the traffic - it is important that relevant departure information is relayed as quickly as possible.
b4r5.512mp_128018.mp3: Greetings, Master. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128001.mp3: I am 1B-8D, an automated droid vendor. I have in stock a variety of quality droid components. No refunds, and no haggling. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128017.mp3: [Failure] Warning! Any attempt to interfere with 1B-8D's primary function will result in violence. Please back away from this unit's access panel.
b4r5.512mp_128013.mp3: [Success] Bzzt... Reinitializing complete. Greetings. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128016.mp3: 1B-8D was built and programmed by Tolas{TOE-loss} the trader. 1B-8D was built to buy droid components for below base cost value, and sell components based on most favorable market conditions. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128014.mp3: That goes against my primary behavior programming. All items must be sold based on the most favorable market conditions. 1B-8D cannot haggle, this is also a part of my primary behavior matrix.
b4r5.512mp_128015.mp3: Market conditions all set to 0. All prices now set to base cost value. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128022.mp3: [Success] Bzzt... Reinitializing complete. Greetings. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128006.mp3: Certainly. 1B-8D is programmed to answer many basic questions from prospective buyers. What do you want to know?
b4r5.512mp_128011.mp3: Sorry, my memory banks have no information on that subject. Please restate your question or ask another.
b4r5.512mp_128012.mp3: Sorry, my memory banks have no information on that subject. Please restate your question or ask another.
b4r5.512mp_128010.mp3: Iziz is the only city on the planet Onderon. All other information on this subject has been purged by Tolas to direct more power to primary functions.
b4r5.512mp_128009.mp3: Iziz is the only city on the planet Onderon. All other information on this subject has been restricted.
b4r5.512mp_128008.mp3: 1B-8D was built and programmed by Tolas{TOE-loss} the trader. 1B-8D was built to buy droid components for below base cost value, and sell components based on most favorable market conditions. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128007.mp3: That information is restricted. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128005.mp3: 1B-8D sells droid components and droids. Currently there are 0 droids in stock and a moderate selection of components. Do you have any interest in my goods?
b4r5.512mp_128002.mp3: Entity Bahima, unknown. I have many serving droid parts.
b4r5.512mp_128003.mp3: The market rate for those parts would be 25 credits.
b4r5.512mp_128025.mp3: 1B-8D cannot do business with patrons who have no credits. Goodbye.
b4r5.601olddroid001.mp3: Greetings and good day, traveler. On behalf of the Khoonda settlement I am programmed to welcome you to Dantooine.
b4r5.601olddroid002.mp3: Is there something I can do to serve you?
b4r5.601olddroid052.mp3: If you will excuse me, I must continue my appointed rounds.
b4r5.601olddroid051.mp3: I am conducting my appointed rounds.
b4r5.601olddroid047.mp3: The main area of interest for visitors is the Khoonda outpost. There you will find the local officials who preside over the Dantooine colony, Administrator Terena Adare and Militia Leader Zherron.
b4r5.601olddroid048.mp3: Zherron strongly urges salvagers to avoid the highly dangerous sublevel of the Enclave ruins.
b4r5.601olddroid049.mp3: Due to reduced militia manpower, several dangerous beasts overpopulate the more rural areas of Dantooine. For more information, speak with Zherron in the Khoonda outpost.
b4r5.601olddroid050.mp3: The Khoonda outpost is just outside this landing facility.
b4r5.601olddroid041.mp3: The local militia occasionally offers employment to qualified soldiers. Speak to Zherron in the Khoonda outpost.
b4r5.601olddroid042.mp3: Additionally, many visitors come to Khoonda to explore the ruins for salvage opportunities.
b4r5.601olddroid045.mp3: Khoonda's salvage industry is a main source of income for the local community. At their own risk, salvagers may remove relics from designated salvage areas within the ruins.
b4r5.601olddroid046.mp3: The fee to remove a relic from Dantooine is proportionate to the appraised value of the item. For more details, speak to Administrator Terena Adare at the Khoonda Outpost.
b4r5.601olddroid043.mp3: The famed ruins of the Jedi Enclave can be found northwest of the Khoonda outpost. You may visit the ruins at your own risk.
b4r5.601olddroid044.mp3: Zherron strongly urges salvagers to avoid the highly dangerous sublevel of the enclave ruins.
b4r5.601olddroid020.mp3: Dantooine is a rural world, far removed from most galactic trade routes. Historically, agriculture has been Dantooine's primary industry.
b4r5.601olddroid021.mp3: Since the destruction of the Jedi Enclave, salvage of the ruins has become a key area of growth for the local community.
b4r5.601olddroid022.mp3: May I be of any further service to you?
b4r5.601olddroid024.mp3: Exterior damage analysis: level seven impairment. Multiple casing breaches detected.  Bipedal servos misaligned by 32 degrees.
