b4r5.601olddroid025.mp3: Memory storage overflow. Memory unit is approximately 56 months overdue for maintenance.
b4r5.601olddroid026.mp3: [Success] Greetings, Jedi. Welcome back to Dantooine.
b4r5.601olddroid038.mp3: May I be of further service to you, Jedi?
b4r5.601olddroid005.mp3: My memory banks recognize you as a Jedi. You are among many Jedi who were trained in the Academy here at the Enclave, prior to its destruction during the Sith invasion.
b4r5.601olddroid018.mp3: Approximately five years ago, the Dark Jedi Malak and his Sith fleet assaulted Dantooine. The surprise of the initial orbital bombardments prevented any resistance from the surface.
b4r5.601olddroid019.mp3: The attack destroyed much of the Jedi Enclave, leaving only the sublevel partially intact. The Sith attack also concentrated heavily on some obscure ruins to the south, but the reason for this is unknown.
b4r5.601olddroid006.mp3: You are on the register as one of the Jedi who left the Enclave to fight in the Mandolorian Wars. My memory has no record of your return before now.
b4r5.601olddroid007.mp3: You had no direct interaction with this droid. However, I have one instance of a conversation between Masters Vrook and Vandar regarding you.
b4r5.601olddroid008.mp3: Beginning playback... Error, recording partially corrupted. Resolving...
b4r5.601olddroid003.mp3: My apologies. I have no recollection of the Sith invasion topic.

benok.207benok001.mp3: Ah, so you must be the Jedi everyone's been whispering about. No more trouble with the TSF, I hope?
benok.207benok015.mp3: Jedi or not, you're the talk of the station. Everyone from the TSF to Czerka Corporation is curious about you.
benok.207benok002.mp3: Perhaps you don't know who I am.
benok.207benok003.mp3: You haven't been on Citadel Station long, have you? Let me introduce myself.
benok.207benok004.mp3: I'm Benok, the man in charge of Loppak Slusk's protection. {condescending}You do know who Loppak Slusk is, don't you?
benok.207benok005.mp3: The two gentlemen with me are Matu and Nahata, Slusk's finest men. Other than me, of course.
benok.207benok007.mp3: Now, Luxa, I meant no disrespect. You're probably Slusk's strongest woman.
benok.207benok009.mp3: And I doubt you could cause any.
benok.207benok010.mp3: Trading jabs with Luxa is hardly the entertainment I was looking for. Let's go.
benok.302odis005.mp3: You need a pilot's license to fly the freighters here. They're tough to get without sponsorship.
benok.302odis004.mp3: I don't care if you think so. I know what I've done and who I am.
benok.302odis003.mp3: Yes... {resigned}and look where I ended up.
benok.502intgate024.mp3: Eventually they'll come back for me. After that, I have a feeling no one'll hear from me again.
benok.512dhagon036.mp3: Well, the meeting is on. Head straight to the cantina. Your guy should be in there.
benok.512dhagon037.mp3: {Good natured and grudd}And no offense, but I hope I never see you again.
benok.512dhagon022.mp3: Have you found the encrypted holodiscs yet? I won't be able to get ahold of my contact from the palace without 'em.
benok.512dhagon027.mp3: I doubt that Bakkel is smart enough to realize how valuable those disks are. So it doesn't need to be done immediately, but the sooner the better.
benok.512dhagon023.mp3: Great going, there. With these I'll check my contacts at the palace. I should be able to get a meeting with your Jedi Master shortly.
benok.512dhagon024.mp3: If you got anything you need to take care of in the quarter, you best do it now. You're dealing with serious politics by contacting them.
benok.512dhagon025.mp3: If things go bad during the meeting, you may not be welcome in Iziz any more. Perhaps never. Just let me know if you want to go through with this.
benok.512dhagon026.mp3: Come back when you're ready. Better yet, call the whole thing off. Palace politics can get you killed these days.
benok.512dhagon040.mp3: I owe you and Mandalore one.
benok.512dhagon021.mp3: We go way back. Way before he became Mandalore. In my experience Mandalorians always know about the doctors around. For some strange reason they keep getting into scrapes. If you want to know more, ask him yourself.
benok.512dhagon016.mp3: Yeah, it was. Although it looked pretty much like this to begin with.
benok.512dhagon017.mp3: A little dirt never killed anyone. Well, maybe a few people. But they didn't pay too well, so they got what they deserve.
benok.512dhagon018.mp3: I give my customers a menu of options. If they go for the deluxe, I'll clean up the place and put on a new smock. Otherwise, they knew the risks.
benok.512dhagon019.mp3: Patients, customers, idiotic Hutt spawn... call them what you like. Most doctors tell you that they got into the business to save lives. Most of them are flaming liars. At least I'll tell you the truth, I'm in it for the credits.
benok.512dhagon007.mp3: Not many people can help you out with that. There've been several assassination attempts on Queen Talia. That place is locked tighter than a Hutt's vault. I know a few people though. Who do you need to get in touch with?
benok.512dhagon008.mp3: A Jedi Master, you say? Now that is interesting. There's quite a bounty on Jedi these days. Not that I'm looking to collect, but if there's a Master there... I think I know who it is.
benok.512dhagon014.mp3: I'm not certain, otherwise I'd tell you. But the man I'm thinking about is smart, likes to stay in the shadows, and is cryptic as hell. If he isn't a Jedi Master, he should become one.
benok.512dhagon010.mp3: The thing is scavengers have already looted most of my stuff. Most of it's garbage anyway, so I don't care too much. But I did have a couple of encrypted holodiscs that they nabbed.
benok.512dhagon011.mp3: So! Here's the punch line. I need those discs because they have some contact information on them. The people I know you don't just walk up to and chat with. There's a procedure. And that holodisc has the procedure.
benok.512dhagon012.mp3: Bakkel's gang pretty much owns this street. From what I hear she's the one that cleaned me out.
benok.512dhagon041.mp3: She's in the local cantina most days. She's tough as drexl leather and more dangerous than an angry Wookiee. If you take Mandalore with you, though, you should be just fine.
benok.512dhagon013.mp3: Just get me the encrypted holodisc. After that, if there is a Jedi Master in the Palace, I'll get you a meeting with him.
benok.512dhagon004.mp3: Wrong place, wrong time. Captain Sullio and I were acquaintances. I just happened to be too close when she got dead. A real shame. She wasn't bad to look at, and she could drink.
benok.512dhagon001.mp3: So you still intend to go through with it? I can schedule the meeting with your Jedi Master as soon as you like.
benok.602suulru037.mp3: Any luck on getting my modulator back from Jorran? I don't think anyone here will be able to help me.
benok.602suulru042.mp3: Excellent! How did you deal with Jorran?
benok.602suulru074.mp3: Really? You must have been very persuasive. I'm relieved this situation is finally resolved. You have more than earned this reward!
benok.602suulru026.mp3: Before the Mandalorian Wars we were making great gains in civilizing this world. The kinrath and kath hounds were mainly under control. We were small but prosperous.
benok.602suulru032.mp3: Many of the mercenaries here were just foot soldiers on both sides of the conflict. Now they're just trying to make a life for themselves.
benok.602suulru034.mp3: That could mean disaster for all of us.
benok.602suulru023.mp3: Yes, I fought in the Jedi Civil War. I guess we 'won'. You couldn't tell here, though. It feels like we've been forsaken by the Republic.
benok.602suulru024.mp3: {Very somber tone}The war was very unkind to Dantooine. That hidden Enclave cost us a great deal. A great deal.
benok.602suulru080.mp3: Well, yes and no. I brought my moisture vaporator to Khoonda to be serviced. On the way back to my farm, I took a shortcut next to the Enclave ruins.
benok.602suulru082.mp3: I went to their camp to get back my moisture vaporator. This smug fellow, Jorran, told me that he found it within the ruins, and by law it belongs to him now.

benok_other_1.207benok014.mp3: I guess you haven't heard the popular rumors then.
benok_other_1.207benok011.mp3: Well, we were just leaving anyway. Come on.
benok_other_1.302odis010.mp3: All right, I can take the hint.
benok_other_1.502intgate023.mp3: {The soldiers walk away}I don't know how to thank you. I'm getting out of Iziz now.
benok_other_1.502intgate016.mp3: But no, no - wait. You can't do this!
benok_other_1.512dhagon028.mp3: Yeah, yeah, I'll get on it. Grab a cot and rest a bit. Once I get a meeting time, I'll let you know.
benok_other_1.512dhagon015.mp3: Nobody knows for sure, but everybody thinks that General Vaklu has to have something to with it. They're keeping the attempts quiet, but that place is locked down tight.
benok_other_1.512dhagon009.mp3: There's a slight problem with that. I know you don't want to hear that, since you did go through all the effort of springing me out.
benok_other_1.512dhagon006.mp3: She's dead now. Not like finding whoever did it will bring her back. I deal with death all the time. We all end up like her eventually.
benok_other_1.512dhagon038.mp3: {His tone is that he couldn't help interjecting this comment}What the hell happened to you, anyway? Your face looks like the backend of a dewback.
benok_other_1.512dhagon039.mp3: {Awkwardly changing subject}Well, regardless, I owe you and Mandalore one.
benok_other_1.512dhagon002.mp3: Like I was saying, though, once I use my contact you may be in over your head. You may not be welcome back on Iziz, again.
benok_other_1.602suulru088.mp3: I thought I'd put my soldiering days behind me forever. I'm both dreading and looking forward to this battle.
benok_other_1.602suulru087.mp3: I'll be glad to return to my farm and retire my blaster for good now.
benok_other_1.602suulru086.mp3: Fantastic! I had only hoped to get the modulator back. I never imagined you would get my money back too! How did you do it?
benok_other_1.602suulru033.mp3: That's true. Discipline is the only thing that keeps an army from becoming an armed mob. And these mercs don't seem to have much discipline at all.
benok_other_1.602suulru003.mp3: I'm sick of all their excuses and empty words. I need justice now.
benok_other_1.602suulru005.mp3: Salvagers are the problem. They strip bare the ruins that belong to the people of Dantooine, and then they sell what they find back to us at inflated prices.
benok_other_1.602suulru007.mp3: But I can't farm without my equipment!
benok_other_1.602suulru085.mp3: I understand that the wheels turn slowly on this sort of thing, but my crops are in immediate danger. The salvaging laws on Dantooine are a mess, and in my mind they favor the salvagers.
benok_other_1.602suulru081.mp3: Damned laigreks came out of nowhere, I had to run before they made a meal of me. When I returned to retrieve my equipment, the salvagers had already stripped it bare!
benok_other_1.602suulru083.mp3: He said he'd give it to me for the "bargain" price of 500 credits! I wasn't very happy about it, but the law was on his side. So I paid the scoundrel.
benok_other_1.602suulru084.mp3: Now the moisture vaporator doesn't work because it is mysteriously missing its modulator. Jorran is offering to sell me a modulator he 'found' for another 500 credits.
benok_other_1.602suulru009.mp3: If you could go to the salvager camp and convince the salvager Jorran to return my modulator, I would be very grateful.
benok_other_1.602suulru016.mp3: These 'war trophies' are advanced weapons that some of the Sith troopers had. Heavy ordinance which wouldn't be much good for defending my home.

benok_other_2.302odis009.mp3: Thanks for your help. I'm still looking, too.
benok_other_2.302odis001.mp3: Hey, you look like a spacer. You work at the docks?
benok_other_2.302odis002.mp3: Because if you need a crew, I'm your man. I flew during the Mandalorian Wars, and again during the Jedi Civil War.
benok_other_2.302odis007.mp3: There's no need to be belligerent. I'll leave you alone.
benok_other_2.512dhagon003.mp3: Thanks for getting me out of there. As detention cells go, it had definite class. But I prefer being out on my own all the same.
benok_other_2.512dhagon005.mp3: No, and at this point I don't care. Just glad to be free.
benok_other_2.602suulru077.mp3: Thanks for the help. I plan on going back to the farm shortly.
benok_other_2.602suulru078.mp3: Since you're asking me, I suppose I could. I figure I still owe you for helping me with my thief problem.
benok_other_2.602suulru079.mp3: Zherron has asked me several times before to join the militia. I expect he's going to be very pleased.
benok_other_2.602suulru076.mp3: Suit yourself. As long as the problem is dealt with, I guess I really don't need to know the particulars.
benok_other_2.602suulru075.mp3: With all the troubles we're facing, I'm glad that parasitic mynock got what he deserved.
benok_other_2.602suulru039.mp3: I'm just glad that someone is actually doing something.
benok_other_2.602suulru038.mp3: What do you want to know? If you're really going to help me, I'll tell you anything you want to know about it.
benok_other_2.602suulru035.mp3: I don't suppose you got any help from the Administrator. It seems to me like she's the one that needs help these days.
benok_other_2.602suulru036.mp3: Khoonda hasn't ever done anything to help me. If I ever did return to soldiering, I'd want to do it for something I believed in. No, I'm not interested.
benok_other_2.602suulru001.mp3: {He sounds pretty annoyed in general - he's tired of being given the bureaucratic run-around}Are you waiting for the Administrator, too? You won't have to wait too long. But if you want results - now that you may never get here.
benok_other_2.602suulru027.mp3: Then the Republic gets invaded by those flaming Mandalorians. Then a few years after that the Jedi Civil War. We're lacking in manpower and supplies.
benok_other_2.602suulru029.mp3: Add to that the mercenaries. I feel a certain empathy with them, but that doesn't make them any less of a problem for us.
benok_other_2.602suulru030.mp3: War is brutal, and the Jedi Civil War was worse than most. After that a lot of us veterans didn't even have a home to go to.
benok_other_2.602suulru031.mp3: {This whole node he's trying to explain to an outsider how the war changed the veterans - at the word "lost" he stumbles because there is no perfect word to explain it}Others just got... lost. The war trained us to fight and some of us just wanted to look for the next battle. It was easier than dealing with what was waiting at home.
benok_other_2.602suulru025.mp3: I'm here to get another pat on the back from the Administrator and hear how unfortunate my situation is. That my problem is "important" and they'll get around to it.
benok_other_2.602suulru002.mp3: Khoonda is like a droid without its power cell - useless. We have problems all over, and the most you can get out of the Administrator is a pat on the back.
benok_other_2.602suulru004.mp3: {He sounds unhappy at the prospect of violence - he's not being hot-headed. He's being spitefully pragmatic}I fought in the war, and I know how to use my blaster rifle. If the Administrator or Zherron{zeh-ron} doesn't do something, then I will.
benok_other_2.602suulru022.mp3: What am I supposed to do? Salvagers keep trespassing on my land and stealing my farming equipment. They grab anything they can get a hold of.
benok_other_2.602suulru006.mp3: I'm not a violent man. I've had my share of it in the war. I sincerely hoped I could just hang my blaster rifle on the wall as a souvenir for my grandchildren.
benok_other_2.602suulru020.mp3: It's hard to deal with womp rats when you got a gundark on your back. I believe she'll get around to it, but I think by then it'll be too late.
benok_other_2.602suulru008.mp3: {He starts out considering the offer then gets excited about it in the second sentence}I suppose you could. Actually you almost look like a salvager.
benok_other_2.602suulru010.mp3: I'm not rich, but I have some souvenirs from the war I could give you.
benok_other_2.602suulru019.mp3: At least you're direct about it. The flaming Administrator won't even give me that courtesy.
benok_other_2.602suulru018.mp3: That's great. I'm certainly not getting any help around here. If you need to know anything more, just ask me.
benok_other_2.602suulru017.mp3: I might be able to offer more if you take care of the problem, though. {The tone on the sentence would have a "Please" in it}Can you help me out?
benok_other_2.602suulru013.mp3: It's right next to the ruins of the Jedi Enclave. Just follow the smell. You can't miss them.

benok_irritated.502intgate002.mp3: {Flanked by two guards, it should give the impression that he is being manhandled}This is outrageous! I'm not a spy, I'm a journalist for Iziz Comm.
benok_irritated.502intgate004.mp3: What? Well, you can't be serious? You accuse me of propaganda? I have proof that Vaklu is withholding information on the so called 'Republic-
benok_irritated.502intgate008.mp3: Please, ma'am, help me. Vaklu's troops won't listen. I'm just a journalist, not a spy.
benok_irritated.502intgate030.mp3: This is just because I try and expose the web of lies that-
benok_irritated.502intgate012.mp3: But that's crazy, I was a member of the resistance. I fought in the Mandalorian Wars.
benok_irritated.502intgate007.mp3: Please, sir, help me. Vaklu's troops won't listen. I- I'm just a journalist, not a spy.

czerka.207czerka001.mp3: Corrun Falt, we are under orders to take you into CSD custody.
czerka.207czerka003.mp3: Executive Lorso gave authorization. Now, if you'll come with us, sir.
czerka.207czerka006.mp3: Please, Corrun, let's not make a scene.
czerka.207czerka008.mp3: Sorry about that. We'll clean this up.
czerka.232czerka004.mp3: At last, someone else! Are you... are you part of a rescue team?
czerka.232czerka005.mp3: I'm part of the first Czerka salvage team. I hid here when the turrets and droids went on-line.
czerka.232czerka006.mp3: I haven't been able to reach anyone. You... you are here to get us out of here, yes?
czerka.232czerka008.mp3: I've got some decent salvage. You could have that.
czerka.232czerka011.mp3: You're insane! Get away from me!
czerka.232czerka009.mp3: Here, take it - just get me out of here!
czerka.232czerka013.mp3: {Taken to 231TEL.}Thank you again. I'll wait here for the next freighter.
czerka.203200merc003.mp3: Haven't had much easier contracts than Czerka, though. We spend most of the time standing around. Could use a few more credits, though.
czerka.203200merc002.mp3: A lot of us are tempted to go, though. Azkul might not be a good guy, but for enough credits, any risk is worth it.
czerka.203200merc001.mp3: I hear Azkul's been paying mercenaries to go to Dantooine. Can't figure out why anyone would need mercenaries for a planet full of farmers.
czerka.220tsflead001.mp3: Thank goodness you're here. We just can't seem to make any progress against the Sith line. After they established their position, they brought out their turrets - they've been devastating our numbers.
czerka.220tsflead002.mp3: We've managed to take a few out, but they just keep unloading more of them to replace the destroyed ones.
czerka.220tsflead003.mp3: It's up to you to help us throw them back. We've got to get them cleared out of here, and then we're ready for one last charge.
czerka.220tsflead004.mp3: All right. Everyone, provide covering fire for the Jedi, then advance on the Sith positions.
czerka.220tsflead005.mp3: We'll be right behind you. Good luck.
czerka.222carth002.mp3: Sir, Sith warship dead ahead of us.{Beat, worried} It's attacking Citadel station.
czerka.222carth007.mp3: {GAMEPLAY PROGRAMMER: Switch back to the navigator and Carth camera.}{Worried}Sir, if it keeps firing on Citadel Station, the station won't be able to maintain its orbit...
czerka.301rutum054.mp3: I'm not sure anywhere's going to be safe for you now. I'm laying low for a while, maybe they'll forget about me.
czerka.301rutum053.mp3: Thank you? They'll be after me worse than ever. I'm laying low for a while, maybe they'll forget about me.
czerka.301rutum052.mp3: {Shaking head}It's your life. Me, I'm laying low for a while, maybe they'll forget about me.
czerka.301rutum033.mp3: Hey, thanks. I appreciate you helping me out of that tough spot there. I, uh, can't really pay you the money, or else I would have given it to those thugs.
czerka.301rutum039.mp3: I will, I promise. And I must be doing something right for you to come along and bail me out like you did.
czerka.301rutum038.mp3: Are you serious? All right, but I must be doing something right for you to come along and bail me out like you did.
czerka.301rutum034.mp3: Uh, all right. What'd ya want to know?
czerka.301rutum037.mp3: The bounty hunters don't have any one place where they stick around. Best thing I can tell you is if you want to find one, get a bounty on your head, and then wait.
czerka.301rutum035.mp3: Jedi Master? Are you crazy? There aren't any more Jedi running around, let alone Masters.
czerka.301rutum036.mp3: But you're serious, aren't you? All right - well, look, if I were a Jedi, I'd be where I could help people. As for where that happens on Nar Shaddaa, I have no idea.
czerka.504gn_vsold003.mp3: Queen Talia must die. Vaklu will become King!
czerka.504gn_vsold002.mp3: I've heard that you are the last of the Jedi. If so, we can't lose!
czerka.504gn_vsold001.mp3: Tobin says that you are one of the General's most important allies.
czerka.506gn_vsold004.mp3: If we supported Queen Talia eventually Iziz would just be like every other Republic planet. We need to secede before we lose our culture!
czerka.506gn_vsold003.mp3: The Republic will no longer control our destiny!
czerka.506gn_vsold002.mp3: I knew that General Vaklu would not stay allied with the Sith. I am glad that we are free of them.
czerka.506gn_vsold001.mp3: Thanks for your help. General Vaklu is the rightful ruler of Onderon now.
czerka.511gn_vsold003.mp3: I don't understand why the Sith are here. But I have faith in the General.
czerka.511gn_vsold002.mp3: You're... uh... not a Mandalorian, right?
czerka.511gn_vsold001.mp3: General Vaklu is a brilliant officer. We will triumph this day.
czerka.504ro_brck008.mp3: I hope that you get to the Queen in time.
czerka.504ro_brck004.mp3: Thank you! Vaklu's supporters stormed our position. The beasts... the beasts have gone mad and attack on their command.
czerka.504ro_brck002.mp3: Please - go to the Palace. We received a transmission that the Palace Grounds have been breached. If so, they don't have much time.
czerka.504ro_brck006.mp3: I don't think they've had time, sir. They've been firing the turret non-stop. Vaklu is close to having air superiority now.
czerka.512gen_salv006.mp3: If you find anything of value, it's mine.
czerka.512gen_salv005.mp3: This is my area, go find your own!
czerka.512gen_salv004.mp3: War is coming. That should be good for business.
czerka.512gen_salv003.mp3: I bet the scavengers on the destroyed planets are rich!
czerka.512gen_salv002.mp3: It's not much, but enough to live on.
czerka.605gen_salv006.mp3: I wish someone else besides Daraala{duh-raa-laa} bought salvage. She's a real miser.
czerka.605gen_salv005.mp3: That Zherron{zeh-ron} has the biggest salvage find ever in his office. And he won't let anybody have it!
czerka.605gen_salv003.mp3: I hear the laigreks{LAY-grex} can even talk. They're getting smarter!
czerka.605gen_salv002.mp3: Gerevick{GUERRE-eh-vick} is not someone you should cross. Ever. He's dangerous.
czerka.605gen_salv001.mp3: Taepalae{TAY-puh-LAY} gathered a group to go to the sublevel. They're probably all going to get killed.
czerka.605gen_salv008.mp3: You came back from the sublevels alive! Only been a couple of folks who've done that.
czerka.605gen_salv007.mp3: I hear you saved Jorran{JOE-ron}, not many settlers would help us salvagers. You're all right by me.
czerka.602g_staff006.mp3: I'm leaving this planet the first chance I get. I can't see things ending well for us here.
czerka.602g_staff005.mp3: The settlers don't understand that if Zherron didn't enforce all the laws with the mercenaries, that things would have been even worse.
czerka.602g_staff004.mp3: My brother owed money to Gerevick. He disappeared a week ago.
czerka.602g_staff003.mp3: The kinrath populations are out of control. Everything we try just gets them angrier.
czerka.602g_staff002.mp3: The Administrator's the only hope we have. Without her the settlers would just squabble amongst themselves like they used to.
czerka.602g_staff001.mp3: {He doesn't want to say this too loudly - he's voicing something very unpopular}A lot of people here hate Jedi. But when they were here, they tried helping us. I don't blame them.
czerka.602g_staff007.mp3: I heard what you did for us. Thank you!
czerka.605gen_merc014.mp3: With our new par-{he was about to say "partners" then stops because the PC is there} Heya, outsider. You should leave our camp.
czerka.605gen_merc013.mp3: I'm thinking of "visiting" some of the local settlers. Running low on supplies. Heh.
czerka.605gen_merc012.mp3: That Ithorian in Khoonda is a flaming lucky pazaak player. If he bets for real money he just doesn't lose.
czerka.605gen_merc011.mp3: I get tired of clearing out the kath hounds from our perimeter. The plains are just full of them.
czerka.605gen_merc010.mp3: Gerevick{GUERRE-eh-vick} is dangerous, he dueled a mercenary. {He sounds vaguely frightened}It wasn't even a contest.
czerka.605gen_merc009.mp3: I can't wait for those salvagers to ship off this planet. They smell it up.
czerka.605gen_merc008.mp3: Forget it, outsider. I'm not going to fall for any of your salvager schemes.
czerka.605gen_merc003.mp3: A secret message? What's the message?
czerka.605gen_merc004.mp3: And you came to tell me that? Even *if* you're telling the truth, that doesn't sound like anything important.
czerka.605gen_merc005.mp3: Zherron{zeh-ron} might be playing a joke on you. Or trying to stir trouble over here. I'm not interested in either, outsider.
czerka.605taepalae002.mp3: We're missing Jorran. I don't see Jorran.

czerka_other_1.301rutum051.mp3: Ah, are you crazy? That was Exchange muscle - when they hear about this, they'll come back a dozen strong and tear you limb from limb!
czerka_other_1.301rutum050.mp3: {The player just mind controlled two thugs to kill themselves, frightened}H-how did you do that? S-stay away from me!
czerka_other_1.301rutum001.mp3: {Nervous, being extorted}Please... look, I already paid the Exchange what I have.
czerka_other_1.301rutum004.mp3: Uh... but... I, uh, oh, look here's the one with your credits! About time - look, these gentleman are getting impatient.
czerka_other_1.301rutum024.mp3: {Nervous, being extorted}I already paid them all I had! I don't have anything left!
czerka_other_1.504ro_brck001.mp3: Hold your fire, they're with us!
czerka_other_1.504ro_brck007.mp3: You two, follow the Jedi. The rest of us will hold our position. We don't have much time!
czerka_other_1.605gen_merc015.mp3: Nobody crosses us and lives. You've been warned.
czerka_other_1.605gen_merc006.mp3: Nobody but me and the person you're accusing. {Still dubious but curious what lie the PC will come up with}So what was the message anyway?

mebla.207mebla006.mp3: Hey there. Care for a game of pazaak?
mebla.207mebla010.mp3: Oh, I'm sorry - I'm only here to relax and play. So, you game for a game?
mebla.207mebla007.mp3: Sure thing! Just for fun, or shall we lay some credit down?
mebla.207mebla008.mp3: Let's have a seat and get to it, then!
mebla.207mebla005.mp3: Looks like luck was on my side, this time. Up for another game?
mebla.207mebla004.mp3: Well done! Care to play again?
mebla.207mebla002.mp3: Whew! Three in a row! I suppose my lucky card isn't so lucky anymore.
mebla.207mebla003.mp3: Here - why don't you take it. I think I'll take a break from the game for a time.
mebla.207mebla001.mp3: I'm through with pazaak for a while, friend. I hope that card does better for you than it did for me!
mebla.207mebla011.mp3: No way, I learned my lesson - never play pazaak with droids.
mebla.402om_sc1003.mp3: I hope this mission is worth it to the Colonel. If not-

ondsold.207ondsold001.mp3: Well, if our treasury continues to be sapped for projects like this one, Onderon will be the next dead planet on the Outer Rim.
ondsold.222ondsold001.mp3: This area is secure. We can take it from here.
ondsold.207repsold002.mp3: It was one of the darkest days in our history. Talia sold Onderon to the Republic, and what did we receive in return?
ondsold.207repsold003.mp3: Nothing! In exchange for the blood of our soldiers, the prosperity of Iziz has been stripped to decorate dead planets like this.
ondsold.207repsold005.mp3: And because we accepted the Republic's aid, we should be indentured to them forever?
ondsold.207repsold007.mp3: Perhaps. Only that the Republic did not even conquer us - our own betrayed us and allowed the Republic to take what it would.

czerkag2.203202czerm003.mp3: I'm not crazy about these mercenaries being everywhere, but they're a necessary evil.
czerkag2.203202czerm002.mp3: I wish the Ithorians would take their herdship back to Ithor and let us do our job.
czerkag2.203202czerm001.mp3: Lorso isn't the most popular executive I've worked under, but I'll say one thing - she gets the job done.
czerkag2.203czerkag2001.mp3: Only authorized Czerka personnel are allowed beyond this point.
czerkag2.203czerkag2002.mp3: Hello, B-4D4. If you're here, who's manning the reception desk?
czerkag2.502term_no003.mp3: Didn't I make myself clear? Leave the terminal alone.
czerkag2.502term_no001.mp3: This terminal isn't for offworlders, or civilians for that matter.
czerkag2.511ro_sold001.mp3: A Basilisk? A Basilisk here? Mandalorians are attacking the city!
czerkag2.511ro_sold006.mp3: Talia has made an alliance with the Mandalorians. Men, destroy them!
czerkag2.511ro_sold002.mp3: Vaklu has made an alliance with the Mandalorians. Men, fight for your lives!

czerkag.203203t1n12001.mp3: T1-N1? What are you doing out here? You're not supposed to leave the mainframe. I think someone needs a memory wipe.
czerkag.203czerkag001.mp3: Only authorized Czerka personnel are allowed beyond this point.
czerkag.203czerkag002.mp3: Hello, B-4D4. If you're here, who's manning the reception desk?

azkul.221grenn034.mp3: Lieutenant Grenn, Sith forces have breached the module and are attempting to pen us up in the compound.
azkul.221grenn024.mp3: You were looking for me, Grenn?
azkul.221grenn026.mp3: Sounds like you need someone to punch a hole for you.
azkul.221grenn028.mp3: All right then. You'll have one Sith-sized hole coming up. Let's go, boys.
azkul.601azkul007.mp3: They're falling before us like herdbeasts to the slaughter. Still, a lesson must be taught about resistance. Kill every one.
azkul.601azkul006.mp3: We must accomplish our objective. We won't be made fools by these backworld slime. Kill anyone who crosses your path.
azkul.601azkul001.mp3: {forceful, ordering}Tell me what you see, soldier.
azkul.601azkul003.mp3: {Almost to himself}They've been warned. {Maliciously certain}It won't be of any use. The plan doesn't change. Captains, prepare your men.
azkul.601azkul004.mp3: {barking orders}Their "leader", Administrator Terena{tah-REE-nah}, must not survive the battle. Everything else is secondary to that objective.
azkul.601azkul049.mp3: {forceful}Are you ready? I won't wait long for you.
azkul.601azkul063.mp3: {severe}I'm not your friend, Jedi. If you're looking for stories, go read a datapad.
azkul.601azkul062.mp3: You don't need to know. Suffice it to say, people much more powerful than you or I are paying a great deal of credits to have the job done.
azkul.601azkul060.mp3: You will be paid generously after you've done your part and we've taken Khoonda.
azkul.601azkul061.mp3: [Failure] {He sounds mocking}Is that supposed to convince me, Jedi? I was trained by the Sith. Your mind tricks won't work on me.
azkul.601azkul050.mp3: {down to business}Good. I will deploy men to surround Khoonda and attack all three entrances.
azkul.601azkul051.mp3: [Success] Okay. Which entrance is their weakest?
azkul.601azkul056.mp3: [Failure] {He sounds mocking}Your mind tricks won't work on me, Jedi. I was trained by the Sith. {matter of fact}You're trying to lure me into a trap.
azkul.601azkul059.mp3: I won't give you the opportunity to stab me in the back.
azkul.601azkul058.mp3: [Success] {forceful}Fine. But I don't need lessons in tactics from a Jedi. Move out men! {[Gameplay Programmer: Azkul's mercs walk towards Khoonda and disappear off camera. Akzul is still talking to the player.]}
azkul.601azkul057.mp3: [Success] Okay. Which entrance is their weakest?
azkul.601azkul055.mp3: [Failure] {acid, condescending}I don't need lessons in tactics from a Jedi. Move out men! {[Gameplay Programmer: Azkul's mercs walk towards Khoonda and disappear off camera. Akzul is still talking to the player.]}
azkul.601azkul052.mp3: {ordering}You heard the Jedi. Move out men!{[Gameplay Programmer: Azkul's mercs walk towards Khoonda and disappear off camera. Akzul is still talking to the player.]}
azkul.601azkul053.mp3: {forceful}Come on, Jedi. You're leading the first wave.
azkul.601azkul054.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer.  Merc attack begins.  Player chooses to fight for the mercenaries or fight for the militia].}
azkul.601azkul070.mp3: Fine. What are you expecting, a reward? You'll get your payment when you see the job through to the end.
azkul.601azkul071.mp3: The only thing I'm interested in hearing from you is that you are ready for us to begin our assault.
azkul.601azkul025.mp3: {Very intimidating, unfriendly voice - this is the leader of a cutthroat band of mercenaries}You are the Jedi I've heard reports of. And I am Azkul, leader of the mercenaries on Dantooine.
azkul.601azkul048.mp3: That is correct. And I want you to help me.
azkul.601azkul026.mp3: {even}Straight to the point. I like that. {dead serious}I will be equally direct.
azkul.601azkul027.mp3: {dead serious}I am planning to take Khoonda, {almost a threat}and you're going to help me.
azkul.601azkul047.mp3: You don't need to know the details. But I can tell you there are a lot of credits involved.
azkul.601azkul028.mp3: According to my reports, I have four times as many soldiers as the militia, and I am committed to taking Khoonda.
azkul.601azkul029.mp3: It is inevitable that I will succeed. If you wish to avoid my men eradicating the people of Dantooine, you will make it easier for me to take Khoonda.
azkul.601azkul030.mp3: Of course, I will pay well for your services.
azkul.601azkul041.mp3: {Threatening}You'd better reconsider. I can't have a Jedi interfering with my plans. There is a considerable bounty on your kind that I will collect on unless you're working for me.
azkul.601azkul044.mp3: Men, I trust you can handle this Jedi?
azkul.601azkul031.mp3: There are many ways someone with your abilities can aid us. Before the action begins, I have two main tasks in mind for you: disable the gun turrets and the traps.
azkul.601azkul035.mp3: Return to me when you when you are ready for us to begin our assault. I warn you not to keep me waiting.
azkul.601azkul034.mp3: When the militia learns of our attack, they will plant traps around the entrances to Khoonda. Disable them.
azkul.601azkul032.mp3: Deal with the turrets however you see fit. Just keep them from pestering my men.
azkul.601azkul033.mp3: Decide quickly. I have a slaughter to plan.
azkul.602azkul029.mp3: Good. This Jedi will fetch a good bounty. Master Vrook will soon be enjoying the hospitality of Nar Shaddaa.
azkul.602azkul040.mp3: You're free to go, Jedi. Just don't cause any trouble for us, or I will collect on that bounty.
azkul.602azkul043.mp3: {Player just finished killing Vrook and draining him dry}You should have let him live. He would have fetched a fine price on Nar Shaddaa.
azkul.602azkul030.mp3: {severe, cruel}Now if you'll excuse me. I have a date with the Administrator, and I'm dressed to kill.{evil laugh}
azkul.602azkul031.mp3: {gloating}Khoonda is ours, thanks in part to your assistance. Here, take your reward, Jedi.
azkul.602azkul038.mp3: Your moral dilemma is none of my concern.
azkul.602azkul037.mp3: You deserve more credits. You'll get fifty percent more.
azkul.602azkul036.mp3: [Failure] Pathetic, Jedi. Try your mind tricks on weak-minded fools like yourself. Take these credits and go!
azkul.602azkul035.mp3: I don't see why I should give you more credits.
azkul.602azkul034.mp3: [Failure] I'm already giving you more than you deserve. Take it and go!
azkul.602azkul033.mp3: [Success] Fine, greedy Jedi. You'll get fifty percent more. Take it and go!
azkul.602azkul009.mp3: {Voice filled with menace}So, Jedi. I take it you are responsible for the surprises we've had during this battle.
azkul.602azkul010.mp3: Stand aside. {He's about to kill the Administrator - so his tone is ironic when referring to her}Our quarrel is with the distinguished Administrator. This isn't your problem.
azkul.602azkul022.mp3: Sensible. I will order my men to leave you be. Now if you'll excuse me.
azkul.602azkul024.mp3: I was going to make it a painless death. But you've been much more difficult than you had to be. Now you're going to pay.
azkul.602azkul016.mp3: We could kill you. But I think you'd slaughter at least four of my men. Recruitment fees are 250 credits per man.
azkul.602azkul017.mp3: So 1000 credits for us to avoid the hassle of replacing those men. Do we have a deal?
azkul.602azkul021.mp3: This is going nowhere. You could've lived.
azkul.602azkul019.mp3: You look capable for a Jedi. Fine. A full squad of eight, then. 2000 credits.
azkul.602azkul020.mp3: That was my final offer, Jedi. Let's see the value of your boasts.
azkul.602azkul018.mp3: That isn't a possibility. This is going nowhere. You could've lived.
azkul.602azkul015.mp3: She's inconvenient and doesn't know the chain of command. She will pay for that.
azkul.602azkul013.mp3: Then you've allied with these flaming settlers. The galaxy doesn't tolerate weakness.
azkul.602azkul014.mp3: I was trained at Malak's academy. Your tricks won't work on me. You're just another dead Jedi to me.
azkul.602azkul027.mp3: I was wondering when you would betray me, Dopak. I'll send your final wages to your children, along with a detonator.
azkul.602azkul012.mp3: You have no idea who you're talking to. I was going to spare your worthless life. I see I was in error.
azkul.602azkul011.mp3: [Failure] Is that supposed to convince me, Jedi? I was trained by the Sith. My unit killed many Jedi.
azkul.602azkul025.mp3: I'll give you one last chance. Leave the Administrator to her fate.

ondlead.221ondlead008.mp3: Other than the Sith attack? Look out the window!
ondlead.221ondlead009.mp3: For some reason, the Sith decided that razing Telos to the ground wasn't enough. I don't know why they're here, but they seem pretty determined to destroy Citadel Station.
ondlead.221ondlead001.mp3: These TSF officers are ill-equipped to handle the threat of the Sith. It is lucky General Vaklu dispatched us.
ondlead.221ondlead002.mp3: Indeed. General Vaklu was eager for revenge for the Sith betrayal.
ondlead.221ondlead003.mp3: I led a moderate sized group of shock troops, who are currently making their way to the fuel containment systems in the station's Urban module.
ondlead.221ondlead004.mp3: My men have ran into some significant Sith resistance, however. If you're heading that way, they could use a hand.
ondlead.221ondlead005.mp3: The Sith are trying to sabotage the control system, to crash Citadel Station into the ground. If that happens, there won't be anything left to save.
ondlead.221ondlead006.mp3: All right, but remember. If they fail, you'd better hope you're not on the station. It's a long drop to the surface.

riiken.221riiken015.mp3: This is probably not the best time for idle conversation.
riiken.221riiken016.mp3: We received a distress call from Citadel Station about a Sith attack, requesting assistance. Because of the relative unimportance of the planet, there's not much in the way of defenses.
riiken.221riiken017.mp3: Queen Talia was quick to realize that it would be wise not to let the Sith establish a foothold in the Rim, so she dispatched the troops she could spare to assist.
riiken.221riiken001.mp3: So we meet again! I hardly expected to see you again here of all places.
riiken.221riiken013.mp3: That you do! But also a talent to take care of it, from my experience.
riiken.221riiken014.mp3: But really, I must thank you. I'm a Captain no longer. Queen Talia saw fit to promote me to Major in thanks for my service.
riiken.221riiken002.mp3: Major, actually. And I have you to thank. Queen Talia saw fit to promote me for my service.
riiken.221riiken003.mp3: When the TSF sent out a distress call, I gladly volunteered to lead a strike force.
riiken.221riiken004.mp3: My troops have already gone ahead and infiltrated the Urban Module. From their last transmission, they are almost to the TSF station.
riiken.221riiken011.mp3: It's a possibility, but right now, we need them to stop the Sith from sabotaging the fuel control systems.
riiken.221riiken012.mp3: If the Sith succeed, it won't matter what we do, Citadel Station won't be able to stay in orbit.
riiken.221riiken005.mp3: Lieutenant Grenn informed me that the Sith are attempting to sabotage the fuel control systems, which would take the station out of orbit.
riiken.221riiken006.mp3: At the moment, that seemed to be the most pressing need.
riiken.221riiken007.mp3: The TSF do their jobs well, but they are not professional soldiers. They're not properly equipped to deal with this.
riiken.221riiken008.mp3: My men have come under heavy attack in the Urban Module and taken some casualties. If they can't accomplish their mission, we'll be in some trouble.
riiken.221riiken009.mp3: In that case, if you find my men and they are in need of assistance, please help them.
riiken.221riiken010.mp3: All right, but remember. If they fail, there won't be anything left to save.
riiken.502mp_riike090.mp3: The men will be working on getting Dhagon Ghent out right away. The major sure isn't happy.
riiken.502mp_riike093.mp3: Great job, Nikko. Without you, I'm pretty sure that the doctor would still be behind bars. And thanks for your leg work, off-worlder.
riiken.502mp_riike098.mp3: If you head over to Dhagon Ghent's office, some men will bring him there shortly.
riiken.502mp_riike099.mp3: Thanks for clearing this whole thing up, I could tell that justice wasn't being served. But we all have our orders.
riiken.502mp_riike095.mp3: The investigation has been handled at the highest levels. I've heard that there's been some... concern about that.
riiken.502mp_riike096.mp3: With Dhagon free, I don't know if the investigation team will find another suspect. They haven't been as diligent as other investigators.
riiken.502mp_riike097.mp3: I'm not gonna say any more. Probably said too much already.
riiken.502mp_riike092.mp3: You're quite a team. Together you got the major to back down. That's no small feat.
riiken.502mp_riike091.mp3: {Nikko's thanks is an after thought}You handled that just right, off-worlder. Dhagon owes you a great deal. And you, too, Nikko.
riiken.502mp_riike087.mp3: I've seen it myself, major. Nikko isn't the only one that spotted Dhagon coming from his office. It really can't be Dhagon Ghent.
riiken.502mp_riike088.mp3: The real killer is still loose.
riiken.506va_capt007.mp3: And I told you that I don't know. You scanned my ID, you know my post is the Merchant Quarter.

om_sc2.402om_sc2001.mp3: Set the staging camp up here. This jungle just never ends.
om_sc2.402om_sc2003.mp3: Two more? Nothing is worth this.
om_sc2.502mp_riike062.mp3: We really need to patrol that sector better.
om_sc2.502mp_riike069.mp3: I had nothing to do with this, sir. This citizen found information about Captain Sullio's murder. It's material to the investigation.
om_sc2.502mp_riike065.mp3: Back again, off-worlder? I'm sure you have a starport visa. If I were you I'd leave before too many more beast cages are stacked in the streets.
om_sc2.502mp_riike066.mp3: Actually, I wasn't tell you about it before. Like I said, I was warned by command to keep my opinions to myself.
om_sc2.502mp_riike063.mp3: It's the off-worlder. Listen, let's keep this brief. I've probably lost my command already because of the conversation we had.
om_sc2.502mp_riike064.mp3: I don't see how it could get worse, but the galaxy has a funny sense of humor about that.
om_sc2.502mp_riike057.mp3: Nikko, is it? And the off-worlder. What brings the two of you here?
om_sc2.502mp_riike058.mp3: That's a bold statement. I assume you have some sort of proof.
om_sc2.502mp_riike061.mp3: That should do it. We still don't know who killed Sullio, but this will greatly assist our investigation.
om_sc2.502mp_riike002.mp3: Welcome to what must be the smelliest place in the universe, off-worlder. How can I assist you?
om_sc2.502mp_riike031.mp3: These are troubled times. You've probably heard that General Vaklu and Queen Talia are having some... disagreements.
om_sc2.502mp_riike032.mp3: I've been warned from command to keep my opinions to myself on that. So I've learned my lesson and am going to keep my mouth shut.
om_sc2.502mp_riike033.mp3: Ask around, though, there are plenty of people who'd like nothing more to talk about it.
om_sc2.502mp_riike039.mp3: {First sentence is speaking to taunting subordinate}I don't think so. I know you'd like nothing better than me getting drummed out of the military. But I'm not going to say a word.
om_sc2.502mp_riike049.mp3: [Failure] It's not that simple. Soldiers are guardians. We protect people. But if they get too political then it enters dangerous territory. It can even lead to a coup d'etat.
om_sc2.502mp_riike051.mp3: The only thing I'm implying is that it's my duty as a soldier to keep politics at home. On the job I respect the rank and the chain of command.
om_sc2.502mp_riike055.mp3: [Failure] If that's the way you feel, then we don't have much to talk about.
om_sc2.502mp_riike054.mp3: Strength? It's not about strength. The military is being corrupted by the General. If those faithful to the Queen don't steer clear of Vaklu's kath hou-
om_sc2.502mp_riike052.mp3: [Failure] I'm doing what I feel is right. Are you? That's something that each person has to answer for themself.
om_sc2.502mp_riike053.mp3: This topic is leading nowhere except for trouble for me. So help a guy out? Let's talk about something else.
om_sc2.502mp_riike047.mp3: [Failure] I - I don't think I will. You've got a strange way with words, off-worlder. But I'd rather keep my job.
om_sc2.502mp_riike048.mp3: Gladly, this is a topic I'd much rather avoid.
om_sc2.502mp_riike040.mp3: [Success] What I really mean? General Vaklu... Vaklu may be a war hero, but everything he's done since the war has been poison for us - and the Republic.
om_sc2.502mp_riike041.mp3: There are rumors, always spoken quietly, that he has made alliances with dark powers. Things worse than the Freedon Nadd movement from our past. I think-
om_sc2.502mp_riike043.mp3: Can't you see it? He's slick with words, but Vaklu's inner circle are responsible for dark deeds. Anyone that speaks out against him is labeled a Rebel spy.
om_sc2.502mp_riike044.mp3: You think the Republic needs a few hundred spies in Iziz? Most "spies" are picked up in raids and never heard from again. It's just wrong.
om_sc2.502mp_riike046.mp3: {He sounds pretty miserable}I don't know how much more help I'll be... I won't be in the military too much longer.
om_sc2.502mp_riike036.mp3: The politics of the day is probably the most talked about subject in the city. And everyone wants to share their particular view of what's going on.
om_sc2.502mp_riike037.mp3: Opinions are like gizka around here, they breed like mad.
om_sc2.502mp_riike034.mp3: Times are too complex for a simple soldier like myself. Sometimes I made the mistake of answering questions honestly.
om_sc2.502mp_riike035.mp3: If you say anything bad about a superior officer they call that disrespecting the rank. Do that too many times and it's not long before you're a civilian.
om_sc2.502mp_riike030.mp3: We've covered that already. And as much as I'd like to, I'm not going to talk to you about it any more.
om_sc2.502mp_riike016.mp3: That's an Air Defense Tower. The city is filled with them. Iziz is an ancient city, and for many generations our main enemy was the beast-riders that lived outside the city.
om_sc2.502mp_riike017.mp3: Towers like these were built to protect us against drexl and their beast-riders.
om_sc2.502mp_riike026.mp3: About fifty years ago Princess Galia married one of the great leaders of the beast-riders Oron Kira. That was right at the start of the Beast Wars.
om_sc2.502mp_riike027.mp3: By the end of it Galia was crowned Queen and finally there was peace between our people.
om_sc2.502mp_riike028.mp3: It's hard to put aside centuries of conflict. There's uneasiness between our people. The beast-riders are upset that General Vaklu has forbidden drexl in Iziz.
om_sc2.502mp_riike029.mp3: Citizens usually only see the fallen beast-riders, who are no better than thugs.
om_sc2.502mp_riike020.mp3: That's a long story. You sure you have the time? Most people don't care for an old soldier spinning a tale or two.
om_sc2.502mp_riike025.mp3: I don't blame you. My grandson gives me that same kind of look when I start getting too long-winded. So what do you want to talk about?
om_sc2.502mp_riike021.mp3: Someone else who likes history, huh? Alright, Iziz was formed pretty much at the dawn of our civilization. It was born out of necessity.
om_sc2.502mp_riike022.mp3: It protected us from the dangerous beasts that litter Onderon. This city is as old as our civilization. Most of our technology was invented to fortify these walls and protect us.
om_sc2.502mp_riike023.mp3: For ages our worst criminals were cast out of the city to an almost certain death. It wasn't completely certain, though. Some of the criminals figured out how to survive out there.
om_sc2.502mp_riike024.mp3: They learned how to tame the native beasts, and it wasn't long before they turned their attention to Iziz.
om_sc2.502mp_riike018.mp3: A drexl is a flying beast. Huge creatures with teeth the size of your arms. Lethal and skin like ferrosteel plates. Somehow the beast-riders figured out how to tame them years ago.
om_sc2.502mp_riike019.mp3: Certainly. Things are quiet right now, I have some time. What do you want to talk about?
om_sc2.502mp_riike014.mp3: Ithorians have been buying them to help rebuild Telos. I don't know why, but ever since they started the beast-riders have been crawling out of the woodworks to sell them animals.
om_sc2.502mp_riike015.mp3: But the Republic blockade has meant long delays. And because of that beast cages are filling up the streets of Iziz.
om_sc2.502mp_riike004.mp3: We certainly do. He and several other people were picked up in connection to a murder.
om_sc2.502mp_riike013.mp3: What else do you want to know about?
om_sc2.502mp_riike005.mp3: Captain Sullio. She was in charge of the Starport checkpoint. A good soldier. Your friend was one of the last people that saw her alive.
om_sc2.502mp_riike006.mp3: So far he's just a suspect. But if he did it... the punishment is death.
om_sc2.502mp_riike012.mp3: He's staying in custody until we either eliminate him as a suspect or find the real killer. Dhagon has quite a record with the authorities. The Colonel thinks that murder isn't too far a stretch for someone like him.
om_sc2.502mp_riike008.mp3: Until we either eliminate him as a suspect or find the real killer. Dhagon has quite a record with the authorities. The Colonel thinks that murder isn't too far a stretch for someone like him.
om_sc2.502mp_riike010.mp3: I know Dhagon personally. He's one of the worst doctors I've ever heard of. But I can't see him deliberately killing someone. He was one of the last people seen with Captain Sullio in the cantina.
om_sc2.502mp_riike011.mp3: Ask around there. I've heard he's got a good motive for killing her. If you can somehow clear that up and prove it wasn't him, command will cut him loose. If I say any more I'll get in trouble.
om_sc2.502mp_riike009.mp3: No way. We're under orders to make sure no one sees the murder suspects. Command is taking this very seriously.
om_sc2.502mp_riike003.mp3: We've already talked about that. If I say anything more, they could strip me of command. You're on your own.
om_sc2.502mp_riike001.mp3: Those damned turrets are going crazy!
om_sc2.506mp_riike091.mp3: Now all that's left is to get to the throne room. There is another security terminal on the other side of the Palace.
om_sc2.506mp_riike092.mp3: Both of them have to be used to open the throne room's doors.
om_sc2.506mp_riike093.mp3: We need to hurry to save the Queen!
om_sc2.506mp_riike090.mp3: Security terminal taken care of, I take it? With you on our side, I think we may have a chance in this war after all.
om_sc2.506mp_riike088.mp3: Take care of the security terminal. Then we can head out of here.
om_sc2.506mp_riike089.mp3: Do it quickly, they may send reinforcements here.
om_sc2.506mp_riike081.mp3: Thank you! Now that you've got me out, you need to get the primary security console's override code then lock the terminal down.
om_sc2.506mp_riike082.mp3: Once you've got that code, if you can get to the secondary security station you'll control the entire Palace's security systems.
om_sc2.506mp_riike087.mp3: The slicer is still logged in to his account. You should be able to just get whatever you need.
om_sc2.506mp_riike083.mp3: {Impressed by PC's competence}You have? You don't waste a minute. Captain Kadron will open the doors to Vaklu and Tobin any moment, then.
om_sc2.506mp_riike085.mp3: We've got to let Captain Kadron in the other wing know that the primary security terminal has been disabled.
om_sc2.506mp_riike086.mp3: If you'll take me as far as the throne room, I can wait there for you to talk to Kadron.
om_sc2.506mp_riike084.mp3: Let's head to the throne room right away!
om_sc2.506mp_riike080.mp3: The security console has to be able to disable this force cage. Just look through its menus.
om_sc2.506mp_riike078.mp3: {The last sentence is delivered in a jovial - "You really deserve it" sort of way}The Queen has requested you stay here until she gets back. I imagine you'll get some sort of reward.
om_sc2.506mp_riike079.mp3: Talk with Master Kavar. She shouldn't take too long.
om_sc2.506mp_riike068.mp3: {Very thankful in his tone, but also surprised to be rescued again}You, again? Seems you've made a habit out of cleaning up our messes.
om_sc2.506mp_riike069.mp3: I don't suppose you could help a fellow out here. If you've ever been in one of these, you know they aren't too comfortable.
om_sc2.506mp_riike076.mp3: I really didn't have much to tell them. If they wanted the override codes only Captain Kadron has those.
om_sc2.506mp_riike077.mp3: I don't want to sound too repetitious, but about this force cage...
om_sc2.506mp_riike075.mp3: That's just great. Don't put yourself through too much trouble. I can catch up on some thinking I need to do.
om_sc2.506mp_riike072.mp3: The primary security console for the Royal Palace is just over there. It controls the force cage.
om_sc2.506mp_riike073.mp3: I think that slicer is still logged in. So you should have full access to everything.
om_sc2.506mp_riike074.mp3: If you could hurry, it's been a long day.
om_sc2.506mp_riike070.mp3: You don't need to tell me about that. Thanks for coming. Vaklu's troops aren't very good hosts.
om_sc2.506mp_riike071.mp3: If you could get me out of here, I'd be doubly thankful. Should be pretty easy to do.

zherron.221zherron003.mp3: If you want to get through to the eastern part of the module, you'd better get going.
zherron.221zherron001.mp3: All right, men. The Sith are trying to hole us up in this compound. We need to break through, or our reinforcements won't be able to move out.
zherron.221zherron002.mp3: Now let's punch a hole in this Sith barricade!
zherron.601zherron040.mp3: {He doesn't think the player purposefully screwed up - just that he's as bad a speaker as Zherron}I'm no speaker... But I don't think that helped much. That's the way the militia acts every time I give a speech, too.{[Gameplay Programmer: Apply a penalty to the attack and hit of the militia squads]}
zherron.601zherron039.mp3: I was expecting something more, but you did better than I ever have. You reminded me of my instructor in the Mandalorian Wars.
zherron.601zherron038.mp3: You're much better with words than me. I think it'll really help.
zherron.601zherron037.mp3: {He's taken aback by the PC's eloquence}I don't have the words. That was really something. I think any one of them would take a blaster bolt for you now.
zherron.601zherron029.mp3: That's about it. Now we just need to dig in and wait for the mercs to come.
zherron.601zherron034.mp3: {Grim determination}Let's get ready for the mercenaries. If we fall here, all of Dantooine falls with us.
zherron.601zherron032.mp3: Afraid not. We don't have much time. We got reports that Azkul is almost ready.
zherron.601zherron030.mp3: Well, I'll tell them what's there to do. I'm not much for words.
zherron.601zherron031.mp3: [Success] All right, I'll assemble the men. {Sounds a little uncertain about all this}I hope you can speak good.
zherron.601zherron009.mp3: The security door on the side.
zherron.601zherron010.mp3: And the garage door in back.
zherron.601zherron011.mp3: We got three squads of militia. We can assign people to the front, back, or inside. Backside has to guard two entrances. The front will have to fight more people.
zherron.601zherron012.mp3: And the inside will have to deal with any that break through.
zherron.601zherron013.mp3: So... where do you think the first squad should be deployed?
zherron.601zherron036.mp3: All right, you take one squad and defend the front entrance. I'll take another and guard the back. One we'll park outside the Administrator's office.
zherron.601zherron016.mp3: The battles that had the least dying were always led by Jedi. I'm gonna go with what you think.
zherron.601zherron017.mp3: Where do you want the second squad?
zherron.601zherron035.mp3: I'll assign the rest of the positions. I'll take the back, you take the front.
zherron.601zherron021.mp3: Where do you want the third squad, the new recruits?
zherron.601zherron024.mp3: Fine by me. The last question is, where do you want to go? Either the front or the back. I'll take whichever one you don't. That way both sides have leadership.
zherron.601zherron027.mp3: {He almost seems like he wants to overrule the player}The back? I... suppose that there is more ground to cover with the two entrances. All right, I'll take the front.
zherron.601zherron028.mp3: Once the fighting starts you got to stay in your area. We both have to guard our half of the battlefield. Come over to me, and the mercs will just charge straight into Khoonda.
zherron.601zherron026.mp3: That's what I was thinking, too. The main group of mercenaries will be coming through there. Probably be good to put our best soldier there.
zherron.601zherron025.mp3: Once either one of us clears the area of mercs, we'll both be heading inside to guard the Administrator.
zherron.601zherron022.mp3: First squad is the most experienced. The only squad that could go blaster to blaster against the mercs. Second squad has a lot of passion, but no experience.
zherron.601zherron023.mp3: Third squad is fresh recruits and not trained too well and they may break in combat. They need a good leader to make them effective.
zherron.601zherron018.mp3: First squad is the most experienced. The only squad that could go blaster to blaster against the mercs. Second squad has a lot of passion, but no experience.
zherron.601zherron019.mp3: Third squad is fresh recruits and not trained too well and they may break in combat. They need a good leader to make them effective.
zherron.601zherron014.mp3: First squad is the most experienced. The only squad that could go blaster to blaster against the mercs. Second squad has a lot of passion, but no experience.
zherron.601zherron015.mp3: Third squad is new and not trained too well and they may break in combat. They need a good leader to make them effective.
zherron.601zherron001.mp3: I imagine that the mercenaries have got two goals in this whole thing. Kill me and kill the administrator. The rest of the settlers won't have courage to resist if they succeed.
zherron.601zherron002.mp3: It's not that the settlers aren't good people. Many folk just don't have the fighting mentality. They'd rather just make people happy and get along.
zherron.601zherron003.mp3: But there isn't any getting along with Azkul, he's out for blood and taking the place over. So we got to protect the Administrator. Khoonda can go on without me, but not without her.
zherron.601zherron004.mp3: The Administrator's locked up in her office tight. Which means that the mercs have to go through us and Khoonda's defenses.
zherron.601zherron006.mp3: It isn't gonna be easy. I suspect we're gonna have to fight on the inside.
zherron.601zherron007.mp3: They've got three entrances they're gonna to try and break in.
zherron.601zherron005.mp3: Thanks to you, they're gonna have a tougher job.
zherron.601zherron049.mp3: We've lost too many soldiers. Fall back inside!{[Gameplay Programmer: cutaway shows Zherron and his remaining troops entering Khoonda through his entrance.]}
zherron.601zherron041.mp3: {[Gameplay Programmer: If the player starts the battle by talking to Azkul, the player arrives with a squad of mercenaries as part of the first wave]}I can't believe you've betrayed us. Terena was wrong for trusting a Jedi.
zherron.601zherron048.mp3: Then I will ensure that your reasons go to the grave with you.
zherron.601zherron047.mp3: You are despicable. Even if you make it past me, Master Vrook will bring you to justice!
zherron.601zherron046.mp3: I must admit, you had me worried there. Men, protect our Jedi ally!{[Gameplay programmer: the battle begins with the player in the middle of a group of hostile mercenaries. Friendly Zherron and militia rush into battle]}
zherron.601zherron042.mp3: That was a pretty speech, but it changes nothing. We will fight to defend our homes!
zherron.602zherron029.mp3: It's you again. Well, you know who I am. I figure you've got a reason for coming back.
zherron.602zherron030.mp3: {This is almost his tag-line, the PC will hear it many times. So this should sound like this is an incredibly common line for him}You want something?
zherron.602zherron075.mp3: You really should talk to Berun about general questions.
zherron.602zherron081.mp3: I don't have anything to say about that.
zherron.602zherron080.mp3: It's our home. Might be the start of an honest capital some day. Right now it's not much more than a swoop bike stop.
zherron.602zherron077.mp3: She's smart. She gets things done. The whole place would fall apart without her. Dantooine isn't the center of much of anything.
zherron.602zherron078.mp3: Our most talented people sometimes leave. Hard for someone to stay a farmer when they have the itch to do something greater.
zherron.602zherron079.mp3: So we're lucky the Administrator never went elsewhere. I bet she'd make a decent Senator even.
zherron.602zherron076.mp3: There aren't more than a dozen of us, and there's too many problems. People keep hoping that the Republic sends help, but we got to help ourselves.
zherron.602zherron074.mp3: We've already talked about that. I don't have anything more to say about it.
zherron.602zherron057.mp3: {He's highly suspicious}He did, did he? What's this about?
zherron.602zherron073.mp3: {Almost a snort at the beginning}I know people, and that isn't like Berun{beh-ROON}. I have no patience for people like you. We're not going to talk about this again.
zherron.602zherron072.mp3: I know we don't agree on this, but he's crossing a line. He lives in his sheltered settler world. He doesn't know what some people are capable of.
zherron.602zherron058.mp3: {He's more animated here than almost ever - it should make the PC think does he have a personal grudge with mercs?}You can't compromise with those people. They're like mynocks on a power converter, sucking the life out of us.
zherron.602zherron059.mp3: {He doesn't sound thankful at all to the PC}So he's asked you to go looking into what I'm up to? If I didn't need every last man here...
zherron.602zherron071.mp3: Maybe later. I have to think about some things.
zherron.602zherron070.mp3: {He sounds disgusted by the player}No chance at all.
zherron.602zherron068.mp3: {Subdued but vaguely hostile}Not your concern. This is something you should just stay out of.
zherron.602zherron067.mp3: [Failure] {He knows the PC is lieing}I'm sure that's what you believe.
zherron.602zherron066.mp3: [Failure] I appreciate the offer. There are things I need help with. This isn't one of them.
zherron.602zherron065.mp3: [Success] I appreciate... {He was about to turn the PC down, but changes his mind}hmm... All right, I can use your help. But you can't tell anyone.
zherron.602zherron064.mp3: [Failure] I appreciate the offer. There are things I need help with. This isn't one of them.
zherron.602zherron060.mp3: [Success] I appreciate... {He was about to turn the PC down, but changes his mind}hmm... All right, I can use your help. But you can't tell anyone.
zherron.602zherron061.mp3: There's a mercenary captain near what's left of the Jedi Enclave's Courtyard. His name is Dopak{DOE-pak}. Just tell him that I said "go ahead." That's all.
zherron.602zherron062.mp3: You have questions, but it's like this conversation never happened, got it? Just do it. It'll help out Khoonda{COON-da}.
zherron.602zherron052.mp3: Some of the salvagers went deep into the ruins and found a lot of Jedi relics. It's the most valuable haul the salvagers ever got.
zherron.602zherron053.mp3: But all the salvagers that went down there are dead. So it seems every day or so some salvager comes claiming they're owed by such and such, or that they're related.
zherron.602zherron054.mp3: The whole thing makes me sick. Gerevick says he won the whole claim in a pazaak game with the last survivor... right before he killed him.
zherron.602zherron055.mp3: But that was a fair fight. There were witnesses. But nobody remembers Gerevick ever playing pazaak.
zherron.602zherron056.mp3: I just hope someone takes this blasted claim off my hands. I'm tired of those low-lives pestering me. We've got real work to do.
zherron.602zherron045.mp3: I'll tell you what I tell all those grubby salvagers - no body, no claim. I'm no longer even looking at wills or credit notes. And if you think that's gruesome, then go space yourself.
zherron.602zherron051.mp3: The Enclave sublevel is dangerous. I'd stay out of there if I were you. Going after those bodies isn't worth it.
zherron.602zherron046.mp3: {He sounds almost happy}Let me see the will. I'll be glad to get rid of this claim and get those salvagers out of my headquarters.
zherron.602zherron049.mp3: Let me see... He left his claim to you? How'd he even...? You know, at this point I don't even care. I'll have one of the militia get the claim for you.
zherron.602zherron050.mp3: Here's your claim. I'll go let the salvagers know that it's been taken care of. Hopefully this is the last I hear of it.
zherron.602zherron047.mp3: He left all his possessions to one of the other dead salvagers? Will I ever get rid of that damn Jedi garbage? I guess nobody gets them now.
zherron.602zherron048.mp3: {He sounds miserable at the end}The Administrator will have to figure out what happens to them. And until then the salvagers are going to keep bothering me.
zherron.602zherron043.mp3: So you did. Here's the credits I told you about. Even with the caves cleared I imagine it'll take some time before the kinrath aren't on the plains.
zherron.602zherron044.mp3: {He sounds moderately thankful - but he isn't prone to display much emotion at all}That was very helpful of you. You've saved some lives today.
zherron.602zherron031.mp3: {Honest appraisal}I've seen a lot of visitors come through Khoonda{COON-da}. You're the first one in awhile that looks the capable sort.
zherron.602zherron032.mp3: We have a small problem with kinrath. Maybe you've already seen some of them. They're coming from a cave on the Khoonda Plains.
zherron.602zherron033.mp3: I'd take care of it myself, but there aren't many people in the militia. We'd lose too many men. There's a reward if you do it.
zherron.602zherron039.mp3: We used some explosives to seal the cave a couple years back. Just made them angrier. They burrowed another entrance even closer to us.
zherron.602zherron040.mp3: I know there are crystals in there, too. Some of the salvagers once thought about going in there to get some extra credits. Too many kinrath, though.
zherron.602zherron041.mp3: Cave is on the southeast side of the plains. Shouldn't be hard to find.
zherron.602zherron038.mp3: [Failure] I agree with you. But I don't barter. I've got more important things to do.
zherron.602zherron036.mp3: {He doesn't beat around the bush - it's clear in his tone he isn't sure the PC could handle them}Very. The kinrath you see on the plains aren't as tough as the ones inside the caves. They may not look much different, but they are tough.
zherron.602zherron034.mp3: Kinrath are normally just pests. We think somethin' happened to their nest. It started near the end of the Civil War.
zherron.602zherron035.mp3: Nobody knows for sure. Even the Ithorian, and they're smart about such things.
zherron.602zherron013.mp3: {Zherron is the strong, silent, type. He says what he means. His tone here is direct and makes it sound like he's leaning in the direction of thinking the PC is trouble}I'm the militia captain here. Are you here because you're in trouble or looking for it?
zherron.602zherron018.mp3: Depending on how greedy you are, we might have some work for you. Before that, though...
zherron.602zherron019.mp3: You got any other reason for coming to militia headquarters?
zherron.602zherron025.mp3: You could pick worse places to look for that. Berun is normally the one to go to with questions. But I can answer a few things for ya.
zherron.602zherron026.mp3: If you're interested, I might have some work for you, too.
zherron.602zherron024.mp3: I suppose you're right, as long as you don't break any laws.
zherron.602zherron022.mp3: {The player just offered to help - and his tone is very blaze, but not unfriendly. It's hard to tell whether he believes the PC or not, Zherron's a hard man to read}Rare thing a visitor wanting to help out. Looks to me like you're here to "explore" the Jedi ruins.
zherron.602zherron023.mp3: But we have a thing or two that need doing. If you seriously want to help, just ask about it. Or any other questions you might have.
zherron.602zherron020.mp3: Hmm... There are better places to explore, and better people to know. I'm sure you have your reasons, though.
zherron.602zherron021.mp3: I'm sure you got questions of your own. And if you're interested I might have some work for ya.
zherron.602zherron017.mp3: If you're looking for help from the militia, talk to Berun{beh-ROON} first. If we can help you, he'll send you back my way.
zherron.602zherron016.mp3: There is often opportunity in challenges, if you know how to look for it. I might have something for you. But first...
zherron.602zherron015.mp3: {Sounds doubtful}I see. Well what's your reason for coming to militia headquarters?
zherron.602zherron014.mp3: Talk to Berun{beh-ROON} first. If your situation needs militia involvement, he'll send you my way.
zherron.602zherron027.mp3: You're making a big mistake. There's good reasons for what I did. Berun is gonna get all of Khoonda killed.
zherron.602zherron028.mp3: You don't know the whole story.
zherron.602zherron001.mp3: I was right about you. You are trouble. But you might just be the right sort of trouble we need.
zherron.602zherron002.mp3: The mercenaries aren't quick to mobilize. So you have time to do what you need. Or are you ready to finalize the defense plans?
zherron.602zherron012.mp3: When you're ready, come back and we can talk about the final plans to defend Khoonda.
zherron.602zherron100.mp3: That's good to hear. Fill me in on the details when you're ready to finalize our battle plans.
zherron.602zherron101.mp3: {uncomfortable, disappointed}I'm sure Terena will be more than happy to pay you once the mercenary threat is resolved.
zherron.602zherron009.mp3: You sure? Once we're done with that, there may not be any time left before the mercenaries attack.
zherron.602zherron011.mp3: That's fine. Better take care of anything you need to first.
zherron.602zherron010.mp3: All right, then we've got a lot to do.
zherron.602zherron006.mp3: Inspecting the perimeter, talking to the troops, and coming up with a battle plan.
zherron.602zherron008.mp3: Then we just wait for the mercenaries to make their move. Thanks to Vrook and you, though, we'll be ready.
zherron.602zherron007.mp3: I've fought in a war or two, but I'm no general. In my experience people like you are better at strategy. You want a hand in making the plan, you got it.
zherron.602zherron005.mp3: I don't know for certain. It could be a day, or even a week. Depends on how good Azkul{AZ-CULL} is at organizing his men. I'm guessing not so good.
zherron.602zherron003.mp3: We could use people handy with a blaster. Getting people to join the militia for a short stint would be good.
zherron.602zherron004.mp3: We also got a lot of things that could use fixing. It isn't glamorous, but that type of work sometimes makes a load of difference. Just look around. Plenty to be done.
zherron.602zherron083.mp3: Off the top of my head...
zherron.602zherron089.mp3: If I had it my way, I'd recruit any citizen of Khoonda that can hold a blaster. But it's hard to convince peaceful farmers to fight, and maybe die, for a cause.
zherron.602zherron088.mp3: We've got some broken Assault droids that have been collecting dust for the last five years. If they were working, it would help a lot with interior defense.
zherron.602zherron087.mp3: The side security door to Khoonda has been malfunctioning as long as I've been here. It may be best to just seal it off lockdown, so nobody gets through.
zherron.602zherron086.mp3: I've had some men lay traps around Khoonda, but nobody here really specializes in demolitions. I'm sure there are some gaps that could be filled.
zherron.602zherron085.mp3: The men who were wounded by the turrets are holed up in the med lab, but our medic droid is busted, so they're healing slowly.
zherron.602zherron084.mp3: The three turrets outside Khoonda are on the blink. They went haywire the other day and wounded some of my men, so we took them offline.
zherron.602zherron082.mp3: Thanks for your help with the Mercenaries. I hope someday I'll be able to return the favor.
zherron.602terena079.mp3: What is it Terena? I'm very busy.
zherron.602terena081.mp3: {Indignant}I deny nothing. You know I have done everything for the good of Khoonda. The mercenaries are a real threat, though many here are blind to it.{he means Berun}
zherron.602terena084.mp3: I believe you're making a mistake, Terena, but I will not let my pride compromise the militia. I will still serve.
zherron.602terena110.mp3: {Serious}You're just in time. Terena told me you've been searching for her "friend."  Well, I'm going to have to ask you to put that on hold for now.
zherron.602terena111.mp3: {Grave}As I've been telling Terena, I've just received solid proof that the mercenaries are planning to annihilate Khoonda. We need your help.

weaponsofficer.222carth005.mp3: Sir, at this distance, our weapons will barely scratch it.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike068.mp3: You have been ordered off this investigation, captain. I hope you can explain yourself.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike070.mp3: We've already got our man. Sullio and this Ghent were fighting the night she was murdered. He had ample motive.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike072.mp3: Have you read the report? Some of the things Sullio called him were vile. Sullio and Dhagon clearly hated each other.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike079.mp3: I see... Well, there's still the fact that he was right there at the scene of the crime.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike082.mp3: The only thing that matters to me is that he was within blaster range when Sullio was killed. And he did not have an alibi.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike085.mp3: Of course he could. There's a direct line of fire tha-
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike089.mp3: Very well, captain. Set Ghent free, then. But if later it turns he did do it, it's going to be on your head.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike084.mp3: That's not quite right. The recording doesn't show who did it, just the direction the shot came from. Which is the opposite direction from Dhagon's office.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike083.mp3: You have a recording? I'm sure you're just misinterpreting it.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike080.mp3: So what? What matters is who was there first? An eye witness said he came from his office almost immediately.
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike075.mp3: {Very angry}Why you little... Friends would not carry on in such a man-
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike074.mp3: So these two were friends? A friend would never say such things to another friend...
weaponsofficer.502mp_riike071.mp3: We did our job, offworlder. And an hour or two of meddling on your part gives you no right to say that.

ondwound.222ondwound013.mp3: I'm here, don't worry about me.
ondwound.222ondwound001.mp3: Well I'm not dead. I guess that's something. I got hit by a grenade. I just barely missed the whole blast. Augh!
ondwound.222ondwound002.mp3: They're moving ahead towards the TSF office. It's tough going, though. The Sith, they seem to be everywhere!
ondwound.222ondwound012.mp3: That's a lot of ifs. But that's my only hope. Good luck.

ondwound.301nscommal009.mp3: Exchange has got this sector carved right down the middle. Soon, they'll own everything.
ondwound.301nscommal008.mp3: {In a hurry, irritated}I don't have any handouts for you. Go bother someone else.
ondwound.301nscommal007.mp3: {In a hurry, irritated}Don't waste my time, I've got a transport to catch.
ondwound.301nscommal006.mp3: {Grumbling}Wish the Exchange would pack up the refugees and ship them all off to spice camps.
ondwound.301nscommal005.mp3: The stink here in the refugee sector is worse than the rest of Nar Shaddaa.
ondwound.301nscommal004.mp3: The bounty hunters have been laying low recently. Like they're waiting for something.
ondwound.301nscommal003.mp3: I hear there's some Jedi wandering around Nar Shaddaa. I thought they'd been wiped out.
ondwound.301nscommal002.mp3: Goto's yacht was fired on by a Republic warship. Has the Republic declared war on the Exchange?
ondwound.301nscommal001.mp3: Did you hear? The Republic's destroyed Goto's yacht. Blew it up, right in orbit!
