ffield_1.232ffield002.mp3: {(He punches the force field and it opens.)}
ffield_1.232232bdur013.mp3: The Czerka mercenaries were a little surprised when I broke my way out of my holding cell. The shields there were even weaker than these.

233mrcc.233233mrcc004.mp3: What do we have here... the 'Jedi.' Saves us the trouble of looking for ya.
233mrcc.233233mrcc005.mp3: Corrun Falt did say you were dangerous... maybe he does know what he's talking about.
233mrcc.233233mrcc010.mp3: Why would I do that, when I can just as easily take them from your corpse.
233mrcc.233233mrcc008.mp3: We'll see. You may have caught a few of my boys off-guard... but let's see how you fight now, "Jedi."

233mrcc.233233mrcc007.mp3: A grenade with your name on it, "Jedi."

sister1.262atriscs1003.mp3: {The mention of sister is important, since she's worried about him}No, mistress, nor any word of our sister. We do not know where they travel now.
sister1.262atriscs1005.mp3: Mistress, we still do not know the significance of the ship or the droid. We downloaded all you asked, but we are still no closer to the answers you seek.
sister1.262atriscs1007.mp3: I hope so, mistress. But there has been no word of her since she departed with the other four on the freighter.
sister1.262atriscs1009.mp3: Yes, mistress: the Iridonian, the Echani-trained pilot, the exile, and the old woman.
sister1.262atriscs1013.mp3: Mistress, she was secured for much of the time the exile was here. At other times you were meditating, and we did not wish to disturb you.
sister1.262atriscs3004.mp3: {Not sure what the mistress just said}Mistress?
sister1.262atriscs3007.mp3: Mistress... forgive us, but are you certain? She would not forsake her oath so lightly...
sister1.262atriscs3010.mp3: {Like standing at attention, trying to prove loyalty}No, mistress. It is you who saved the Jedi upon Dantooine... who have collected their knowledge, and hid it here to protect it.
sister1.262siscut1002.mp3: None yet. I do not understand why she displays such disobedience.
sister1.262siscut1007.mp3: Why Atris would have sent her on such a mission is something I do not understand.
sister1.262siscut1008.mp3: In terms of combat, she is the last among us. In terms of stealth, she is willful and not prone to disguise herself. Her stance - it has too much passion about it.
sister1.262siscut1006.mp3: Perhaps it is better that our sister chose exile rather than having it forced upon her.
sister1.262atrissis012.mp3: {A little concerned}Mistress, the last of our sisters is not among us.
sister1.262atrissis001.mp3: {A little concerned}Mistress, the last of the Handmaidens is not among us.
sister1.262atrissis009.mp3: {Trying to give cautious advice, afraid of offending mistress}Mistress, the last of the Handmaidens - she is willful, and she has demonstrated a... fascination with Jedi. It may not have been w-
sister1.262sisend015.mp3: The last of our sisters has returned to us.
sister1.262sisend001.mp3: {Cold, judgmental - a betrayer has returned to them}The last of the Handmaidens is before us.
sister1.262sisend004.mp3: You have betrayed us. You have betrayed Atris.

sister2.262atriscs3011.mp3: But... why? How did she fall?
sister2.262siscut1001.mp3: {Concerned}Has there been any word of her?
sister2.262siscut1003.mp3: {Slight accusation}You know why. She bears the face of her mother.
sister2.262siscut1009.mp3: Perhaps that is why Atris sent her. Perhaps it is an exile of her own.
sister2.262siscut1005.mp3: She has always brought shame upon us. In terms of combat, she is the least among us. Her stance always had too much passion about it.
sister2.262atrissis004.mp3: {Confused, makes no sense.}But - why? Her oath...
sister2.262sisend002.mp3: It is good that you have returned. You have much to answer for.
sister2.262sisend005.mp3: You are no longer one of us. You followed the Jedi, betrayed your oath.
sister2.262sisend008.mp3: It is a crime to kill blood - but not to kill a betrayer as you.
sister2.262sisend013.mp3: We shall see... you were always the last of us. And now we shall show you why.
sister2.602jedi_rum001.mp3: Do you actually believe a Jedi would return here? After all they've done to us... they wouldn't dare.
sister2.602jedi_rum005.mp3: Well I hope it's true. I hear there's a bounty on them, and we could certainly use the money.
sister2.602jedi_rum007.mp3: I think Tarn has finally cracked. Running around like a madman, raving that he was being chased by a Jedi!

quello_irritated.301quello003.mp3: What's with you, letting that piece of junk sink its struts into my landing pad?
quello_irritated.301quello024.mp3: Neither do I, so stop wasting mine.
quello_irritated.301quello025.mp3: I got another ship coming in, and unless you want that piece of junk's hull crushed flat, you'd better move it. Got it?

quello_irritated.301quello030.mp3: What do I look like, a flying backpack? Credits is the language around here, not scrap.

quello_irritated.301quello023.mp3: The problem is, you're on my landing pad.

quello_irritated.301quello021.mp3: {A little sinister}I got some visitors booked for your space, but I'm sure the two of you can work it out when they arrive.

quello_irritated.301quello018.mp3: You keep that piece of junk here, then you gotta pay. Cough up the credits, and there won't be any trouble.
quello_irritated.301quello012.mp3: [Success] {Chewing it over}Yeah? Well, this is the first I've heard of it. Tell you what, let me check it out - if you're cleared, then you're clear, no trouble.
quello_irritated.301quello016.mp3: Eh, well, heh-heh! Don't let me hold you up, then, hm?
quello_irritated.301quello013.mp3: {Thinking it over, then dismissive}Hmmm. Ah, never mind, it's not worth the trouble.
quello_irritated.301quello015.mp3: {Confused, a little worried}I gotta tell you, though, I got another one of your ships docking here within an hour... I'm not sure what to tell them.
quello_irritated.301quello014.mp3: {Worried, second part is to himself, knows that there's going to be a fight when the second ship arrives}You call the shots... but this is gonna be trouble, I can feel it.

quello_irritated.301quello009.mp3: I got a ship that's supposed to dock on this pad any hour now. What am I gonna do?

quello_irritated.303fassa045.mp3: Great, good. You return with credits and I forget.
quello_irritated.303fassa044.mp3: [Failure] You persuasive. But Vogga's thugs more persuasive. 600 credits.
quello_irritated.303fassa036.mp3: {Excited}Power cells you say? I have an idea. Pylons need new power supply. Ithorian gives Fassa some power cells and Fassa let him go. Agree?
quello_irritated.303fassa041.mp3: Heh heh heh heh. You funny human. Heh heh heh. I like you. But Vogga doesn't pay fees, he collects them. But maybe sometime you need help with a freighter and Fassa remembers you. Now you tell Ithorian of deal?
quello_irritated.303fassa040.mp3: Don't worry about it human. Fassa and Lasavvou can talk. You go tell him?
quello_irritated.303fassa037.mp3: Great, good. You go tell him, right?
quello_irritated.303fassa039.mp3: You rude. Fassa will remember. What else?
quello_irritated.303fassa035.mp3: That's an unfortunate story. But Vogga likes credits, not stories.
quello_irritated.303fassa042.mp3: You helped Fassa. So I let Ithorian go for you. You go tell him, right?
quello_irritated.303fassa031.mp3: Now that freighters can depart safely, I can use good a pilot.
quello_irritated.303fassa032.mp3: Fassa can do this. Good. I'll send someone for him.{Gameplay programmer: Remove Odis from 302NAR}
quello_irritated.303fassa030.mp3: Yes. But no work for pilots while ships get hijacked.
quello_irritated.303fassa052.mp3: What? Do I look like passenger ship to you? Ack. All right. You helped me, I help you.
quello_irritated.303fassa053.mp3: Fine. I do for you. But don't ask of Fassa again! What else?!
quello_irritated.303fassa054.mp3: Can't do anything when ships hijacked. Maybe when that problem go away, we talk about it.
quello_irritated.303fassa055.mp3: What? Do I look like passenger ship to you? Stop bothering me.
quello_irritated.303fassa023.mp3: Why you speak with Exchange? No matter... you do not decide when to speak to them... Exchange decide to speak to you.
quello_irritated.303fassa025.mp3: But best you keep hidden and not speak with Exchange. You not want their attention I think.
quello_irritated.303fassa024.mp3: Fassa heard they not so happy with you. Maybe best you not speak to them.
quello_irritated.303fassa021.mp3: [Failure] I don't think so. Goto not hire many humans. You want waste my time?
quello_irritated.303fassa022.mp3: Don't flatter me. {suspicious}What you want to know about Exchange?
quello_irritated.303fassa029.mp3: The Exchange is very powerful. Fassa doesn't know how to reach them. Maybe you talk with Vogga.
quello_irritated.303fassa026.mp3: {suspicious}What you want to know about Exchange?
quello_irritated.303fassa027.mp3: Exchange causes big problems for boss Vogga. All freighters get hijacked when they leave. We think Exchange is doing this.
quello_irritated.303fassa006.mp3: You not from here? Business bad. Freighters get hijacked, no trade gets through. And can't get fuel from Sleheyron. Fuel reserves building up there.
quello_irritated.303fassa019.mp3: You talk to Vogga. Maybe him you can help.
quello_irritated.303fassa011.mp3: You talk to Vogga. Maybe him you can help. I have enough trouble with pylons.
quello_irritated.303fassa012.mp3: Pylon power supply badly damaged. Only can support one pylon at a time. Can't bring freighters in fast enough. You help bring freighters in, maybe Fassa can help you later.
quello_irritated.303fassa056.mp3: You help first, maybe we talk about it later.
quello_irritated.303fassa018.mp3: I cannot pay. But maybe later you have freighter, need quick unloading, and Fassa help you.
quello_irritated.303fassa014.mp3: Good, good. I give you basic access to pylon consoles. From pylon you can read ID Signature of freighters. You figure out what order the three freighters should dock.
quello_irritated.303fassa015.mp3: Freighter with higher first two numbers has higher priority. If first two numbers tied, then higher last three numbers has higher priority. For example, P-11-115-999 has lower priority than D-15-154-111. You got it?
quello_irritated.303fassa016.mp3: One more thing. First two numbers are always the same as the first two numbers in the second set of numbers. You can read freighter ID from pylons. But hard to get full signature ID from each pylon.
quello_irritated.303fassa017.mp3: Use pylon power console near me to change which pylon is powered up. You go check ID Signatures from each pylon and then you assign priorities to the three freighters.
quello_irritated.303fassa013.mp3: {Excited}Cryogenic power cells you say? Ithorian gives Fassa some power cells and Fassa let him go. Agree?
quello_irritated.303fassa010.mp3: Goto and his Exchange hijacks Vogga's ships. Hurts business.
quello_irritated.303fassa008.mp3: [Success] Goto and his Exchange hijacks Vogga's ships. Hurts business.
quello_irritated.303fassa009.mp3: For money I assume. We don't know how he does it... every ship we send out, he gets.
quello_irritated.303fassa004.mp3: My boss is the Hutt Vogga. I oversee the docks for Vogga's freighters.
quello_irritated.303fassa005.mp3: Vogga is here in dock area. On north side.
quello_irritated.303fassa003.mp3: I'll give you access to the pylon consoles.
quello_irritated.303fassa002.mp3: You help Fassa. I not forget. Now why you bother me again?

ref2.301refenc003.mp3: {Desperate}No, look - you can't keep us trapped in the Refugee Sector. We can't survive there. You've got us locked in!
ref2.301refugee2001.mp3: Thanks for your help - they would have crippled me for sure.
ref2.301refugee2008.mp3: If you saved me to cripple me again, then you're worse than they are - what do you want with me?
ref2.301refugee2007.mp3: {A little grimmer}All right. What do you want, then?
ref2.301refugee2002.mp3: Well, they work for the Exchange - for a Quarren named Visquis. He's looking to step up in the Exchange.
ref2.301refugee2003.mp3: The only language the Exchange respects is money, so Visquis is trying to increase his profits by using the refugees here in Nar Shaddaa as a cheap labor force.
ref2.301refugee2004.mp3: We're only good to him as slaves and merchandise. He wants to keep us in one place so he can control us. That's always been the way... well, except lately.
ref2.301refugee2006.mp3: Huh. You don't. He comes to you, if he's got reason to - either because you can help him out, or because you're making trouble. Either way, it's not a good thing.
ref2.301refugee2005.mp3: The Exchange has been clamping down on the Refugee Sector hard, and I have no idea why. They've started kidnapping people, hurting others... but there seems to be no reason to it.

refugee3.301refugee3026.mp3: I saw what you did to those Exchange thugs and that refugee. I don't want any trouble, I won't tell anyone I saw you. Please, let me be.
refugee3.301refugee3025.mp3: I saw what you did for that refugee, stranger. Could you, could you spare a few credits, maybe help another refugee in need?
refugee3.301refugee3001.mp3: {A little wheedling at the end}I saw what you did to those Exchange thugs, stranger... can you spare a few credits, maybe help another refugee in need?
refugee3.301refugee3013.mp3: {A little panicked, runs away}Forgive me, stranger... please, I beg you, do not kill me!
refugee3.301refugee3012.mp3: {A little panicked, but desperate for cash}F... forgive me, stranger... but if you had some credits you could spare, it would be a great help... please.
refugee3.301refugee3002.mp3: {Nods, grateful}Thank you, stranger - I won't forget your kindness.

visquis.301visquis004.mp3: Welcome, <FullName> - I regret this message has taken so long in reaching you, but I only recently became aware of your presence on Nar Shaddaa.
visquis.301visquis005.mp3: {Bows}I am Visquis, a representative of an... exchange of shipping interests here on the smuggler's moon.
visquis.301visquis006.mp3: I am extending an invitation to you to join me in my private lounge within the Jekk'Jekk Tarr, where we may speak without being disturbed.
visquis.301visquis007.mp3: I wish to discuss something of mutual interest concerning your past profession - and prospects for the future.
visquis.301visquis008.mp3: Oh, and do come alone - one human in my presence is more than enough.
visquis.304visquis001.mp3: Ah, you have finally arrived. Please, come in, the air here is quite suitable for your kind.
visquis.304visquis019.mp3: Much better - I assure you, no one will harm you as long as you are my guest and we keep things cordial between us.
visquis.304visquis004.mp3: Based on your actions alone, I take it you are not familiar with the organization I serve... or my responsibilities.
visquis.304visquis005.mp3: I run the Refugee Sector - I decide what happens here, I control the flows and currents of this sector.
visquis.304visquis017.mp3: You have done much to aid the Exchange here on Nar Shaddaa. I wish to know why.
visquis.304visquis018.mp3: So you are the exile mentioned in the coreward database. Strange... I had not thought even an ex-Jedi would stoop to such depravities.
visquis.304visquis006.mp3: You have caused a great deal of trouble for the Exchange here on Nar Shaddaa, and I wish to know why.
visquis.304visquis016.mp3: We sought to put pressure on the Refugee Sector for a simple reason - whenever seeming-innocents are placed in danger, especially human fodder, there the Jedi are, lightsabers blazing.
visquis.304visquis015.mp3: Ah, of course. Information is such a high commodity here on Nar Shaddaa.
visquis.304visquis013.mp3: Oh, you have had it for quite some time.
visquis.304visquis014.mp3: I must admit, once you were on Nar Shaddaa, you became difficult to track, but that is what bounty hunters are for.
visquis.304visquis007.mp3: So you are the exile mentioned in the coreward database. It seems my squeezing of the Refugee Sector has yielded success, after all.
visquis.304visquis008.mp3: It is curious, though - we have been applying pressure on the humans in this sector for some time, yet only now do you show yourself.
visquis.304visquis009.mp3: Ah, the Jedi have always been slow to act when danger threatens, more so now than in the past, and you are no different.
visquis.304visquis010.mp3: Oh, you mistake me. I was not the one who put the original bounty on you - we all have our Masters, you know.
visquis.304visquis011.mp3: Your price is so high that any bounty hunter who captures you would be able to buy their own planet.
visquis.304visquis012.mp3: You must have angered Goto greatly for him to hunt you so.
visquis.304visquis053.mp3: And that is why you are the perfect bait... and why I will bring you to Goto, then kill him.
visquis.304visquis002.mp3: {Shrugs}As you wish. Is there something I can offer you, a refreshment perhaps?
visquis.304visquis003.mp3: Do not be taken aback by my hospitality - I assure you, no one will harm you as long as you are my guest and we keep things cordial between us.
visquis.304visquis051.mp3: You must have angered Goto greatly for him to hunt you so.
visquis.304visquis052.mp3: But now your journey is at an end... and I will soon bring you to Goto.
visquis.304visquis020.mp3: Ah, you have finally arrived. Please, come in and remove that cumbersome suit, the air here is quite suitable for your kind.
visquis.304visquis021.mp3: Do not be taken aback by my hospitality - I assure you, no one will harm you as long as you are my guest and we keep things cordial between us.
visquis.304visquis024.mp3: Restrain yourself, Hanharr. There is no need for violence.
visquis.304visquis025.mp3: I gather from your conversation that this is not the Jedi I invited here - it is difficult for me to tell, you humans all look so alike to me.
visquis.304visquis026.mp3: Perhaps you would care to explain what I owe the honor of this visit? And where I might find the Jedi?
visquis.304visquis028.mp3: Ah, what a prime example of human arrogance. What you know is substantially less than what I know. Otherwise, you would not have come.
visquis.304visquis029.mp3: One, everything that goes on in the Jekk'Jekk Tarr is invisible to Goto. It is something I discovered by accident, and have tested many times since to insure accuracy.
visquis.304visquis030.mp3: Second, I am not acting on Goto's orders - not anymore. Hanharr and I reached an agreement to deal with Goto altogether... and collect a tidy sum from Vogga.
visquis.304visquis032.mp3: He might, it is possible. But it is a risk I am willing to take.
visquis.304visquis047.mp3: I am tired of overseeing a sector of filthy humans, drowning in their own stink, helpless as rontos caught in a pen. I aspire to greater things, and there is little room for promotion under Goto's reign.
visquis.304visquis048.mp3: Plus, this Jedi has killed several of my brothers - first at Telos, then elsewhere.
visquis.304visquis049.mp3: So I have come up with a strategem. First, I need one of the Jedi. Preferably the one you have.
visquis.304visquis033.mp3: You see, Vogga is very tired of having his freighters hijacked by Goto - it is causing his word to have less... weight on Nal Hutta. There is a leak in his operations here on Nar Shaddaa.
visquis.304visquis034.mp3: Rather than simply find the leak and eliminate it, his anger has compelled him to eliminate the source of the irritation altogether.
visquis.304visquis035.mp3: Unfortunately, Goto is very careful about showing himself to others - Vogga's employee, Hanharr, discovered this when he attended the gathering on Goto's yacht. It is always holograms with Goto - always.
visquis.304visquis036.mp3: But I have a suspicion that Goto will reveal himself to a Jedi. When that happens, that is when I intend to strike.
visquis.304visquis037.mp3: Unfortunately, it is clear he will not reveal himself to a two-credit bounty hunter with the audacity to try and strike a deal with me.
visquis.304visquis038.mp3: So please - tell me where the Jedi is. I am not in the mood for negotiation.
visquis.304visquis041.mp3: Take her away. It looks as if we will not be getting a Jedi this day.
visquis.304visquis043.mp3: Hanharr, please - calm yourself. The Jedi was on the way to meet us when sidetracked. We must be patient.
visquis.304visquis045.mp3: If she is a Jedi, perhaps she will come for her out of some misguided sense of protectorship. If not, then she will come to meet with me - and we may strike another arrangement.
visquis.304visquis044.mp3: If he is a Jedi, perhaps he will come for her out of some misguided sense of protectorship. If not, then he will come to meet with me - and we may strike another arrangement.

aaida.302aaida017.mp3: {hopeful}Have you found a way to Lootra yet? I must see him!
aaida.302aaida018.mp3: {her dream has been shattered, but this is where she was for the last several years and she never fully let herself believe her husband was really alive}Oh, you wicked soul... you taunt me with false hope - rebuild my life, then shatter it.
aaida.302aaida019.mp3: {she wants nothing more to do with the player. disgusted, but not angry, just worn out}Just leave me be.
aaida.302aaida016.mp3: Back again? Is there anything I can do for you?
aaida.302aaida002.mp3: Another refugee? I'm sad to see another join our ranks... I lost my husband, Lootra, long ago in the Jedi Civil War.
aaida.302aaida013.mp3: When Telos was bombarded by the Sith, some of us were able to escape on in-system shuttles. We floated in orbit for weeks before we were picked up by Republic capital ships.
aaida.302aaida014.mp3: {A little downcast}I think the Sith wanted witnesses to what happened to Telos... and I have been drifting from planet to planet, ever since, only to end up here, with nowhere left to go.
aaida.302aaida015.mp3: You are kind to offer, but unless you can return my husband to me, there is little that you can do.
aaida.302aaida003.mp3: {in disbelief, excited, hopeful}Wh- Lootra's here?! Please, you must help me get to him!
aaida.302aaida011.mp3: {Incredulous}Wh- how did you do this? I barely know you, and you've brought me word of my husband, and then a free path to him... it's almost too good to be true.
aaida.302aaida012.mp3: You've given me my husband back, stranger. My husband - my life. Thank you.
aaida.302aaida004.mp3: The Exchange is circling this sector like shyracks. If one of us should slip free, they will hunt us down and punish us.
aaida.302aaida010.mp3: Please... don't cause any trouble on my behalf. If you harm any of the Exchange here, they'll take it out on us a hundred-fold.
aaida.302aaida008.mp3: 'Deal with the Exchange?' You might as well wrestle with a planet. This branch of the Exchange is run by Saquesh, a Quarren with ties to Visquis himself.
aaida.302aaida009.mp3: Visquis is the Exchange boss here on Nar Shaddaa, at least in this sector. You don't want to cross him - there's usually a battalion of hired guns lurking in the shadows behind him.
aaida.302aaida005.mp3: No one knows - I think they're trying to starve us into submission. Then they can make us slaves on the Hutt spice planets or disposable workers in the tibanna gas factories on Sleheyron.
aaida.302aaida006.mp3: {A little quieter, then disbelieving at the end}But other refugees think the Exchange is looking for someone - some even say it's a Jedi, but that's insane. No Jedi would ever come to a waste pit like Nar Shaddaa.
aaida.302aaida007.mp3: {Shakes head, then quieter at the end}It's just a rumor - I don't even believe it. Sometimes I wonder if it's just a rumor someone dreamed up to make us suffer.
aaida.303aaida001.mp3: Thanks again, stranger. You've returned Lootra to me, and I will be forever grateful.
aaida.303lootra003.mp3: The destruction of Telos - I can't even tell you what happened after, being shuttled from system to system, barely one planet ahead of the Sith fleet...

adana.302adana001.mp3: Who are you... one of Saquesh's kath hounds?
adana.302adana004.mp3: Then maybe you ought to keep a tighter leash on his tentacles, vac-brain. Because he's running this sector into the ground.
adana.302adana019.mp3: Saquesh and his thugs torture the humans, make everyone's lives miserable. After I'm sold, at least I'll have someone making sure I stay alive.
adana.302adana020.mp3: My mom owes Saquesh some credits. So he took me to sell me to the Hutts. They always need spice handlers for their camps... a lot of people die down there.
adana.302adana002.mp3: Adana... my mom made the mistake of telling Saquesh he couldn't sell me to the Hutts... so he took me.
adana.302adana017.mp3: What, are you Saquesh's boss or something? I thought you smelled even worse than him.
adana.302adana003.mp3: {Downnote}Yeah... the Hutts always need spice handlers for their camps... people are always dying there.
adana.302adana016.mp3: Anything is better than this slum.
adana.302adana006.mp3: {sarcastic}Oooh... the ugly thug knows my name. Can it also count? What's two plus two?
adana.302adana009.mp3: Really? Oh, why didn't you say so? Oh, sorry about those things I said to you. You do look a little like a Kath hound, though.
adana.302adana012.mp3: {disappointed}Aww... I wanted to see you thrash him. {upbeat}Well, thanks!
adana.302adana011.mp3: I'll go find mom. Kick him once in the tentacles for me!
adana.302adana010.mp3: {sarcastic}Oh goody. I was hoping I'd get to sit in this cell a little longer.
adana.302adana008.mp3: Hah! You and me should play some high stakes Pazaak.

geriel.302geriel025.mp3: Keep... back. I... am... ill. Contagious, the others say.
geriel.302geriel001.mp3: Keep... back. I... am... ill. Contagious, the others say.
geriel.302geriel007.mp3: I don't know... I was well just yesterday. Now... I don't think I'll last much longer.
geriel.302geriel024.mp3: [Success]{sad} I suppose I will die soon anyway.
geriel.302geriel020.mp3: [Success]{sad} I suppose I will die soon anyway.
geriel.302geriel003.mp3: I won't turn away your help... thank you.
geriel.302geriel004.mp3: You're very kind. But I don't think it helped much.
geriel.302geriel023.mp3: I'm feeling a little better. Thank you! [Geriel hands you something.]
geriel.302geriel015.mp3: Oh, I'm feeling a little better. Thank you!
geriel.302geriel022.mp3: {relieved}Really? The others say I have the Plague.
geriel.302geriel014.mp3: {relieved}Really? The others say I have the Plague.
geriel.302geriel012.mp3: You're not going to kill me, are you? Please don't kill me...
geriel.302geriel009.mp3: Thank you so much for curing me!

hussef.302hussef049.mp3: Oh, hello again. What can I do for you?
hussef.302hussef057.mp3: [Failure]{Angry} I won't succumb to the Exchange! {Calmer}We have children here, with bright futures. We can't give up.
hussef.302hussef058.mp3: Ah... poor Adana. I hope we can find a way to get Saquesh to release her.
hussef.302hussef056.mp3: [Failure] There are bad times for us, yes. But I will not give in to the Exchange.
hussef.302hussef051.mp3: You're right. There's no hope left for us. I will speak with the Overseer.
hussef.302hussef050.mp3: Poor woman. After she heard her daughter'd been sold, she went insane. No one's seen her since.
hussef.302hussef048.mp3: Look how grim our situation is. Another refugee, old Geriel, died.
hussef.302hussef047.mp3: Geriel says you saved his life. Maybe all of our lives.
hussef.302hussef042.mp3: How could you give Nadaa to the Exchange like that?
hussef.302hussef046.mp3: {suspicious}If you say so... what can I help you with?
hussef.302hussef045.mp3: [Failure]{suspicious} If you say so... what can I help you with?
hussef.302hussef044.mp3: Perhaps so. Oh, these are terrible times for us.
hussef.302hussef043.mp3: [Failure]{distraught} No... we can't just give into them...
hussef.302hussef041.mp3: Thank you for helping out Adana! I was worried about what would happen to her.
hussef.302hussef012.mp3: You wiped out all of the Serroco on your own? Impressive. You've made things easier for us around here.
hussef.302hussef011.mp3: I imagine you had something to do with the Serroco backing off a bit. Thanks for helping us out.
hussef.302hussef010.mp3: Thanks for taking care of Saquesh. I fear what the Exchange might do next, though.
hussef.302hussef009.mp3: I appreciate you convincing Saquesh to give us more space. We're indebted to you.
hussef.302hussef001.mp3: Welcome, traveller! My name is Hussef. I try to look out for the other refugees.
hussef.302hussef013.mp3: I see you're a stranger here. Watch your step, and keep to the camp.
hussef.302hussef040.mp3: All right. I don't want any trouble with you.
hussef.302hussef008.mp3: Well, that may be, but watch yourself just the same. The Serroco crew fights first, and talk later. They won't bother warning you before shooting.
hussef.302hussef039.mp3: They're veterans from the Serroco campaign and... they don't take kind to strangers.
hussef.302hussef038.mp3: The {SAIR-A-CO}Serroco refugees have been wiped out, but on the inner side, you've got Overseer Saquesh and his Exchange. They've been pushing us refugees pretty hard lately.
hussef.302hussef037.mp3: The Serroco refugees are over on the skyward side. They're veterans from the Serroco campaign, and they don't take kind to strangers.
hussef.302hussef014.mp3: You've got the {SAIR-A-CO}Serroco refugees over on the skyward side. They're veterans from the Serroco campaign and don't take kind to strangers.
hussef.302hussef036.mp3: On the inner side, you got the Overseer and his Exchange. They were pressuring us pretty hard, but they've laid off recently.
hussef.302hussef015.mp3: And on the inner side, you've got the Overseer and his Exchange. They've been pushing us refugees pretty hard lately.
hussef.302hussef061.mp3: You've already helped us greatly. Life should start improving for us.
hussef.302hussef035.mp3: If you could convince the Serroco to leave us alone, that would help.
hussef.302hussef034.mp3: If you could convince the Exchange to take some of the pressure off, that would really be a big help.
hussef.302hussef032.mp3: If you could convince either the Exchange or the Serroco to give us more space, that would really help a lot.
hussef.302hussef021.mp3: Occasionally their thugs kidnap people and sell them into slavery with the Hutts.
hussef.302hussef022.mp3: They've also hemmed us in... we used to live all throughout this area, but they've crammed us all in here now.
hussef.302hussef023.mp3: They're trying to break our spirit so that we'll become slave workers for the Hutts.
hussef.302hussef031.mp3: You might be right. But I can't imagine why else they'd be coming down on us.
hussef.302hussef026.mp3: Is there anything else you'd like to know?
hussef.302hussef020.mp3: Only if we enter their territory... it makes things a little tight here in the camp. Not much room to move.
hussef.302hussef019.mp3: Those two have a truce. Neither side wants to mess with the other.
hussef.302hussef018.mp3: The Exchange isn't much in this area anymore. Just the Serroco.
hussef.302hussef017.mp3: The Serroco are pretty much wiped out now, so they're not really an issue.
hussef.302hussef016.mp3: With the Serroco wiped out and the Exchange driven from this area, it's not an issue anymore.

kahranna.302kahranna022.mp3: Did you find us a pilot yet?
kahranna.302kahranna020.mp3: Did you find us a pilot yet?
kahranna.302kahranna021.mp3: It couldn't really take this long! I'm through waiting for you.
kahranna.302kahranna019.mp3: Get away from me, you scum!
kahranna.302kahranna001.mp3: Greetings... are you the spacer we were told about?
kahranna.302kahranna004.mp3: You're the one! Good. My family and I are anxious to leave, and I have the payment for you. 500 credits.
kahranna.302kahranna018.mp3: [Failure]{angry} No, the arrangement was for 500. You're not the spacer. Leave me alone, you Gamorrean.
kahranna.302kahranna013.mp3: [Success] Um... we can't afford that. Will you please take 600?
kahranna.302kahranna017.mp3: Oh... this is terrible! We'll have to find another way.
kahranna.302kahranna014.mp3: Oh, thank you! Here's the 600 credits. Please hurry back to get us.
kahranna.302kahranna012.mp3: Thank you! Here's the 500 credits. Please hurry back to us.
kahranna.302kahranna002.mp3: Oh. We were expecting one of the pilots from the docks sometime soon to come and get us off Nar Shaddaa.
kahranna.302kahranna003.mp3: He is late - I don't know where he is.
kahranna.302kahranna005.mp3: Thank you! To be honest, I don't even know his name. Some guy named Planore said he had a pilot friend who would take us for 500 credits.
kahranna.302kahranna011.mp3: It's been over a week. I hope nothing has happened to him!
kahranna.302kahranna010.mp3: [Failure] I can't afford to make that mistake again.
kahranna.302kahranna009.mp3: [Success] Thank you... I'm beginning to lose hope that we'll ever get out of here.
kahranna.302kahranna008.mp3: Thank you... I'm beginning to lose hope that we'll ever get out of here.
kahranna.302kahranna007.mp3: {saddened}I was afraid of that. I knew I shouldn't have trusted him.
kahranna.302kahranna024.mp3: I hope not... but you may be right.

lootra.303lootra049.mp3: {A little irritated}You going to make a habit of busting into my room?
lootra.303lootra027.mp3: {Angry, challenging}I don't know who you are, but you picked the wrong room to break into.
lootra.303lootra048.mp3: If you're with the Exchange, then you promised you'd give me a little more time to decide. I should have known you core slimes wouldn't give me a chance.
lootra.303lootra047.mp3: {Angry, threatening}We'll see about that - if it's a coffin you're looking for, this room's more your size.
lootra.303lootra028.mp3: {A little wary, then a little depressed, was hoping it was his lost wife}No harm done. For a minute, I thought you might have been someone else.
lootra.303lootra029.mp3: My wife... Aaida, there's a chance she may be here on Nar Shaddaa. A lot of refugees ended up here after the Jedi Civil War. I came here to see if I could track her down.
lootra.303lootra030.mp3: {A little frustrated, then depressed at the end.}Thing is, I can't get into the Refugee Sector, and even if I could, I'm not sure I could find her. I've been here for weeks, hoping to see her face. All I've done is watch my credits burn away to nothing.
lootra.303lootra034.mp3: The Exchange has got the place barricaded with thugs - they're putting the squeeze on the whole sector, trying to crush the spirit out of the remaining refugees.
lootra.303lootra035.mp3: Now, I'm almost cleaned out. I burned the last of my fuel and my freight just getting here - the Exchange promised me a job shuttling freight via cargo cruiser, and I'm close to taking them up on it.
lootra.303lootra040.mp3: {Resigned, defeated}[Success] I think you're right - without her, there's nowhere I really have left to go, or even want to go to.
lootra.303lootra041.mp3: {Frowns, thinking}It's strange you came by when you did... I was right at the edge of deciding whether to give up, turning it over in my mind, and suddenly, you walked through the door and gave me the answer I needed to hear.
lootra.303lootra037.mp3: {Suspicious}Yeah? And what's it going to cost me?
lootra.303lootra039.mp3: {Nods}If you can find her, that'll be a small price to pay. All right, stranger, you got a deal.
lootra.303lootra038.mp3: {A little incredulous, shaking his head}Well, I'm not going to turn away an offer of help - all right, stranger, if you can find her, then you'll have my thanks.
lootra.303lootra036.mp3: I don't, and that's the most frustrating thing. But sometimes... sometimes I'm just sure she's still alive, somewhere.
lootra.303lootra031.mp3: What? Is there any way to get her out?
lootra.303lootra033.mp3: I'll pay you whatever you want. Just please, get her out of there!
lootra.303lootra032.mp3: I can't believe she's still alive - this is the best news I've heard in years. Please, whatever you can do, I'd appreciate it.
lootra.303lootra024.mp3: {A little hopeful}Any chance you've heard some word of my wife?
lootra.303lootra026.mp3: Ennnh... wh... what? No! No, there may still be a chance of finding her. Isn't there? My head feels strange.
lootra.303lootra025.mp3: {Shocked, then depressed}Wh... what? I always feared that was what happened... at least now I know.
lootra.303lootra002.mp3: {Reunited with wife}{AY-DA}Aaida, I didn't think I'd ever find you, I can't believe you're here, before me.
lootra.303lootra004.mp3: Shhhh. We can talk about it later. You have my thanks, stranger. I can only hope you have as much luck at what you're looking for.
lootra.303lootra007.mp3: {Frowns, thinking}It's strange you came by when you did... I was right at the edge of deciding whether to give up, turning it over in my mind, and suddenly, you walked through the door and gave me the answer I needed to hear.
lootra.303lootra023.mp3: Maybe you're right - thanks again, stranger.
lootra.303lootra006.mp3: Of course, of course. Here you go - it's all I had left, but it's nothing compared to finding Aaida again.
lootra.303lootra005.mp3: That I do. Here you go - it's all I had left, but it's nothing compared to finding Aaida again.
lootra.303lootra001.mp3: Thanks again, stranger. I won't forget what you've done for me.
lootra.502cp_geles016.mp3: If you want to pass here, I'll need to see your starport visa.
lootra.502cp_geles002.mp3: Everything seems in order. You're cleared to go.
lootra.502cp_geles003.mp3: There are reports of Republic smugglers arming dissidents in the city. Checkpoints have been set up throughout the city to prevent more civil disturbances.
lootra.502cp_geles004.mp3: There are two types of starport visas. The type you have is an individual visa, good for just you and any pre-registered staff and family that accompany you. The Office of Emigration also issued open visas.
lootra.502cp_geles007.mp3: Because of the Republic attacks, General Vaklu just announced that the Office of Emigration has been shut down.
lootra.502cp_geles008.mp3: There have been a lot of edicts since the Republic launched an unprovoked attack on our space forces. No one can get starport visas any more.
lootra.502cp_geles009.mp3: Listen. I wouldn't mind letting some of these unfortunates through. But regs are regs.
lootra.502cp_geles010.mp3: {Rueful}Besides, some of my troops would like nothing more than to get rid of me to earn favor with General Vaklu.
lootra.502cp_geles011.mp3: Any officer loyal to the Queen has found life increasingly difficult. So far all the officers in the Merchant Quarter are still royalists, but many of our troops think Vaklu is right.
lootra.502cp_geles012.mp3: I think he's right, too, but he should respect the Queen's orders. But if I break any of Vaklu's orders, I fear some of my men wouldn't wait for my court-martial.
lootra.502cp_geles013.mp3: The Republic and the Jedi brought many wars to our planet. Things were far simpler and safer when we were independent.
lootra.502cp_geles014.mp3: General Vaklu keeps pressuring the Queen to listen to the will of the people and secede from the Republic. But Queen Talia is staunchly in favor of the Republic.
lootra.502cp_geles005.mp3: I don't make the law, off-worlder. Only the Queen or General Vaklu can issue starport visas. It's a lengthy process, costs money, and there's a long line ahead of you.
lootra.502cp_geles006.mp3: I wouldn't pay the beggars near here much mind. Just ignore them and go about your business.
lootra.502cp_geles015.mp3: Hey, I remember you from the Cantina.
lootra.503cp_geles023.mp3: Can't find a better place to drink? I can't, either.
lootra.503cp_geles001.mp3: {He sounds weary - like after a tough day}You're the off-world captain, right? I recognize you from the checkpoint.
lootra.503cp_geles024.mp3: {He sounds weary - like after a tough day}You look like an offworlder. My names Gelesi. I'm a checkpoint Captain in the Merchant Quarter.
lootra.503cp_geles002.mp3: If you're here for juma juice, it's not that good. But at least it's cheap. I don't think Bith have the same sense of taste we do.
lootra.503cp_geles003.mp3: Long day, as always. Sullio was captain of that checkpoint for years. I never knew why she came here every night until I got her job.
lootra.503cp_geles006.mp3: Hm. She was murdered. I didn't want her job, but I got it now.
lootra.503cp_geles021.mp3: Well you proved it wasn't that doctor, Dhagon Ghent. Which I tried to tell them all along. But since I wasn't even here, no one would listen.
lootra.503cp_geles022.mp3: It's like those investigators weren't even really looking. The evidence was very poor. But he was their guy. Almost like they didn't want to find the real murderer.
lootra.503cp_geles007.mp3: The same as everyone. People are trying to blame that doctor, Dhagon Ghent. I don't think even command believe he did it.
lootra.503cp_geles008.mp3: {He sounds a trifle nervous when he's describing the investigation}But someone's got to take the blame. I - I almost think that the investigators aren't really looking. Dhagon's convenient and they don't want to find the real murderer.
lootra.503cp_geles009.mp3: Sullio was murdered. Maybe even assassinated. I might be a little paranoid.
lootra.503cp_geles010.mp3: I have a wife and daughter to look after. And I feel like I'm a target now. I'm tempted to just grab my family and take the first shuttle out of here.
lootra.503cp_geles011.mp3: [Failure] I really am torn. There are days... There are some days where I think I'm a fool to stay.
lootra.503cp_geles019.mp3: Is? Is that a threat? You haven't exactly been discrete since you arrived here. People are bound to notice if you do anything to me.
lootra.503cp_geles020.mp3: {Emphasize you - let the player instantly think, "Well - I can get somebody else to get to you"}So there's nothing you can do to me without being thrown in jail. You're being watched.
lootra.503cp_geles017.mp3: So the rumors are true. If you're working with who I think you are, I'll leave. Right now. Just don't hurt my family.
lootra.503cp_geles018.mp3: {He sounds very scared and waivering in his tone}I promise I won't tell anyone. I'll be on the first shuttle out. Uh... I'll be going.
lootra.503cp_geles015.mp3: Whatever you say. There are a lot wild rumors around. You sound earnest. Heh, but so do a lot of people.
lootra.503cp_geles016.mp3: Look. I've had a rough day. So if you don't mind, I'd like some time to myself.
lootra.503cp_geles013.mp3: [Success] {Seems hesitant and worried - he realizes the PC may be connected with the wrong people}I... believe you. How can you... ? Nevermind that. I think it may be a good idea to turn in my notice.
lootra.503cp_geles012.mp3: [Failure] I've gone over this so many times. Ughh... No, I still don't know what to do.
lootra.503cp_geles004.mp3: We stand at the checkpoints all day long. It gets hot out there, and my feet are always killing me. But now I'm in charge and everybody's problems are mine.
lootra.503cp_geles005.mp3: So I have to deal with all the people begging to get out of the city. Every one of them's got a story. Let me tell you, there are a lot of sad stories out there.
lootra.503panar022.mp3: {You can hear him sag in his voice - he gives up}All right... Let's go.

nadaa.302nadaa023.mp3: How could you! You horrible beast!
nadaa.302nadaa021.mp3: I don't think I'll ever see Adana again!
nadaa.302nadaa022.mp3: Saquesh took my daughter, Adana, to sell to the Hutts. All because I told him I could not pay his tribute.

nadaa.302nadaa002.mp3: Don't you work with Saquesh? He took my daughter... Adana, to sell to the Hutts. All because I told him I could not pay his tribute.
nadaa.302nadaa013.mp3: But I... I don't have it! I owe 600 credits.
nadaa.302nadaa016.mp3: [Failure] That would doom us both. There must be another way... could you please help us?
nadaa.302nadaa014.mp3: [Success] Yes... I suppose that is one way we can stay together.
nadaa.302nadaa015.mp3: Oh, this is terrible. This is terrible! But I must be with Adana.

nadaa.302nadaa005.mp3: Thank you! But... won't he track us down and kidnap her again?
nadaa.302nadaa007.mp3: I'll do my best... please return her to me! After Saquesh sends her to the Hutts, it will be impossible to find her.
nadaa.302nadaa006.mp3: Thank you... thank you... Please hurry! After the Hutts have her, it will be impossible to find her.
nadaa.302nadaa004.mp3: You would? Oh, thank you! Please hurry. If he's already delivered her to the Hutts, it will be impossible to find her.
nadaa.302nadaa012.mp3: {upset}The Overseer... Saquesh... he took my daughter to sell to the Hutts. All because I told him I could not pay his tribute.
nadaa.302nadaa010.mp3: {upset}Yes... He took her to sell her to the Hutts. All because I told him I could not pay his tribute.
nadaa.302nadaa025.mp3: Thank you so much for returning my Adana to me!
nadaa.302nadaa026.mp3: Thank you! But won't he track us down and kidnap her again?
nadaa.302nadaa027.mp3: I'll do my best... {note, can use truncated VO from strref 86491}
nadaa.302nadaa024.mp3: Thank you so much for returning my Adana to me!
nadaa.302nadaa017.mp3: Thank you so much for returning my Adana to me!

serrocothugcommon.302serthug005.mp3: [Success] All right, you can go see him.
serrocothugcommon.302serthug003.mp3: Hurry up and take care of your business.

serlead.302serlead019.mp3: Do you now? Suppose I were interested. What's this plan of yours?
serlead.302serlead024.mp3: [Success] We'll go and make our move. Men, let's take them out!
serlead.302serlead023.mp3: [Success] We'll go and make our move. Men, let's take them out!
serlead.302serlead022.mp3: [Success] We'll go and make our move. Men, let's take them out!
serlead.302serlead020.mp3: [Success] We'll go and make our move. Men, let's take them out!
serlead.302serlead021.mp3: [Failure] That would be suicidal. Almost as suicidal as your making that absurd suggestion.
serlead.302serlead017.mp3: We can hold our own against them. Not that it's your concern.
serlead.302serlead018.mp3: No? Well, we can certainly handle you!
serlead.302serlead009.mp3: Well, that's too bad. Is that all you wanted to say?
serlead.302serlead010.mp3: [Success] Hmm... Then what would you propose me and my men do?
serlead.302serlead013.mp3: [Failure] No thanks. I tire of this talk.
serlead.302serlead011.mp3: [Success] All right. We'll lay off a bit.
serlead.302serlead008.mp3: We don't need your help. Now get out of here before I space you.

serlead.302serlead004.mp3: You've played target practice with my men. Your leaving isn't an option.
serlead.302serlead002.mp3: I don't make threats... only state the facts.
serlead.302serlead003.mp3: Listen. I've already agreed to give the refugees some more room. Now get out of here.

serlead.503gen_thug002.mp3: This is our part of the Merchant Quarter. Watch your step.
serlead.503gen_thug001.mp3: Go back to your ship, offworlder. We don't need your kind in Iziz.
serlead.503gen_thug007.mp3: {bhunter attack}You can't be the one that fought all those bounty hunters. Only some sort of crazed Wookiee could pull that off.
serlead.503gen_thug006.mp3: {missing captain}Shame about the missing captain. They're probably going to increase patrols around here now.
serlead.503gen_thug005.mp3: {Nikko victories}I heard you held your own against Nikko. Not an easy feat.
serlead.503gen_thug004.mp3: You're in a whole different league of trouble. I'll pretend I never saw you.
serlead.512gen_thug003.mp3: Pickings are scarce these days. Most people avoid the streets now.
serlead.512gen_thug002.mp3: This is our part of the Merchant Quarter. Watch your step.
serlead.512gen_thug001.mp3: Go back to your ship, offworlder. We don't need your kind in Iziz.
serlead.512gen_thug007.mp3: Some of those alien thugs had a go at you, right? I... um... I don't want to cross you.

serlead.512gen_thug004.mp3: {missing captain}Rumor has it you spaced that soldier captain. Maybe you Republic types aren't so bad.

serthugb.302serthug003.mp3: Hurry up and take care of your business.
serthugb.302serthug2001.mp3: Hey, I thought we told you to stay out of here!
serthugb.302serthugb003.mp3: If the Exchange tries to muscle in, we'll break them.
serthugb.302serthugb002.mp3: If any more refugees try to come in here, we'll cut them down.
serthugb.302serthugb001.mp3: We're all we've got - we need to stick together.
serthugb.501portmstr012.mp3: You again? You don't need to see me if you want to leave the city. Once you get to the starport you're done with the bureaucracy.
serthugb.501portmstr001.mp3: It's been awhile since you've docked here, eh? I suppose the lockdown has hurt your profits, as well.
serthugb.501portmstr002.mp3: It must be hard to shuttle people when nobody is allowed to leave. The blockade has been bad for everyone.
serthugb.501portmstr011.mp3: Nothing new. Our space forces have been in full readiness ever since the space battle in orbit. Tensions are running high.
serthugb.501portmstr003.mp3: Your manifest says it's been two months since you last came here. It's become much worse since your last trip. Military checkpoints are everywhere.
serthugb.501portmstr004.mp3: Could be. Our space forces have been in full readiness ever since the space battle in orbit. Tensions are running high.
serthugb.501portmstr005.mp3: All Republic vessels must be searched, and the delays are turning pilots gray before their time. And ever since the Republic fired on our space forces things have been even slower.
serthugb.501portmstr006.mp3: {Shakes head, sighs}Bad days, bad days... and things are getting worse. I'd get out of the system quickly if I were you, friend.
serthugb.501portmstr007.mp3: Well, doesn't look like you have any trade goods, so the inspection's just a formality. Here's your starport visa. Don't lose it! They're priceless right now.
serthugb.501portmstr010.mp3: There's strict food and water rationing. And General Vaklu's troops have been very thorough in finding Republic dissidents. Bombing is very common.
serthugb.501portmstr008.mp3: If you want to leave the planet, you need a starport visa. They're very hard to get. Many people want to get out of here before things get worse.
serthugb.501portmstr009.mp3: Certainly. Mind what I said about the starport visa. I know one captain already who can't get back into the starport.
serthugb.501portmstr013.mp3: You are... human, aren't you? Your face looks... Uh... Nevermind.
serthugb.504ro_plat001.mp3: Ahead is the throne room.  We must get to the Queen to protect her.
serthugb.504ro_plat002.mp3: If you're heading to the Palace, we'll follow you. The Palace itself has been breached!
serthugb.506ro_plat001.mp3: Ahead is the throne room.  We must get to the Queen to protect her.

b5d8.303b5d8004.mp3: Greetings, I am B-5D8. How may I assist you?
b5d8.303b5d8010.mp3: Vogga the Hutt is the owner of this warehouse as well as many other facilities, apartments and structures on Nar Shaddaa.
b5d8.303b5d8005.mp3: This is a warehouse privately owned by Vogga the Hutt.
b5d8.303b5d8006.mp3: Your specific business-related inquiries will have to be directed to Vogga himself. I am not authorized to disclose any information of that nature.
b5d8.303b5d8007.mp3: However, I can say that this is an entirely droid-operated facility, and as such, we purchase droids for use here.
b5d8.303b5d8009.mp3: We only purchase droids from sanctioned traders. If you wish to sell your droid, I would suggest you sell it to Kodin in the main Hub.
b5d8.303b5d8008.mp3: We only purchase droids in larger amounts. If you have a droid you wish to sell, I would ask that you take it to Kodin.
b5d8.303b5d8003.mp3: Please enter the warehouse and report to C7-E3 for assignment.
b5d8.303b5d8002.mp3: You are not authorized to leave the warehouse. Please report to your post.
b5d8.303b5d8001.mp3: Wait, where are you going! You are not authorized to leave the warehouse!
b5d8.303kodin002.mp3: Before I accept this, I must ask you how you acquired this particular droid.
b5d8.303kodin004.mp3: I am sorry, but because of incidents in the past with droids you "acquired," problems have arisen. Thus, I must inquire as to the means with which you obtained them.
b5d8.303kodin010.mp3: I see. There should be no problems then. Credits will be transferred to your account as usual.
b5d8.303kodin012.mp3: I suppose you're right. No one would look for a lost droid here, anyway. The credits will be transferred to your account as usual.
b5d8.303kodin006.mp3: I see. There should be no problems then. Credits will be transferred to your account as usual.
b5d8.303kodin008.mp3: Let's get you to work. Report to C7-E3 for assignment.

c6e3.303c6e3012.mp3: Oh, you're back. What can I do for you?
c6e3.303c6e3019.mp3: I see, well good day to you then.
c6e3.303c6e3018.mp3: I'm sorry, but only C7-E3 can open the inner doors.
c6e3.303c6e3017.mp3: As I said, if I were at the controls, I could open the door for you.
c6e3.303c6e3013.mp3: That C7 droid absolutely infuriates me! Needs help to do my job, do I?
c6e3.303c6e3014.mp3: I would be happy to help you, but as long as that C7 unit is perched at the door, I can't.
c6e3.303c6e3015.mp3: Well, if the C7 unit were to be disabled, my programming would require me to take over his responsibilities in his absence.
c6e3.303c6e3016.mp3: Yes, I would be willing to give you access to the next room.
c6e3.303c6e3008.mp3: Oh, I see! Well, that will show him - "obsolete piece of junk," indeed!
c6e3.303c6e3009.mp3: Yes, of course, I'll get that open right way.
c6e3.303c6e3001.mp3: I certainly hope that rude C7 unit didn't send you over here. Those more recent models have no etiquette programming whatsoever.
c6e3.303c6e3002.mp3: I think he should be replaced or shipped down to maintenance to direct droids there, but I cannot seem to convince my masters of the logic of the request.
c6e3.303c6e3003.mp3: Oh, I wouldn't go that far, despite what others would say. A number designation for a C7 unit means far more than an integer increase.
c6e3.303c6e3004.mp3: Some droids undergo radical changes with each generation. Each numeric jump in sequence can have wide-ranging changes in functionality and temperament.
c6e3.303c6e3005.mp3: But then, you are a new model yourself, I wouldn't expect you to understand how it feels.
c6e3.303c6e3006.mp3: Now, was there something I could help you with?
c6e3.303c6e3020.mp3: Ah, it is nice to have my old job back.
c6e3.303c6e3021.mp3: Vogga hardly pays any attention to the warehouse, he won't even notice the change.
c6e3.303c6e3022.mp3: Yes, I would appreciate it if you kept it to yourself.
c6e3.303hk50001.mp3: Who are you? You're not supposed to be here-

c7e3.303c7e3020.mp3: Shouldn't you be getting back to work? Keep this up and you'll be on the scrap heap by tomorrow.
c7e3.303c7e3018.mp3: You can't be serious! I am not in need of deactivation! What are you talking about?
c7e3.303c7e3016.mp3: As I said, only authorized cargo droids are given access to the rest of the warehouse. Now please, get back to work. I know that C6 unit needs assistance.
c7e3.303c7e3015.mp3: What are you still doing here? Return to your post.
c7e3.303c7e3008.mp3: I am sorry, but only authorized cargo droids are allowed into the warehouse. I cannot permit you to enter, due to the sensitive cargo.
c7e3.303c7e3013.mp3: No, in fact, I do not have you on my list of Kodin's acquisitions. How did you get in here?
c7e3.303c7e3014.mp3: I see. Well, I have no current use for you. I'll assign you to C6-E3. He needs the help to make up for his inferior programming.
c7e3.303c7e3009.mp3: Oh, I see. You are the droid recently acquired from Kodin? In that case, you were assigned to assist me here in place of the old C6 droid.
c7e3.303c7e3010.mp3: No, you will be doing your work out here. If I need you in the other room, I will tell you.
c7e3.303c7e3011.mp3: [Failure] If you do not wish to comply with these instructions, I can have you scheduled for a memory wipe and behavioral reprogramming.
c7e3.303c7e3012.mp3: Good. Now report to C6-E3 - you will be assisting him.

gen_sold.305dessicus009.mp3: {Defeated, weak, but defitant}You have defeated me... but you will not leave here alive.
gen_sold.305dessicus010.mp3: This complex is a trap... when my heartbeat fails, this place shall explode, removing all trace of the GenoHaradan... and you.
gen_sold.305dessicus008.mp3: Do... you think you could best me? Try... your skills against this.
gen_sold.305dessicus001.mp3: So... you've crawled your way here. I admit, I thought to be dueling you on some far-distant world.
gen_sold.305dessicus002.mp3: But you have honored me by not wasting my time hunting you down.
gen_sold.305dessicus006.mp3: Do you think I would reveal it to you? If so, then you thought wrong.
gen_sold.305dessicus007.mp3: Prepare yourself - I have waited for this moment to test myself against the Jedi for some time.
gen_sold.305dessicus005.mp3: I do not think I can kill you - I have watched your movements, seen you fight, and I have already killed you a dozen times over.
gen_sold.305dessicus003.mp3: We shall see. GenoHaradan Brothers - attack!
gen_sold.305dessicus004.mp3: We shall see. I have studied your movements, seen you fight, and I have already killed you a dozen times over.
gen_sold.501gen_sold010.mp3: If it weren't for all the politics, I could just be happy and do my job.
gen_sold.501gen_sold009.mp3: General Vaklu dares too much. He is skirting treason!
gen_sold.501gen_sold008.mp3: The Republic has spies and operatives that are causing havoc in our city. If they keep it up, it will lead to war.
gen_sold.501gen_sold007.mp3: The soldiers in the Merchant Quarter are too loyal to the Queen. Is everybody except me blind?
gen_sold.501gen_sold006.mp3: Queen Talia is a smart and capable ruler. The times before the Republic were terrible for us. Doesn't anybody remember that?
gen_sold.501gen_sold005.mp3: The Merchant Quarter is mostly safe. Other parts of the city have had real trouble.
gen_sold.501gen_sold004.mp3: It disgusts me how many soldiers in other commands are willing to put aside their sworn duty. We took an oath to protect and serve the Queen faithfully.
gen_sold.501gen_sold003.mp3: My brother fought in the recent space battle. He said that the Ebon Hawk didn't fire first.
gen_sold.501gen_sold002.mp3: General Vaklu was an underground resistance leader during the Mandalorian occupation. He's a real hero.
gen_sold.501gen_sold001.mp3: Comm blackouts normally don't last this long, right?
gen_sold.501gen_sold013.mp3: {Missing Captain - doesn't suspect the PC, looking for leads}We're still searching for Captain Riiken. If you have any information let the Onderon military know.
gen_sold.501gen_sold012.mp3: {swoop champ}Just because you're the swoop bike champion doesn't make you above the law. You just keep your engines cooled if you do any celebrating.
gen_sold.501gen_sold011.mp3: {murder investigation}The suspect we held for Captain Sullio's murder had to be let go. We still don't know who actually killed her.
gen_sold.502gen_sold010.mp3: I'm just going to try and stay out of all the politics and do my job.
gen_sold.502gen_sold009.mp3: General Vaklu dares too much. He's skirting treason!
gen_sold.502gen_sold008.mp3: The Republic has spies and operatives that are causing havoc in our city. If they keep it up, it will lead to war.
gen_sold.502gen_sold007.mp3: The soldiers in the Merchant Quarter are too loyal to the Queen. Is everybody except me blind?
gen_sold.502gen_sold006.mp3: Queen Talia is a smart and capable ruler. The times before the Republic were terrible for us. Doesn't anybody remember that?
gen_sold.502gen_sold005.mp3: The Merchant Quarter is mostly safe. Other parts of the city have had real trouble.
gen_sold.502gen_sold004.mp3: It disgusts me how many soldiers in other commands are willing to put aside their sworn duty. We took our oath to protect and serve the Queen faithfully.
gen_sold.502gen_sold003.mp3: My brother fought in the recent space battle. He said that the Ebon Hawk didn't fire first.
gen_sold.502gen_sold002.mp3: General Vaklu was an underground resistance leader during the Mandalorian occupation. He's a real hero.
gen_sold.502gen_sold001.mp3: That comm blackout couldn't have come at a worse time. What's going on?
gen_sold.502gen_sold014.mp3: I could've sworn I saw you at the riot. Command said that all the ring leaders were picked up, though...
gen_sold.502gen_sold013.mp3: {bounty hunter attacks}Trouble seems to follow you, off-worlder.
gen_sold.502gen_sold012.mp3: {sky ramp explosions}There was an alert over by the Sky Ramp earlier. I hope it's settled now.
gen_sold.502gen_sold011.mp3: {swoop champ}You must be the best swoop biker alive! I'd ask for your autoprint, but I'm on duty.
gen_sold.502intgate001.mp3: Let's hurry this up. I want him escorted out of here quickly.
gen_sold.502intgate003.mp3: You're a Republic spy and your propaganda will be silenced. We are taking you back to our barracks for interrogation.
gen_sold.502intgate005.mp3: {The posse gets close to the PC, near the end they walk close enough to the PC to cause the guard to stop}{Clearly he is threatening death}One more word of treason out of you...
gen_sold.502intgate006.mp3: What are you looking at? This is none of your business.
gen_sold.502intgate017.mp3: {He says the first line like it's a quaint notion}A warrant? General Vaklu passed an edict giving the military broad authority to detain and question anyone suspected of treasonous activity.
gen_sold.502intgate018.mp3: It was specifically meant for us to pick up spies like this before they could leave Iziz or go underground.
gen_sold.502intgate031.mp3: Enough out of you! Perhaps this traitor is more of an agent provocateur. Sent by the Republic to sow dissent in our ranks.
gen_sold.502intgate028.mp3: {Gloating tone}[Failure] And who is going to report it? You should watch yourself. You don't want to be known for siding with people like him.
gen_sold.502intgate029.mp3: Men, we're taking him away. Now!
gen_sold.502intgate026.mp3: [Success] Men... let him go. We'll be back with a court order. Then we'll take him to the barracks.
gen_sold.502intgate027.mp3: And you... You should watch yourself. You don't want to be known for siding with people like him.
gen_sold.502intgate021.mp3: [Success] I have the... wrong man. Yes, you heard me right. We have the wrong guy.
gen_sold.502intgate022.mp3: So let him go. But watch it, both of you. If I hear even a hint you're up to something I'm coming back.
gen_sold.502intgate020.mp3: I don't have time to answer your barbed questions, off-worlder.
gen_sold.502intgate011.mp3: This spy has been using his position as a journalist to spread lies and dissent among our people. No doubt he's been up to other treasonous activity, as well.
gen_sold.502intgate013.mp3: Yes, and your disloyalty now deeply sickens me.
gen_sold.502intgate015.mp3: {Grinning in his tone}I like the way you think. Men, let's take the back way to the barracks.
gen_sold.502intgate009.mp3: {Approving grunt}Hmph. Men, let's take this spy away.
gen_sold.502intgate010.mp3: Another word out of you and we can make the trip very uncomfortable.
gen_sold.506va_capt006.mp3: I don't have time for your resistance, Captain Riiken. We need the override code for the Palace shields.
gen_sold.506va_capt008.mp3: I'm sure that's what you'd like me to believe. I have been authorized to use any means at my-
gen_sold.506va_capt010.mp3: Blast! Defend the security room with your lives! The Jedi could ruin everything!
gen_sold.506va_capt002.mp3: Gather our forces. Make sure the defenses are set. Colonel Tobin says the Jedi is coming our way.
gen_sold.506va_capt004.mp3: Take your beasts and attack him. We need more time to prepare!
gen_sold.506va_capt005.mp3: I'm going to the control room. Perhaps the captain can be persuaded to cooperate...
gen_sold.506va_capt003.mp3: Take your beasts and attack her. We need more time to prepare!

bartend.301bartend009.mp3: Back again, I see. How can I help you this time?
bartend.301bartend001.mp3: So, you have the look of a seasoned spacer about you. What backwash you looking for?
bartend.301bartend010.mp3: Well, honestly there's not much for people like you and I to do around here, if you, uh, catch my meaning.
bartend.301bartend022.mp3: So does your wit. Now buy a drink or get out.
bartend.301bartend011.mp3: {meaningful emphasis on "our kind"}Well our kind isn't exactly the majority on this planet.
bartend.301bartend012.mp3: Well, there is plenty for them to do. The pazaak den, swoop races, the Jekk'Jekk Tarr... they're pretty much taken care of.
bartend.301bartend019.mp3: Now there's a place that's literally deadly for our kind.
bartend.301bartend020.mp3: Jekk'Jekk Tarr is a bar filled with cyanogen gas. It's poisonous to you and I but the aliens "drink" it up and pay good money to do so.
bartend.301bartend021.mp3: The cyanogen gas also acts as a social buffer since the people who typically frequent Jekk'Jekk Tarr aren't interested in speaking to the likes of you and I in the first place.
bartend.301bartend017.mp3: Bah! Don't bother with Lupo's racing gallery. The track's deadly and the betting's awful.
bartend.301bartend018.mp3: {Born-a Liss}Borna Lys keeps threatening to take the place over and run it right, but I don't see how she could.
bartend.301bartend013.mp3: Yeah, the pazaak den is a glorified social club for hard-line pazaak players. It's exclusive, though, with a guard at the door and a password needed to simply get in.
bartend.301bartend014.mp3: Don't know why you'd want to get in that place. Bunch of Firaxa Sharks will strip you clean of your credits. Especially The Champ.
bartend.301bartend016.mp3: You can make fun of him all you want, just so long as you don't play him.
bartend.301bartend015.mp3: He only shows up to play people he deems worthy enough. You'd just have to beat about everyone in that place before he'd even think of coming out of hiding.
bartend.301bartend002.mp3: That so? Well, you're in luck - I got plenty of it. Cost you a hundred credits for a flask big enough for what you need, no more.
bartend.301bartend008.mp3: Here's the flask. Aged to perfection - should be just what you need.
bartend.301bartend007.mp3: All right, then. I'm not going anywhere.
bartend.301bartend006.mp3: [Failure] {A little quieter}Well, you aren't just paying for the drink and the flask - you're paying for me to keep my mouth shut about why you need it. Understand?
bartend.301bartend005.mp3: [Success] All right - guess you weren't as desperate as I thought. Fifty credits, no more.
bartend.301bartend004.mp3: Heh. You're not much of a haggler, are you? Yeah, all right, take the juice. But I don't take kindly to being threatened in my own place.
bartend.301bartend003.mp3: [Success] {Just been victimized by Jedi Mind Trick}You know, you're not paying me anything. I'll just give you the juice - now.

drdplay.301drdplay040.mp3: [S4-C8 is out of credits and will not play again.]
drdplay.301drdplay039.mp3: [Against all odds, S4-C8 has beaten you.]
drdplay.301drdplay037.mp3: [You have taken all of S4-C8's credits.]
drdplay.301drdplay036.mp3: Thank you for repairing me. I feel ever so much better now.
drdplay.301drdplay001.mp3: Oh! Hello! You have caught me at a rare time. Usually there are many players who seek to play, but you are fortunate to have caught me at a moment of quiet.
drdplay.301drdplay002.mp3: I fear it is because I am simply not a skilled pazaak player. I am afraid protocol droid skills and language interpretation are not something that lend themselves to pazaak and probability.
drdplay.301drdplay003.mp3: Why, I cannot help myself - in fact, every time I seek to find the answer to that question, I am consumed with the need to come here and play pazaak.
drdplay.301drdplay004.mp3: I am concerned that the problem may lie with my memory core - without routine memory wipes, you know, such degradation is known to occur, leading to instabilities.
drdplay.301drdplay006.mp3: Yes, well, I am somewhat embarrassed by the whole thing, but thank you for the support. I find it difficult to share such inadequacies in front of other droids.
drdplay.301drdplay007.mp3: I fear my obsession with pazaak is one such corruption.
drdplay.301drdplay010.mp3: I am not sure I wish it fixed. I do find some degree of satisfaction in playing. Would you like to play?
drdplay.301drdplay012.mp3: Oh, most certainly, sir. I am not a good player. Quite the mark, as it were.
drdplay.301drdplay035.mp3: [You notice nothing out of the ordinary.]
drdplay.301drdplay024.mp3: [You notice that there is an unusual looking module attached under the droid's left arm. ]
drdplay.301drdplay033.mp3: [Failure] [You pry the casing open, however you use too much force and the components inside come loose and scatter at your feet.]
drdplay.301drdplay031.mp3: [Success] [You have opened the casing without damaging any of the components inside.]
drdplay.301drdplay032.mp3: [Inside the casing, there is a data-recorder and a high-powered burst-transmitter. This is obviously a passive information gathering device.]
drdplay.301drdplay027.mp3: [Failure] [You cannot gain access to the module's system.]
drdplay.301drdplay025.mp3: [Success] [You have successfully interfaced with the module.]
drdplay.301drdplay026.mp3: [According to the memory core, the module was set to send burst transmissions at a set interval. The signal was omni-directional and therefore the receiver remains anonymous.]
drdplay.301drdplay019.mp3: I suppose you're right. I wouldn't want the problem to spread to my many other functions.
drdplay.301drdplay021.mp3: [Failure] [You cannot find any programs that do not belong there.]
drdplay.301drdplay020.mp3: [Success] [You find the faulty programs and delete them from the droid's memory.]
drdplay.301drdplay013.mp3: Why, you are quite correct. If you are indeed skilled, then I would not mind a quick look.
drdplay.301drdplay016.mp3: [Failure] [You fail to find anything wrong with the droid.]
drdplay.301drdplay014.mp3: [Success] [You find the malfunction and correct the problem.]
drdplay.301drdplay015.mp3: Oh! That feels much better. I cannot believe I went on and on about such a foolish game. Thank you, truly, thank you.
drdplay.301drdplay008.mp3: {Interrupted halfway through as switch kicks in}Why, I do not k- would you like to play pazaak?
drdplay.301drdplay009.mp3: {Interrupted halfway through as switch kicks in}Like I was saying, I do not k- would you like to play pazaak?

gamblerf.301gamblerf006.mp3: Feels like years since I got pazaak.
gamblerf.301gamblerf005.mp3: I'm almost afraid to win, with the Exchange watching the tables.
gamblerf.301gamblerf004.mp3: These tables are going to bleed me dry.
gamblerf.301gamblerf003.mp3: I swear. Half of these players must have skifters up their sleeves.
gamblerf.301gamblerf002.mp3: That crazy pazaak droid shut down not long ago, no one knows why.
gamblerf.301gamblerf001.mp3: Been a lot less wins in here lately.
gamblerf.512bounty2001.mp3: A thousand credit bonus to whoever kills him. The Exchange sends their regards, <FullName>!

tobin_irritated.402cs_tob_1001.mp3: {Tobin in a generic part of a ship ordering around a captain, who looks nervous}You let the ship escape? I will deal with your failure later, captain. But for now - find that ship.
tobin_irritated.402cs_tob_1003.mp3: If you find anything, alert me immediately.
tobin_irritated.502cs_vak_1001.mp3: General, we have found them again!
tobin_irritated.502cs_vak_1004.mp3: But the fools are here... in Iziz. The intel on this is certain. I'm ordering men loyal to us to take care of them now.
tobin_irritated.503tobin006.mp3: Follow me men, we must not let Kavar escape! The rest of you take care of her!
tobin_irritated.503tobin005.mp3: Follow me men, we must not let Kavar escape! The rest of you take care of him!
tobin_irritated.503tobin007.mp3: Stop the fighting! Stop! Sergeant, take care of the witnesses. I'm sorry we had to do that.
tobin_irritated.503tobin010.mp3: A Sith Lord... no idea of the name. Frankly, we had no idea who we were dealing with at first. And by the time we did, it was too late.
tobin_irritated.503tobin028.mp3: The Queen has lashed her future to an ailing Republic. When the Republic falls, she will bring Onderon with her.
tobin_irritated.503tobin042.mp3: You have made a foolish decision. Men, kill the Jedi. He will be of no use to us.
tobin_irritated.503tobin041.mp3: You have made a foolish decision. Men, kill the Jedi. She will be of no use to us.
tobin_irritated.503tobin037.mp3: Like I told you, the men outside will try to kill you. We will talk later.
tobin_irritated.503tobin014.mp3: For now, it's simple. We have to act like you're our enemy. When you leave this cantina my men have orders to kill you.
tobin_irritated.506506kreia006.mp3: What... but the Jedi are gone. They have all but vanished.
tobin_irritated.506506kreia008.mp3: {Shoves her out of the way, strides to exit}Out of my way, old woman. This war can still be won and Onderon can be freed.
tobin_irritated.506tobin024.mp3: {Tobin, several Vaklu soldiers, and the player stand before the opened outer door to the throne room. Tobin addresses the player}Well done. There is just one last obstacle before the throne room.
tobin_irritated.506tobin025.mp3: The beast that was used to break through the force field into the Throne Room lies ahead.
tobin_irritated.506tobin026.mp3: No doubt it has slain its Sith handlers and now has a taste for human blood.
tobin_irritated.506tobin021.mp3: {Tobin yells at his men}Ignore the beast. Into the Throne Room. The Queen must die!
tobin_irritated.506tobin018.mp3: Just disable the security terminals. Then the doors will open, and the civil war will be all but over.
tobin_irritated.506tobin023.mp3: In order to get to the throne room we'll have to open the security door. There are security terminals to the north and south.
tobin_irritated.506tobin017.mp3: If you find him - make his end painful.
tobin_irritated.506tobin014.mp3: He's fending off the royalists that are trying to get to us. He's left command of this area to me. I will let him know when we are close to breaching the throne room.
tobin_irritated.506tobin015.mp3: Good luck to you. We will keep the entrance secure.
tobin_irritated.506tobin013.mp3: I admit... I used to doubt you could defeat him. But Master Kavar is no match for you.
tobin_irritated.506tobin006.mp3: Will you just die, already?! You will go no further than this.
tobin_irritated.506tobin002a.mp3: You're too late, our pet beast is about to breach the force field to the Throne Room. The Queen will be dead in moments!
tobin_irritated.511tobin004.mp3: I'm glad we've finally met up, again.
tobin_irritated.511tobin007.mp3: We will honor our end of the deal.
tobin_irritated.853nihtobin001.mp3: {Surprised, a little unnerved, but resorting to being an asshole}Out of my way. I am Colonel Tobin, of the Onderon mil-
tobin_irritated.853nihtobin004.mp3: {Pleading}Telos, Master... there is an academy of Jedi on Telos. Perhaps hundreds of them... enough to sustain you... and enough for you...
tobin_irritated.851851tobin012.mp3: My only crime was Onderon's salvation... and now those hopes have turned gray... kill me now, before they are stripped from me forever.
tobin_irritated.851851tobin011.mp3: [Failure] Onderon is not the Republic, not any longer. The Sith will pass it by.

tobin.402cs_tob_1002.mp3: Our... ally has indicated that the Jedi hasn't left the system yet. Send a detachment to Dxun.
tobin.402cs_tob_1004.mp3: {Captain is dismissed and leaves - scene fades}Now get out of my sight.
tobin.502cs_vak_1003.mp3: The crew of the Ebon Hawk is elusive, General. We were warned about that, but we still underestimated them.
tobin.503tobin002.mp3: In orbit I thought for sure that the Ebon Hawk was mine. I was certain. Only to see you slip through my fingers during the battle.
tobin.503tobin003.mp3: Imagine my delight to discover you were on Iziz. Quite careless, if you ask me.
tobin.503tobin043.mp3: Oh, and harness your grenades, men. Civilian casualties cause a mess of paperwork.
tobin.503tobin008.mp3: Appearances have to be maintained. And I'm afraid we don't have much time. You've helped out General Vaklu, and he understands how to show gratitude.
tobin.503tobin017.mp3: We have allies, terrible allies. They want you dead. However, the General believes you could ultimately be an even greater ally.
tobin.503tobin009.mp3: But we have to maintain appearances. Do you understand?
tobin.503tobin011.mp3: The General believes we can make a new alliance that will be in both of our interests. Vaklu wants to control all of Onderon. And perhaps more, down the road.
tobin.503tobin023.mp3: The Republic's time is nearly over, and strong men like him will rule the age to come. You have shown that you are strong, too, and he feels it inevitable that you become a force to be reckoned with.
tobin.503tobin012.mp3: We'd like to ask your assistance in dealing with our 'ally' the Sith Lord. We have much to offer in return.
tobin.503tobin013.mp3: Eventually we will attack Queen Talia's palace. Iziz is an ancient city, filled with artifacts from our darker past. Some of those might be especially useful to you.
tobin.503tobin026.mp3: Besides the Sith Lord wants you dead, and an enemy of our enemy...
tobin.503tobin029.mp3: But Vaklu wants Onderon to be independent and strong. And ultimately being in his good graces would be more advantageous to you.
tobin.503tobin030.mp3: You must make a choice - will you support us or the Queen?
tobin.503tobin039.mp3: {Incredulity}Then why did you help Anda? You would serve Talia, instead? We could help you settle your score with Kavar.
tobin.503tobin040.mp3: Since you have business in the Palace. You will need to make that choice. I will contact you later.
tobin.503tobin038.mp3: That can easily be arranged. That is also in both of our interests. We have a deal then.
tobin.503tobin036.mp3: Excellent, you won't regret this decision. We will contact you.
tobin.503tobin027.mp3: There is no way they could possibly stand up to you, but they don't know that. Leave Iziz and don't come back until we send a message for you.
tobin.503tobin015.mp3: If the payment I've offered you is insufficient, I assure you General Vaklu himself can offer you a satisfactory deal.
tobin.503tobin024.mp3: We would send you a message. To your Mandalorian allies on the Dxun moon. We still need the Sith Lord to take care of a few things first.
tobin.503tobin025.mp3: But after we've got what we need, then your assistance will be requested.
tobin.503tobin022.mp3: What I have told you is true. We only deal with their intermediaries. We know it's a Sith Lord, but little else. We need your help...
tobin.503tobin020.mp3: You helped Anda with something that has been a serious problem for us. The General believes you have already been a more faithful ally than our current ones.
tobin.503tobin018.mp3: Exactly. That way they are satisfied that we are still loyal to them.
tobin.503tobin019.mp3: I assume you want to know more about our ally. There is little we know about him... or her, even. It's...
tobin.504cs_vak_2007.mp3: It will take time, General. The throne room doors are much stronger than normal security doors.
tobin.504cs_vak_2003.mp3: But, it will take time, General. The throne room's force shields are far stronger than normal shields.
tobin.506tobin007.mp3: The plan has gone well so far. Some of the Sith were sent to the west before the beasts suddenly went mad and attacked everyone.
tobin.506tobin019.mp3: There is one to the north and one to the south. I expect you will face heavy resistance both ways.
tobin.506tobin008.mp3: The plan seems to be working. The Sith and their forces went to the north. But the beasts turned on the Sith, and us. It is chaos behind me.
