mp_anda.502mp_anda041.mp3: Here are the credits we talked about, there is twice as much waiting for you if you... do what is being asked.
mp_anda.502mp_anda038.mp3: Two of the poor Captains have lost their commands. A great shock, no doubt? Just one more left and the royalist Captains will be no more.
mp_anda.502mp_anda039.mp3: Here is the sum of credits we agreed upon.
mp_anda.502mp_anda035.mp3: So all three Captains have been removed from their posts. You are quite impressive. Here is the reward I promised.
mp_anda.502mp_anda036.mp3: I will let my friends know of your able assistance. I am certain we can return the favor at some point in the future.
mp_anda.502mp_anda037.mp3: You've made a powerful ally, Jedi.
mp_anda.502mp_anda033.mp3: Will you reconsider helping me? I believe we both share concerns about the Queen.
mp_anda.502mp_anda034.mp3: {Patient - hoping the PC eventually comes around}Then we still have nothing to talk about.
mp_anda.502mp_anda031.mp3: I have a job for someone like you. The pay is very good.
mp_anda.502mp_anda064.mp3: {Quietly furious}I told you that discretion was important. There were witnesses in the Western Square.
mp_anda.502mp_anda065.mp3: Here are the credits promised, but I'm leaving now. Fortunately any witness in the Western Square can be dealt with, but you've opened the door to the wrong kinds of inquiry.
mp_anda.502mp_anda066.mp3: Friends may still contact you... later.
mp_anda.502mp_anda001.mp3: The rumor I've heard is that you don't fully agree with our Queen and her supporters. If you aren't averse to Queen Talia stepping down, we could use your help.
mp_anda.502mp_anda047.mp3: It would be worth your while.
mp_anda.502mp_anda030.mp3: Your help would not be without its compensations. Speak to me later if you change your mind.
mp_anda.502mp_anda002.mp3: I am a strong supporter of General Vaklu. The Merchant Quarter is an important area. Not only financially but strategically, as well.
mp_anda.502mp_anda003.mp3: It is one of the few districts that is directly connected to the Royal Palace. The Queen and her advisors are well aware of this and have ensured that the Captains here are extremely loyal to her.
mp_anda.502mp_anda004.mp3: This presents complications for Vaklu. If you could arrange for them to be removed from their command, you will be richly compensated.
mp_anda.502mp_anda029.mp3: For each task you complete, I am prepared to pay you 2500 credits. Plus you will earn the favor of some powerful people. We could make your job much easier here.
mp_anda.502mp_anda028.mp3: Why would you think that? Does it matter? Her next in command, Gelesi, is just as loyal to the Queen unfortunately.
mp_anda.502mp_anda007.mp3: There's Gelesi at the Starport, Riiken commands from the Turret Tower, and Bostuco guards the entrance to the Sky Ramp. All loyal, and all need to be reassigned.
mp_anda.502mp_anda024.mp3: A true veteran, years of honorable service. Completely dedicated to the Queen. Sadly I think he is more on our side than the Queen's.
mp_anda.502mp_anda025.mp3: {Anda uses complex here because what she's saying is that Bostuco would never betray the Queen - but she prefers not to think of herself as a traitor}But he is an old soldier that can't adapt to today's... complex situation. Regardless of what the best interests of Onderon are, he won't swerve from executing the Queen's misguided decrees.
mp_anda.502mp_anda027.mp3: Persuasion may be ineffective. Take this military security card. It can be used to slice into security terminals. Perhaps you will find solutions there.
mp_anda.502mp_anda026.mp3: I doubt simple persuasion will be enough to change his mind. I hope the security card I gave you may be of help.
mp_anda.502mp_anda022.mp3: {Just minor distaste}Your solution was... extreme. But the results are acceptable. The military has closed off the entrance to the Sky Ramp.
mp_anda.502mp_anda023.mp3: The royalist Bostuco has been dealt with. Well done.
mp_anda.502mp_anda020.mp3: He has requested reassignment back to the Wall. I am impressed that you were able to influence him at all.
mp_anda.502mp_anda021.mp3: I can see that I was right to ask for your help. You're quite persuasive.
mp_anda.502mp_anda016.mp3: He's been responsible for the Merchant Quarter for years. He has been chastised repetitively for his criticism of General Vaklu.
mp_anda.502mp_anda017.mp3: His years of service won't protect him if he continues to subvert the chain of command. He has received several warnings. With a nudge he just may get a dishonorable discharge.
mp_anda.502mp_anda018.mp3: Then my recommendation is to bide your time. Eventually an opportunity may present itself.
mp_anda.502mp_anda019.mp3: He does occasionally patrol the run down part of the Merchant Quarter by himself. Perhaps your paths may cross then.
mp_anda.502mp_anda013.mp3: Poor Riiken couldn't keep his opinions to himself. He hasn't lost his command yet, but he will shortly. Excellent job.
mp_anda.502mp_anda014.mp3: I heard he met with a tragic accident while on patrol. But for us, it isn't entirely bad news. So we will manage somehow.
mp_anda.502mp_anda015.mp3: I hope that the credits I gave you will make this hard time easier for you.
mp_anda.502mp_anda010.mp3: He is the most junior of the captains. His superior, Captain Sullio, met with an accident. I believe you are familiar with that.
mp_anda.502mp_anda011.mp3: Besides his strong loyalty to the Queen, I know next to nothing about him. He sometimes frequents the local cantina when he isn't at his post.
mp_anda.502mp_anda009.mp3: Poor Gelesi appears to have been involved in a serious bar room brawl. Only a few scrapes and bruises, but he has requested a reassignment. I have been told command will generously grant this request. Well done.
mp_anda.502mp_anda008.mp3: It seems the young Captain Gelesi has booked passage for a shuttle leaving Iziz tomorrow morning. He won't be a problem to us any longer, well done.
mp_anda.502mp_anda005.mp3: You can't attack them directly. The entire city would be after you if you assaulted their checkpoints. You may have to be subtle and patient.
mp_anda.502mp_anda006.mp3: They don't have to be killed, just removed from command.

mp_gegor.502mp_gegor015.mp3: You have returned. My stock is filled with weapons I can only sell to offworlders. Please take a look, the finest bargains in all of Iziz.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor002.mp3: Please tell me you are an off-worlder... You came from the space port, right?
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor014.mp3: You are? Wait... This is not so. You think to make a joke on Gegorran{GEG-or-an}. Haha.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor003.mp3: But this is good news! You have a starport visa, right? I can only sell my best weapons if you have that. These soldiers ensure that I don't forget these formalities.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor005.mp3: No need to be alarmed, my foreign friend. Pay this soldier no heed. Pretend he isn't here.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor013.mp3: Oh, everything's great here! We're all very happy. So very happy.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor010.mp3: General Vaklu is concerned about well-armed insurgents. They've had to get arms from somewhere. Not from me, of course, but all sales of weapons have been severely restricted.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor011.mp3: I can only sell to off-worlders like you that have the proper clearance. And now offworlders can't come here because of the blockade and searches, but it's a wise policy.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor012.mp3: Of course, soldiers are only doing their job. Even if it puts me out of business, I am happy! Ha ha. Even if I am forced to live off scraps in the street, I am so happy to do my part! Long live General Vaklu.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor006.mp3: A large variety of weapons, my stock is very good. You might want to buy some before the General decides he needs more blasters.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor007.mp3: Then weapon merchants, like myself, have the honor of providing them to him at a substantial discount. Even below what it costs us... We do it happily or else...
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor009.mp3: Or else we are very unhappy at not being able to do our part. Heh heh.
mp_gegor.502mp_gegor001.mp3: Ha ha! I, ah, I noticed your incident just now. I'm afraid I have nothing more to say. Good luck in your travels!

mp_gsoldier.502mp_gegor004.mp3: Watch it, Geg. The captain already has enough complaints about you.

saedhe.502mp_pgrd001.mp3: These are dangerous times. People like Ponlar aren't making it any easier.
saedhe.601saedhe065.mp3: Thanks for the helping out the militia.
saedhe.601saedhe064.mp3: {He loathes the PC now}I have nothing more to say to you.
saedhe.601saedhe042.mp3: I don't suppose you've found any of those atmospheric sensors?
saedhe.601saedhe043.mp3: That's great news. My offer still stands - I'll pay you 3000 credits for all of them.
saedhe.601saedhe063.mp3: If you must, but I'd really like to buy them off of you. They're important. Come back if you change your mind.
saedhe.601saedhe048.mp3: Thanks for your help on this. Here are the credits as promised. I'll get this to Zherron when I get back to Khoonda.
saedhe.601saedhe047.mp3: Your droid is right. I'll pay you 5000 credits instead. I'll get this back to Zherron when I get back to Khoonda.
saedhe.601saedhe049.mp3: {Sounds deflated near the beginning then gets his best poker face tone on}I was afraid of that. So how do we do this, then?
saedhe.601saedhe056.mp3: {Still poker face mode}I'm not going to lie, he would be very interested. But Azkul{AZ-CULL} is a low-life. We did it to protect the settlers of Dantooine.
saedhe.601saedhe057.mp3: I'll pay 5000 credits for all three sensors. We're not a prosperous colony, that's really all we can afford. Please help us and make some money.
saedhe.601saedhe058.mp3: {Pretty big disbelief}You wouldn't...? He's strangling the life out of us with his mercenaries. Who knows what he's planning. Please, whatever you do, don't let him know.
saedhe.601saedhe060.mp3: I'm going to alert the militia and let them know you intend to sell us out to Azkul. You won't get away with this!
saedhe.601saedhe062.mp3: I may be old, but I'm not defenseless!
saedhe.601saedhe061.mp3: {Very pissed off. Deeply sarcastic with his second sentence especially "pleasure"}Here you go. It's been a pleasure dealing with you.
saedhe.601saedhe059.mp3: Fine... Here are your credits. Now just go.
saedhe.601saedhe055.mp3: {Relief}Done - 5000 credits. That's all I can offer. We're not rich and you can tell why we need those sensors.
saedhe.601saedhe050.mp3: {Cautiously explaining the militia's actions}We were picking up off-world transmissions between the mercenaries and... someone, we don't know who.
saedhe.601saedhe051.mp3: We know that the mercs are up to something, we just don't know what. We set those atmospheric sensors up to gather information.
saedhe.601saedhe052.mp3: Now you know why we need those sensors. I'll pay you 5000 credits for all three of them. That's about all we can afford.
saedhe.601saedhe053.mp3: You make money and help us out at the same time. What do you say?
saedhe.601saedhe054.mp3: Heh, heh.  Yeah, that's admirable of you! Thank you! I'll get this back to Zherron when I get back to Khoonda.
saedhe.601saedhe044.mp3: {Grumbling acknowledges that}It is worth more to us than that. I'll pay you 4000 credits for the lot of them.
saedhe.601saedhe032.mp3: I don't suppose you've found any of those atmospheric sensors?
saedhe.601saedhe036.mp3: Ehhh, it's important we get it back. It's expensive equipment and we can't afford to replace 'em.
saedhe.601saedhe038.mp3: Regardless, have you found any of 'em yet?
saedhe.601saedhe039.mp3: There was a time when seeing a kinrath was a rare thing. They mostly were around some caves to the south of here. But now... they're everywhere.
saedhe.601saedhe040.mp3: They're dangerous, too. More vicious than they used to be. I'd stay away from the eastern side of the plains. Heh. Now that I think about it, stay away from the west, too.
saedhe.601saedhe041.mp3: The west is filled with kath hounds. Dantooine is in a sad state these days.
saedhe.601saedhe031.mp3: You ready to trade those atmospheric sensors for credits yet?
saedhe.601saedhe030.mp3: I have important things to do that help people. Maybe you've heard of that word?
saedhe.601saedhe001.mp3: {He's startled at first - he's in the middle of the wilderness and wasn't expecting anybody}What? You shouldn't sneak up on an old fella like that. You shouldn't be out here anyway. This is kinrath territory.
saedhe.601saedhe027.mp3: It's just habit. We warn people that the area around Khoonda is dangerous, but some of them don't listen.
saedhe.601saedhe028.mp3: Probably nothing you can't handle, but I'd stay clear of the caves all the same.
saedhe.601saedhe029.mp3: The kinrath have been tunneling for years. Those caves have a whole swarm of 'em. We've collapsed a couple of the caves, but they just come right back.
saedhe.601saedhe009.mp3: A couple weeks back there was an accident here. One of the Western Fringe farmers was coming to Khoonda on his swoop with a load of atmospheric sensors.
saedhe.601saedhe010.mp3: We found him dead and his swoop bike all banged up. I've come back a couple of times to try to figure out if that's what really happened.
saedhe.601saedhe026.mp3: Hmm, that's just a great attitude. Sorry to waste your time.
saedhe.601saedhe013.mp3: I do. The Kinrath are dangerous, but as long as you stay on your swoop bike there's no way they should catch you.
saedhe.601saedhe014.mp3: I've carefully searched this area and haven't found anything. So maybe our man just got sloppy. We really need those atmospheric sensors.
saedhe.601saedhe024.mp3: I don't suppose you'd be willing to keep an eye out for something, hmm?
saedhe.601saedhe025.mp3: {He doesn't want to get too specific because he's hiding something}It's technical. I doubt you'd understand it. But I'd really appreciate your help.
saedhe.601saedhe016.mp3: Ehhh... It's just important we get it back. They're expensive pieces of equipment and we can't afford to replace them.
saedhe.601saedhe017.mp3: Regardless, I don't suppose you'd be willing to keep an eye out for something?
saedhe.601saedhe023.mp3: Heh heh, there is, there is. A good one, too.
saedhe.601saedhe020.mp3: I doubt you'll be able to find any evidence of what happened here. But you might come across the atmospheric sensors. They have to be somewhere.
saedhe.601saedhe021.mp3: If you find any of them just come back here. I'll pay a thousand credits for each one you can find. Even if they're broken.
saedhe.601saedhe022.mp3: No idea whatsoever. I figure it's a real long shot you'd ever spot one. But I also figure it wouldn't hurt to ask.
saedhe.601saedhe018.mp3: {Silent for a moment - then earnest}I just really need them. It's important. Please come to me if you find any of the atmospheric sensors.
saedhe.601saedhe019.mp3: I'll pay you a thousand credits for each one you find, whether they're broken or not.
saedhe.601saedhe011.mp3: I'm one of the Khoonda militia. They need all the able bodies they can get. I was a Republic custom inspector before I came back home.
saedhe.601saedhe012.mp3: Now I'm the closest thing the militia's got to an investigator.
saedhe.601saedhe002.mp3: There was a time when seeing a kinrath was a rare thing. They mostly were around some caves to the south of here. But now... they're everywhere.
saedhe.601saedhe003.mp3: They're dangerous, too. More vicious than they used to be. I'd stay away from the eastern side of the plains. And now that I think about it, stay away from the west, too.
saedhe.601saedhe004.mp3: The west is filled with kath hounds. Dantooine is in a sad state these days.
saedhe.601saedhe005.mp3: {He's hesitant to speak bad of the Republic}Mostly because the Republic has left us to fend for ourselves. I gave the Republic the best years of my life, and I understand they're under pressure.
saedhe.601saedhe006.mp3: But I think that they'd be able to spare at least something to help us out. All we get is sympathy.
saedhe.601saedhe008.mp3: I know this area and you have to do certain things even if it puts you in harm's way. What I'm doing is important.
saedhe.601saedhe007.mp3: Some law and order for one thing. Take what I'm doing right now.
saedhe.602gerevick009.mp3: Ahh... You have called me. Have I not told you that I don't like interuptions?
saedhe.602gerevick010.mp3: {Pauses to listen to something that his comlink is saying - not audible to the PC}Now this is a disruption that is most welcomed. This news bears some thought. You have done well... this time... do not interrupt me again.
saedhe.602gerevick011.mp3: {He looks out the door. His tone is ominously promising.}Preparations need to be made. Another was not expected so soon.
saedhe.602gerevick008.mp3: Another interruption. You must not have heard who I am. Waste another's time, not mine. Someone less important.
saedhe.602gerevick001.mp3: {Gerevick has a stilted way of speaking and his tone is often antagonistic and unfriendly - he sounds dangerous}Your look is not of the hapless settler. You are the newcomer that lands in a battered ship, yes?
saedhe.602gerevick002.mp3: No friendly greetings are here for you.
saedhe.602gerevick007.mp3: {Starts off almost amused - then gets nasty at the end}Many of the weak are skilled in manners. But I am not weak. Do not seek to insult me again.
saedhe.602gerevick005.mp3: I come here to speak to the militia and make them understand a truth. Something of mine they have in their possession. It's very unwise to stand in my way.
saedhe.602gerevick006.mp3: I am done being inconvenienced by you.
saedhe.602gerevick004.mp3: {He seems amused}You act like I have insulted your man. Your ship I haven't seen, but if it takes after you it can't be in perfect condition.
saedhe.602gerevick003.mp3: {He seems amused}You act like I have insulted your woman. Your ship I haven't seen, but if it takes after you it can't be in perfect condition.
saedhe.610gerevick001.mp3: Braved the perils of the sublevel, yes? Many stories and artifacts in your possession? This is fortuitous for myself and associates.
saedhe.610gerevick002.mp3: For now not only do I get rich salvage, but an even richer bounty. Do not be making this difficult. Your death can be quite painless.
saedhe.610gerevick005.mp3: So this is your threat? Is terror what I'm supposed to feel? We know a thing about Jedi and their ways.
saedhe.610gerevick006.mp3: And now, Jedi, we shall fight.
saedhe.610gerevick004.mp3: Negotiations are not possible. A deal has been made with anxious people. People you do not cross.
saedhe.610gerevick003.mp3: Have I not been clear? I want your corpse, which you will provide me with presently. I know a thing about Jedi and their ways.

mp_ponla.502mp_ponla033.mp3: If I speak more right now, the soldiers will arrest me. Perhaps later.
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla011.mp3: I won't remain silent any longer! The Republic has actively attacked us. They attack our space ships unprovoked! What next... an invasion? Perhaps they seek to conquer us. Will you stand idly by? Will you let them bomb our city?!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla013.mp3: If Queen Talia is so removed that she won't do what the people so clearly want... then we must show her. With force!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla015.mp3: Brothers and sisters, let us rise up now and march to the Palace. Our will cannot be denied!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla032.mp3: The time of patience is over. Let's show them our resolve with force!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla031.mp3: [Failure] You're just a Republic off-worlder. Follow Ponlar! Gather arms!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla028.mp3: [Failure] Sacrifices are inevitable - but it is the price of change!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla016.mp3: I - I will...I will not! My cause is just, the Queen must bow to our will!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla019.mp3: [Failure] Everyone... don't stop! Arm yourselves! The Republic is a threat to our very existence!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla017.mp3: My head! Everyone... everyone, stop now. I will go quietly.
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla001.mp3: There must come a time when the Queen bows to the will of the people. The Republic has brought nothing but war and death! In our fifty years of flying their colors we have had more war than the past millennia.
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla002.mp3: Back General Vaklu in his effort to make her see reason. We do not need the Republic. They need our resources, our world, and our blood!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla003.mp3: For all that we have given, now we get nothing. The Republic is weak and falling apart. Its Jedi, whose fallen brethren have brought such misery to us, have disbanded. Let's be the first world to take our future into our hands.
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla008.mp3: Exactly! That is all we ask. Close to two thirds of Onderonians want to reclaim our independence. To isolate ourselves from the ravages of the Republic. To relive our golden age when we answered to no Senate.
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla010.mp3: You can't silence me forever, soldier. But... I'll keep my peace for now.
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla007.mp3: No, they take from us. They are like mynocks sucking energy and resources from so many worlds. They bleed us for their bureaucracy and their excesses.
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla006.mp3: Leave here, off-worlder. My words are meant for the sons and daughters of Onderon. Your type continues to plunder our world. And we have nothing to show for it. Begone!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla005.mp3: Yes, you. It is up to each and every one of us to turn the tide. To take control of our future!
mp_ponla.502mp_ponla054.mp3: [Ponlar is too busy to speak right now.]

mp_crowd_vaklu.502mp_ponla029.mp3: [Success] That's right. Death to the Queen! Death to her allies!
mp_crowd_vaklu.502mp_ponla020.mp3: He's right! Gather arms - kill the royalists!
mp_crowd_vaklu.502mp_ponla027.mp3: The off-worlder joins us! Let's fight these rats! The royalists must die!

mp_psoldier.502mp_ponla014.mp3: That's it Ponlar, we're taking you in. You've gone too far!
mp_psoldier.502mp_ponla021.mp3: They're arming... ? We need backup. You - we could use your assistance... Try to disable them. If the mob grows, many more will die.
mp_psoldier.502mp_ponla026.mp3: You would fight with them? This is madness! We need reinforcements!
mp_psoldier.502mp_ponla024.mp3: We have no time for this. Fire!
mp_psoldier.502mp_ponla022.mp3: Thank you, off-worlder... We may have to hold them off alone until backup arrives.
mp_psoldier.502mp_ponla018.mp3: I don't know what you did, but thank you, off-worlder. That was too close for me.
mp_psoldier.502mp_ponla009.mp3: That's enough, Ponlar. If you keep this up, you're going to spend time in detention. You're coming awfully close to treason.

nikko.502mp_riike094.mp3: What were you trying to do, off-worlder? If I hadn't spoken up for Dhagon he'd still be in jail!
nikko.502mp_riike077.mp3: It's absolutely true, major. I was a friend of both of them. They've done this dozens of times.
nikko.502mp_riike078.mp3: Bahima, the bartender, can confirm it. As well as half a dozen other people. They were an odd pair, but they certainly didn't hate each other.
nikko.502mp_riike081.mp3: I've already given my report, offworlder. He came from his office like I said.
nikko.502mp_riike086.mp3: But the offworlder has a recording from one of Bahima's broken serving droids. It shows that the shot came from the opposite direction.
nikko.502mp_riike073.mp3: {Trying to cover the PC's slip}Uh... What he meant to say, major, is that they were friends.
nikko.502mp_riike059.mp3: It's a long story, so bear with me Captain. The night of the murder I was playing pazaak. It was a prosperous night...
nikko.502mp_riike060.mp3: ...And so S0D3's transmission clearly shows that the murderer was firing from the marketplace. But Dhagon came running from his office. It couldn't have been him.
nikko.503nikko042.mp3: Welcome back. My deck is still warm, if you're up for pazaak.
nikko.503nikko041.mp3: {Friendly tone to it, paying the PC a compliment}It's the pazaak shark. No more games for me. I know when I've been beat.
nikko.503nikko040.mp3: {WIN: Jovial; jesting in friendship}I almost had you there at the end. But cards are fickle friends, at best.
nikko.503nikko038.mp3: Wow. Those were the best credits I ever spent. If you ever want to give me private lessons or let me buy you a drink, look me up.
nikko.503nikko039.mp3: As for pazaak, however, I think you cleaned me out for the night.
nikko.503nikko036.mp3: {FINAL WIN: Jovial; jesting in friendship}That's enough for me. The deck is not speaking my language tonight, though you were a pleasure to play against.
nikko.503nikko037.mp3: I promised you some pazaak cards, and I always keep my word. Here you go.
nikko.503nikko035.mp3: {WIN 1: Jovial; jesting in friendship}Finally, some worthy competition for a worthy pastime. I'm curious if you can do that again.
nikko.503nikko034.mp3: {LOSE: Jovial; jesting in friendship}That round you had the luck of a hairless Bantha, friend. Perhaps next time the cards will treat you better.
nikko.503nikko032.mp3: {1 LOSE: Genuinely sorry}That's a shame, friend. Perhaps next time the cards will be in your favor.
nikko.503nikko001.mp3: Nice to meet you, sentient. Are you interested in a friendly game of pazaak? The deck is warm, the drink is plentiful, and the company amiable. Can I tempt you?
nikko.503nikko031.mp3: You want another game, you've got another game.
nikko.503nikko030.mp3: You know your cards. I'm certainly up for some more spirited competition, though.
nikko.503nikko029.mp3: I only got one more loss in me tonight. You win this one, I'll throw in some extra cards.
nikko.503nikko021.mp3: We haven't played before, so you should know I don't pull any punches. Every game, I play to win.
nikko.503nikko028.mp3: You prove your mettle and I might throw in a bonus one of these rounds. But enough of my cautionary advice, let's play!
nikko.503nikko002.mp3: A foul business, that is. Like most nights, I was here. What do you want to talk about?
nikko.503nikko026.mp3: {At first he's wondering, "Why are you telling me this?" Then he gets excited realizing that it might contain a clue, near the end he realizes that, "Duh, the PC's already thought of this - I'm such a dumbo"}Er... good for you? Oh, give it to Kiph. He may be able to see if it has any information in it...
nikko.503nikko027.mp3: I bet you've already thought of that, huh? Let me know if you find anything out. Maybe it'll have something that proves Dhagon is innocent.
nikko.503nikko019.mp3: If it'll help, Dhagon, you got it.
nikko.503nikko020.mp3: There's no way that Dhagon could've done it. I saw him coming from his office. That's the opposite direction of the marketplace. We should go talk to Captain Riiken and clear all of this up.
nikko.503nikko016.mp3: That would be Bahima's S-0D2. Uh, no, S-0D3. Or is it 2? Whichever one it was. He keeps losing them. I remember when I arrived it was still smoldering.
nikko.503nikko017.mp3: Who knows? Sometimes the slum dwellers shoot his serving droids for fun. This part of the quarter is getting more and more lawless, I'm afraid.
nikko.503nikko025.mp3: When Dhagon and I were waiting for the soldiers, we had to chase off some scavengers that were stripping S-0D3.
nikko.503nikko018.mp3: No, I'm afraid there was quite a crowd growing. We were seeing if there was any way we could help Sullio. There was nothing we could do, of course. She was dead.
nikko.503nikko011.mp3: I was cleaning up stakes from a particularly rewarding pazaak game when I heard a loud sound outside. I grabbed my blaster and went out the door. When I got out I saw Captain Sullio.
nikko.503nikko012.mp3: She was quite dead. Blood was everywhere. I heard a noise and saw Dhagon Ghent coming from his office across the courtyard. We both waited for the authorities to get there.
nikko.503nikko013.mp3: The next day they picked up Dhagon and several other people in the area. It's crazy to think he did it. Sullio was our friend.
nikko.503nikko014.mp3: Just outside the door by the junk heap.
nikko.503nikko006.mp3: She did? Oh no, by the four moons what a mix up! They got it all wrong. Dhagon and Sullio were good friends. It's just when they got a little too much juma juice, they'd carry on.
nikko.503nikko024.mp3: They'd call each other all manner of things. It could get quite hilarious, really. But it was just friendly banter.
nikko.503nikko007.mp3: That night Sullio was in great form. Dhagon and I were laughing later about some of the choicer ones later. 'Yellow-toothed dung dweller,' heh heh. We bought her a couple of drinks afterwards.
nikko.503nikko008.mp3: It may look strange on the outside. But it was just their habit, their way of passing time during these dark nights. Listen, if the soldiers think that's a motive, they just didn't do enough digging.
nikko.503nikko005.mp3: Never! Dhagon thought very highly of the good captain. I did, too. She had a sharp wit, that one. Sad to see her go.
nikko.503nikko003.mp3: Know him? He's probably my best friend on this planet. Honestly, he's not a very good doctor. But he is a great drinking companion..
nikko.503nikko004.mp3: I'd much rather talk about something else. Focusing on the negative is no way for a gambler to live.
nikko.503nikko022.mp3: I'll tell Dhagon to get out of Iziz fast, before they figure out his connection to all of this.
nikko.602g_settle009.mp3: Don't play pazaak with Pato{pa-TOE}. He's either lucky or cheats, or both!
nikko.602g_settle008.mp3: We should try getting along with the mercenaries. If we push them, they'll make our lives miserable!
nikko.602g_settle007.mp3: It's not smart to speak badly of Azkul{AZ-CULL} and his mercenaries. Some of the most vocal have gone missing.
nikko.602g_settle006.mp3: {Very bitter}I'm sick and tired of those mercenaries. Some people say Zherron{zeh-ron} is antagonizing them too much. I think he should do more!
nikko.602g_settle005.mp3: It's getting dangerous to even come to Khoonda{COON-da}. I hear the kinrath are attacking swoop bikes now.
nikko.602g_settle004.mp3: Salvagers are just thieves and scavengers. I can't wait until the last of them leaves.
nikko.602g_settle003.mp3: Zherron{zeh-ron} keeps goading the mercenaries. I think he should let the little things slide. He's making things worse for everyone!
nikko.602g_settle002.mp3: If it weren't for the Jedi we'd be a prosperous community. They've brought us nothing but trouble.
nikko.602g_settle001.mp3: The salvagers keep coming here and bothering the militia. That Gerevick{GUERRE-eh-vick} is the worst of them.
nikko.602g_settle010.mp3: They say the Jedi saved us from the mercenaries. I guess I should stop blaming them for the troubles on Dantooine.

ond_soldier_ri.502mp_riike038.mp3: {Sneering - baiting tone}Yes, tell them what you really think, Riiken{RYE-ken}.
ond_soldier_ri.502mp_riike050.mp3: {He is hoping that he is implying that Vaklu is close to a coup d'etat}Are you implying something, Riiken?
ond_soldier_ri.502mp_riike042.mp3: {The subordinate is genuinely outraged at Riiken tearing into someone he highly admires and idolizes}That's enough! You may be the Queen's pawn, Riiken, but you will not rail against a brilliant General like Vaklu.
ond_soldier_ri.502mp_riike045.mp3: {Last sentence sounds very final}I will see you are relieved of your command for this. Your mouth just ended your career. No matter how distinguished your war record is, it is over.

bakkel.503bakkel001.mp3: What do you want here, offworlder? The room is taken. The whole cantina is taken. You should leave.
bakkel.503bakkel002.mp3: You?! And just how do you intend to do that?
bakkel.503bakkel005.mp3: Those words will be your last!
bakkel.503bakkel008.mp3: It isn't for sale. I warned you, off-worlder, kill her!
bakkel.503bakkel004.mp3: It isn't for sale. I warned you, off-worlder, kill him!
bakkel.503bakkel007.mp3: The off-worlder wants to make a donation. Kill her and take everything!
bakkel.503bakkel003.mp3: The offworlder wants to make a donation. Kill him and take everything!

gen_patr.503gen_patr004.mp3: Beast-riders are nothing but barely tamed animals! Things are bad enough without their gangs.
gen_patr.503gen_patr003.mp3: We've never had a civil war. If Vaklu starts one, I don't think people realize how bad it'll get.
gen_patr.503gen_patr002.mp3: I've been all over the galaxy, and this has got to be the worst service I've ever seen.
gen_patr.503gen_patr001.mp3: I wonder if the waitress will ever get me my drink.
gen_patr.503gen_patr010.mp3: No way am I going to play pazaak with you. You beat Nikko.
gen_patr.503gen_patr009.mp3: {PC Started Riot}Some off-worlder started a riot in the Merchant Quarter. We should throw all of them out of the city!
gen_patr.503gen_patr008.mp3: I overheard some soldiers talking about explosions on the Sky Ramp. It sounds like sabotage.
gen_patr.503gen_patr007.mp3: {swoop champ}The Iziz swoop bike champion just talked to me. I can't wait to tell all my friends!
gen_patr.503gen_patr006.mp3: This bar is getting too rough for me.
gen_patr.503gen_patr005.mp3: I swear I didn't see anything! Just don't hurt me!

sod3.503kiph040.mp3: {effeminate male droid voice}Hello there? What is this? Oh my, she's dead!

xaart.503xaart037.mp3: Good to see you again. Any luck with the visa?
xaart.503xaart001.mp3: I thought it was you. I served in the Mandalorian Wars with you. You're a Jedi, right?
xaart.503xaart002.mp3: There is a great deal of interest in Jedi these days. Your... reluctance is understandable. But we did both serve the Republic during the war.
xaart.503xaart003.mp3: I was one of the ground troops. We fought on Dagary Minor together. It was near the beginning of the war. We, uh, we didn't win that battle.
xaart.503xaart004.mp3: Enough of the past. The whole galaxy isn't safe for Jedi now. Especially here. Onderon has suffered through three wars started by fallen Jedi. Do you still serve the Republic?
xaart.503xaart036.mp3: A pity. The Republic needs every capable person they can get. If you'll excuse me.
xaart.503xaart035.mp3: I didn't mean any offense. But this is the first good thing that's happened to me in days.
xaart.503xaart005.mp3: That's the first good news I've had in months.
xaart.503xaart006.mp3: I was sent by the Republic Senate to investigate certain delicate matters that are happening on Onderon. It's worse than we feared.
xaart.503xaart007.mp3: I have to get to Coruscant to deliver my report. But days before I was planning to leave they started requiring starport visas.
xaart.503xaart013.mp3: I really can't say. The most I will say is stay clear of General Vaklu. His ambition knows no bounds. I believe the people of Iziz are absolutely correct, a civil war is brewing.
xaart.503xaart014.mp3: And Vaklu may very well win if I can't get to Coruscant in time.
xaart.503xaart033.mp3: Helping me is not without its risks. I know you have Jedi training, so you can probably handle it. But I may be being watched.
xaart.503xaart034.mp3: If - if that would compromise your mission, perhaps we should go our separate ways.
xaart.503xaart031.mp3: My mission requires the most extreme caution and delicacy. I don't want to risk going through channels to get a visa. General Vaklu is not above arranging an accident for me.
xaart.503xaart032.mp3: I'm taking a great risk talking to you, but I'm running out of options.
xaart.503xaart030.mp3: Thank you, but this is a personal starport visa. It is keyed to you, and you alone. I appreciate your gesture. But I need an open starport visa. Those are transferable and work for anyone.
xaart.503xaart029.mp3: Thank you for the tip. The journey to Coruscant would be more costly and attract more attention. But there are many freighters bound for Telos.
xaart.503xaart026.mp3: Really? I've been looking for one for weeks. Thanks!
xaart.503xaart028.mp3: I...I don't understand. But I'll wait here. Time is of the essence!
xaart.503xaart027.mp3: You've done a tremendous service for the Republic. Now I have to catch the first shuttle out of here. May the Force be with you!
xaart.503xaart015.mp3: What do you want to know about that night?
xaart.503xaart025.mp3: The information I have is vital to the Senate. I hope you can help.
xaart.503xaart017.mp3: Because he was with me at the time.
xaart.503xaart018.mp3: It's quite simple - right now he's accused of murder. If he's convicted the sentence is death. If he's accused of espionage, let's say assisting a Republic spy, then the penalty for that is death.
xaart.503xaart019.mp3: I'm afraid the Onderonians are quite "fond" of their death penalty. So if I stood up for him, he'd be trading one death sentence for another.
xaart.503xaart020.mp3: I was with Dhagon in his office at the time of the murder. He definitely wasn't involved with her murder.
xaart.503xaart021.mp3: We were taking great pains not to be seen. Which has a certain irony to it, really. If you can free him, please do. He's been invaluable with his help to the Republic.
xaart.503xaart022.mp3: I only wish there were something I could do to help him.
xaart.503xaart008.mp3: After the Jedi Civil War the Republic was weak... and the cost to the Jedi Order was staggering. This entire region is unstable and the entire Republic government could collapse.
xaart.503xaart009.mp3: If Onderon secedes other worlds may follow, and that can't be allowed to happen!
xaart.503xaart010.mp3: Trade between our worlds has brought economic prosperity, and people just take it for granted. All worlds are now interconnected.
xaart.503xaart011.mp3: The Senate also smoothes over differences and is a great instrument for peace. If the Republic falls apart, a thousand little wars born out of petty rivalries will erupt over time.
xaart.503xaart012.mp3: Eventually the entire galaxy could be thrown into a dark age.
xaart.503xaart039.mp3: Leave the city while you can. They'll close the checkpoints soon because of this.

ralon.504gn_rsold003.mp3: If we supported Queen Talia eventually Iziz would just be like every other Republic planet. We need to secede before we lose our culture!
ralon.504gn_rsold002.mp3: The Republic will no longer control our destiny!
ralon.504gn_rsold001.mp3: I knew that General Vaklu would not stay allied with the Sith. I am glad that we are free of them.
ralon.506gn_rsold004.mp3: If we supported General Vaklu eventually Iziz would just be another world enslaved by the Sith. We need to fight to keep our freedom!
ralon.506gn_rsold002.mp3: General Vaklu was once a hero of our people, but his alliance with the Sith shows how far he has fallen.
ralon.506gn_rsold001.mp3: Thanks for your help. Queen Talia is the rightful ruler of Onderon.
ralon.605ralon049.mp3: Ah, the traveler has returned. I hope that Dantooine is providing suitable distraction and entertainment for you.
ralon.605ralon050.mp3: {Very neutral tone - could get here from angry or happy Ralon states}So what shall we talk about?
ralon.605ralon068.mp3: {He seems pretty baffled by this}I... uh... have no real desire to put myself in harm's way for Dantooine. They haven't exactly made the salvagers' stay here pleasant.
ralon.605ralon062.mp3: There isn't much to see around here. The planet is very lightly populated by settlers, mercenaries, and us.
ralon.605ralon065.mp3: We come from many different planets, drawn to the rumors of fortune. I believe the early salvagers did make some credits. But latecomers like myself barely find anything.
ralon.605ralon066.mp3: {Bitter tone again - he dislikes and doesn't trust the Administrator}The early salvagers said that the ruins were mostly empty to begin with. Many think that the Administrator didn't allow us to salvage until her people were done with it.
ralon.605ralon064.mp3: I do not know, nor care. They are trouble, but fortunately they ignore us. When they are looking for work they mainly bother the settlers.
ralon.605ralon063.mp3: {He sounds bitter}They want nothing to do with us. The only thing they want is a part of our profits. And now that salvaging is running out, I doubt they will tolerate our presence much longer.
ralon.605ralon061.mp3: I still have it right here. You are fortunate that no one else has purchased it yet.
ralon.605ralon054.mp3: {He sounds nervous}I hope you've enjoyed your purchase.
ralon.605ralon056.mp3: All sales are final, I'm afraid. You should take the matter up with the militia. But they will say the same.
ralon.605ralon059.mp3: I... I believe you. But fortunately the militia and salvagers don't appreciate violence even here.
ralon.605ralon060.mp3: There is nothing more I want to discuss. Take the matter up with Zherron{zeh-ron} the head of the militia. But you will not like what you hear.
ralon.605ralon058.mp3: Salvagers have been selling outsiders precious 'artifacts' for a long time. Do not make this worse than it has to be.
ralon.605ralon057.mp3: And you bought it. That is your problem not mine. You should be more careful with large purchases in the future.
ralon.605ralon055.mp3: I am not a Jedi so I couldn't say for certain. But I had a suspicion. But that doesn't matter.
ralon.605ralon048.mp3: Have you come to join the others and mock my misfortune? Go away. You have added to my already considerable troubles.
ralon.605ralon001.mp3: Ah, a visitor comes to our delightful salvager camp. We are honored. Do you come bringing your credits and curiosity?
ralon.605ralon006.mp3: Brevity is indeed an understated virtue. I will get to, as you say, my point.
ralon.605ralon007.mp3: A question I pose to you, traveler, do you wish to buy one of the most elusive of all Jedi artifacts? A powerful Jedi holocron.
ralon.605ralon047.mp3: You are passing up a real opportunity. But if at any time you change your mind, do not hesitate to ask.
ralon.605ralon014.mp3: A shrewd question from a discerning mind. My price will be very low. You could sell it for thousands.
ralon.605ralon015.mp3: I ask a mere 1000 credits for this rare find. This is not a matter of negotiation. You should buy it quickly before others come.
ralon.605ralon035.mp3: A discerning question. The reason is simple. The market of buyers is limited on Dantooine. If I were on Coruscant, I could make a fortune with this.
ralon.605ralon036.mp3: My dilemma is I lack the funds to travel. So I cannot reach a better market, so my price is reduced. But you travel and surely you could find a Jedi buyer.
ralon.605ralon046.mp3: They know of my predicament and would seek to savagely reduce my profits. You shouldn't associate with such... unpleasantness.
ralon.605ralon045.mp3: Can you help? Yes, you can buy this excellent holocron. Although your profits are astounding, my share is plenty.
ralon.605ralon037.mp3: {He sounds conflicted then he gives up - he sounds bitter}Can you help...? You are a curious person, too kind to be in this sector of the galaxy. Forget the holocron, traveler. I apologize for the deceit.
ralon.605ralon038.mp3: It was sold to me with false pretenses and I have been forced to continue this cycle. Dantooine has been the pit of misfortune for me.
ralon.605ralon044.mp3: {He sounds sincere}Certainly. I apologize again for my actions.
ralon.605ralon043.mp3: The less said of that the better. I am one step lower than a beggar, I know. I just need money to get off this planet.
ralon.605ralon039.mp3: Settlers treat us with scorn and disdain. Parting them with their money is almost a service. You have shown more civility than I've ever seen on this planet.
ralon.605ralon040.mp3: But I still must try to get enough money to leave here.
ralon.605ralon041.mp3: 500 credits. Probably a small sum to you, but for me it might as well be the price of a star cruiser.
ralon.605ralon042.mp3: You are most kind, traveler. You have given me a chance to go home. Here, take the fake holocron, I don't need it any more.
ralon.605ralon018.mp3: Ahh, I assure you it isn't. I will show it to you presently.
ralon.605ralon019.mp3: As you can see it is in fine shape. A real bargain at a mere 1000 credits.
ralon.605ralon034.mp3: Of course it is. Worth many thousands of credits to the right buyer.
ralon.605ralon020.mp3: {He loses his composure and his glib pitch}H-How did you know? Will I never unload this accursed thing?! {Sighs}This isn't my fault, you can't blame me.
ralon.605ralon033.mp3: {This is a quick final word and his tone shouldn't invite further conversation}No hard feelings, right? Just trying to make a living.
ralon.605ralon032.mp3: Do not be too angered with me, traveler. I - I merely sought to try and improve my desperate situation.
ralon.605ralon030.mp3: I apologize immensely. But surely you recognize that attacking me here will pose problems. The militia and salvagers will hunt you.
ralon.605ralon031.mp3: I will n... Very well, take it. Leave me to my poverty and my suffering.
ralon.605ralon021.mp3: This forgery has passed through several hands in this camp. I am merely the latest victim. I wish to abandon this dung heap.
ralon.605ralon029.mp3: {He sounds pretty miserable}Be serious, any sentient with scent glands can tell this is the garbage pit of Dantooine.
ralon.605ralon022.mp3: No, of course not, another salvager sold it to me. And he bought it from another one before him. When there were more salvagers, incidents like this were common.
ralon.605ralon023.mp3: But now there are few of us and I am stuck with this garbage. There's no way I can make it home to my family and children.
ralon.605ralon025.mp3: A tragic tale I will not bore you with. I came to make credits to get us out of our sad state. But I have lost everything and more. Our family will be sold to the Hutts.
ralon.605ralon027.mp3: Just 500 credits and I'll be able to go home to my family.
ralon.605ralon028.mp3: You are *most* kind, traveler. You have given me a chance to be with my family. Here, take the fake holocron, I don't need it any more.
ralon.605ralon026.mp3: {He finally gives up}Fine, this is going nowhere. Let's talk about something else if you won't believe me.
ralon.605ralon024.mp3: You with all your 'observations.' I'm not going to talk to you about the holocron any more.
ralon.605ralon017.mp3: Now then, your situation's not so different from mine. Perhaps when you get enough money you can return. There is a fortune to be made.
ralon.605ralon016.mp3: Your wisdom is immense. Here is the holocron. Now our business is complete and we can talk of other things.
ralon.605ralon013.mp3: This is no idle boast, traveler, but a fact. A holocron is easily worth many thousands of credits. But I will sell it to you for a low price.
ralon.605ralon008.mp3: {Just a touch uncomfortable in this node - he's lying and isn't happy being complimented}You flatter me, traveler. It was a good day when I found this holocron. But you are lucky, for I will sell it to you for a low price.
ralon.605ralon005.mp3: This saddens me to hear. True this camp isn't as opulent as you are used to with your offworld notions of comfort and decadence. But this is a place of people who toil.
ralon.605ralon004.mp3: Am I that transparent to you? Apparently this is so. I am Ralon, known throughout this camp for the many artifacts of value that I have uncovered. An expert, this is certain.
ralon.605ralon003.mp3: {He really isn't fibbing here - being treated nicely is unusual for him, the most genuine tone}A civilized person with manners. Very rare in this part of the galaxy. I am most honored to meet you. If I may...

ro_tcpt.504ro_tcpt001.mp3: Is the Jedi sti...? We're under attack, men!

ro_trp1.504ro_trp1001.mp3: The royalists in the bunker are contained. We deploy as soon as the reinforcements arrive.

ro_trp2.504ro_trp2001.mp3: Tell command we need reinforcements! A Jedi Knight is assaulting our flank. Hold the line!

va_trp3.504ro_trp3004.mp3: There's no escape, hold the line...
va_trp3.504va_trp3003.mp3: Someone, get the force shield back online! Get it up now! It's too late...

g_darkjedi04.504ro_trp3006.mp3: Hold the line! Those cowards will be dealt with.
g_darkjedi04.506si_sold1002.mp3: {He thinks of killing him - but he wants to know the answer, as well. He's using the Force to sense what's going on and is distracted. He gains in certainty after the "It's the moon" line}Be silent! It's... It's the moon. The Dxun moon. Vaklu has indeed betrayed us.
g_darkjedi04.506si_sold1003.mp3: First we kill the beasts, then the royalists, and then... then Vaklu dies.

va_tcpt.504va_tcpt001.mp3: Attack them, men! Don't let them take the turret!

va_trp1.504va_trp1002.mp3: Call for reinforcements - Vaklu's troops are storming the Sky Ramp!

va_trp2.504va_trp2001.mp3: They're gonna overrun our position! Send in the droid reinforcements, We need them now!

ro_corp.506ro_corp004.mp3: Do you want to head back to Captain Kadron? We can take you there immediately, if you like.
ro_corp.506ro_corp005.mp3: The area should be clear, we can get there very quickly.
ro_corp.506ro_corp001.mp3: Do you want me to guide you to the Palace entrance? We can leave immediately, if you like.
ro_corp.506ro_corp002.mp3: Let's hurry, then, Vaklu's forces could break into the throne room at any moment.
ro_corp.506ro_sold1001.mp3: Captain, the dining room is almost secure. There don't app-
ro_corp.506talia011.mp3: {Very deferential}If you will follow me. I will take you to your shuttle.

ds_sith_elite_sp.506si_sold1001.mp3: {He can't help ask the question, then pauses realizing his Sith Lord may kill him for his impudence}Why do the beasts... turn on us, Master?

sith_drexl.506tobin020.mp3: Watch out! I've lost control of the beast!

dopak.512d_thug009.mp3: Hey, I've said what I'm going to say. I've got things to do right now.
dopak.512d_thug008.mp3: You looking for Dhagon Ghent? You're not going to find him here.
dopak.512d_thug002.mp3: {Slightly hostile street tough - doesn't want to tick off the PC too much, they are obviously tougher than he is}You looking for Dhagon? You're not going to find him here.
dopak.512d_thug003.mp3: A soldier captain was murdered at the cantina real good. They got some suspects at the tower. From what I hear, Dhagon Ghent is one of them.
dopak.512d_thug007.mp3: Like I would know. Iziz is a crazy place right now.
dopak.512d_thug005.mp3: It's the turret tower on the other side of the market. Captain Riiken is the man to talk to.
dopak.512d_thug006.mp3: If you talk to him, tell him I got his twenty credits.
dopak.602azkul026.mp3: I didn't sign on for this cold-blooded slaughter, Azkul.
dopak.605nallek002.mp3: Ease off, Nallek. There's better sport than this one.
dopak.602dopak044.mp3: Thanks again. And good luck to you.
dopak.602dopak040.mp3: It was pretty brave of you to stand up to Azkul like that. Your resolve made me finally take action against him.
dopak.602dopak043.mp3: Oh, sure. You are a powerful Jedi after all.
dopak.602dopak042.mp3: {touched}I'm happy to hear that, I really am.
dopak.602dopak041.mp3: I plan to leave Dantooine with as many of my men as will come with me, and look for some work that is more honorable than wholesale slaughter of civilians.
dopak.602dopak039.mp3: {Cold}I've got nothing more to say to you.
dopak.605dopak021.mp3: {Laughing tone}I know about the thief. The amount of noise the settlers have made over that thief you'd think he stole their whole planet.
dopak.605dopak022.mp3: Before you ask - I have no idea who the thief is. It's not one of us. {He's very serious here and hard}If we wanted something that bad we'd just take it.
dopak.605dopak038.mp3: I don't suppose you're here to hire us. It's been a long time since we've had a paying job. Some of us are getting jumpy.
dopak.605dopak001.mp3: {His tone is cautionary - not too challenging. Only a very belligerent PC will want to throw down in response to his opening lines}You've wandered into the wrong camp. You got the look of a warrior, and we got all the blasters we need.
dopak.605dopak004.mp3: If you're looking for work, too, just take a trip spaceward. We don't need any more competition, got it?
dopak.605dopak031.mp3: Most of us are veterans of the Jedi Civil War. Some even fought in the Mandalorian Wars. A lot of soldiers have been looking for a place in the galaxy.
dopak.605dopak032.mp3: The really skilled usually wind up here.
dopak.605dopak036.mp3: We find ways to divert ourselves. A lot of us find odd jobs. There are many more mercs around than what you see on Dantooine. We're spread out.
dopak.605dopak034.mp3: We had a contract with the Republic doing some work in the Outer Rim. But they scaled back and we were some of the casualties.
dopak.605dopak035.mp3: Now the Republic isn't hiring any more. I hear they have no credits.
dopak.605dopak033.mp3: {Lots of respect in his tone}A sentient by the name of Azkul{AZ-CULL}. He was an elite trooper for Malak during the Jedi Civil War. He knows how to wage war.
dopak.605dopak023.mp3: {He sounds annoyed when he mentions the settlers}It's just another spaceport to me. We've been here too long for my tastes. And the settlers...
dopak.605dopak030.mp3: I have time to kill and talking about Dantooine just irritates me.
dopak.605dopak029.mp3: {Grudgingly admits anything nice about her}She's got spirit. But she seems to focus most of her effort on trying to get us off this planet. Terena{tah-REE-nah} has to learn that we aren't moving.
dopak.605dopak027.mp3: It galls me to think we fought wars to protect gizka like them. They don't do anything to help themselves, and they don't know how...{He's about to say something else here - but stops himself from getting carried away} how to take responsibility.
dopak.605dopak028.mp3: They're on their own. And either they should start working and stop whining, or else they're in for a tough ride.
dopak.605dopak024.mp3: We have to live somewhere, something those settlers don't seem to understand. That flaming Administrator and her kath hound Zherron{zeh-ron} can't keep their noses out of our business.
dopak.605dopak025.mp3: There's a natural order to things that they just don't seem to get. They'll learn.
dopak.605dopak026.mp3: {This line is more enigmatic and guarded than threatening. On Republic his tone indicates he thinks they're a joke - a sham of a government}Just make sure these settlers know their place. The "Republic" isn't going to send a single trainee to help this planet.

dillan.601dillan060.mp3: {Pretty irritated to have to deal with the PC again}What do you want now?
dillan.601dillan046.mp3: I hope your friends and family are fine. Many soldiers that came back from the war had... bad news.
dillan.601dillan051.mp3: She was the Agricultural Administrator of Dantooine. After the Sith attacked, she kept us together. Without her, the only thing you'd see around here would be mercenaries.
dillan.601dillan052.mp3: We'd had problems with Mandalorian mercenaries even before the Jedi Civil War. The Jedi helped clear most of the problem up.
dillan.601dillan054.mp3: But after the war, many soldiers from both sides of the conflict became mercenaries. And since we're so far from the Core, some started gathering here.
dillan.601dillan055.mp3: The difference between an out of work mercenary and a bandit is just a vibroblade's edge. The only thing we can prove they've done is intimidate a few farmers.
dillan.601dillan056.mp3: The farmers give them goods, money, food, or whatever just to stay on their good side. The only one that isn't scared of them is the Administrator.
dillan.601dillan057.mp3: There've also been a lot of disappearances recently. And not all of them can be blamed on kath hounds. But nobody can prove the mercenaries are responsible.
dillan.601dillan058.mp3: A farmer here and there, or a family. We lost enough people during the war that keeping the kath hound and kinrath populations under control hasn't been possible.
dillan.601dillan059.mp3: So there are a lot of animal attacks. Some deaths too. So the disappearances might be just coincidence. But a lot of the stubborn folks seem to be more accident prone.
dillan.601dillan047.mp3: Khoonda used to be old man Matale's estate, but he didn't do so well during the war{meaning he died a pretty horrible death that she doesn't want to talk about}.
dillan.601dillan048.mp3: The Administrator rebuilt it and now this is our center of government.
dillan.601dillan049.mp3: {Irritated at someone making fun of her home}I know it doesn't look like much, but there aren't that many settlers on Dantooine. This building is the start of something new for us. We are very proud of it.
dillan.601dillan050.mp3: We're working on it. Is there anything else you want to talk about?
dillan.601dillan066.mp3: {even}Well, since you're asking, {forceful}absolutely not! I'll lie low until the dust settles.
dillan.601dillan065.mp3: {grudging}Yeah, I guess so. I'm not too fond of my job, but it's better than the job I'd have if the mercs took over. I'll report to Zherron for militia duty.
dillan.601dillan064.mp3: I already told you I would. Quit nagging me!
dillan.601dillan061.mp3: {wary, slightly hostile}You'll find little welcome here, Jedi.  For your own good, I recommend you speak to Administrator Adare, quickly finish your business in Khoonda, and go!
dillan.601dillan001.mp3: {She's none too pleased having another undesirable land on her planet}Another visitor. You must be here to join in the plunder of the old Jedi Enclave. You'll have to see Administrator Adare{uh-DAR-ey} first.
dillan.601dillan045.mp3: {She's not particularly inclined to be helpful}She's inside Khoonda.
dillan.601dillan040.mp3: Salvagers are stripping it of anything valuable. Mostly they're collecting trash the Jedi left behind. The Enclave was bombed during the war, so there's not much left.
dillan.601dillan043.mp3: But since you're a salvager, I expect you already know all that.
dillan.601dillan044.mp3: {Extreme distaste}Is that how you justify it, then? You'll need to see Administrator Adare in Khoonda before you do your grave robbing.
dillan.601dillan002.mp3: {Slightly confused that the player seems clueless}You're one of the salvagers right? Your ship looks banged up enough to be a part of that lot. But you look... different.
dillan.601dillan037.mp3: {Amused}Have you taken a look at your ship recently? It looks like it's been chewed up and spit out by a Wookiee. Twice.
dillan.601dillan039.mp3: {Bantering sarcasm - especially on the "great" word}But you're the boss, so your ship is in just great shape. You really don't look like a salvager, though. Why did you come here?
dillan.601dillan003.mp3: {She's now pretty curious who the PC is}Then who are you? The only recent visitors we've had on Dantooine have been salvagers. And a slew of mercenaries.
dillan.601dillan036.mp3: {Back to being irritated}We get a lot of that here, too. Ever since the Enclave got slagged, seems half the people that visit are smugglers or worse. You probably want to head to Khoonda then.
dillan.601dillan028.mp3: {Slight disbelief - but more than politely interested}Really? You seem pretty well-armed for a farmer. But a lot of us joined the military during the Jedi Civil War. If this is your first time back, a lot has changed.
dillan.601dillan029.mp3: {Sober and sympathetic}You may want to go into Khoonda and ask around about your family. There was a lot of... movement when the Sith invaded. Hopefully everybody you knew is safe.
dillan.601dillan019.mp3: Jedi are nothing to joke about in these parts. Their secret Enclave caused a lot of hardship for us during the war. Obviously you haven't been here recently.
dillan.601dillan026.mp3: It wasn't? They turned our small world into a big target. For a while we thought we'd suffer the same fate as Taris. And it's because of them.
dillan.601dillan027.mp3: But if you want to get to the ruins of the Jedi Enclave you're going to have to get permission from the Administrator. She's in Khoonda.
dillan.601dillan020.mp3: You really are, aren't you? Haven't you caused enough trouble here? Most of us would be just as glad if your kind never came back.
dillan.601dillan021.mp3: And the rest would just as soon see you killed. With the Exchange bounty on Jedi, you'd be smart to keep your identity secret.
dillan.601dillan025.mp3: [Success] I will tell no one I've seen you... But please leave and don't cause any trouble.
dillan.601dillan022.mp3: Just don't add to our troubles. Do what you need to do and leave Dantooine. Then don't come back. Our world is on the verge of collapse because of you.
dillan.601dillan023.mp3: Fallen Jedi killed many friends and family around here. But dealing with the Exchange is just as bad.
dillan.601dillan024.mp3: If you don't mind, I'm busy.
dillan.601dillan004.mp3: {Disappointed and then irritated}Just to see the sights, right? You're just another salvager. Go see Administrator Adare in Khoonda if you want to get into the ruins.
dillan.601dillan018.mp3: Just head into the building and you'll find your way to the Administrator. I'll be over by the entrance if you need anything else.
dillan.601dillan017.mp3: Have you ever sliced a Jedi security door? The old ruins are secure from salvagers unless they get permission from Adare.
dillan.601dillan009.mp3: She was the Agricultural Administrator of Dantooine. After the Sith attack, she kept us together. Without her, the only thing you'd see around here are mercenaries.
dillan.601dillan010.mp3: We had problems with Mandalorian mercenaries even before the Jedi Civil War. {She is grudgingly honest here - she doesn't like Jedi}The Jedi helped clear most of the problem up.
dillan.601dillan011.mp3: But after the war, many soldiers from both sides of the conflict became mercenaries. And since we're so far from the Core, some started gathering here.
dillan.601dillan012.mp3: The difference between an out of work mercenary and a raider is a vibroblade's edge. The only thing we can prove they've done is intimidate a few farmers.
dillan.601dillan013.mp3: The farmers give them goods, money, or food just to stay on their good side. The only one that isn't scared of them is the Administrator.
dillan.601dillan014.mp3: There have also been a lot of disappearances recently. And not all of them can be blamed on kath hounds. But nobody can prove the mercenaries are responsible.
dillan.601dillan015.mp3: A farmer here and there, or a family. We lost enough people during the war that keeping the kath hound and kinrath populations under control hasn't been possible.
dillan.601dillan016.mp3: So there are a lot of animal attacks. Some deaths, too. The disappearances might be just coincidence. But a lot of the stubborn folks seem to be more accident prone.
dillan.601dillan005.mp3: Khoonda is the big building just outside the landing port. It used to be the estate of a man named Matale, but he and his family disappeared around the time of the bombardment.
dillan.601dillan006.mp3: The Administrator rebuilt it and now this is our center of government.
dillan.601dillan007.mp3: I know it doesn't look like much, but there aren't many settlers that live on this planet. This building is the start of something new for us. We're very proud of it.
dillan.601dillan008.mp3: We're working on it. Is there anything else you'd want to talk about?
dillan.601dillan063.mp3: That was some intense fighting. I'm glad we both made it through... and the mercenaries didn't.
