terena.602azkul023.mp3: The Republic won't stand for what you've done here. You'll pay for your crimes.
terena.602terena040.mp3: I hope that you haven't run into any difficulties you couldn't deal with.
terena.602terena041.mp3: Is there anything else I can assist you with?
terena.602terena055.mp3: Who do you want to know about? There are three groups of people on the planet right now. The settlers, salvagers, and the {her tone drops a touch when mentioning the mercs - disapproving}mercenaries.
terena.602terena070.mp3: Mercenaries have been a problem for Dantooine since the end of the Mandalorian Wars. When the Jedi Enclave was here, they were firmly kept in check. But now...
terena.602terena071.mp3: Relations are uneasy between us. {Good at his job means he was a good little Nazi basically}Their leader, Azkul{AZ-CULL}, was a Sith Trooper during the war, and I have no doubt he was very good at his job. Until they find work, tensions will grow.
terena.602terena072.mp3: If you want to know more, I suggest you talk with Berun in the militia headquarters. He would have more details.
terena.602terena063.mp3: They are a necessary inconvenience. Money has been a great concern to us ever since the Sandrals and Matales{ma-ta-LAY} were... removed during the Jedi Civil War.
terena.602terena064.mp3: The agricultural exports we produce just cover basic maintenance. To expand and prosper we needed credits. So we had to exploit a valuable resource we had. The ruins of the Jedi Enclave.
terena.602terena065.mp3: It was not a decision lightly made, and even then we couldn't do the work ourselves. Too dangerous, and every settler matters on our small world. So we opened the door to enterprising salvagers.
terena.602terena066.mp3: The salvagers you see now are the last remnants of that force. The tithe we took from their claims sustains what semblance of government you see now.
terena.602terena068.mp3: We tolerate their presence because we must, and they generally follow our laws. But their time is almost over. The Jedi Enclave's sublevel is the only place left with reasonable salvage.
terena.602terena069.mp3: And it has too many dangers for them. The salvagers aren't warriors. Generally they are out of work miners or cast-offs from other worlds.
terena.602terena067.mp3: We plan on using those credits to improve production and protect our world. We have enough to sustain ourselves until more prosperous times.
terena.602terena056.mp3: Dantooine is one of the younger worlds of the Republic. A couple of generations ago this world was still untamed. We made great progress, in no small part due to the Jedi.
terena.602terena057.mp3: But recently we have been losing ground. During the war the most prominent settler families either fled or were executed by the Sith. Losing their resources and the Jedi was too great a loss.
terena.602terena058.mp3: {Her last sentence is a canned line - a player paying close attention should wonder if she's telling the truth or just repeating a mantra}But now we are organizing and starting to truly work together. Once we achieve that, I am confident that Dantooine can be safe and prosperous again.
terena.602terena059.mp3: {Pause and then confiding tone}No, I suppose I'm not. We need the Republic, and always have. We aren't self-sufficient yet and we need aid. The fate of the Telos project is intimately tied to our own.
terena.602terena060.mp3: The most humanitarian elements of the Senate have put their careers at stake in the rebuilding of Telos. If those efforts succeed, their prominence will grow and further aid will be given freely.
terena.602terena061.mp3: But if they fail... There are colder, more authoritative elements in the Senate that could come to power. They would think nothing of leaving the strategically unimportant worlds to their own devices.
terena.602terena062.mp3: That would be a tragic day for Dantooine and many other worlds. The Republic is in flux, its final shape is uncertain.
terena.602terena050.mp3: To most people in the galaxy, the distinction between Sith and Jedi is a blurry one. Especially since most Sith were once Jedi.
terena.602terena051.mp3: It is complicated by the fact that Malak and Revan were great heroes of the Republic and famed Jedi Knights. But a few years later they were leading an armada which threatened everyone.
terena.602terena052.mp3: And here on Dantooine the Jedi Enclave provoked a brutal occupation by the Sith. It could've been far worse, but even now the damage has not been fully mended.
terena.602terena053.mp3: I don't think everyone hates Jedi. If just a few people changed their minds or spoke up... it could make a great deal of difference. I think that we need the help of the Jedi.
terena.602terena054.mp3: If the Jedi's reputation isn't redeemed, the consequences could be quite regrettable. Until then I would keep your identity secret.
terena.602terena048.mp3: There are plenty of opportunities to assist people on Dantooine. Too many, I'm afraid. I would go to the militia headquarters and make your intentions known there.
terena.602terena049.mp3: Besides that, just listen and ask around.
terena.602terena076.mp3: {She really doesn't want to hear this, but it is her duty}What have you learned, Jedi?
terena.602terena088.mp3: {She doesn't believe the player}Forgive me if I seem to doubt your word, but I won't impugn Zherron on the basis of hearsay. So unless you have any physical evidence...
terena.602terena077.mp3: {Resigned. She really doesn't want to do this}Very well. I will deal with this situation as I must.
terena.602terena078.mp3: Guard, please bring Zherron and Berun here immediately.
terena.602terena080.mp3: I'll get straight to the point. I have found evidence that you are unbalancing our precarious relations with the mercenaries. Do you deny this?
terena.602terena082.mp3: I have no choice but to err on the side of diplomacy.
terena.602terena083.mp3: Until further notice, I am giving command of the militia to Berun. {sad, hopeful}I... I hope, Zherron, that you will continue to serve as Berun's second in command.
terena.602terena046.mp3: I have no doubt that Berun means well, but I have every confidence in Zherron. I would ask you to ignore anything Berun asked of you. He doesn't see the full scope.
terena.602terena047.mp3: I realize that I am asking you for help, but you must also know that I am the head of this nominal government. It wouldn't be appropriate for me to divulge all information to you.
terena.602terena042.mp3: He was investigating the mercenaries for us. We've been increasingly concerned about them. Their behavior has always been antagonistic, but recently they've been behaving differently.
terena.602terena043.mp3: Vrook was investigating this when he disappeared. We were counting on any hard intelligence he could provide. Our other assets have been.. unavailable recently.
terena.602terena044.mp3: {She does say please - but her tone isn't a request}If you find any information on the mercenaries during your stay on our planet, please report it to Zherron{zeh-ron} or myself.
terena.602terena045.mp3: I believe I've told you everything I can. Please find, and rescue Vrook.
terena.602terena015.mp3: A visitor. Please come in. Welcome to Khoonda. I am Administrator Terena Adare. You're the owner of the, um... ship that just landed?
terena.602terena018.mp3: I'll take it as a given that the vessel is indeed yours.
terena.602terena019.mp3: And unless I'm much mistaken that's the Ebon Hawk. That vessel has been on Dantooine before, during the war. That was a Jedi vessel.
terena.602terena022.mp3: My point is that the previous owner of that ship was a very... influential Jedi. And Jedi are not as admired here as they once were.
terena.602terena023.mp3: Right or wrong, our settlers blame the Jedi and their hidden Enclave for their suffering. I remember the old Jedi Masters and the considerable help they lent to Dantooine.
terena.602terena024.mp3: I still maintain... discreet... connections with Jedi. I suppose your arrival here is no coincidence.
terena.602terena025.mp3: Indeed, true coincidence seems very rare in the affairs of Jedi. But I should tell you...
terena.602terena026.mp3: My friend... Let's just call him Vrook. We've known each other for many years. And our continued friendship could create many problems in the current political climate.
terena.602terena027.mp3: He came to Dantooine not too long ago. He was looking into something quite important. He's gone missing recently. Did he send for you in case something went wrong?
terena.602terena032.mp3: Vrook and I had a mutually beneficial arrangement for several weeks. He went to the Jedi Enclave's sublevel recently and hasn't returned. I know the sublevel is dangerous.
terena.602terena033.mp3: I'm starting to fear the worst. Would you be willing to go to the ruins of the Enclave to look for him?
terena.602terena036.mp3: From what I know of your 'type,' you have all of the equipment you need to deal with the sublevel. I do realize the Jedi Order disbanded so you must find credits yourself, however.
terena.602terena037.mp3: The sublevel is dangerous enough that the salvagers have not managed to properly search it. There are many artifacts of value. Normally I ask for a percentage of all salvage.
terena.602terena038.mp3: In your case, however, you can take whatever you find without the customary tithe.
terena.602terena039.mp3: I will have one of the militia transmit permissions to the Enclave's security door. Go expecting danger, for you will most certainly find it there.
terena.602terena035.mp3: This could work to both of our advantage. You can search for artifacts for your... own interest and also for Vrook at the same time.
terena.602terena034.mp3: {She appreciates this attitude}We are fortunate that you've come. Don't expect it to be easy, though. Things rarely are with Jedi.
terena.602terena030.mp3: [Failure] Many mistakingly believe that Jedi are paragons of honesty. I've dealt with far too many to be fooled by this reputation. You want answers I'm not comfortable giving right now.
terena.602terena031.mp3: But in time, with trust, we may be able to communicate more freely. I do need your help.
terena.602terena028.mp3: [Success] {She sounds as though she is relieved, she wants to believe this lie}We need the skills of a Jedi more than ever. He was helping investigate Azkul{AZ-CULL} and his mercenaries.
terena.602terena029.mp3: But he had his own errand to run in the Enclave. Jedi business of some sort. He went into the sublevel, which isn't without its dangers. And he hasn't returned.
terena.602terena099.mp3: Like many parts of Dantooine, the sublevel of the Enclave has become infested with dangerous creatures. Large, vicious insects called laigreks have made the sublevel their home.
terena.602terena100.mp3: Several salvagers have reportedly been injured or killed by the laigreks. I would expect a Jedi to fare better against the creatures than the salvagers.  But Vrook has not returned in some time.
terena.602terena074.mp3: {Sighs}I feel I must step carefully here. You are not like other Jedi I have known. You seem darker somehow.
terena.602terena075.mp3: Yes, I understand. Say no more. For good or ill, I feel you are the only one remaining who can help me with the present situation.
terena.602terena021.mp3: Of course not, I'm trying to stabilize an entire planet. An Exchange bounty, no matter how abundant, is little use in that endeavor. {She doesn't want to come out and say the player is a Jedi - kind of political deniability}But if a Jedi were here, that would best be kept secret.
terena.602terena020.mp3: That is an unfortunate truth. And a wise request, which of course I will honor. Most settlers here hold bitter memories of the Sith occupation.
terena.602terena017.mp3: I meant no disrespect at all. It is in fact a remarkable vessel.
terena.602terena016.mp3: {She's a tough broad and expects an answer to her question}Depending on you business here, the pleasure may be mutual. But you didn't answer my question. Is that ship yours?
terena.602terena014.mp3: Do you require anything else, Jedi?
terena.602terena001.mp3: I see you have found the elusive Master Vrook. He's told me that his "rescue" complicated our situation to some degree. {Her tone sounds disapproving of Vrook - because this criticism could also be laid against her, too. She's on the PC's side.}I can't say that I anticipated that.
terena.602terena002.mp3: I thank you for finding him, though. Vrook has informed me that the mercenaries devised a plan of attack to annihilate Khoonda itself. I must ask for your aid again, Jedi.
terena.602terena003.mp3: Zherron says that even with a plan, the mercenaries have to gather their forces then coordinate their assault. So we still have time. I'm afraid the militia has not been adequately trained for the task that befalls them.
terena.602terena012.mp3: Here is a master card key that will open all of the security doors inside Khoonda. Anything that might aid you in your task, please use.
terena.602terena013.mp3: Soon all the civilians will be evacuated. So if you have any business with them, I suggest you take care of it. Whenever you are ready to finalize the defenses, talk with Zherron{zeh-ron}.
terena.602terena011.mp3: I have instructed the militia and other Khoonda personnel that you are to be provided with anything that can be spared. Unfortunately, that isn't much.
terena.602terena008.mp3: Our militia is effective at peace-keeping but isn't prepared for a full-scale battle. If you can do anything to ready them for the reality of it, that would be helpful.
terena.602terena009.mp3: Besides that, look around Khoonda and see what you can do to strengthen our defenses. I know that we don't have the perimeter turrets online, and that alone could make a significant difference.
terena.602terena010.mp3: Zherron{zeh-ron} says there is a considerable chance they will breach Khoonda itself. Anything you can do to slow them down could turn the tide of battle.
terena.602terena006.mp3: Right now just us and the militia. I don't want to create a needless panic. But be assured I will make sure that all civilians are warned in time so they can get to safety.
terena.602terena007.mp3: Though if we lose this battle, nowhere on Dantooine will be safe for settlers for long.
terena.602terena004.mp3: Certainly not. The common mercenaries are wild and undisciplined, like feral kath hounds. We didn't anticipate that their leadership could organize anything so elaborate.
terena.602terena005.mp3: We were wrong. But thanks to you and Master Vrook we now have a chance to win this battle.
terena.602terena098.mp3: I've placed Zherron back in charge of Khoonda's defense. Right or wrong, Zherron is the best man to lead the militia in this crisis.
terena.602terena090.mp3: {overjoyed and relieved}Thank you so much for your aid. You can be sure that Dantooine will not forget how the Jedi protected us from this threat.
terena.602terena092.mp3: We are a humble community, and this conflict has greatly diminished our resources. I hope this reward will be sufficient.
terena.602terena097.mp3: {confused}Um, okay... Certainly. I will commission a great statue of your likeness.
terena.602terena096.mp3: {She is touched by your generosity}I am humbled by your generosity. I will put this to good use.
terena.602terena095.mp3: {uncomfortable and a little disappointed}That is true I suppose. I can offer a little more.
terena.602terena094.mp3: Now if you'll excuse me, I have much work to do. Dantooine will be slow to rebuild, but I am confident now that we will one day achieve prosperity.
terena.602terena091.mp3: I'm sorry to offend you. You are, of course, our savior and I am very grateful to you.
terena.602terena089.mp3: You are always welcome here, Jedi.
terena.711re_flash001.mp3: {She isn't a coward - but a sergeant telling his CO that their orders are suicide}Comm says we've lost another heavy droid transport. How can we break through the Mandalorian lines without support? The path is mined and the place is crawling with enemies.
terena.711re_flash002.mp3: I know we've got our orders to press forward, but we're at quarter strength. We can't, General. It's impossible. We need to retreat.
terena.711re_flash006.mp3: We already lost half the men just getting to the path. They've got the rest of the company pinned down by the crash site. You can't possibly ask the troops to go forward.
terena.711re_flash007.mp3: If you ask us to charge, will it make a difference? Will our sacrifice mean something?
terena.711re_flash008.mp3: We... we will press forward if you ask it. The path is mined. If you ask us to charge, there will be losses, General.
terena.711re_flash005.mp3: But we won't help by throwing our lives away to storm the path. Too many Mandalorians, too few of us.
terena.711re_flash004.mp3: General, it would be suicide to go forward. There's just too few of us!
terena.711re_flash003.mp3: We know, General. But we just don't have enough men to accomplish our objective, no matter how important.

terena_other_1.711re_flash011.mp3: Everyone, you heard the General. Charge, charge!

g_ml_wnd.602g_ml_wnd013.mp3: Thanks stranger. I should be back to duty in no time.
g_ml_wnd.602g_ml_wnd012.mp3: {it's hard for him to talk, because he is in a lot of pain}The gun turret... malfunctioned. Hurt us bad.
g_ml_wnd.602g_ml_wnd019.mp3: This soldier is out cold, and won't awaken anytime soon.

merc_cpt.604merc_cpt023.mp3: I said leave, not snoop around our camp. I guess you settlers are just incapable of listening. Attack, men!
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt025.mp3: [Master Vrook is enclosed in a force field, a prisoner of these Mercenaries. He regards you without expression.]
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt001.mp3: Halt, settler. This is a restricted area.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt024.mp3: {She just has this thought}How the hell did you get through the kinrath? You should leave.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt012.mp3: I know that you settlers have a score to settle with Jedi. Trust me, this one's gonna suffer.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt022.mp3: {She likes the PC}For a settler, you're all right. Leave the cave and don't tell anyone what you saw. If you come back, we'll have to kill you. I'd rather not, so just go.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt021.mp3: Trust me. Jedi have a very bad fate waiting for them on Nar Shaddaa. Anything he's done to you, he'll more than pay for.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt020.mp3: I can understand how you feel, but he's worth a lot less to us if he's dead. So we're not going to kill him and we're definitely not going to let you kill him.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt014.mp3: He's a what? It doesn't matter if he's a master. That forcecage will hold him.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt019.mp3: There's no way someone can break out of a forcecage. Even a gondark couldn't break out of that.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt015.mp3: If you think you can help keep him secure, take a stab at it.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt016.mp3: I have no idea what you did, but I feel a lot more certain he's not going anywhere. Here are some credits, we appreciate the help.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt017.mp3: You must really hate this guy. {She sounds like she's happy about this}We'll make sure to give him some special attention in transit.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt018.mp3: As much as you've helped, don't come back. And don't tell anyone what we're up to. This Jedi is taken care of.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt013.mp3: There's nothing you can do about it. We've been ordered to deliver him to the Exchange, and that's what we're gonna do!
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt004.mp3: This isn't kidnapping, this is bounty hunting. This Jedi is worth a lot of credits on Nar Shaddaa. And we're collecting.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt005.mp3: {She's trying to sound menacing here}I'm going to say this nice and simple for your little kath herding head - unless you want to wind up dead, leave now.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt011.mp3: You've got some smarts. Just keep walking and don't tell anyone what you saw here. I don't want to see you back here again.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt010.mp3: I'm not in a question answering mood. You're not supposed to be here. Leave or face the consequences.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt009.mp3: {She sounds very happy that this is going to break out into a fight}I warned you. But I'm glad you didn't listen. Attack, men!
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt008.mp3: I follow my orders and nothing you can offer will change that. Besides we're going to get rich off the bounty for this Jedi.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt007.mp3: What?!That's a Jedi trick! We trained against that during the war. It's a Jedi, men! Kill her before she tries something else!
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt006.mp3: What? That's a Jedi trick! We trained against that during the war. It's a Jedi, men! Kill him before he tries something else!
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt003.mp3: He's a Jedi Master? Well, the bounty is going to be that much sweeter, then. Nar Shaddaa is paying extremely well for Jedi. Especially if they're alive.
merc_cpt.604merc_cpt002.mp3: We are highly trained veterans. And you're just a settler with a toy blaster. We're taking the Jedi to Nar Shaddaa, and that is the end of that.

daraala.605daraala051.mp3: I heard you were responsible for driving the settlers off this rock. Thanks. Now we can salvage all we like free of Khoonda's regulations and fees.
daraala.605daraala049.mp3: I heard you were responsible for driving the mercenaries off this rock. That's good. Dantooine was getting to crowded for my tastes.
daraala.605daraala050.mp3: I've still got some Jedi junk left to sell. You buying?
daraala.605daraala032.mp3: {She says you with distaste}What... ? Who is that? Oh, it's you.
daraala.605daraala036.mp3: You go down into the sublevels yet? Or did you suddenly develop some sense.
daraala.605daraala037.mp3: It's a shame about them. Have any luck getting to their bodies? I figure there's about no chance you'll succeed, but the reward is still open.
daraala.605daraala043.mp3: {She's very upset that her lie has been exposed}I should flay him alive for helping an outsider! I figured it was worth a try. Those salvagers are worth more dead than they ever were alive.
daraala.605daraala048.mp3: You? What are you going to do about it? You attack me and everybody on the planet will be gunning for you. I'm important here. Get out of my sight.
daraala.605daraala047.mp3: I hope the laigreks{LAY-grex} make short work of you, outsider. Goodbye.
daraala.605daraala045.mp3: You're not seriously thinking of turning the bodies into Zherron? Then no one would get the salvage. Don't be a fool.
daraala.605daraala046.mp3: At least if you give it to me you can make some credits.
daraala.605daraala044.mp3: {Somewhat venomous tone}I look after myself, it's the only way you can get by in this galaxy. Now get out of my sight.
daraala.605daraala042.mp3: {She sounds like she has 0 faith the PC will succeed}Yeah, well good luck with that. Do you want something else?
daraala.605daraala038.mp3: You have? You managed to find them down there? You're tougher than you look. I have 1000 credits for their bodies and their personal effects.
daraala.605daraala041.mp3: {Best poker face right now - she desperately wants those bodies. Hints of being very anxious}Suit yourself. But who else will want a couple corpses?
daraala.605daraala040.mp3: {She's trying to conceal her pleasure at having duped the PC}You've proven very helpful. Heh. I have something I have to do. Come back if you want to talk again.
daraala.605daraala039.mp3: {She can't believe the PC is such a sap}And no reward, too? Heh heh. You've proven very helpful. I have to go take care of something. I'll talk with you later.
daraala.605daraala035.mp3: {Vaguely threatening at the end, although she sounds too tired and irritable to sound menacing}So you managed to get all the salvage, eh? That's our livelihood you're stepping on. You should watch yourself.
daraala.605daraala034.mp3: You were really helpful. Heh heh. What do you want?
daraala.605daraala033.mp3: I heard you turned in the corpses to Zherron. What a waste. You could've been rich, you fool.
daraala.605daraala028.mp3: You still lurking around here? Just go back to Khoonda{COON-da}. You're not going to find any Jedi artifacts here. Except the ones I'm selling.
daraala.605daraala031.mp3: You aren't serious are you? I'll assume it's a joke, because you don't look that dumb. No I won't join any flaming militia.
daraala.605daraala030.mp3: I didn't mention that before? I'm the one people sell their Jedi salvage to. You should've said you were interested in buying.
daraala.605daraala029.mp3: Certainly. Take your time, look through the pile.
daraala.605daraala001.mp3: {She sounds vaguely irritated but mostly lazy}You a new salvager? Or one of those Khoonda{COON-da} cantina rats coming here to complain.
daraala.605daraala003.mp3: Oh, is that so? You're no mercenary and with those armaments this isn't a social call. You're at least thinking of heading to the ruins.
daraala.605daraala004.mp3: I'm going to give you some advice - turn back. There's nothing you're going to find.
daraala.605daraala025.mp3: You don't look like you're going to crawl around the ruins. If you want to go to the sublevel, you are going to need the Administrators permission, though.
daraala.605daraala027.mp3: She'll never give you permission. Might as well get on your spaceship and leave Dantooine. You're not wanted here.
daraala.605daraala026.mp3: {She's not happy that her gloating was cut short}Well you're welcome to go down there and die. The laigreks{LAY-grex} are hungry and could use a treat.
daraala.605daraala021.mp3: If you're not going to listen to anybody, maybe you can help me out. The only place that has anything is the sublevel. And only a couple of fools have gone there.
daraala.605daraala022.mp3: And they're now dead fools. Yeah, I'd like to do the decent thing and get their bodies and put them to rest. That hole isn't a fit place for a salvager.
daraala.605daraala023.mp3: So if you find a couple human corpses down there just grab their gear and their bodies. I'll pay you 500 credits for each of them.
daraala.605daraala024.mp3: {She's lying again here - but it should sound sincere}Us salvagers that are still here have to stick together.
daraala.605daraala018.mp3: I've been here the longest, and I'll be here last. I buy Jedi salvage from the ruins. Slow business now, but I get by.
daraala.605daraala019.mp3: Sometimes I sell them to visitors like yourself. Besides, that's none of your flaming business.
daraala.605daraala020.mp3: {She sounds accusatory here - she's marginally nicer now that the PC is a customer, but she still has a rude edge to her tone}You should've let me know you're a customer, instead of letting me think you're some disease-ridden salvager. Let me show you what I've got.
daraala.605daraala013.mp3: Because anything valuable in the ruins was carted away months ago. The only salvagers left are either desperate, ornery, or not right in the head.
daraala.605daraala014.mp3: And while you look dirty enough to be here, I don't think you're any of those things. So go back to Khoonda.
daraala.605daraala015.mp3: The only thing left is the sublevel. And that's crawling with laigreks{LAY-grex}. And those things are smarter than half the salvagers here. Though that don't take much.
daraala.605daraala016.mp3: And don't be asking any pesky questions. You're new and no one is going to help you out.
daraala.605daraala017.mp3: Because there isn't enough salvage to share with the people already here. And a hungry newcomer is about as welcome as a diarrhetic Hutt.
daraala.605daraala002.mp3: We don't need another one. Look around this camp. We got the salvaging more than covered.

jorran_other_1.605jorran043.mp3: It's you again. Thanks for helping me out down there.
jorran_other_1.605jorran028.mp3: Whatever you want to know. I owe you.
jorran_other_1.605jorran025.mp3: That may be the "right" thing to do, but it don't make it the smart thing.
jorran_other_1.605jorran064.mp3: [Success] Okay, okay. Here, take the modulator. Please leave me be!
jorran_other_1.605jorran063.mp3: [Success] {terrified}Okay, take the modulator! And the 500 credits! Please don't hurt me!
jorran_other_1.605jorran057.mp3: [Success] Gee, I never thought of it that way. Here, take the modulator, and 500 credits, and tell Suulru I'm really sorry.
jorran_other_1.605jorran053.mp3: Huh? Did I just...? You're welcome, I guess.
jorran_other_1.605jorran052.mp3: [Failure] {trancelike}I'll give... {snapping out of it}Wait a minute. What am I thinking? You're not taking my credits, and if you want the modulator, you'll have to pay!
jorran_other_1.610jorran008.mp3: {This guy isn't a warrior, definite cowardice in his tone}Thanks for saving me. I thought those laigreks{LAY-grex} had me for sure.
jorran_other_1.610jorran053.mp3: {He sounds pretty fierce for the coward he is}What are you talking about? I'm not giving you anything.
jorran_other_1.610jorran055.mp3: {He's frightened and angry}You're just as bad as Taepalae!
jorran_other_1.610jorran054.mp3: That's just too bad for you. I'm going.
jorran_other_1.610jorran051.mp3: I was panicking. I'm just trying to get enough credits to book passage off this rock. This is the first salvage I've found in weeks!
jorran_other_1.610jorran035.mp3: I don't have too much to give. But all right. Here's 300 credits. Is that enough of a reward for you? Can I go now?
jorran_other_1.610jorran039.mp3: {He's been annoyed up for awhile - but now he's piqued}Now... I hadn't thought of that. We could arrange something like that. That would work.
jorran_other_1.610jorran047.mp3: I'll hold onto it then. But I won't sell it to anyone. If you want to buy it from me later, just meet me at the salvager camp.
jorran_other_1.610jorran044.mp3: Haha... A pleasure doing business with you. Now I can finally get passage back home. I hope that junk is worth it to you, I really do.
jorran_other_1.610jorran045.mp3: I'm going to the salvager camp. It'll take some time to get things in order.
jorran_other_1.610jorran042.mp3: Aw, it doesn't work that way. Maybe it's worth a lot more than 1300 credits and you make off real good. Maybe it's a lot less, and I make off good.
jorran_other_1.610jorran074.mp3: {worried, nervous, trying to laugh it off to lighten the mood}Hey, yeah. So, 800 credits for this valuable salvage?
jorran_other_1.610jorran028.mp3: {He's lying and he's not terribly good at it. His second sentence is evasive}... No, I didn't get anything. Now I'd just like to leave.
jorran_other_1.610jorran030.mp3: Fine, I did grab a couple of things from the room we were in. But it's just Jedi garbage.
jorran_other_1.610jorran024.mp3: That may be the "right" thing to do, but it don't make it the smart thing.
jorran_other_1.610jorran061.mp3: Oh. Uh, what do I know about moisture vaporators? I told him I wasn't sure if it would work or not.
jorran_other_1.610jorran065.mp3: {really ancy. We wants to leave badly}Hey, uh, can we please talk about this later, when we're not in danger of being eaten by laigreks?
jorran_other_1.610jorran066.mp3: Sorry, I've got to go! You can meet me in the salvager camp.

jorran.605jorran003.mp3: I feel much better now, thanks to you. I don't think I thanked you properly down there. I was pretty shaken.
jorran.605jorran006.mp3: I really hope the Jedi salvage you bought was worth it. I meant what I said about no returns, though. I need the money to go home.
jorran.605jorran007.mp3: But it's nice to see you again, regardless.
jorran.605jorran041.mp3: I hadn't even thought of that. I know the militia will take just about anyone. I need the credits and would like working with people who'll actually watch your back.
jorran.605jorran042.mp3: I want to think it through, but I think I just might go to Khoonda and sign up. Thanks for the idea!
jorran.605jorran040.mp3: I'm still thinking about it. I probably will, though. I certainly could use a few more credits, and if the militia will have me, well... that would be something.
jorran.605jorran037.mp3: They like tunnels and we never saw much of them except underground in the hilly regions. I guess to a laigrek{LAY-grek} the sublevels must be like paradise, though.
jorran.605jorran030.mp3: I found three things down there. One's some sort of crystal and the others look like lightsaber parts.
jorran.605jorran031.mp3: If you give me 1000 credits, you can have it all. That'll be enough for me to get off this rock. No returns on this, you're stuck with what you buy.
jorran.605jorran036.mp3: Just don't take too long. I'll have to sell it to Daraala{duh-raa-laa} eventually.
jorran.605jorran035.mp3: I'll hold onto it, then. If you want to by it later, just meet me back here.
jorran.605jorran033.mp3: Haha... A pleasure doing business with you. Now I can finally get passage back home. I hope that junk is worth it to you, I really do.
jorran.605jorran034.mp3: Come back any time. It'll take me awhile to get everything set straight.
jorran.605jorran032.mp3: Doesn't work that way. Maybe it's worth a lot more than 1000 credits and you make off real good. Maybe it's a lot less, and I make off good.
jorran.605jorran010.mp3: {Kinda angry}It was all Taepalae's{TAY-pa-LAY} fault. She said the entry way to the sublevel was safe enough. That area has hardly been explored.
jorran.605jorran011.mp3: We barely got in there then everybody started going left and right grabbing anything they could. It was every man for himself and nobody was watching for laigreks.
jorran.605jorran012.mp3: Then before you know it we were under attack by those beasts. So salvagers were running every which way and they left *me* to die.
jorran.605jorran029.mp3: I think I was the only one that managed to find anything worth something down there. A crystal and a couple things that look like they go in a lightsaber.
jorran.605jorran013.mp3: All the easy pickings have been picked. Now everything that's worth more than a glass of juma juice is long gone. So the sublevel is about the only place that's left.
jorran.605jorran014.mp3: And as you might've noticed it's very dangerous down there. Almost nobody's managed to get anything from down there. Not that it matters.
jorran.605jorran027.mp3: Even the sublevel was ransacked long before the salvagers came here. The uppity Administrator says her people never went down there, but that's just a pile of kath droppings.
jorran.605jorran015.mp3: {Half-chuckle}Nothing gets by you, huh? There was a group that managed to get in and got one of the best hauls ever. Taepalae said we could do that, too.
jorran.605jorran020.mp3: Well since every last one of them is dead, their find is sitting in the militia's headquarters. That's one of the biggest claims ever and they won't give it to nobody.
jorran.605jorran021.mp3: So people keep saying that they were owed by the dead salvagers. Or that they're related. But Zherron isn't an idiot.
jorran.605jorran022.mp3: The only thing he's going to believe is a will. And after some tried to pass less than authentic ones off on him, now he'll only take a will and their personal effects.
jorran.605jorran023.mp3: {He's quite amused by that}She was playing you for a fool. Haha. No doubt she'd like to find those bodies. That plus a conveniently worded will and she'd make a pile of credits.
jorran.605jorran026.mp3: I don't want nothing to do with that. The salvagers will all help her, and the militia will get involved. You can't hurt her directly.
jorran.605jorran024.mp3: Probably not since you know the truth. Unless you're willing to make a fake will, though, the truth won't help. You look like the type of moron that'll just turn it in to Zherron.
jorran.605jorran017.mp3: They were the first to really get anything from this damned level. They were so confident they went right back in. A bunch of us salvagers waited by the entrance.
jorran.605jorran018.mp3: Only two of the four came back, and one died right away from his wounds. The other man was going to be rich. But then he picked a fight with Gerevick{GUERRE-eh-vick}.
jorran.605jorran019.mp3: It wasn't much of a fight. Then there was no one left. And that's the whole problem.
jorran.605jorran044.mp3: Oh, that again? I sold Suulru the moisture vaporator in the same condition it was in when I found it.
jorran.605jorran049.mp3: {a little ruffled}You're a bit demanding, aren't you? If you want the modulator, I'll sell it to you for 500 credits, the same price I offered to Suulru.
jorran.605jorran062.mp3: {scared}With all these people around? You wouldn't dare!
jorran.605jorran061.mp3: [Failure] Ha! I'd like to see him try to attack me in a camp full of scavengers!
jorran.605jorran059.mp3: [Failure] Nice try, but your sob story was just a little too over the top to be believable.
jorran.605jorran058.mp3: [Success] {Sighs}I guess I was being overly selfish. Here, take the modulator back to Suulru.
jorran.605jorran056.mp3: [Failure] I'm thankful for what you did for me, but I really need to make enough money to get off this planet.
jorran.605jorran055.mp3: [Success] All right. Just for you, I'll knock the price in half. That's 250 credits. Take it or leave it.
jorran.605jorran054.mp3: [Success] {grudging}Okay, here's the modulator and thanks for saving my life. But do me a favor and don't ask for any more favors!
jorran.605jorran048.mp3: Dunno, it just must have fallen out somewhere. I came across it later.
jorran.605jorran047.mp3: Finders keepers. I've got a permit that allows me to salvage anything on the enclave grounds. I didn't make up the laws here, but I abide by them all the same.
jorran.605jorran045.mp3: All right. Daraala got there before me and she just took the modulator, because she was loaded down with the other stuff that Suulru abandoned.
jorran.605jorran046.mp3: But after I sold the farmer back his moisture vaporator, I won the modulator from Daraala in a game of stones.
jorran.605jorran005.mp3: I still have those Jedi artifacts I found for you. If you don't want them I can sell them to Daraala{duh-raa-laa}.
jorran.605jorran004.mp3: I found a few Jedi artifacts down in the sublevels. I was planning on selling them to Daraala{duh-raa-laa}, but I'll sell them to you if you want them instead.
jorran.605jorran002.mp3: Back again, huh? I don't know what more I can say to you.
jorran.605jorran001.mp3: I don't have anything to say to *you.*
jorran.610jorran057.mp3: You don't have to tell me that twice. If you want to talk to me, I'll be by the salvager's camp. I'm leaving before the laigreks come back{LAY-grex}.
jorran.610jorran034.mp3: Listen, I didn't ask for your help. I appreciate it, but I don't owe you anything.
jorran.610jorran037.mp3: {He just wants to get away so much that his lie sounds reasonably convincing}I didn't find a single thing. I just want to get out of this pit.
jorran.610jorran038.mp3: There's no way I'm going to give those to you. I risked my life for those. I've given you all the credits I got. But I earned what I found.
jorran.610jorran050.mp3: Not right now, I'm going. But I'll be at the salvager camp if you want to talk again.
jorran.610jorran049.mp3: I'm not giving you my find!
jorran.610jorran040.mp3: I-I managed to grab three things. One's some sort of crystal and the other looks like parts. For a lightsaber maybe, I don't know.
jorran.610jorran041.mp3: If you give me 1300 credits, you can have it all. That'll be enough for me to get off this rock. No returns on this, you're stuck with what you buy.
jorran.610jorran046.mp3: Come visit if you like. But if you don't like what you bought, it isn't my problem.
jorran.610jorran075.mp3: {a little relived}Okay. Do you want this stuff for 1300?
jorran.610jorran036.mp3: I don't have any more credits on me. That's, that's really all I have.
jorran.610jorran031.mp3: They like tunnels and we never saw much of them except underground in the hilly regions. I guess to a laigrek{LAY-grek} these sublevels must be like paradise, though.
jorran.610jorran032.mp3: There certainly are enough of them. You know, what's frightening is the beasts are getting smarter. I've heard they've even laid traps for us salvagers. Sounds crazy, but it's true.
jorran.610jorran009.mp3: {Very vicious at the start}It's all Taepalae's{TAY-pa-LAY} fault! She said the entry way to the sublevel was safe enough. This area has hardly been explored.
jorran.610jorran010.mp3: We barely got in here. And then everybody started going left and right, grabbing anything they could. It was every man for himself, and nobody was watching for laigreks!
jorran.610jorran011.mp3: Then before you know it we were under attack by those beasts. So salvagers were running every which way and they left me to die.
jorran.610jorran029.mp3: {He thinks about it for a moment then grudgingly replies}I guess you're right. I grabbed a couple of things in the room we were in. I didn't want to tell you because you might make a claim for it. I need the credits.
jorran.610jorran012.mp3: All the easy pickings have been picked. Now everything that's worth more than a glass of juma juice is long gone. So this level is about the only place that's left.
jorran.610jorran027.mp3: Uh, certainly. Just don't take too long. I don't know how long before those beasts come back.
jorran.610jorran026.mp3: Even this level was ransacked long before the salvagers came here. The uppity Administrator says her people never went down here, but that's just a pile of kath droppings.
jorran.610jorran014.mp3: There was a group that managed to get in and got one of the biggest hauls ever. Taepalae said we could do that, too.
jorran.610jorran015.mp3: {Sounds bitter here}But they were a damned sight more organized than we were. And they've caused more problems dead than they ever did alive.
jorran.610jorran019.mp3: Well since every last one of them is dead, their find is sitting in the militia's headquarters. That's one of the biggest claims ever and they won't give it to nobody.
jorran.610jorran020.mp3: So people keep saying that they were owed by the dead salvagers. Or that they're related. But Zherron isn't an idiot.
jorran.610jorran021.mp3: The only thing he's going to believe is a will. And after some tried to pass less than authentic ones off on him, now he'll only take a will and their personal effects.
jorran.610jorran022.mp3: {He's quite amused by that}She was playing you for a fool. Haha. No doubt she'd like to find those bodies. That plus a conveniently worded will and she'd make a pile of credits.
jorran.610jorran025.mp3: I don't want nothing to do with that. The salvagers will all help her, and the militia will get involved. You can't hurt her directly.
jorran.610jorran023.mp3: Probably not since you know the truth. Unless you're willing to make a fake will, though, the truth won't help. You look like the type of moron that'll just turn it in to Zherron.
jorran.610jorran016.mp3: They were the first to really get anything from this damned level. They were so confident they went right back in. A bunch of us salvagers waited by the entrance.
jorran.610jorran018.mp3: It wasn't much of a fight. Then there was no one left. And that's the whole problem.

jorran_disappointed.605jorran016.mp3: {Sounds bitter here}But they were a damned sight more organized then we were. And they've caused more problems dead than they ever did alive.
jorran_disappointed.605jorran060.mp3: [Success] Okay, I don't want any more trouble. Here's the modulator.
jorran_disappointed.610jorran052.mp3: Here I was thinking you might be a nice one. No need for threats.
jorran_disappointed.610jorran048.mp3: Of course it's negotiable. It's mine, not yours. And I say take a short trip out an airlock without a spacesuit.
jorran_disappointed.610jorran043.mp3: You can buy it from me here or at the salvager camp. I'll hold onto it for you. I owe you that much at least. Just don't take too long.
jorran_disappointed.610jorran013.mp3: And as you might've noticed it's very dangerous down here. Almost nobody's managed to get anything from down here. Not that it matters.
jorran_disappointed.610jorran017.mp3: Only two of the four came back, and one died right away from his wounds. The other man was going to be rich. But then he picked a fight with Gerevick{GUERRE-eh-vick}.

jorran_echo_hidden.610jorran007.mp3: Is that you? I thought I heard something. Is it safe yet?
jorran_echo_hidden.610jorran006.mp3: Hello? Anybody? Flaming sublevel playing tricks on me.
jorran_echo_hidden.610jorran005.mp3: I could. But if there is another one of those damned beasts out there, I'll stay put.
jorran_echo_hidden.610jorran004.mp3: Please take care of them. I can't stand much more of this. If you do manage to clear a path, please come back.
jorran_echo_hidden.610jorran003.mp3: You must be fierce with a blaster then. Give me a moment, I sort of jammed the door a bit. Just don't leave!

jorran_echo_hidden_1.610jorran001.mp3: Is someone out there? Anybody? Help! Laigreks are everywhere! Help me, I'm trapped in here!
jorran_echo_hidden_1.610jorran002.mp3: Y-Yes. Yes, I am. I locked the door in here. I thought I was going to be laigrek compost! Did you take care of them, stranger?

nallek.605nallek031.mp3: Just stay out of my way, mudlicker.
nallek.605nallek030.mp3: The warrior returns. Getting tired of this planet yet? We've been planet-bound too long for my tastes. What do you want?
nallek.605nallek029.mp3: [Nallek seems afraid of you. He can't seem to say anything to you even if he wanted to.]
nallek.605nallek001.mp3: Smells like another salvager's come to our camp. Vacate, mudlicker. Don't make me tell you again.
nallek.605nallek003.mp3: I don't need help to take out a mudlicker. Yeah, I'm talking to *you.*
nallek.605nallek028.mp3: And just keep going. You don't want to get into trouble with us.
nallek.605nallek025.mp3: Wh-What? I'm a veteran of the Jedi Civil War. I fought dozens of battle-trained Republic soldiers. You're going to die.
nallek.605nallek024.mp3: {He sounds maliciously pleased}You've given me all the excuse I need, outsider. You're dead now.
nallek.605nallek021.mp3: But *I* have a problem with *you.* Flaming outsider taking away our work. This is mercenary territory and we don't want anyone getting in our way.
nallek.605nallek022.mp3: We're the real boss on this planet. So stand clear of us.
nallek.605nallek023.mp3: {He's maliciously amused}You serious? The settlers are no more than herdbeasts. Her handful of militia don't run this place. We do.
nallek.605nallek011.mp3: [Failure] I'm a real soldier, and you're just a trainee with a dart gun. {He's just spoiling for a fight}Don't you *dare* compare yourself to me.
nallek.605nallek012.mp3: I... don't want to fight. What do you want to know?
nallek.605nallek016.mp3: I don't know for sure. I heard rumors. I heard we got a secret job working with some powerful organization. No one tells me who. I know we're planning an attack soon.
nallek.605nallek017.mp3: But I don't know against who. They aren't too far, though, because we're expecting to attack soon.
nallek.605nallek020.mp3: I don't feel so well. I feel dizzy. I gotta go now.
nallek.605nallek019.mp3: We're preparing to attack soon. So they have to be in this sector of the galaxy. They're being very quiet about who the enemy is.
nallek.605nallek018.mp3: I told you what I know. Someone rich and powerful. We're not going to have to hit up settlers for food and supplies any more.
nallek.605nallek014.mp3: All the time. They tell us to be careful. Just scare them and make sure we get anything we want. Except Khoonda{COON-dah} we got everything under control.
nallek.605nallek015.mp3: There's been a couple of people we had to get rid of. {He sounds sad}But I wasn't on those trips. Azkul's{AZ-CULL} got it all figured out.
nallek.605nallek013.mp3: You either one of those useless salvagers or uppity settlers. {On enough it sounds like he wants to bash in a few skulls}I've had *enough* of your type.
nallek.605nallek004.mp3: [Success] You fight in any wars? I fought in the Jedi Civil War. I guess you don't look like much of a salvager.
nallek.605nallek010.mp3: {He doesn't sound threatening - he views this as a fair exchange}Stay out of our way and we'll stay out of yours. That's the best deal you're going to get here.
nallek.605nallek008.mp3: You were a soldier, too. You know I'm not going to answer you.
nallek.605nallek009.mp3: I-I want to answer your question. {Sounds like he has a mild headache}My head...
nallek.605nallek006.mp3: I thought you were one of those useless salvagers. Or perhaps an uppity settler. I've had about enough of their attitude.
nallek.605nallek007.mp3: So I figured blasting one of them would do me some good. Been awhile since we had work.
nallek.605nallek005.mp3: Sides don't matter much, we're all soldiers. Most of us mercenaries worked with the Sith. Not too many Republic soldiers survived the war.

malak.711malak001.mp3: Do not heed the words of the Jedi Council. The Republic will fall if we do not act now.
malak.711malak002.mp3: Already the Mandalorians have taken three systems along the Rim. They will only grow more powerful with time.
malak.711malak003.mp3: Come stand with me. We will use our might to help the Republic in its time of need. Join Revan and I. Together, we will battle this menace.
malak.711malak037.mp3: {His voice starts as young Malak and then becomes sinister - like Darth Malak except without the synthesizer}You would... fight your fate, Jedi? Violence before reason, excellent. You make a worthy addition to our ranks.
malak.711malak036.mp3: All life is a test. And sometimes the student can be a teacher, too. You know it even now.
malak.711malak005.mp3: The Jedi Council is wise, but will take too long to deal with this threat. We must act now to stop the Mandalorians.
malak.711malak004.mp3: I have heard of you. Your masters speak well of you, of your skills in battle. Join us.
malak.711malak010.mp3: I am proud that Revan and I will be taking up our lightsabers for the good of the Republic, without the blessings of the Council.
malak.711malak011.mp3: The Council seems content to watch, to debate, while entire systems fall to the Mandalorians. If we don't act now, there may be no Republic army to assist in the future.
malak.711malak012.mp3: {Malak is now no longer saying what he said in the past - he is starting to be subtly tempting. He's trying to walk the PC down a slippery slope to the dark side}I sense you will join us. What are your reasons?
malak.711malak017.mp3: A good reason. Delay would have brought ruin, and there was much suffering. You had to act.
malak.711malak018.mp3: It was within our power to end the war. And the Council chose to debate behind closed doors while planets burned.
malak.711malak022.mp3: Their vaunted wisdom bred only inaction. And that would've led to destruction greater than anything born of the dark side.
malak.711malak023.mp3: So if you could do it all again... the real question is would you? The Mandalorians await on the edge of space eager to crush the Republic. You know how this turns out.
malak.711malak024.mp3: Would you do it any different? Knowing what it costs you, knowing what it costs the rest.
malak.711malak026.mp3: So do you see so far that you know that it would be for the best? Such arrogance.
malak.711malak028.mp3: And now you are all alone. Would you join me now? You didn't follow Revan and I down our path. Join us. Your journey hasn't ended yet.
malak.711malak035.mp3: The first lesson will be carved in your flesh. Pain is the ultimate teacher. And the lesson begins now.
malak.711malak034.mp3: More power than the Jedi can ever offer you.
malak.711malak032.mp3: Are you so certain? Every step along the way we did what we thought was right. Perhaps the same path lays before you.
malak.711malak033.mp3: But the time of words are done. Now it is time you experienced the full power of the dark side.
malak.711malak030.mp3: She didn't join us that day, but in time she came to our way of thinking. And even before then she wavered and wondered what would've happened.
malak.711malak038.mp3: {Mocking}It is a familiar path... there were those who wished to follow you to war, yet remained behind. They came to hate you for the choices they wished to make.
malak.711malak027.mp3: There is much ambition and pride in you. I sense given the chance you may have followed me on the entire journey. Will you join me now?
malak.711malak025.mp3: So knowing all that would transpire, would you still follow Revan and I? Excellent.
malak.711malak021.mp3: You have learned much. You no longer need to obey their hollow teachings.
malak.711malak020.mp3: Yes, that's right - without us the Republic would've been no more. And the Council...
malak.711malak019.mp3: {His voice becomes more like the Sith Lord from KotOR1 with each word}This is pointless then. You stand alone in this, Jedi. Soon you will see things my way.
malak.711malak016.mp3: Who we truly are is defined by our actions. To deny your actions is to deny yourself, your nature. You show weakness with your words.
malak.711malak015.mp3: A wise decision. Conflict often reveals much hidden within a person... their true strength.
malak.711malak014.mp3: If you cannot examine your life and your choices, then you are weaker than I thought.
malak.711malak013.mp3: {Slight evil salesman}You should trust in yourself - and in your instincts.
malak.711malak009.mp3: But the war is real. The suffering is real. The death toll the Mandalorians inflict are all very real.
malak.711malak008.mp3: The Mandalorians must be stopped. And if the war ends with their defeat, then anything else is a small price to pay.
malak.711malak007.mp3: The dark side? This is survival.
malak.711malak006.mp3: The Jedi Council is wise but can make mistakes. History has proven this time and time again.
